title: Fine in general
text: The location is a little sketchy, next to the Port Authority, but the hotel itself is fine.  Staff is friendly, the room was very clean, and the breakfast was on the better side for a Fairfield.  Just be aware that the rooms are a little small, as is the breakfast area.

title: return of forgotten item
text:
A very well located hotel in Manhattan, 10 minutes from Time Square, with very close subways. Spacious room.
The most notable thing about the hotel is the staff. The ladies who served breakfast were super friendly.
I would especially highlight the reception staff and mention Luis Nuñez, who managed the return of an object left at the hotel, which he sent me to Spain.
Great management. Not all hotels care so much about their clients and are so professional. totally recommended

title: Don’t stay at this property
text:
This property is disgusting. I walked up on 37th and didn’t even want to check in. The lobby consists of a tiny space which has no redeeming properties and I didn’t even have enough space for my luggage. It’s all carpet which old and I won’t walk barefoot on and won’t shower here. 

Only one of the 3 outlets works so you can only charge your laptop or phone. The TV is tiny and overall I’m skeeved out at the experience. The average rate is $350/ night which is outrageous

They send an email before you arrive that says there’s no gym, no early check in and noise is tolerated - it’s the most unfriendly note I’ve ever receive prior to a stay at any hotel let alone one where I have titanium platinum status. The whole experience is disappointing - I expect a higher level of experience from Marriott 

Please don’t stay here - it’s an awful experience

title: Professional, Respectful & Welcoming!
text:
From the moment upon arrival I felt respected, appreciated and overall like I made the right decision to stay at this particular property. The front desk associate, Annaleigh, was so welcoming, friendly and personable from the moment we arrived. From thanking us for being Marriott Bonvoy Gold Elite members, to informing us about our complimentary room upgrade to asking if we wanted to utilize the late checkout, the entire experience was above and beyond.

The following day I had to return to this hotel to attempt to extend my stay because of an extremely horrible experience at the Delta hotel immediately next door and not only Annaleigh, but Vanessa who took care of us at this time went more than above and beyond. From checking to see if she could extend our stay for the same exact room (with the best view!), to offering to match the prior nights rate because it was better, to getting us late in the day housekeeping and even going as far as to apologize for the experience we had at the Delta Hotel. I cannot say enough good things about this interaction. She made us feel the way we should be treated and you can tell she truly appreciates what she does and knows how to take care of her guests.

I hope that these words of how grateful we are to the staff at The Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Times Square can make it back to them personally, and I hope they can know that they were able to turn a really horrible and unwelcoming experience into a phenomenal staff and situation

title: Okay
text: We stayed here during the first week of February. Low season period (as much as it can be in New York) with a fairly honest cost for three people. Top location 5 minutes from Times Square and 2 minutes from the nearest metro station (Port Authority). Small room but we stayed there for very little; it was tidied up every day (by this I mean emptying rubbish, minimal cleaning of the bathroom with replacement of towels and making beds). We never queued too long for breakfast as we always went down early (between 7.30 and 8) however the room is very small for all the hotel guests. The staff was quick and courteous (especially Teresa). Overall we were satisfied.

title: Good but not too much!
text: Generally my reviews are reflected in the others released, and I would like to point out that I easily adapt to all types of situations, but this time some clarifications need to be made. The location of the hotel is excellent, welcome, cleanliness of the rooms too. The room used for breakfast is inadequate and can accommodate 72 people and even if they open from 6.30 until 9.00, if you decide to take it easy you are in trouble because the queue reaches the hall. Having said this, in my humble opinion and given what is offered, you should first spend $10 and have breakfast outside. At breakfast you will find bread for toast, jams, butter, honey, cereals, milk, coffee, fruit, waffles (where there is an endless queue), muffins, eggs and a sort of hamburger immersed in a slop that I had never seen. It is not an American breakfast where cheese, cold cuts, bacon and spreadable chocolate are missing... As for the rooms, with furnishings and a slightly old-fashioned concept, it must be added that the photos taken with a wide angle will give you a quadruple (as in my case) which is nothing more than a double with two very small queen size beds where you sleep uncomfortable. These are details that once they arrive and cannot change, you have to digest them. Meditate!

title: Nice hotel, great staff
text: Booked this hotel for family trip to NY. Location is great, walking distance to major sites and easy to travel by metro. Rooms were OK, decent space for Manhattan, clean and functional. Staff is great, starting with Louis and Gregory at reception, Diomarys made our day during breakfast - very helpful and smiling all the time. Hotel is tall  - 32 floors and has three lifts, be prepared for short waiting times during rush hours - this is compensated by the location and staff service.

title: Wonderful hotel and staff
text: I cannot say a bad thing about this hotel. The staff we super friendly especially Gregory Prealta on the front desk! Rooms and hotel were very clean. Hotel was within walking distance to all the things we wanted to see and do! We stayed for 6 nights and wanted to stay another 6. I highly recommend this property!

title: Perfect location, good service, average breakfast, housekeeping not so great
text:
I would definitely come back. I gave this hotel 3 stars since it's not the best but it's not the worst either. 
First of all the location is just perfect! The hotel is close to everything you need: good restaurants, rooftops, subway station, Time Square, Boradway theatres... fantastic! 
Breakfast was good but not the best in terms of variety, there was almost no fruits to chose from. There weren't many tables available so you had to go there quite early. A big plus: if you ask for a paper bag you can actually take your breakfast with you. 
All the staff were friendly and they tried their best to accomodate our needs. But the housekeeping wasn't great. They tell you that housekeepers will not clean your room daily, but when they do clean your room is always half done. I found pillow cases left on the ground (dropped or forgotten I don't know), the bathroom wasn't well cleaned as well.

title: Be Aware about the Deposit
text: The hotel advised me there was a deposit equivalent to £250 when I checked in . This was never advised anywhere prior to our arrival.  The receptionist advised it would be repaid within 7 to 14 days after checkout. I never received anything after 14 days. I contacted hotel 3 weeks ago and was told they'd sort it out .46 days later still nothing . I know need to contact my credit card company to try resolve this..

title: Free breakfast
text:
When I went there early in the morning on the day of check-in to leave my luggage, I was told that they could prepare a room for me if it was different from the one I reserved. Since I was alone, I was fine with any room and was able to check in.
The free continental breakfast was appreciated. It was basically bread, but they did have scrambled eggs. It was a bit of a hassle, but the self-service waffles were delicious. They also gave me a bag to take home every time, and I was grateful that I could take my coffee with me.
The room had no amenities, and the facilities felt like a rundown business hotel. Don't get your hopes up here.
The location was good, and there was a roof over the sidewalk part of the way, so even if it was raining, you could easily walk a little to the metro station.

title: Worst Marriott in New York City
text:
Do not stay here the rooms are like broom closets and carpets are filthy rooms stink of cigarettes and pot. Our room had pubic hair in shower and long black hair on sheets.
I called the front desk immediately upon seeing the room and problems they try to cover themselves by saying we will send someone up.
Rooms were over $526 a night we had 7 rooms. The manager would not do anything.
I finally called Marriott and lodged a complaint .
My grandson has asthma so the room with smoke was not good they offered to send up a fan. We opened the window.
Believe me when I say don’t stay there.

title: Excellent
text: Beautiful hotel, clean and very well located. It's my second time at this hotel. Spectacular breakfast. The attention and cordiality of Mrs. Irma Gonzaga in the breakfast area stood out every morning. All reception staff also friendly and cordial. They receive package at no cost.

title: Great Hospitality
text: It was a great experience with a great location. The rooms were tiny, but that’s expected of NYC. Everyone in the hotel was super nice. The breakfast attendant Irma G gave us exceptional service throughout our stay! Can’t wait to book again with them!

title: Thanks Irma!!
text:
I want to thank Irma Gonzaga for her kindness and excellent breakfast provision... all prepared with love and dedication for those of us who enjoyed a few days of vacation... thank you for making our stay pleasant!!
Everyone in general very friendly and good location of the hotel

title: The worst experience
text: I left a necklace in the room and contact them just hours after checkout. Unfortunately, they never tried to help me and told me the room was occupied. Maybe it was picked up by a housekeeper, but they didn't care!

title: Good Stay - Some Challenges
text:
I stayed here five nights during a NYC Christmas visit with my granddaughter. 
Positives:
Friendly front desk and breakfast staff
Room and bathroom were small (NYC) but clean and well maintained 
Breakfast buffet had the standard variety of selections and was constantly refilled 
Convenience store located in the same block for drinks and snacks 
Short walk to Times Square and theaters 
Capizzi, small mom and pop pizza place, just a block away (we ate there three times !)
No elevator issues like those mentioned in other reviews  (although there were times they got crowded).  

Shortcomings:
The hot water heater, at least on the 7th floor, provided an ambience of showering inside a cement mixer.  This sound also occurred when any neighboring room showered. 

The elevators, again at least on the 7th floor, made a faint whirring sound like what you'd hear when walking on a sidewalk and a subway passes underneath. As Elwood Blues said "You get used to it", however,  light sleepers might have a challenge. 

Housekeeping schedule was odd - first day, room cleaned by 10AM.  No service the next day, third day no bed service but housekeeping knocked about 5PM to pick up trash and offer clean towels. 

Small thing, but odd - TV comes on at 100% volume, so if you forget the mute button it blasts you out. 

Overall, a good stay. Rating would have been higher without the noise from the hot water heater. 
Despite the challenges, and because I'm now aware of them, I'd stay here again.

title: good hotel
text:
The hotel is well located, on an avenue not as bustling as the rest of Manhattan, this hotel offers breakfast included, something I really appreciated, it was quite good.
The room is small, but comfortable, very well equipped with everything you need.

title: Better than expected
text: It faces the side of the Port Authority and that's a bit sketchy, but a great location in terms of walkability to most everything in the greater Times Square area, including both Penn and Central stations.  Rooms are NYC-sized (i.e., small) but efficiently organized, bathrooms were reasonable, elevators were fast, and breakfast was routine but not unexpected. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Best recommendation is that we'd re-book.

title: décevant
text:
Le coffre fort est à même le sol , donc inaccessible.

Pour ma part j'ai rangé une bague dans une poche de ma valise, je ne l'ai pas retrouvée en rentrant chez moi.
Mon compagnon n'a pas non plus retrouvé ses écouteurs sans fil, qu'il se souvenait avoir rangé dans un sa...

La salle du petit-déjeuner est constamment pleine il faut jouer du coude pour trouver une place. J'ai vu des gens manger sur leurs genoux dans le lobby.   D'ailleurs, le petit-déjeuner n'a rien de Continental : seuls pains à disposition un petit pain blanc  ou un baggel qu'il faut chauffer pour ramollir et espérer pouvoir manger.
Le seul point positif est la propreté de la chambre. Normal pour un 4 étoiles.
Autrement pour le reste rien à voir avec un 4 étoiles

title: Great stay
text:
We just stayed at the Fairfield Inn. The hotel is in a great spot for all the attractions and lots of places to eat.  

Hotel is clean and the bed was comfortable. Staff friendly and helpful. 

We had breakfast included, my only advise on that is to get down as soon as it’s open, one day we went down a bit later, although the breakfast is constantly filled, there was plenty, it was just very busy in there, other guests not being very patient, or considerate to other guests or even the staff, but that’s not the hotels fault.

Apart for that it was a great stay!

title: Hotel strategico
text:
Ottima posizione ,a pochi passi da molti luoghi d’interesse.
Camere spaziose , con frigo bar ,asse e ferro da stiro,
Bagno ben tenuto e sempre ben pulito.
Arredi un’ po vecchiotti ma ben tenuti.
Il locale della colazione e ben tenuto è gestito molto bene dal personale.
Unica pecca la poca varietà dei prodotti proposti,con pochi scelte salate.
Bella la macchina per iwaffel e buono il caffè .
Tutto il personale è sempre stato gentile,disponibile e efficiente.
Complimenti a tutti

title: Great Stay in a Great Location
text:
We were in New York for a week and decided to stay at the Fairfield Hotel as it was in a great location, close to the subway, ferries to Brooklyn and to Battery Park. The room was quite small and we didnt have to much luggage but for long term stays it may not be the best option as storage is limited. Our room was cleaned daily, reception on check in and out were very helpful. Their is complimentary tea and coffee for guests 24/7 which was a nice touch as well as a free breakfast which runs from 7-9.30am. Also within the bathroom their is complimentary shampoo, conditioner and body wash which isnt the really small typical hotel kinds these are proper sized and a nice feature to have as we traveled as light as possible! Hairdryer is amazing as well! Bed was also very comfortable. Elevators are a bit slow especially in rush hour times like early morning and evening. 
Overall a great hotel and would recommend!

title: Geteilte Emotionen..............
text: .........wenn ich an den Aufenthalt in diesem Hotel denke. Warum? Nun,  Ausstattung, Freundlichkeit des Personals und Lage des Hotels würden wohl 5 Sterne rechtfertigen. Jedoch war die Kälte im Frühstücksraum - vor allem wenn man dazu noch einen Platz unter den Belüftungen zugewiesen bekam - einem entspannten Frühstück abträglich. Und mit kalt meine ich wirklich kalt...ohne Jacke war ein Sitzen (nicht nur für mich, sondern auch für meine Mitreisenden) nicht möglich. Dazu bestand das (warme) Frühstück tagtäglich aus zwei verschiedenen Fleischlaibchen und Eierspeise sowie Toastbrot (sowie typisch amerikanischen Süßigkeiten, welche für mich zum Frühstück nicht in Betracht kommen). Also gab es des öfteren Toastbrot mit Butter (welche jeweils erst aufgetaut werden musste) und Honig oder Marmelade. Wir haben uns anlässlich der Buchung unter "mit Frühstück" etwas mehr erwartet.........aber wahrscheinlich ist man als (Mittel-)Europäer hierbei auch verwöhnt. Meinen bzw. unseren Geschmack hat das Frühstück - gepaart mit der unnatürlichen Kälte - leider nicht getroffen! Daher alles in allem nur drei Sterne für diese Unterkunft - leider!

title: Comfortable and close to everything
text: We stayed six nights at this hotel. It is clean, and comfortable and close to everything. It provides breakfast and guests are encouraged to take breakfast away with them, because it is so busy and the breakfast area is not large enough to accommodate large numbers of guests! We were quite happy with our stay. One problem is the lifts (or elevators...). There are only three lifts and quite often you have to wait for far too long for one( and at times one or two were out of order!). On several occasions we had to wait for over 45 (forty five!) minutes for a lift, as we were on the 24th floor and it was quite a challenge for us to walk down so many floors. Overall we had a very good stay and the staff were professional and friendly.

title: Clean, friendly and comfortable location!
text:
My wife and I stayed at this hotel as a pre-cruise location. Writing this from our room as we wait for our time to make our way to the ship. 

We were warmly greeted and booked in by Karen. We arrived well before our 4 pm check in time but she offered to hold our bags while we walked around the city or she would see if she could get a room ready for us in a few minutes. We opted for the latter.   10 minutes later she brought our room keys to us in the lobby. 

Our room on the 25th floor was quite comfortable and had the great amenities one would expect at a Fairfield.   About 30 minutes later, our phone rang. It was Karen asking if our room was fine. We don’t find that level of service often in our travels and truly thought it was a very nice gesture knowing how busy  the lobby was when we arrived.   Looking out the window, we had a nice albeit obstructed view of the Empire State Building. 

This morning at breakfast we were promptly provided a table and then went through their buffet. The offering were very good including scrambled eggs, sausages, waffles, pastries, bagels, yogurt, fruit, oatmeal and Starbucks coffee.  

We thought based on the cost, location, comfort and friendliness/ efficiency of the staff, this was an excellent choice and a good value. 

Kudos Fairfield Manhattan/Times Square for a job so very well done!

title: Great, centrally located midtown Manhattan hotel option.
text:
I stayed at two different hotels during my New York City weekend, this one and a luxury hotel.  My experience at this property was far superior to the luxury hotel.  

What set this hotel apart was the staff and the service they provided.  Everybody was friendly, welcoming, and quite helpful.   

Plus, the room itself was comfortable and had a great view of the Empire State Building.

The hotel also is in a very convenient location.

I would stay at this hotel again without hesitation.

title: Good Hotel with best location in Manhattan
text:
Nice hotel in Manhattan, very nicely located just some few meters from Subway station / Penn station.
Room was good, bed was comfy, our room was on 19th floor and view from the window was the rear side of 'New Yorker Hotel', their service was good, breakfast was good too.

title: Centrale, stanza piccola, colazione sopra la media
text:
Posizione centralissima a Manhattan, a 10 minuti a piedi da Penn Station e 15 da Times Square.

Lobby ampia e un po’ caotica, check-in estremamente cortese. Quadrupla (due matrimoniali alti e comodi) di dimensioni ridottissime. C’è spazio appena per un minuscolo armadio e per appoggiare le valigie. In compenso pulizia ottima e make up della stanza ogni giorno.

Bagno piccolo ma tutto sommato funzionale, ovviamente senza bidet :-(

Sorpresa inaspettata: una colazione (inclusa nel prezzo) “presentabile”, con buone scelte a buffet (normalmente gli hotel a NY risolvono con un muffin confezionato è un succo di frutta). Un po’ ripetitiva ma un vero affare poter partire con un pasto.

Prezzo in zona 350 dollari al giorno, in linea con Manhattan.

title: Dovrebbe essere organizzato meglio
text:
Il punto di forza di questo albergo è che si trova a due passi da Times Square e Broadway. Basta scendere fare 100 metri a piedi e troverete la metro, la stazione e la fermata del bus.
Onestamente mi duole dare tre stelle perché le camere sono spaziose e fornite di ogni confort compreso il ferro da stiro. Non avrete problemi a ricaricare i vostri dispositivi elettronici perché ci sono 5 prese usb oltre le prese della corrente normali.
Vi consiglio vivamente al momento del vostro check-in di indicare che volete far sistemare la camera ogni giorno ed insistete perché sono un po’ pigri.
Passiamo ora alle note dolenti.
Il primo punto sono le ascensori perché io e la mia famiglia durante i primi due giorni del soggiorno eravamo al 29º piano e la mattina, dopo colazione, scendere è un inferno infatti farseli a piedi è stato faticoso. Ok la vista sull’Empire State Building ma è inaccettabile la lentezza delle tre ascensori di cui la maggior parte delle volte ne funziona solo uno.
Il secondo punto è direttamente collegato al primo perché l’ingorgo delle ascensori è dovuto al fatto che il locale colazione può ospitare solo 74 persone e così si creano file che arrivano fino alla lobby. Potete immaginare quindi che dovete fare colazione celermente. È un peccato perché il buffet è ben fornito e il personale è disponibile e gentile

title: Disaster
text:
My family stsyed at this hotel for 5 nights, room smelled like cigarette smoke every morning.  Front Desk was not helpful in resolving the problem, just offered scented spray.  The complimentary breakfast was a disaster as there were long line that moved slowly and lack of food. 

Do yourself a favor and look at other hotels nearby, there are plenty and can't be worse than this experience.

title: Very expensive, but very poor quality and service
text:
The rooms are unfortunately worn down and desperately need an fresh-up. Of the 3 elevators, 1 was out of service for four days, so waiting times of 12-15 minutes for elevator was on the order. 
Unfortunately, the front desk couldn't bother less.
On the third day, we actually had to ask whether the 800 US per night included a room maid service or not. We could get towls, but had to insist to have to room made.
Staff and guest all agreed that the air-conditioning in the breakfast room was really overdoing it, but the staff committed they had no clue neither who to aks, let alone how to change it.

title: Great Stay
text: Excellent stay, easy to access throughout public transportation and just a few steps from the metro, hotel grounds and rooms, facilities clean and tidy, the penthouse suite definitely worth it, there are going to be a few photos attached, just for your information. The only drawback has been the breakfast service, groups have been preferred over solos or couples, which is not convenient for a business travel, we got somewhere to be, and especially as Marriott BonVoy Titanium Elite Members with hundreds of nights spent, we would like to have a table, space only for designated members, the Four Points by Sheraton in Singapore did that and it was extremely convenient to just pop-in, eat a few plates and go. This was pretty much it, the rest was super ok.

title: Breakfast
text: Big compliment for the breakfast team; with good spirit and a professional attitude Teresa and Diomarys took care of us, and the other guests, at breakfast. Thank you very much Teresa and Diomarys! And of course the colleague who provided gluten free breakfast for one os us! You did a good job and gave us a welcome feeling; a good way to start each day here in NYC!

title: Ugh - skip this hotel!
text:
1) We checked in... 30mins later another guest was given our room, used the key and walked right in.
2) later, when returning, our keys didn't work, due to the earlier incident.
3) after a linen change we were left one towel. Called reception, an hour later, nothing. Spoke to reception, "housekeeping have a list of rooms and will get to it." four hours later, still nothing. Pathetic. Great to let two paying customers use one towel.
4) upon first shower, body wash was empty. Called housekeeping. They said they no longer supply body wash and gave me three bars of hand soap. Originally, we had one I assumed was for the basin, not to split between basin and shower. Stingey. 

Oh, but Kitchen staff were great. Doesn't negate the rest.

title: Great customer service
text:
My stay was awesome and got even more awesome with the help of Gio, Gregory and Alex. They realy epitomize what true customer service looks/feels like.
Thanks a million guys!!!!! The breakfast crew did there thing as well. They ensured I ate and was fully energized to take on the day ahead.

title: Vacation
text: Front desk staff Jeffrey I think that’s how u spell it very helpful told us places of interest and showed us on the transit map what train to take and gave us the map the next day he ask us how our day was. Breakfast was poor just some eggs and a few  sausage could use bacon not everyone likes sausage. Lots of kids from I believe it was vide dance club I think that’s how u spell it out of control parents letting there kids run around the hotel the parents looked like they are space out. The elevator are all ready slow have 3 elevators for 33 floors u need ur room key to get to ur floor but the kids from vide dance club get in and press every button and at nite when u trying to sleep they would play in the hallways and stairwell knocking on ur door and laughing and running down the stairs.Homeless people outside at nite. Would I stay here again only if there is not a group of kids from a dance group staying at the same time

title: Good stay
text: The staff here are very friendly and really helpful, couldn’t fault them. The rooms themselves have comfortable beds but are a little dated and in need of some TLC. The lampshades were broken and so was the air con unit vent, although it did work really well. The location is good, near Times Square and all the local amenities. Towels were plentiful and room service is every other day. My friend fractured her ankle whilst we were there and the hotel was really helpful and provided ice, wheelchair and anything we needed.

title: bon hôtel
text: A proximité de Penn Station, l'hôtel bénéficie de la proximité des métros et est bien situé. Le lobby dispose d'un bar. Les chambres sont plutôt grandes (plus que certains hôtels parisiens...), propres et assez agréables, avec une belle salle de douche. Equipement complet. Literie très confortable. Environnement plutôt calme en étage élevé avec une belle vue. Accueil et départ efficaces. Petit déjeuner correct.

title: Good location and hotel for the price
text:
The hotel is good, dated, but good. You get what you pay for. 
Only bad thing is the breakfast area, very small for the amount of guest, however Irma Gonzaga made a very good effort to keep it moving and to accommodate everyone, she is very friendly, professional and shows she likes her job.

title: Not bad for the price
text: Not exactly dirt cheap, but very reasonable compared to other hotels in the Times Square/Hells Kitchen area. King Room/City View: Clean room, clean bathroom, very comfortable king bed. Within walking distance to everything: subways, dining, attractions. Free breakfast buffet with many hot or cold options. Staff friendly

title: Confortable y muy buen ubicado
text: Nos gustó mucho la ubicación, la higiene y la buena predisposición de todo su personal. El check in fue rápido y como la habitación estaba disponible pudimos entrar antes. Es luminosa y no es ruidosa. El desayuno tiene lo básico, podría ser mejor, pero se compensa con la simpatía y calidez de Teresa Cruz y Dyomaris Correa que son las que le ponen alegria a las mañanas del desayunador; algo que no es menor en estos tiempos. Sin duda nos volveremos a hospedar cuando podamos regresar. Lo recomendamos!

title: Fair experience for low expectations
text:
I am still in my trip, I booked through Expedia but wasn’t able to leave an early feedback.
I booked my stay for 7 nights but booked another stay after my 4th day.
Leaving below feedback hoping someone can see it be:
check-in was great and I was able to get my room earlier but unfortunately the room wasn’t similar to what I have seen in Expedia.
There is a huge noise at night because of some fans working all the time in the rooms, so for someone like me it is too noisy to have this continuous sound while trying to sleep!
The room is clean but too small :(
Elevator is having a queue and someone should go out earlier expecting delays till arriving at the street.

title: good basic service
text: The staff was friendly and efficient. The room (King) was quite nice with a decent desk & chair. The bathroom was nice, but a little tight. The hallways are very narrow, but the elevators are pretty prompt. A good value stay dose to theaters,

title: Diomarys Correa gracias!!!!!
text: Increíble experiencia sobre todo en el área de desayunos donde Diomarys Correa nos atendió a con alegría y muchas cosas ricas.  El resto todo sucedió bien y con calma. Muy buena experiencia los recomiendo en especial la sala de desayuno y su gente.

title: great customer service
text: The desk clerk to check people in was amazing.  Cynthia Nicols remained calm and helpful during a very difficult time.  She was wonderful at handling all of the guests and helping to make sure that we were all happy

title: Affordable and clean Marriott property
text:
3 night stay with wife and friend.
2 king rooms were ample size and very clean. Nice view of Midtown from 28th FL.
Nice complimentary breakfast.
 each morning 
Staff was friendly and courteous.
Strongly suggest a dedicated restroom for fitness center. The restroom near the workout room was always occupied by employees. Employee had to give you access and it was not adequately kept clean.
Would stay again as our Marriott member senior rate was very reasonable.

title: Exceptional Accommodation
text:
Very clean and comfortable hotel. The room was spacious and well presented on arrival. A very good standard and very reasonably priced. Bathroom was very clean with a very cool shower. Staff at this hotel were exceptional and very helpful!
The location couldn’t be better and all means of public transport are very close by.
You can’t go wrong with this hotel 👍🏼

title: Good place to lay your head in the center of Manhattan.
text: Right across from the Port Authority terminal on 40th St. Room was clean and quiet. The only thing about the room was I thought the pillows were too fluffy, but that's just me. Beds comfy. The breakfast included was very good - worth it just for that! Though the breakfast area did get crowded at times. Also, they seem to have a problem with checking people in -- rooms were not ready in time, and it wasn't just a one-off - every day was like that. Small lobby where people waiting for their rooms were crowded together. Nice personnel. Decent shower.

title: Brilliant Location & Value for Money!
text:
Only a stones throw away from Times Square & a majority of the attractions, this hotel was perfect for our sightseeing trip! The 40th street subway is also at the end of the block & allows you to catch a majority of the different lines directly! This was a massive help and took a lot of stress out of getting the subway!

Staff were very friendly, especially the maintenance man who came up to fix our window after it wouldn’t close - couldn’t do enough to make it right for us! Room was surprisingly quiet despite the constant traffic & very dark thanks to the blackout curtains. Main issue with noise came when our upstairs neighbours decided to have a shower as it sounded like the roof was caving in! Definitely recommend ear plugs for light sleepers. That being said, water pressure was superb and very hot!

title: excelente
text: Un hotel que sin dudas volvería, no solo por la comodidad de su habitación, por su buen desayuno, pero por sobre todo por el personal que atiende el hotel, tanto en recepcion sino como en el area del desayuno, nos hicieron sentir en casa,

title: Au coeur de Manhattan
text:
Hôtel idéalement placé pour qui veux découvrir Manhattan. Il est proche de tous les grands sites, Times Square, Empire State Building, Central Park, ... Une station de métro à l'angle de la 42 ème permet d'accéder à tout New York.
Les chambres sont correctes. Privilégier les étages supérieurs (au delà de 10) pour profiter d'une vue sur des building (sinon c'est le parking de la gare routière)
Un petit bémo, l'hôtel n'a pas de bar.

title: Great place to stay
text: My husband and I were in the city for a quick two night trip and had a great stay here. Karen was the front desk agent was great and the check in process was smooth. Room was good and very quite being across from the bus terminal. A close walk to get to any of the broadway theaters. Breakfast was great and they kept everything stocked. They were able to hold our luggage at check out as we had a late evening flight. They even kept one of my fragile items in the back office so it didn’t get damaged. Would definitely come back next time we are in the city.

title: Great stay in a central location
text:
We stayed for 5 nights at the Fairfield, the location is very central, it runs alongside port authority terminal station, having arrived from JFK Airport we took the LIRR to Penn station and comfortably walked from there to the hotel as it is just off 8th avenue. 

For the hotel itself, we had a king room on the 24th floor, although in a noisy area once the windows were shut no noise interrupted our sleep, the bed was very comfortable and we had everything we needed including a mini fridge in the room and coffee making facilities, the rooms were cleaned every day if you wanted it, we settled for every second day and there is a safe in the room. 

The hotel serve breakfast each morning from 6-10:30am, again I had read reviews about it being small and not enough space, we always got a table upon check in, the staff are so friendly, clearing tables, making sure the seats and table were clean before seating us, offering to fill our water bottles for the day, always checking if we needed take away bags or boxes for snacks during the day. We were served by Diomarys, Teresa, Luis and Rodolfo. They always greeted us with a smile and some pleasant conversation, nothing was ever too much trouble, one morning when we arrived down the cookies were finished as we were late and the staff, a very tall girl, I didn’t get her name, went in and cooked us a batch while we had our breakfast, ever so helpful. There was a huge selection of cereal, fruit, eggs, waffles, bagels, sweet pastries and cookies, juices, something for everyone, with take away coffee and tea for on the go. The staff in the breakfast area are a credit to the running of the service and I would come back and also recommend the hotel to others. 

Reading reviews prior to our stay I was worried about the lift situation, believe me, we never had a problem with the lifts, there is 3 and they come very quickly. 

We are checking out now today, check out is 12pm, there is a seating area downstairs if you wish to utilise after you checkout and also the hotel are happy to stow away your luggage. 

I would rate this hotel 5/5 for quality, friendliness, comfort of the rooms and location. Well done and do not be afraid to book this hotel. It has everything you need and want.

title: Decent but dated
text: Hotel is in a decent location. Close to Times Square and theatre district is a bonus but area around hotel and Port Authority is pretty seedy. Room we had was clean and roomy by NYC standards but pretty dated and carpet was torn dirty in places. Hotel really in need of a renovation. Breakfast was a pleasant surprise. Good selection that changed daily. Personell in the hotel overall very helpful.

title: Long waits for elevators
text: The elevators and breakfast room were a nightmare. We had to wait up for 20 minutes to get elevators up or down.  And the breakfast room also came with a line and long wait. The water that they put out was often empty. And they hotel is located just a few doors from a liquor store so it didn’t feel safe. We would not stay here again.

title: Muy buena experiencia
text:
Lo que más destaco es la atención de todo el personal del hotel, destacándose en la recepción Alex y todo los chicos que asisten en el desayuno (Teresa, Irma, Luis, etc.). Nos hicieron sentir como en casa!!!
Las habitaciones son chicas como en todo NY pero las camas son muy cómodas. Si se pide te hacen limpieza cada 48hs y te dan toallas diarias. Volveríamos sin dudarlo.

title: Posizione top
text: La posizione è il punto di forza di questa struttura. A 1 minuto metro e 8Av, a 5 minuti siete a time square. Negozi e locali non mancano . In più avevo anche la colazione compresa, non particolarmente abbondante la scelta, ma visti i prezzi di New York non è male . Unica pecca la pulizia delle camere, la fanno a giorni alterni.

title: Hôtel confortable au centre ville
text:
Nous avons séjourné 5 nuits dans cet hôtel. La situation est excellente, près de nombreuses lignes de métro et de Times Square que l’on peut rejoindre à pied. 
La chambre était de taille suffisante, propre, literie de bonne qualité. Le ménage a été fait quotidiennement (sauf le dimanche). Nous étions en étage élevé comme demandé, la vue était dégagée et agréable. 
Le petit déjeuner n’était pas incroyable mais nous avons toujours trouvé de quoi manger. En revanche, gros bémol sur les couverts et assiettes jetables utilisés… 
Le personnel était sympathique.
En rapport qualité prix, nous recommandons.

title: exceallant choice
text: I cannot say enough about how great this hotel was. our whole family stayed here for a wedding, and the front desk staff was great!! the breakfast staff was so sweet and amazing, we felt safe, everything was clean!!

title: Great location ! Helpful staff !
text: We were involuntarily re-located to this hotel because the hotel we booked at cancelled our booking while we were on our long transatlantic flight. The staff during check-in did their best to accommodate us as we were very disappointed and tired by this time. Breakfast was good, you could even get a paper bag and take some things with you to go. Also could take coffee to go. The breakfast room is a bit small though. Would probably need some more tables/chairs. The breakfast staff was very polite. Location is great... very close to Times Square and Broadway !

title: Needs updating and a deep clean
text: Stayed for 4 nights right before Christmas week. The rooms are very tiny and cramped. They could also do with a renovation as they seemed quite dated. I had a 6 year old with me, so she wanted to watch TV, but it hardly worked correctly and seemed pretty old as well. The shower head was horrible! The shower leaked water all over the floor as well, which is annoying. The bathroom is very tiny as well. For the price, it's not worth it. Free breakfast was a plus, but only if you don't care how food tastes. The front desk help was very nice and friendly, though they were behind what looked to be bulletproof glass? So it was hard to hear what they were saying most of the time. Rooms were only cleaned when you asked for it, same with towel restock. I wouldn't say the rooms were dirty but they felt dingy and I wouldn't trust walking around barefoot or in just socks. For the money, I will stay somewhere else next time.

title: Amazing Front office manager!
text: Anthony Pichardo, the front office manager was so helpful. He exceeded our expectations with the check-in process and allowed our two rooms to be side by side and also on the same floor. He was so kind, we will definitely be staying here again!

title: Fabulous hotel
text:
Great hotel  and very close to Penn Station. Would highly recommend very clean and comfortable and a lot of variety at Breakfast. 
However I’m still waiting for my 100$ refund that you took at checking in. 

Best wishes 
Lindsey

title: Highly recommended
text: Had a really great stay at this hotel. Really well located, clean, decent size rooms (especially for NYC) and really quiet at night. Walking distance from so many cool places but also right by the subway station. Breakfast was great and so were the breakfast staff. Only negative was the housekeeping. They said it was every other day but in 6 nights we only got housekeeping once and had to request someone to come and empty the bins and take the used towels away. Other than that, would recommend and would definitely stay again.

title: SAVE YOUR MONEY!!!
text:
Don’t go here…..the rooms are terribly small and outdated.  My bathroom had stained shower floors, broken drawers and TV, no blanket on the bed, the elevators didn’t work, the breakfast was bad and the same every single day we were there, the location is good I guess but man the price you pay to stay was definitely not! 
I can give them the staff, they were nice and even they don’t know what to say, it’s a job so…..
Never again will we stay here for what you pay.
Nothing like the photos!!!!

title: L’ascensore di oggi passa domani!
text: L’attesa dell’ ascensore è estenuante. Anche 10 minuti. La cosa snerva parecchio.per il resto è accettabile, ma conviene usare le scale!. Sto scrivendo la recensione mentre aspetto l’ascensore. La cosa rompe parecchio. Penso a quelli che sono ai piani alti

title: Excelente ubicación y personal
text: He estado alojada 10 días, la ubicación es buenísima. El personal del desayuno excepcional sobre todo Irma, Teresa, Luis y Daniel. Todos hablan español, te da recipientes para que te puedas llevar comida del buffet, bollos, leche, tostadas, cola cao, café, etc. el personal de recepción muy amable también. La única pega que le veo es que te limpian la habitación 1 día si y otro no y no t la limpian muy bien. Te hacen las camas pir encima, el espejo y el lavabo ni lo tocan, te vacían la papelera y poco más. Aun así lo recomiendo.

title: Go elsewhere
text: Tiny tiny postage stamp sized room, terrible AC/HVAC, incredibly long lines for breakfast, front desk employees behind a glassed/walled enclosure (speaks to the safety concerns they have).  Room was not ready at 5pm as promised, so we had to leave our bags.  Porter also 'lost' one of our bags and brand new $50 water bottle, which they wouldn't replace.  Bag was eventually located and had clearly been rifled through.  This place is right next to the bus station and also to a parole office, so be aware of the surroundings.  Overall, it was not a pleasant stay.

title: Checked all the boxes
text:
I have stayed at a lot of Marriotts but this one was the most well-run and most accommodating considering it was their busiest day of the year. The staff were courteous, calm and helpful at all times. Robert Matarrazo, the hotel’s director of operations saved the day for me, making it possible for my son and me to make it  to our dinner spot and get to Madison Square Garden to see Stromae’s sold-out performance (it was brilliant!) Our  room was very clean and made the best use of its small space. The beds were divine. The only thing I found slightly problematic was the sliding door to the bathroom which did not have a tight fit.

Breakfast was a pleasure. It was very crowded but efficiently run. The staff replenished everything quickly; they were extremely  cheerful and helpful. 

Walking to this Marriott was a little dicey but hey, it’s Manhattan with all of the unsavory aspects of a huge metropolis. But once you entered the front door, you felt welcomed and respected. A superb experience all around!

title: Great experience for a family with teens.
text: I labored over choosing a hotel that was affordable, yet nice, and in close proximity to the majority of activities we had planned so we could walk to everything. The hotel was great! Staff was super friendly and helpful all around  from the front desk to the cleaning staff. Even at the free breakfast, staff was proactive in cleaning up our plates and bringing us coffee.   I had been in the lobby market area looking for pain reliever. There was none on the shelf and an employee asked if I needed assistance.   He dropped what he was doing to go hunt some in the back.   Housekeeping was great as well. The hotel was clean and we were greeted every time we came in and out of the lobby.

title: Emplacement idéal
text: Hôtel bien situé pour les visites. Métro pas loin, gare routière et pas mal d'attractions proches (Times Square, Bryant Park etc.). Le personnel est très agréable, serviable, souriant, poli. Les chambres sont propres. Celles donnant sur la rue sont bruyantes, forcément. J'ai trouvé le petit-déjeuner un peu léger. Pas de saucisses ou de bacon, pas de machines à gaufre alors qu'on en trouve dans tous les motels, pas de pancakes.

title: Excellent location, all you need for your stay in NY
text:
Hotel very well located on busy street, room clean and comfortable and a good size, v comfy bed, lots of storage space, bathroom compact but v clean and serviced alternate days.
Breakfast was great, v friendly and attentive  staff , good selection of food- porridge, cereals, fruit, yoghurt, bagels, croissants, muffins, pastries and toast, scrambled eggs, meat and fried potatoes, nuts and other toppings, tea, coffee and juices. We were able to pack a little picnic to take out sightseeing too which was great!
Checkout was 12 and staff were happy to hold bags for us until we needed to go to airport. All in all excellent value for money- happily recommend! We never had to wait for long to get a table for breakfast, just a few moments.

title: Great location
text:
We had a nice stay, but the rooms are very small and not so clean. Every morning you will have to wait in a long line to get into the breakfast Restaurant where they mainly serve bread and pastries. 
Luis provided the best service every morning and was very accommodating and helpful

title: Convenient
text:
The hotel is well placed for a week in NY, close to the station and subway. Price was fair but room claustraphobic , you could probably manage the 12 inch gap round the bed with little luggage but for a week with three cases it was rather like a game of tetris, every day.
Breakfast was included but minimal. The staff worked hard to keep supplies topped up but plates, plastic cutlery and arms stuck to the tables, which some days were limited.

The tour/travel advisor was helpful but great praise goes to Christian the Mohican, and his colleague, the concierges, who were unfailingly helpful and pleasant. Five stars to them.

title: Nice hotel, dodgy streets.
text:
We stayed here as a family of four (11&13 Yr old kids). The hotel is quite pleasant, staff from reception to the restaurant were all friendly and helpful. The room was pretty small, enough room for 2 double beds and not a lot else, apparently this is normal for New York.
The main reason for the 4 star rating is the immediate area. I know it's not the fault of the hotel, but I can only rate it on what it's like. Which is pretty rough. Homeless and beggars all over the local streets and a lot of drug taking, in fact most of the Garment District to a couple of blocks north of Times Square was unpleasant to walk around, especially after dark. The one good point is that the subway (Port Authority Bus Terminal) is at the end of the street, really handy for getting to Lower Manhattan etc. We had a couple of small issues with the room when we got there which were sorted out quickly, and the complimentary breakfast was a plus point. Overall a nice hotel, just a shame the area isn't as nice.

title: Great location, Not great accommodations
text: This location was perfect -- 1 block from subway and only a couple blocks walk to Times Square.  The bed was fine.  The employees were extremely friendly and helpful.  We were able to keep our baggage stored for a few hours after checkout but before we transferred to a different hotel close to LGA.  The room is tiny, but that is to be expected in NYC, however, the hallway on floor 5 is barely wide enough for two people to walk side-by-side.  And the cabinets outside of the elevator doors made the hallway feel very claustrophobic.   We did not eat breakfast here as the selection was lackluster -- they were out of eggs and while the plain bagel might have been ok, once you sliced it, it was covered in gunk from everyone else's bagels.  Probably not a deal breaker for most people, but was definitely a deal breaker for my picky 8 year old.  My only other complaints are 1) the bathroom door didn't close all the way and 2) the bathroom shower had trash in it from the prior occupant.  I wouldn't stay here again and would utilize another hotel in the same area.

title: Great location and met our needs
text: Exceeded expectations from start to finish. Check in was quick and easy, Gregory was very helpful. Room was bigger than I was expecting and the beds and pillows were top notch. Bathroom was renovated and towels were thick. Liked having the mini fridge. Breakfast was included and more than I was expecting. Had some hot options which was nice including eggs and sausage. Wish they had a waffle machine but that was the only thing lacking. Location was perfect for our needs. Close to public transportation and Times Square. Felt pretty safe even though right across street for busy Port Authority bus terminal. Good value for the money.

title: Perfect Location for the Javits Center
text: We stayed 4 nights for New York Comic Con 2022. Perfect location, close enough to to the Javits Convention Center, 1/2 block from Penn Station. Directly across from the old main post office building. The lobby is welcoming with comfortable furniture and work-friendly tables and chairs, Service was friendly and efficient. Room was clean, and the breakfast was adequate with several choices. We asked for a room refrigerator and it was promptly delivered. We really had zero complaints and would stay here again.

title: Ottimo soggiorno
text:
L’hotel si trova in un’ottima posizione ( a 5 minuti da Times Square, a pochi passi dalla stazione degli autobus e dalla metro). Il personale è gentile, le camere sono confortevoli e la pulizia viene effettuata a giorni alterni, ma al check in ti informano di ciò. La colazione è buona, c’è la possibilità di mangiare sia salato che dolce ed il personale rifornisce in continuazione il buffet. 
Consiglio assolutamente questo hotel e lo sceglierei di nuovo!

title: Excellent hotel and exceptional staff
text:
We had an excellent stay in the Fairfield. This hotel is excellent and is made even better by the amazing staff the hotel had. All the staff exceeded my expectations and were always very friendly and helpful.

Our room was great. Just what we needed after a busy day in New York seeing the sights. Yes the rooms are not the biggest but they are excellent, clean, modern,bed is super comfy and the bathroom is clean & modern.

The only complaint/ negative thing I could say about the hotel and its only a minor thing for us was the hot breakfast food. There was not choice or variety in the hot food section, it was the same food every morning and sometimes it was not hot.

title: Buena ubicación y personal fantástico
text:
Hemos estado alojados tres semanas en este Hotel. Está bien situado para poder llegar a todas las atracciones que se quieran visitar en Manhattan. Junto a varias líneas de metro, La terminal de autobuses y la estación de trenes de Penny Station.
Queremos destacar el personal que trabaja en este Hotel. Y con especial cariño a Irma y Rodolfo.
Irma es una persona que siempre te atiende con una sonrisa y siempre dispuesta ayudarte en todo lo necesario.
Y qué decir de Rodolfo, es encantador y muy profesional. Si algún día teníamos que salir antes porque visitábamos otras ciudades, no dudaba en quedar con nosotros a la hora que fuera para facilitarnos el desayuno para llevar. Es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo que sabe relacionarse con la gente, muy educado, muy amable y encantador.
El valor humano de las personas que trabajan en este Hotel es muy elevado y te facilitan mucho tu estancia.
Muchas gracias!!

title: Rapport qualité prix exceptionnel !
text:
Impossible de trouver mieux en plein cœur de New York près de Time Square, pour 1400 euros les 8 nuits c’était parfait.
Cerise sur le gâteau ce petit déjeuner très sympa inclus avec un personnel adorable et serviable (pas mal d’attente au delà de 7h30) 
Chambre propre un peu petite mais au calme au 23 eme étage et c’était là l’essentiel. (pas de vue exceptionnelle)
Plusieurs lignes de métro très proche.
Un seule ombre au tableau, l’incroyable saleté de la 40 eme rue aux alentours de l’hôtel avec de très nombreux clochards, ordures, immondices et une forte odeur de substances illicites…Heureusement après 10 minutes de marche vers la 6eme rue cela devient agréable.
Hormis ce point on recommande cet hôtel.
Peu de restaurants de qualité pour déjeuner ou dîner, on a privilégié par exemple le Whole Foods entre la 33 eme et la 10eme avenue.
Personnel sympa à la réception qui vous propose des bouteilles d’eau gratuites sur demande.

title: Hôtel agréable, bien situé, personnel aimable
text:
Nous avons séjourné une semaine dans cet établissement ou nous avons occupé deux chambres. Toutes deux spacieuses et confortable, propres.
Le personnel est aimable.
Le petit-déjeuner inclu est très appréciable avec du salé et du sucré. L'équipe qui gère la salle du petit-déjeuner est sympathique et efficace. Merci à Diomarys Correa et à son équipe qui maintient une salle propre, un buffet approvisionné et qui affiche un beau sourire. Il faut tout de même descendre de bonne heure au risque d'avoir de l'attente, la salle n'étant pas très grande.
L'hôtel est très bien situé au coeur de Manhattan.

title: Excelente hotel para estar cerca de Time Square, con subte en frente. Muy buen desayuno
text:
Muy lindo hotel, con camas cómodas, cerca de todo y con excelente locomoción de subte enfrente.
Muy buen desayuno, completo con café de Starbucks,  la atención de Diomarys y Luis excelente. 
Volvería sin dudas!!

title: Bon hôtel
text:
On est venu entre amis en août 2022. L hôtel est bien en soi. Les chambres spacieuses,  propres, literie bonne. Un petit frigo mais qui n en est pas vraiment un , il conserve juste au frais..
Personnel très sympathique.  Il s agissait de nos anniversaires de mariage et nous avons eu 1 petite surprise sur notre lit le lendemain de notre arrivée (pétales de rose et décoration sur le lit ). Pour le petit déjeuner qui est correct allez y avant 07h30 sinon il y a la queue, le personnel est d ailleurs très gentil .Vous pouvez même demander des doggy bag à remplir pour picniquer le midi,ce qui est très pratique. 
Des fontaines d eau sont disponibles à l accueil ce qui est bien quand il fait chaud pour remplir ses bouteilles et partir visiter
L hôtel est bien placé à quelques minutes de times square et une bouche de métro à proximité. Cependant nous avons été surpris par le nombre de SDF sur ce secteur. La crise Covid a fait des dégâts mais aucune agressivité de leur part.
Nous étions venus il y a 6 ans dans 1 autre hôtel situé à proximité  et ce n était pas comme cela. Mais c est tout le secteur de times square qui est touché. A refaire nous choisirons un hôtel plus éloigné et plus calme quitte à faire 10mn de métro.  
Malgré tout nous nous sommes régalés . Cet hôtel est très bien et bien situé au regard des transports..

title: Great hotel for price
text:
This was second time staying at this property.  Staff are excellent-we arrived 5 hours prior to check in and expected just to store our luggage and come back.  Front desk checked us in early!  Rooms are clean, staff are friendly, and beds were comfy.  The breakfast buffet is excellent with choices for everyone.  A special shout out to Diomarys Correa, Breakfast Attendant.  She kept the room orderly, seated people quickly all the while smiling & singing.  
The location is great for getting transportation to wherever you need to go-right across from Port Authority.

title: Ottima posizione
text:
Hotel a pochi passi da Times Square,comoda la stazione metro a meno di 100 metri, la linea in questione vi collega direttamente all' aereoporto JFK.essendo vicino a Times Square logicamente locali negozi e ristoranti non mancano.
Stanze in tipico stile newyorchese, minuscole, con moquette,stranamente la pulizia della stanza è su richiesta, dopo le 8 per entrare nella minuscola sala colazione, bisogna fare anche 15 minuti di fila. 
Calcolando però che a New York il tempo da passare in stanza è poco, questa struttura è ottimale soprattutto per la posizione.

title: Gran hotel
text: Hermoso hotel, y estupenda ubicación. El servicio brindado en el desayuno fue excelente y la habitación se encontraba impecable. Además, cabe destacar la atención de los empleados ya que fue increíble, como por ejemplo es el caso de Deomarys, Luis y Rodolfo! Super recomendable.

title: Personal desayuno
text: El personal del desayuno fue muy amable, especial mención a Diomarys, una mujer encantadora (un día te llevaremos a conocer a Profesor) y también muchas gracias a Luis, muy atento con todas nuestras peticiones. Muchas gracias por todo!

title: Great location, great stay
text:
->Area and Surroundings:
The hotel is very well located. It’s right in the heart of Manhattan say only 10 minute’s walk from Times Square. One more beautiful thing of the hotel is that it is right opposite Port Authority Bus terminal, this makes it really convenient to catch intercity buses.

The hotel is just 5 mintues walk to seven elven or Burger King. Also a 1 mitue walk to nearby pizza joint which is open till 1AM

->Room:
We were upgraded to a city view room on 23rd floor. The room size was good compared to other hotels in New York Manhattan area. The bed was a king size bed (not queen size) and made me sleep very comfortably.

The room has enough storage in form of big drawers below the TV cabinet and also on the bed side.

->Bathroom and Bathing experience:
The bathroom was tiny in size but had all the amenities which are required. A Hair dryer, Shaver voltage points and toiletries were provided.

->Hotel Staff
The hotel staff was always helpful and warm. The rooms have good fast wifi and its Free.

->Breakfast:
The hotel had decent enough breakfast. It had 2-3 hot dishes daily. Bread, Beagles, Tea Coffee, Juices, scrambled egg, Potato wedges, flavored yogurts etc. were a regular feature. The Breakfast was very crowded and one has to wait for their turn to be seated. The breakfast serves “Starbucks” coffee as a regular feature.

->Swimming Pool / Gym / Spa:
The hotel does have a pool and a fitness center but I was not able to visit the same

Special mention:
Wifi Speed was good during our stay. and we loved our stay in this hotel and city.

title: Great stay!
text: Fairfield was only 1 of 2 hotels that I could find that had 2 beds that was affordable. It is in a great central location. I took my 18 year old son and the hotel and room was perfect for us. The front staff was great and the breakfast staff was very friendly and worked hard.  Subway station is at the end of the lock and the bus that takes you to the Hudson River is only a few blocks away.  If I ever go back to NYC, I would definitely stay here again.

title: Hell ride from the hotel to La Guardia arranged by front desk
text: Hotel staff should have guest safety their priority even after check-out. We requested a ride to La Guardia airport on July 2, in the morning (8 am), at the hotel front desk. They called for a flat rate taxi and told us to wait for a black car to arrive. A black car was waiting a few minutes later; instead, front desk staff guided us to a private (run-down, not black) car at the door, apparently not belonging to any company, no sign of any license to transport passengers. Once started, it became apparent that the driver had no idea how to get to the airport, tried to navigate himself with his phone GPS, driving with one hand, while holding his phone in the other. Still he missed the obvious airport sign on the way and took a wrong exit and took us to a detour on small streets and finally getting back to the freeway later...the car had no AC. A passing car tried to warn that something was wrong on the left side of the car, but the driver said it was OK. Then he started to demand cash payment before arriving at the airport...Fairfield Inn Times Square hotel should know about this scam ride (probably used on other guests too) and hold any hotel staff, who is involved, accountable, to end this dangerous practice...Future guest should also be aware of this scam, if they plan a flat rate ride arranged by front desk staff. An experience like this ruins the overall impression of the hotel, which is otherwise at a great location in NYC.

title: Recomiendo este hotel 100%
text:
Totalmente recomendable este hotel! Estuve 15 dias y no pudo ser mejor la experiencia alli. Desde los conserjes, el front desk, la gente que esta en el desayuno (Diomarys es una genia!! Siempre atenta y a disposición de lo que se necesite), hasta las chicas que limpian la habitación. Nos hospedamos en un piso alto, y siempre los ascensores vinieron rapido. La ubicación es inmejorable, frente a port authority, donde casi todas las lineas de subtes pasan por ahi. Incluye un desayuno recontra completo y  con cafe de starbucks. Reciben paquetes sin ningun problema.
Claramente el dia que vuelva, pienso hospedarme en este hotel!!

title: Repetiría, sin duda alguna...!!!!
text:
Como siempre que elijo un hotel reviso y reviso mil veces las opiniones en distintos foros, webs,..., sobre los hoteles que tengo previsto quedarme. En esta ocasión tenía varias opciones y me quedé sorprendido por que habían muchas de ellas bastante malas o preocupantes, respecto la limpieza, el atendimiento del personal o incluso por problemas con la tarjeta o pagos indebidos....

En mi opinión personal, solo puedo decir que toda mi estancia fue perfecta, así de simple. Resumiendo, solo puedo decir que:

1.- La limpieza fue perfecta y la realizaron todos los días (Gracias, Jenny). Os recomiendo leer antes de criticar al hotel o al personal de limpieza, puesto que se indica claramente que si quieres la limpieza de la habitación debes indicarlo en la recepción del hotel en el momento del "check-in", tanto los días, como la hora que deseas la limpieza. Nosotros indicamos que nos limpiaran la habitación a partir de las 11:00 y nunca nos molestaron o se adelantaron a la hora indicada.

2.- Nos alojaron en la planta 23 y no fue, en absoluto, ningún problema, dado que los 3 ascensores funcionaron perfectamente y no tuvimos problemas de ningún tipo a la hora de utilizarlos.

3.- El desayuno es bastante sencillo, pero es que no podéis esperar un estandar europeo de "todo incluido" o "desayuno buffet de hotel de playa". Estamos hablando de un hotel de ciudad, de la ciudad de NY...!!!!! Había lo básico y necesario: Huevos revueltos, leche, cereales, fruta, yoghurt, baggels, tostadas, magdalenas, café, té,.... Qué más queréis...!!!!!. Por cierto, mención en especial a Teresa y Luis.... UN MILLÓN DE GRACIAS...!!!!!

4.- Respecto la tarjeta o los cargos adicionales que te aplica el hotel..., CERO...!!!!! Nada de nada, yo no suelo (y no me gusta) dejar ninguna tarjeta de crédito por posibles "sustos" después de dejar el hotel...; pues bien, este hote te ofrece la posibilidad de dejar un depósito en metálico de 250$ que son COMPLETAMENTE REEMBOLSABLES, y de INMEDIATO, al dejar el hotel (siempre y cuando no hayáis provocado ningún desperfecto en la habitación). Aunque no me acuerdo de los nombres de las distintas personas que nos ayudaron en recepción, así como el personal de recepción de equipaje (si, este hotel tiene servicio de consigna), solo puedo decir que todos fueron muy amables y se comportaron de 10.

5.- Ni vimos cucarachas, ni tuvimos problemas de ruidos, ni problemas con el A/A,..., repito, nuestra estancia fue de 10.

Solo os puedo decir que repetiría mi estancia en este hotel, porque me han parecido muy profesionales en todo momento y la ubicación del mismo es perfecta, a escasos 5-10 minutos de Times Square.

Por cierto, mi estancia resultó sobre unos 1200$ desde el 16 al 23 de Julio, así que la relación de calidad-precio, fue excelente.

title: +posizione +personale cortese - pulizia - costo
text: La posizione è ottima, ma l'assenza di pulizia (per sette giorni camera mai rassettata) e alcune carenze come il malfunzionamento di due ascensori su tre, non spiegano il costo di oltre 200 dollari a notte sostenuto. Il personale è molto cortese.

title: Super Hotel an super Lage
text:
Das Hotel befindet sich an einer super Lage direkt neben dem Bus Terminal (kommt man super nach New Jersey in die Jersey Garden Mall) und etwa 5min zum Times Square. Trotz Nähe zum Times Square war es im Hotel nie extrem laut. Rund um das Hotel hat es div. Restaurants und Ibisse und auch Einkaufsmöglichkeiten. 

Das Hotel selber ist sehr sauber. Wir hatten das Zimmer im 27. Stock und es war genug gross für 2 Personen. Für New Yorker Verhältnisse eher ein grosses Zimmer. Das Bett ist sehe bequem und gross genug. Unser Zimmer wurde auf Wunsch (wurde beim Einchecken gefragt) jeden Tag geputzt. Die Mitarbeiter an der Reception sind alle sehr nett und zuvorkommend. Wir hatten nie Probleme mit dem Fahrstuhl etc. wie in div. anderem Bewertungen. 

Das Frühstück ist klein aber fein. Ist halt typtisch amerikanisch. Bagel, Toast, Rührei, Corn Flakes etc. erwartet nicht zu viel. Der Frühstücksraum ist relativ klein für das Hotel man bemüht sich jedoch immer das man schnell einen Tisch bekommt. Das Personal beim Frühstück ist sehr nett und immer gut gelaunt. 

Ich würde das Hotel auf jeden fall nochmals buchen.

title: Visite en famille
text:
Hôtel bien situé à proximité du métro. 
Etage 31 bien insonorisé 
Ménage fait sur demande à la réception 
Présence d’un coffre, un frigo, séchoir, fer et table à repasser 
Le petit déjeuné est varié : œuf brouillés, saucisses, yaourt, pain, gâteau… café, jus.

title: Honteux, à fuir : présence de cafards dans l'hôtel !!!
text:
Localisation est idéale très proche de Times Square mais ...

 Nous avions réservé cet hotel pour 6 nuits du 5 au 11 mai. J'avais séjourné dans cet hôtel il y a 7 ans et j'en avais gardé un bon souvenir. 

Malheureusement, la présence de gros cafards un peu partout dans l'hotel (nous disposons de vidéos à titre de preuve) : chambre, salle de bains et à la réception a était la cause écourté notre séjour au bout de la 2e nuit. 

Lorsque nous avons signalé le problème au staff, le problème a été pris à la légère, comme si cela ne les choqués pas (au vu de leur attitude, ils semblent avoir l'habitude). Un membre du staff est monté attrapé l'un des cafards localisés dans notre douche avec notre serviette, a ensuite l'a laissé repartir dans le couloir et a jeté la serviette en face de l'ascenseur dans le couloir. 

Lorsque nous avons manifesté notre mécontentement à la réception auprès de la manager (que nous avons attendu 1h30) :  

- nous avons constaté qu'il y avait d'autres cafards (un membre du staff leur courait après dans le hall de la réception situé à quelques pas de la salle du petit déjeuner et des cuisines et l'a attrapé avec ses mains), 

- la manager nous a demandé sur un ton hautain de quel pays nous venions car à NYC cela était normal (?!).  Après notre insistance elle nous a proposé une réduction de 10% sur le tarif de la précédente nuit (?!). 

Nous avons donc décidé de quitter cet hôtel au bout de 2 jours. 

Au vu du prix de cet hôtel, cela est une honte. Cet hôtel devrait être fermé.

title: A dream team - amazing service delivery
text:
Perfect location in Times Square right next to the Port Authority Terminal and a short distance away from Central Park.

Excellent staff. Service from the heart led by the GM Helen Guon. Staff are the key to the hotel’s success.

The Reception team in Nancy Le, Keren, Kendijah. The F&B Team Diomarys. Teresa. Rodolfo. The Security team in Anthony. Cheden from Housekeeping. They were amazing and absolutely service from the heart. The dream team.

Excellent service delivery team. If I have such winning teams, I would be smiling from ear to ear on a daily basis.

Keep it up Helen.

title: Horrible person at Front Desk
text:
I had prepaid my stay at this hotel. I'm also a Bonvoy Member who travels 20 days a month for business. I always pick Marriott Hotel. 
I had a problem with my debit card so I had to quickly buy a debit card with 300 $ in it for incidentals at that Fairfield. They do not accept Google Pay so it was tricky because my bank is overseas. 
Emily at the front desk is the most obnoxious, arrogant, rude, mean person I've ever met at a hotel in my life. Her attitude towards me was not acceptable and does not represent the Marriott Brand at all. There was no manager available so it was not possible to solve my check-in problem. As a heavily pregnant woman and traveling from JFK, I found myself without any reservation because Emily quickly canceled mine. She's just an awful awful person. Very unprofessional and classless. She refused to apologize. Worst customer service because of that rude woman. Please Marriott, you can't keep this type of person at all. I won't go back because of her attitude and would not recommend this hotel at all.

title: Not up to a Fairfield Inn
text: I am talking about the one across from the Port Authority. Everything was dark with poor lighting. Furniture chipped. Awful bath toiletries - not up to a Fairfield standard.o am Gold Lifetime asked for high floor - totally disregarded. Pricey for what you get.

title: For A Nice Place To Stay
text:
Great location, great staff. I'm a Marriott member and last time in NY stayed at the Fairfiled by Madison Square Garden. 
That staff was just a bit more attentive.

The daily breakfast is fine and that staff really works it. Kudos to all of them.

Room was on the smaller side, not a lot of space. Don't expect frills. This is a place to hang your clothes and sleep. Very, very clean.

Location is great. Across from Metro Port Authority. Every subway connection you need is right there. Also, even with a little rain and wind, it's an easy walk to, Times Square and the Theatre District. Central Park too if you're a walker.

So while this isn't a property that might 100% reflect the Marriott brand, I would certainly stay here again.

[They have a great car service arrangement if arriving from JFK!]

title: Excellent location and good staff. Would go back
text:
Excellent location, good room and super staff. 

The staff are super helpful for anything you need. Room was nice and clean, location mid town by penn station is great to visit the city as you’re not far from anything. 

Breakfast included is a buffet and a lot
Of choice. Dietary requirements can be catered for no issues. 

Would return with no hesitation.

Only area for improvement be more environmentally friendly removal of plastic cutlery and paper plates put in proper crockery to help minimise hotels impact on environment and plastic waste. Apart from that excellent hotel and ok gym 🙂

title: Great hotel staff!
text: We stayed in the Fairfield inn Times Square for 5 nights! The hotel is great rooms are clean and have everything you need in a great location! The breakfast is brilliant! So much choice! The staff are very helpful Theresa, Irma and Diomarys, were so great and friendly! We will definitely be back!

title: Nice hotel
text:
Stayed here for a week with my husband. Hotel is basic but clean and comfortable, staff were friendly especially the breakfast staff, they couldn't do enough for you. Breakfast was very good and plentiful.
Rooms were small but we were good with that as we didn't plan on spending to much time in them, Beds were comfortable.
And it was great location also, 5 mins from times square and down road from port authority

title: EXCELENTE HOTEL MUY CERCA DE TIMES SQUARE
text: Este hotel me encanto, nos dieron una habitacion en un piso 24 , teniamos vista al Empire state, la habitacion grande re comoda, el desayuno completisimo , constaba de tostadas, bagels, english muffin,huevos, panceta, salchichas, waffles , frutas, cereales y cafe starbucks  la atencion de 10. muy recomendable!!

title: Excelente experiencia!
text:
Hotel muy bien ubicado, habitaciones grandes para estar en Manhattan, desayuno completo y de calidad. 
Personal muy atento y servicial.
Llegamos más temprano que el horario de check in, pero al estar la habitación disponible nos ingresaron de inmediato, sin problemas ni solicitudes adicionales.
Por lejos el mejor hotel en que me he quedado con la familia en NY!

title: 5 night stay, December 2021
text:
We took a trip to New York in December 2021 and stayed in this hotel for 5 nights, I could not recommend this hotel enough. 

The room was very spacious and clean and is in a great location for tourists, especially with it being walking distance from central Times Square.

My partners 21st birthday coincided with our stay and the room decorations were very kindly organised and undertaken by an employee named Anthony Pichardo De La Cruz, without hesitation. This small gesture is something that many other hotels wouldn’t go out of their way to plan and something we were both very appreciative of.

title: Small room, good breakfast, walkable location
text: The hotel is not on a busy street. The location directly across the street from the Port Authority station means easy to access public transportation. It also means you have the typical homeless that tend to be in that area. We felt safe though. The breakfast was excellent. The ladies that worked in the food area and desk area were all friendly. No view from room. Only a couple of blocks from Times Square. The staff were constantly cleaning the hotel (not the rooms). Typical signs of age and wear such as rusted fixtures in bathroom and very uncomfortable beds. They held our luggage after checkout until our flight. Hard to get the room temperature correct- it leans towards hot.

title: Fair but far from great
text:
We spend 8 nights at the Fairfield Inn in Times Square/Manhattan. As a general line the whole experience was a 5 out of 10. The hotel offers just enough for a decent stay: OK bedrooms and great location. 

Rooms: The size of the room is OK for 2 people. We booked a 2 double bed bedroom for 3 people and it was a little awkward to move around. Storage isn't enough even for 1 person. The bathroom is OK.  Beds are comfortable. 

Amenities: The room has a kettle with few tea bags and coffee samples, small fridge, safe, microwave, clothing iron and a tv with Netflix. All in good condition. 

Cleaning: The cleaning service just operates every other day and the cleaning days weren't that clean. We didn't always get the full set of towels (1 towel per person, rarely got hand towels) needed in the room and it was barely dusted. 

Entrance and services: The hotel hosts a large number of guests which usually crowd at the lobby making it difficult to access the help counter. 

Elevators don't suffice the daily transit to the lobby. The high number of guests and floors create long lines every morning during breakfast hours for people to go up and down their room. 

Breakfast was poor. We all understand the challenges of serving a good breakfast during covid, but it was far from good. The choices were limited and the quality of the food was towards bad. 

Staff: Everyone was nice and helpful.

Location: Location is great. Super centric and easy to travel around the island by metro, walking, bus or taxi. Lots of restaurants and entertainment close by. Probably the best asset of this hotel. 

Overall, the experience wasn't bad, but far from great. When you spend your days walking around and eating outside you expect to arrive to a clean and fully equipped room where you can rest peacefully.

title: Very pleasant stay, brilliant location and great complimentary breakfast
text: Clean rooms although very small but perfect for a base whilst exploring NYC. Brilliant location way to get to and from the airport using public transport. We really enjoyed eating on 9th Avenue which is a very short walk. Great complimentary breakfast although the restaurant is not able to be used due to covid restrictions there was always somewhere to sit in the lobby. It was a huge bonus being able to sit on the roof top bar even though the bar isn’t currently open to serve drinks. Very clean hotel, all staff very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants good value for money.

title: Un po’ deludente
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per Natale!
Causa COVID ci hanno informati che le pulizie venivano effettuate su richiesta e nonostante l’avessimo fatto, su 9 giorni, abbiamo trovato la stanza pulita 3 volte.
3 ascensori, uno sempre rotto, quindi attese interminabili per l’utilizzo!
Colazione buona, ma molto affollata, però ottima l’organizzazione per poterla portare in stanza!
Camera per 4 veramente piccola!
Posizione comodissima e strategica.

title: Good stay but...
text:
Not a lot to say about the hotel location (it is where it is) and/or size, same thing. I will just focus in what it wasn't so good:

* There was a problem with the payment when we arrved. The guy there showed absolutely no interest about it, and continued doing some stuff with his computer ignoring me, while I was puzzled thinking what to do.
* This hotel will charge you twice in your credit card. When you arrive, it will make an authorization for the whole stay. And when you leave, will make another charge for the stay, instead of taking it from the authorization. Took them 3 weeks to drop the authorization. In that time they completely ignored my mails asking about it.
* The 1st time the housekeeping was done, I noticed they reprogrammed the AC unit to keep it off and with a lower temperature by default. I guess that they're told to do so in order to save in the electric bill.
* The second housekeeping sweep left no bathtub towels. I had to go down to reception and ask for them when we arrived at night after a long day.

Apart from this points, the hotel is exactly what you might expect based on its description and website. Nothing more, nothing less.

I wouldn't go back to this hotel though. The bad points were bad enough. Specially the 2 ones (lack of empathy from the desk guy, and "charging twice" for the stay). The other points I know they just might happen.

title: Fantastic
text:
Fantastic little hotel. A few minutes walk from Times sq on West 40th st. Plenty of delis and fast food nearby. 
Foyer was decorated for Christmas and was lovely. Always spotless and staff checked vaccine status checking in. 
Room was a good size for a New York hotel. 8 rooms per floor. Two large double beds and a decent bathroom with bath tub. Our room overlooked a rear alleyway and we heard no street noise over night at all! 
Room was well equipped only complaint would be a few coat hooks behind door when you come in would be helpful.
