Breakfast was amazing though busy. Waffles eggs cereal pastries fruit to taste and unlimited drinks. Staff were doing an amazing job serving and cleaning. Not enough seats so be prepared to get it to go. 
We couldn’t fault this hotel in anyway and would definitely be back.

title: Birthday treat
text: Great hotel. Staff very welcoming and knowledgeable. Rooms very very clean. And secure. Free hair dryer. Safe. Coffee. Will come and stay again. Easy access to all major sights  times square and central park.

title: Good hotel for price & location
text: Stayed 3 nights in December. Good location, close to several metro stations. Hotel is clean & maintained. Breakfast included for a 2 hour window each morning. Will service your room if you ask the night before. Bed was comfortable. Only complaint was lack of water pressure. Otherwise solid hotel & would stay again. Price was competitive for what you got.

title: Good hotel.  Would stay again
text:
First, I think a lot of people confused this with another Fairfield inn nearby. This hotel has three elevators and they are lighting fast. 

The good:
Good location, easy walk to Times Square and subway stations
Good HOT breakfast, servers are nice
WiFi strong and fast
Relatively quiet

Things could be improved:
Increase Breakfast window to three hours. Two hours are short and there were long lines at 8:45.

title: è un buon hotel
text:
Hotel comodo per la vicinanza alla metro e alle varie attrazioni, camera grande e confortevole dotata di ogni confort, bagno un po’ piccolo. Per far pulire la stanza bisogna dirlo alla reception il giorno prima.
Colazione sia dolce che salata, unica pecca è la fila x entrare nella sala colazioni.
Tutto sommato è un buon hotel, lo consiglio.

title: Decent. Great Location.
text:
We stayed in room 2303.   Room is small considering a family of 4 ( 2 adults, 2 children). However, other reviews mention that room size is normal by NYC standards.  Elevators are small and  it may take a while ( 5 minutes) to reach the 23rd floor.
Location was convenient, right across the street from the port authority bus station (our arrival/departure point). Easy walking distance to Times square, Bryant Park , St PAtrick's Cathedral, and other traditional landmarks. Check in was smooth, 
Personnel at check-in was courteous. Ladies at the cafeteria are always very busy but ready to help if needed.

title: Emplacement idéal pour tout faire à pied.
text: L’hotel est situé à 2 rues de Times Square, et à 3 rues de la High Line … c’est l’idéal ! Les chambres sont correctes, pas très grandes  mais tout y est : machine à café, coffre fort, linges et aménités, table à repasser. Le petit déjeuner est très bien et le personnel est très sympa. Le ménage est possible en cours de séjour mais pensez à prévenir la veille. Seul bémol : les chambres sont situées autour de la cage d’ascenseurs, et les plus sensibles d’entre nous perçoivent quelques nuisances sonores pendant la nuit. L’impression d’ensemble est très positive. Merci beaucoup pour l’accueil !

title: Fair Value, Room for Improvement
text: The location was great, the staff was helpful and we really enjoyed the restaurant downstairs. Our air conditioner in the room didn’t work and had to be fixed daily or twice a day. We switched rooms and the bathroom door was almost impossible to open/close. Nothing terrible and fair value for the experience, just a bit of room for improvement.

title: Wouldn’t recommend
text:
I appreciated that they allowed me to check in early. I also liked that they had water to drink in the lobby. I did not have difficulties with the elevators as other reviewers mentioned. The breakfast was decent- cold cereals and yogurt as well as make your own bagel/toast and a couple of warm things like eggs. The coffee was good and you could take it to go.

Despite other reviews I read, the front staff was generally unfriendly. Upon check in it really felt like I was annoying the front desk staff for doing a simple check in. No greeting and welcome. It didn’t matter that much as I didn’t need to interact with them but I am surprised that others found them friendly. I wouldn’t agree.  There were several problems with the room- had to flush the toilet twice to get it to flush, the lock on the door was permanently on deadbolt so the door wouldn’t shut without several manipulations and the shower made this horrendous noise that shook the whole bathroom when on. It felt like the whole tub was going to take off. Everything would fall off the little shelf in front of the mirror when showering. Lastly the thermostat was broken. I did ask someone to come fix that as it was warm. I ignored the other things. Wasn’t worth it.  The room was ‘fine’ but it’s very small with chipped furniture, mold in bathroom tiles etc. I was traveling alone so it was again, fine, but it would have felt cramped with two people. I won’t opt to stay here again and honestly cannot recommend it.

title: Ótimo custo benefício.
text: O hotel está localizado bem perto da times square, metrô e restaurantes. Chegamos bem antes da hora do check-in e eles não cobraram nada. O quarto tem um tamanho regular e o banheiro é bem pequeno. O café da manhã é básico. O hotel tem um ótimo custo benefício.

title: Buena relación calidad/precio
text:
Muy buena relación calidad/precio
Buena ubicación cerca de estaciones de metro y times square
El desayuno delicioso variedad de panes café jugos huevos cereal y frutas, fuimos en viaje familiar lo recomiendo habitaciones cómodas escoge pisos altos

title: Amazing front desk staff!
text: My stay here was so much nicer than it could have been - and it was pretty nice to begin with - because of the attitude and helpfulness of the people at the front desk, especially Alexi.  Every time I had a question, he was on it with a cheery, helpful attitude.  The room was great, everything went well, but the standout of the visit was the staff attitude.  Thanks for making me feel so welcome during my stay.

title: Sleeping in a Pee Bed
text: I checked into this Marriott at 2:30am after a long day of travel troubles. We had a total of 4 rooms, which took a while to secure because we had to wait for rooms to be released as people didn't check in--totally understand that. We made sure that our high school students in our group had rooms, and by the time I made it to my room at 2:45am, I was exhausted. By 3am, I crawled into bed, only to realize that it was wet. It had an odor to it as well. This was really odd as the bed was perfectly made. I left the sheets down, and moved to the other bed in the room, which was thankfully dry. In the morning I could see a large yellow pee stain on the sheets in the area that had been wet. We let the management know at the front desk the next morning, and their only response was that I should have called down to let them know at 3am. I was incredibly surprised and disappointed that at a Marriott hotel I would first have a bed wet with pee in a "clean" room, but that there was little support from the hotel staff, other than I should have called them. We were led to believe the hotel was completely full as we had to keep waiting for rooms to come available (which wasn't a problem), and it was 3am. This was not the best stay at a Marriott property.

title: Room SMELLS and is musty, and tiny
text: We stayed for 5 nights in this room.  First, the room was smelly and musty and humid.  The ventilation does not work in this hotel.  There were homeless people right  outside the front door of the hotel.  You had the ask for the room to be cleaned on the previous day.  The room did not have a remote control for the TV.   The hotel is old and in a bad part of time square.  The breakfast was only from 7-9am in the morning.  It was a to-go box.

title: Kleinfelds Girl Trip, New York, NY
text:
The Fairfield Inn Marriott was better than expected after reading other reviews. The room was clean, bed Comfortable and they called to check if you needed anything. There was security with your room key to enter hotel. 
 I had called the hotel directly prior and spoke with Anton who helped set up our rooms near each other and a city view! Anton and the staff very helpful…
Breakfast was basic but plenty of cold items, yogurt, fruit, muffins and coffee.
 We could walk to Times Square, Circle line Cruise and Uber to Kleinfelds!

title: Gran Hotel, cerca de todo…
text: Muy buen hotel, gran la ubicación (cerca a estación metro, tren, bus, farmacias, supermercados), la atención del personal en general es EXCELENTE, a pesar de la situación se esmeran para que el momento sea cómodo y fácil, quizás lo único incomodo es el lobby, dado que en momentos es bastante congestionado

title: MR
text: Do NOT bring your family here!!!  We are here now and fearful to walk out the front doors.   Drugs and gangsters lay at the front doors cat calling your family.    Unbelievable to see this is our country.   U r NOT safe in this area.      Hotel said they have a continental breakfast.   NOT.    You can have a bag lunch with biscuit, granola bar.    They won't even give u a hot cup of coffee.    I have been in several Asian countries and felt safer there than in this area.

title: Pésimo Hotel
text: El Hotel está en una excelente ubicación al lado de estación del tren, farmacias, restaurantes, barras, bancos y Times Squares.  El servicio del Front Desk fue exceptional y el proceso de llegada y salida fue sumamente rápido. El Hotel cuenta con desayuno pero yo no le llamaría desayuno ya que era lo mismo todos los días, baggel (Duro), barra nutritiva y jugo de manzana todo dentro de una bolsa para comer en el cuarto.  La Habitación que me asignaron está sucia, sábanas manchadas y en mal estado.  A las afueras del Hotel siempre tiene un fuerte olor a marihuana y mucha gente que no tienen buen aspecto, el cual uno se sentía inseguro.

title: Disappointing
text: I would never have thought this hotel was a Marriott property.  If was poorly run and unwelcoming.  The location is right across from the Port Authority which offers some convenience, however, there are lots of people hanging around and a strong smell of pot.  The breakfast was the worst grad and go ever!  IT consisted of a granola bar, apple juice and the worst excuse for a bagel in NYC and some cream cheese.   The front desk is unfriendly, understaffed and unorganized.  They even misplaced the key to luggage storage area.    That being said, the rooms themselves are not bad though no microwave in the room.  There are LOTS better places to stay in NYC that are moderately priced.  DO NOT STAY HERE!

title: No recomendado antes de confirmar que lo anunciado sea cierto
text:
Fue una pésima experiencia en The Fairfield Inn and Suites Times Square desde que llegamos a la recepción. La recepcionista fue desatenta y llena de obstáculos, de negativas, desde el momento del registro: "Para llegar tarde, ud tenía que llamarnos, NO escribirnos; NO aceptamos efectivo; su habitación ya NO está disponible, NO entiendo lo que dice". Permanentemente, lucía amargada, triste, frustrada, con el ceño fruncido cuando se le hablaba. Por lo demás, a ella no le pareció agradable que fuéramos por medio de Booking, fuimos tratados como huéspedes de segunda categoría por esta razón. 

Llegamos más o menos a las 10 am y la recepcionista pretendía hacernos esperar hasta las 4 pm a pesar de que la habitación estaba ya pagada desde la noche anterior; afortunadamente otra recepcionista nos avisó que la habitación ya estaba lista y pudimos ingresar después del registro, de lo contrario habríamos tenido que esperar más de 6 horas a pesar de haber hecho pago automático de la noche anterior 

Esto no fue todo: en 5 días, NUNCA nos asearon la habitación; se acabó el jabón y tuvimos que comprar afuera para poder usar; la basura NUNCA fue recogida; las sábanas ni las toallas NUNCA fueron cambiadas; el tapete es muy sucio; el desayuno es industrial, pobre, no es nutritivo (jugo de caja, pan duro, queso crema) y no cambió el menú en 5 días de estadía; la habitación es oscura; no hubo agua caliente en la ducha en 5 días y no nos atrevimos a preguntar a la recepción.

En este contexto tan horroroso, salir del hotel a caminar a la calle era un placer; llegar al mugre del hotel, y al humo de marihuana que sube desde la calle en donde está situado, era una tristeza porque no reunía las características de un hotel sino de una posada de carretera. Hay mejor atención en un AirBNB que en este hotel. Nos sentimos burlados frente a la publicidad que anuncian en la página, no corresponde a la realidad.

Respecto a la seguridad, es muy fácil que una persona que no esté hospedada allí ingrese a las instalaciones, que pase a los ascensores, con el riesgo de que llegue a las habitaciones. 

Aparte de ello, al salir, pedimos que por favor nos llamaran un taxi para ir al aeropuerto y la recepcionista nos dijo "Salgan a la esquina, ahí pasan taxis permanentemente". 

En el Fairfield Inn & Suites By Marriott New York Manhattan/Times Square fuimos claramente engañados; no obtuvimos el servicio que pagamos. Si usted va a ir, hay otras opciones cerca, mejor situados, más limpios, más económicos y con mucha mejor atención.

title: Fair prices and great location
text: Hotel is clean and secure. The rooms are small. The bathroom was clean. The city view from the 31st street floor was worth the stay alone. As the hotel is taking covid -19 measures masks must be worn at all times. Breakfast is served as cold: bagel, apple juice box, blueberry muffins, and cups of mixed fruit can be picked up at front desk 7-9 am. The location of hotel to subway and penn station is very close. There are a lot of things to do around hotel. Overall, good experience.

title: Debe mejorar
text: La ubicación, a pocas cuadras de Times Square, lo hace atractivo. Es importante tener en cuenta que en la cuadra del hotel queda una sede de NYS DOCCS (New York State Department of Corrections and Community Supervision), entidad estatal encargada del control y supervisión de los reclusos, que se deben presentar en las oficinas. Hay permanentemente filas de reclusos en el día (esto garantiza una presencia policial permanente si bien la cuadra no se ve muy amigable debido a esto). Adicionalmente, en los días y las noches se ve mucha mendicidad y drogadicción en la cuadra. La cuadra es oscura y  sucia. En todo caso, se rescata la practicidad de la ubicación, ya que desde allí es muy fácil organizar recorridos a toda la ciudad: a la vuelta queda la estación de buses y Metro de 42nd Street Port Authority. A 6 minutos a pie, la de Times Square. Está última conecta con más líneas de Metro y Tren. El aseo sólo se hace si uno lo pide desde el día anterior. El desayuno es una bolsa con un jugo de caja, una barra de granola y el bagel más duro de Nueva York ( con queso para esparcir), que hay que reclamar (únicamente) entre 7 y 9 am en la recepción. Es un sitio únicamente para llegar a dormir, que en el fondo es lo que uno necesita en Manhattan. Las habitaciones son cómodas. El estado de las llaves del agua debería mejorar porque gotean. Si uno quiere café tiene que comprar agua embotellada en la calle, y pedir en la recepción vasos de cartón y sobres de café en polvo para preparar en la cafetera de la habitación. Había visto en algunas reseñas el tema del olor a marihuana, pero es algo que no es propio simplemente del hotel, sino de la zona de la ciudad: en los alrededores, cada cuadra tiene una o dos convenience stores que venden productos de marihuana para fines recreativos, así que es cada vez más común ver gente fumando en la calle, sobre todo ahora que no está penalizado el consumo. Pero es cierto, la cuadra entera huele a marihuana. Tanto que cuando uno entra al hotel siente que adentro también permanece el olor, si bien uno no ve a nadie fumando adentro. El bar del hotel, así como el gimnasio, y la cafetería están cerrados por las restricciones sanitarias y de aforo de la ciudad (abril de 2021). En conclusión, es práctico si bien hay muchas cosas por mejorar.

title: warm like home
text: Very comfortable place, the staff is very professional, helpful, cooperative and give a warm hospitality like home, i strongly recommend it to everyone perfect location in the heart of New York and warm as home, special thanks to  Kendijah and Anton who made our stay feels like home and Thank you for everything

title: This is why I always choose Marriott
text: I had to come into the city for an interview and picked here as you couldn't beat the rate. The hotel itself was great, really really clean, staff provided great service and even though the restaurant was closed I found the vending machines and the grab and go breakfast to do the job. I got upgraded to a high floor with a city view which was nice and there wasn't too much noise except loud guests in the hall but that would come and go quickly. The only negative part for me was that it seems quite a lot of homeless and people on drugs hang outside the hotel on that specific street don't know if this is normal or not. But these people were there throughout my whole stay, I'm a woman and unfortunately didn't feel safe around these people but I would be willing to give the hotel another go to see if this really was the norm because I really did enjoy it.

text:

He was on top of everything at the reception and gave individual attention to each and every person who approached the counter.

title: Muy mala calidad de servicio
text: Nos encontramos con un hotel que además de ser caro lo único que tiene positivo es la ubicación, la comunicación tiene con suerte a 1 persona que habla en español, el aseo señalan que lo realizan cada 3 días y no es así, nosotros estuvimos 10 días y nunca hicieron el aseo, nos cambiaron de habitación por haber fuga de agua, a los 3 días de llegada, los desayunos ofrecidos son humillantes (una bolsa con 1 jugo pequeño y 1 pan duro) se indica que no se debe fumar pero el hotel completo esta con olor a marihuana. title: Mala atención
text: El personal es muy mal educado, no tienen  una persona que hable español y tampoco ponen voluntad para entender a los que no hablan ese idioma. Pésimo servicio...no recomiendo que vayan. La pasé muy mal

title: Management & Staff are incredible!
text: Highly recommend any large or small groups to book your next stay at this location. Management (Jeanette) was extremely helpful and accommodating to my group of 12. It was a short stay but definitely felt comfortable with the staff and area. Views were also a great touch and we’ll definitely be back.

title: Impeccable
text: Amazing stay, the view was impeccable and the room was very comfortable! The staff was great and catered to my all my requests. Born and raised in Westchester, Ny so I’m not a stranger to visiting Manhattan (The City as we call it) and it was just a beautiful experience the 3 days I stayed. The hotel is located 2 blocks away from Time Square (literally a 5 minute walk) and 6 blocks from Herald Square. And plenty of food choices. Definitely plan on staying here again when my Fiancé comes to visit from Georgia. Thanks again Fairfield staff

title: Horrible Customer Service
text:
The front desk staff was rude and didn't seem to show any empathy. I am a Marriott member and have already sent my other review through the actual survey site along with contacting corporate. 
When I was checking in, I did a mobile. When I showed up, they informed me I would have to wait until 4pm. I asked what the point was for using mobile and they said that it didn't matter and that no one checks in before 4pm...I understand they were sold out the night before and not every room will be ready but when someone chooses to use mobile for 2pm you'd think they would try and accommodate the early arrivals when they can clearly see it on their computer screen. Front desk and Housekeeping must not communicate AT ALL. 
I asked to use the bathroom to put myself together and they acted as if I had just committed a crime. 
When I was finally ready to checkout, the people in charge of holding my luggage couldn't find it. Said they misplaced all the luggage tags and were going to try and locate my items...when I asked for a manager they said they only get them for important ordeals. 
Will never stay here again!

title: Good, basic accomodation for a mid range budget
text:
Disclaimer - I would give this hotel a 3.5 star rating overall.

Ok, so New York accommodation is super expensive comparatively (and add in the Australian exchange rate) so my review is hard to compare to other hotels on the market, in used to a much higher standard for this price point yet understand the comparison level in New York is different.

This hotel is in a great location near Times Square and walking distance to the subway to get you around easily. 

Staff were all friendly, and the room although basic gives all the requirements for a comfortable stay. 

Breakfast is included in the rate , and all though once again basic gives a good variety to get you going for your exploring for the day. 

Would I stay here again? I would probably opt for something a bit more high end next time and spend the extra dollars, however for a budget friendly stay, I cannot fault this place.

title: The Fine Art of Hospitality
text:
This hotel is a quintessential NYC ‘must’ and has all the ingredients for a perfect opportunity to see New York City at its best.  The recipe starts with a cast of guests out of casting central, then stir in the cavalcade of hoteliers along the vibrant electricity of W40th Street between Eighth and Ninth Avenue. Gently stir and rest. Now add (well you don’t really have a choice in the matter) a pinch of Pandemic, and you have the making of a NYC getaway that you will treasure forever. 

Everything and everyone here runs smoothly from the effortless check-in to the early morning pick up breakfast, from the stellar housekeeping squad to the always available ice in the lower lobby ice machine (a particular personal quirk). 

As mentioned, the variety of guests and visitors to this location are beautifully diverse. Witnessing the front desk staff mindfully adapt to the wide range of personalities and assorted cultural representatives was inspiring. Hospitality is an art as you engage with your guests to make them feel welcomed, nurtured, safe, and well served. Here at the Marriott Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan Times Square hospitality is a fine art. 

A Pandemic by nature is annoying and cumbersome to say the least. But here at Fairfield Manhattan Times Square they’ve taken lemons and made lemonade. The systems implemented to accommodate guests’ COVID-19 safety were clear and user friendly. And the staff leading the way were sincere protectors.  From Helen Guon, the General Manager to the others I encountered: Merkenson, Kendijah, Andrise, to others too numerous to mention - these hospitality professionals paved the way for a much needed respite from the pervading madness happening in our world today. 

I salute this hotel and it’s staff. Together they create a gem of a caring, supreme experience. 

Bravo!!!

title: Great location for reasonable price
text:
This hotel is appr. 6 blocks away from Times Square, in walking distance, close to subway. Perfect located and a nice hotel for a really acceptable (Manhattan-) price. Rooms are big enough and bigger as in most other comparable hotels in Manhattan. We liked also a lot the included breakfast. Nothing special, but a good enough start into a Manhattan Sightseeing-Tour day. You don’t lose time looking around for a nice cafe...

We’ll consider the hotel for sure for our next trip to NYC.

title: Perfect location in the heart of NYC
text:
We actually loved this hotel it was 5 minute walk to the heart of time square but not that close to be filled with lots of people and noise.
Clean rooms nice bed shower and bathroom.
Hotel was everything we needed for our 5 day stay in NYC.
I mean you in the city that never sleeps so your out early and home late all you need is a comfy bed and this hotel had that in the perfect location and for a reasonable price 👌

title: Estada agradável
text: Hotel com ótima localização, pertinho da Times Square, e a 50 mt de uma estação de metro, exatamente a linha que faz o Aeroporto de JFK, o que foi muito conveniente e em frente ao Port Authorith. Hotel com boas acomodações, ótimo café da manhã, com várias opções, não tivemos problemas com filas. Check in e out bem rápidos. Chegamos cedinho e deixamos as bagagens no hotel antes do check in, assim aproveitamos o dia todo.

title: Alex
text: Parents are currently staying in this hotel and have been served this continental breakfast (photo shown)! They won’t be returning to this hotel and recommend anyone to avoid this hotel in the future. They smell cannabis on the way into the hotel and been hassled by homeless on the way into the hotel which you think staff would stop.

title: Girls Vacay in New York
text:
Overall a pleasurable in this hotel.

Good points
- check in simple and smooth
- room clean with all amenities - hair dryer, safe, iron, ironing board, fridge, coffee machine etc
- beds comfy and room has air con (though a little noisy) and ample storage

Bad points
- ok breakfast - Limited hot food choices. Could choose from cereal, toast, waffle, bagels, scrambled & boiled egg, Cheese omelette and sausage pattie, yogurts and tea/coffee
- location was quiet and off the beaten track, streets were a bit dirty
- lifts were a bit slow/not always working
- no options for lunch & dinner

title: Melhor Custo Benefício na “Big Apple”
text: Ficamos surpresos com a qualidade do hotel, levando-se conta o preço baixo e sem taxa de resort. Localização ótima, ao lado do Port Authority (foi muito fácil o traslado, pois viemos de ônibus do Aeroporto de Newark). Quarto espaçoso, aconchegante e silencioso, com armário, cômoda, frigobar, máquina de fazer café, etc. O café da manhã é muito bom, com várias opções. Todos os dias nos deixavam 2 garrafas de água mineral, após a arrumação. Nos deixaram fazer o “Check In” antes das 13h. Além de tudo que foi exposto, há que se destacar a atenção e simpatia dos funcionários. Com certeza, quando voltarmos a NYC, ficaremos neste hotel.

title: Terrible - Stay Away
text: I stayed here from Jan 14-16.  At 4am on Sunday morning, the heating system in the room broke. It was bitterly cold in NYC. I complained to the front desk manager. Did not even receive the courtesy of a response.  I was told that there have been several problems with heating units in the hotel.  Very poor service and lack of adequate follow up by management.

title: Decent stay
text:
So this was a super last minute trip for us to Times Square. A friend was having a birthday party at the sky room and we had another event in the city the next day so thought it would be better to just stay. Glad we did. 

The room was decent (nothing to write home about) bed was comfy, staff was nice. Check out is at 12 which I loved! Breakfast was nothing to write home about, we decided to get breakfast elsewhere. 
Parking is ridiculously expensive. $74/day, 60-70 if you self park! We booked an ipark spot a few hours before for $56. The garage was a 4 min walk away. For us it was worth it being that we were coming from Long Island and a round trip train ticket was about $50 for the both of us. It just felt easier to drive. Traffic getting to the city can always be challenging but it was fine for us. 

Overall, I would stay again. It was exactly the getaway I needed! 

Happy Yelping :)

title: Me encantó!!
text: La ubicación increíble,cerca del metro y lugares importantes de Manhattan, la habitación muy cómoda,las camas super confortables, el servicio muy amable, el desayuno muy variado y tienes la cortesía de café Starbucks y chocolate caliente durante todo el día.

title: Good Visit
text:
Walkable to the Javitz center, close to many things.  The hotel room was clean and quiet and comfortable. 
Although breakfast is offered, we usually do not partake of the 'freebie' hotel breakfasts, but there is coffee and basics out for the morning as well.   We were there in February, and this hotel was good value for the money.

title: Idéalement situé
text: Situation parfaite proche de tout pour manger pour du shopping... le personnel très sympa. La chambre n'avait pas été faite le 1er jour on l'a signalé le soir , le temps d'aller dîner c'était fait. Le petit dej super ya un peu d attente car la salle est petite. Beaucoup d'air froid sort des fenêtres manque d'isolation

title: Great value
text: I liked everything about this hotel. The price was fair, the beds were confortable although they were full (not queen). Everything was clean. Excellent included breakfast buffet and the staff was nice and helpful. Location is just steps from Times Square and subway station. I would return to this hotel.

title: Lovely stay
text:
Great location. Despite what other reviews say, this our 4th stay in Manhattan. 
Breakfast is well organised.
Rooms well equipped.
Definitely reccomend this hotel for families, we are a family of 4 and the rooms were great for us.
Close to our fave Joe's Pizza

title: EXCELLENT STAY
text:
My daughter stayed 5 nights at this hotel. It was a  great location for all attractions.  Staff were exceptional, especially the Reception Staff and all the Breakfast Room staff.  Great breakfast making it a great start for the day.

Hotel very clean.
Thank you to Reception staff for organising decorating our room for our birthdays and for the lovely birthday card with the exceptional sketch of NYC, very artistic.
Until our next visit.
Will highly recommend

title: Short stay in NY.
text: Excellent. Good value, great service, modern, clean, well located, reasonable rates. Elevators were busy at breakfast, but expected. Breakfast food was plentiful, but bacon would have been appreciated. All in all, no complaints.

title: Made special memories with the family
text: Fairfield hotel is in a good location only a 7 minute walk to time Sqaure.The best hotel to stay for location and value for money would defeintley recommendation it.The buffet breakfast was  good especially with having the children I needed  breakfasts included for a good price and I definitely got that. It was really helpful that on the day I was checking out I could leave my bags with the hotel so I could explore New York 💛

title: Bon hôtel
text: Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel du 09 février au 17 février. Emplacement idéal proche Time Square et plusieurs ligne de métro. Check in rapide avec du personnel qui s'adapte à notre niveau d'anglais cest assez agréable ... la chambre est de taille suffisante manque un peu de rangement mais bon on peux toujours s'adapter ! La literie est très confortable! Le petit-déjeuner super ... très copieux et varier vraiment pas déçu on partait tous les matins en ayant pris un bon petit-déjeuner... ( œufs, bacon, cheddar, yaourt, gaufre, muffins, bagel, fruit, café de Starbucks donc très bon !) Le personnel du petit-déjeuner vraiment très gentils toujours à l'écoute de notre fils. Nous sommes très content de notre séjour seul petit bémol durant notre séjour... la femme de menage a fait notre chambre alors que nous ne le souhaitions pas le papier était sûrement tomber ... jusque la ce n'était pas très grave mais nous nous sommes rendu compte que celle ci avait emmener en meme temps que toutes les serviettes la cape de bain brodé au nom de notre fils ... n'ayant pas prévu que le chambre serait faite nous l'avons laissé dans la salle de bain ... après plusieurs demande de recherche auprès du personnel impossible de la retrouver aucune personne ne l'avais vu ... nous avons finalement trouvé un accord pour un remboursement de la cape ( même si on eu vraiment préféré la retrouver car malheureusement la nouvelle n'auras pas la même valeur sentimental ) merci à la dame des cuisines qui nous ai venu en aide pour traduire et nous expliquer et qui a été très compréhensive avec nous ! C'est très agréable de parler avec des gens qui s'investissent pour trouver une solution... et nous n'en tiendrons pas rigueur à l'hôtel car malheureusement les erreurs peuvent arrivés! Nous avons trouvé un accord et c'est bien la le principal ... en résumé nous recommandons cet hôtel!

title: Location location
text:
Stayed here 11-17 February 
Staff where so friendly and helpful , rooms larger than average all public areas are clean and tidy 
Coffee in the foyer all day 
Breakfast is brilliant 
Bed nice 

And location is just perfect , across the road from port Authority bus and subway terminal

title: Hotel was okay - staff was tremendous
text: Don't usually purchase anything like this through Groupon but we were a little disappointed to be put on a the 2nd of 30plus floors - didn't seem to get much as we had a Groupon - Although I must say of all the hotels that I have stayed in over the years the staff here went above and beyond ... hotel itself ... meh.

title: Good customer service - kinda wonky
text:
First, the customer service was excellent. Everytime we needed assistance with anything - they were exceptional.

The breakfast is okay. It’s very crowded if you go at 9 or 10 am on the weekend but earlier is fine. 

The elevators are pretty slow but they were reliable. 

A night club is on the top floor but I heard only the vaguest hints of noise and we were on floor 26. However, I imagine you might get more noise if you’re further up.

title: Maratona perfetta
text: Ottima posizione dietro a Madison Square Garden...servito da metro e da mezzi pubblici! Hotel pulito e comodo soprattutto per la Maratona, per allenarsi per raggiungerlo terminata la gara. Ottimo il buffet della colazione. Se mai tornassi a NY, opterei di ritornarci con famiglia o senza. Dalla finestra vedi un fantastico Empire.

title: Pleasant stay!
text: I just completed an overnight at the Fairfield Inn/Times Square and had a pleasant experience. From check-in to check-out, the staff were courteous and helpful. My Titanium Elite status was recognized at check-in, leading to an upgrade to a premium room. Breakfast was substantial (quite crowded, especially on weekends, so give yourself extra time). The hotel is located steps away from major tourist sites and a variety of public transportation options. Highly recommended!

title: Incompetent or Crooks?
text: It’s one or the other. I’m an Ambassador with Marriott (lifetime titanium)  and stay well over 200 nights a year at Marriott properties. I spoke in person (during my stay) about being overcharged on the nightly rate-to the tune of 4.5x. When I checked out, the manager assured me it was resolved. Low and behold, I get my credit card statement and I’m charged correctly for the final bill, but the higher rate was additionally charged on top of everything the day prior. Over charged several hundred dollars. Called the front desk and they said it was because I cancelled my reservation. I told them I stayed there and was charged! They said they would need to look into it and I immediately disputed with the credit card company. I’ve stayed almost 3000 nights with Marriott, and can’t think of this happening before.

title: Ci manchi da morire
text: E' un ottimo hotel a Manhattand. La colazione, per quanto poco varia è importante soprattutto con i bambini. Comodissima la posizione: due minuti a piedi da Times Square. Il personale gentile, la camera un po' piccola per 4, ma poco male visto che a New York si sta semre in giro con il naso all'insù

title: ΚΑΤΑΠΛΗΚΤΙΚΗ ΘΕΑ
text: Αυτο το ξενοδοχείο είναι σε πολυ καλό σημείο , στο κέντρο του Μανχάταν, δίπλα στη Times Square.Εχει μεγάλα δωμάτια με πολυ αναπαυτικά κρεβάτια, Καθημερινά σας προσθέτουν καφέ, σοκολάτα και εμφιαλωμένα νερα, όπως και είδη καθαρισμού.Είναι πολύ καθαρα και πολυ άνετα. Το δωμάτιο μας κατα τη παραμονή μας στη Νέα Υόρκη ήταν στον 24ο όροφο και είχε απίσυετη θέα. Σερβίρονται καθημερινά βάφλες και κέικ πολλα φρούτα οπως και ομελέτες χυμοι κλπ.Ειναι μια εκπληκτικη επιλογη και αν μείνετε εκεί αρχες Ιανουαρίου οι τιμές ειναι και πολυ χαμηλες.

title: Excellent
text: From start to finish the hotel staff could not have been more helpful. Room was good, breakfast was great to start the day. Hotel located minutes from Times Square & subway Station around the corner. Would definitely come back again when visiting New York City.

title: Limpeza deixou a desejar
text: Estou hospedado no hotel ainda e por dois dias seguidos não fizeram a limpeza do quarto. Tentei fazer a reclamação no site do hotel e não consegui, por isso deixo aqui a minha indignação: estou com quatro pessoas, sendo uma criança e acho inadmissível não limparem o quarto por dois dias seguidos.

title: Déçu !!!
text:
J’ai passée un séjour dans cet hôtel du 11janvier au 19janvier 2020 . 
Je me suis bien renseigné sur les avis avant de confirmer notre réservation ...
Je suis assez déçu de notre séjour dans cet hôtel : 
Petit déjeuner froid et non variés .
Chambre petite pas assez de rangement . 
Réceptionniste non professionnel lorsqu’on est pas bilingue aucun d’eux ne se soucie de vous et pire ricane entre eux ! j’ai du en parler à sa supérieur car j’etais très très remonter ! 
Enfin bon mise a part les hommes de la sécurité très aimable et la salle de sport accessible h24. 
Cet hôtel ne mérite pas le prix de la nuitée!  j’ai énormément voyagé et à ce prix nous nous attendions à meilleur accueil et service .

title: Hands down, amazing staff.
text:
My son and I have stayed here twice for comic con. The last trip we were celebrating his 15th birthday in NYC. The staff went out of their way to make him feel special, complete with a birthday card and balloons delivered to our room. They even sang happy birthday to him in the lobby. When we got to the room there were salty and sweet snacks waiting for us. Thank you Marriott staff for making our trip so memorable. 

Additionally, this location is perfect, close to Times Square, but not so close it's too loud at night. The included breakfast is also a benefit. We eat a hearty breakfast and have enough energy to explore the city until dinner time.

title: Perfect stay
text:
Me and my nine year old stayed here for five nights and it was perfect. The staff at the check-in desk are some of the nicest people I met in NYC - really nice, helpful people. Check-in was seamless. The lifts are really speedy so no queueing for ages for the lift. We had a city view room on the 30th floor - had a great view of the empire state. Rooms themselves are spacious. From previous reviews I was expecting a tiny room, but there was more than enough space to store clothes etc from 2 large suitcases. Room decor is nice and has a modern feel. We had a huge TV with Netflix. The bed was amazing - I had the best nights' sleep here! Didn't hear any noise from outside either. Breakfast is great especially considering it's included; something for everyone and lovely starbucks coffee too. Location was just perfect, literally minute's walk into the centre of times square, but plenty of bars, restaurants, transport links even closer on the way. There is a subway entrance just further up the street, a bus terminal across the street and a handy bus close by (on 42nd street) that goes east-west and vice versa across the island, from the Intrepid museum on the west to the UN building on the east. 

All in all, a fabulous stay and I will definitely be back the next time I'm in NYC, hopefully sooner rather than later!

title: Top Lage
text:
Sehr netter und schneller Checkin und Checkout (thanks to Rachel for the nice room). Wir hatten Zimmer 3508 mit seitliche Blick auf das Empire State Building.
Zimmergröße ausreichend und sauber, nur das Bad war etwas klein. Für eine Städtereise aber ausreichend. Lager hervorragend, in 5 min. ist man am Times Square.
Das Frühstück ist gratis und für amerikanische Verhältnisse sehr gut und mit einer ordentlichen Auswahl.

title: New Year's Holiday
text: 年末年始に8泊しました。朝食は、フルーツ・卵料理・ソーセージ類・パン各種・パウンドケーキなど。飲み物とヨーグルト各種。無料なのになかなか良かったです。朝食時は電子レンジも使えました。コーヒーはスタバで１日飲み放題(深夜を除く)。スタッフも愛想よく、お部屋も清潔でした。タイムズスクエア徒歩圏内、ポートオーソリティバスターミナルのすぐ横なのでアウトレットにいくのも便利。地下鉄も使いやすいし、また次もここでいいなぁと思っています。日本人はいませんでした。

title: Deixa a desejar
text:
Localização excelente!
Café da manhã bem americano e lotado de gente....fila de 20 min mais ou menos para conseguir entrar no local onde é servido. Desistimos de tomar café no hotel mesmo estando incluso já no primeiro dia.
Quartos muito pequenos....arrumação OK.
Num dos dias da arrumação de quarto a arrumadeira levou junto com algumas sacolas um sapato do meu marido. Reclamamos por 3 dias seguidos e a resposta que tivemos no final foi simplesmente: não localizamos!
Não me hospedo novamente!

title: Good location. Surprisingly quiet at night. Helpful staff. Great breakfast
text: This hotel is in a good location and is surprisingly quiet at night. I had no trouble sleeping at all and I am sensitive to sounds. The room was a little small for two people, but the price was not bad. The stall was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and comfortable and the breakfast was very good. It is not a fancy place, but I would stay there again.

title: Unsere Zimmer war miserabel
text:
Wir hatten ein Zimmer im 6.Stock.Das Fenster war undicht, deswegen sprang ständig die völlig veraltete Klimaanlage /Heizung an.Das Zimmer waren klein und auch die Einrichtung nicht schön.Unser Ausblick war miserabel (Hinterhof).Die Bar war auch  an beiden Tagen nicht
 geöffnet.Das Frühstück klein ,aber für amerikanische  Verhältnisse okay.Die Hotellobby ist auch nicht schön.Wir bekamen bei unseren 2 Übernachtungen auch keine Zimmerreinigung.Die Lage ist allerdings sehr gut.War bis jetzt das schlechteste Hotel das wir in NY erlebt hatten.

title: Small All Around
text:
Our overall impression of the hotel was that it is small in many ways... small lobby, small rooms, small beds, small breakfast area, etc. It was decently clean and the service was overall pleasant. The two double bed room had very little room to move around. And the double beds were among the most narrow that we’ve used - really tough to fit two adults in one of these beds. There was an instant coffee maker but no kettle. We received a free bottle of water each day. There’s a beverage fridge in the room as well. Good Paul Mitchell toiletries. No shower cap but they do provide makeup wipes. The wardrobe had a safe in it but since the wardrobe was tilted forward, the safe door would swing open if it wasn’t locked which caused a few head bumps. 

The breakfast was ok - somewhat typical free hotel breakfast. If you don’t go down for breakfast by 9, expect to wait a while. The line stretched to the checkin desk on one morning when we were late going down. We had to wait over 25 mins to get a table. It probably is not a good sign that there’s a printed sign stating average wait times (during weekdays only). I suspect the weekend wait times are a lot longer. 

The location is not bad - centrally located to Times Square, etc.

title: Ok New York Hotel
text: The staff at this hotel are friendly,  professional and helpful. The rooms are small. Our room and the hotel were clean. The worst part is the bathroom. It has no counter space.It just has a couple narrow glass shelves. The make up mirror gets in the way of the main mirror.  The mirror in the  hall outside of the bathroom is positioned in a spot so that if you leave the bathroom door open anyone in the hotel room can see right in the bathroom. The walk in tile shower is very nice. The beds were comfortable. The elevators are very fast which was great. I've stayed in New York hotels before that ran me  late for functions because the elevators were slow so.This is a big deal. The location is ok that's about it. The hotel is on the backside of the port authority bus terminal. This gives it a little back street feel. The bus terminal does have a shopping mall inside where you  buy anything you might need and a walgreens is right around the corner. Their is a sub way stop on the corner. The hotel is not far from most tourist attractions  but isn't real close to most tourist attractions either if that makes sense.  This hotel is  on my list of places to stay next Christmas season. I wouldn't mind staying at it again.  I'll price shop though. Nothing really sets this hotel apart from a cheaper price hotel if I find one.

title: Great Location, small rooms compared to American standards though
text: A tiny hotel in the heart of NY(5th Avenue) small rooms, front staff are friendly and accomdating. great location. Expensive,  but its NY you see. Guess its a budget category of Marriott. Complimetrary tea coffee all day.

title: Cancelon/Hotel Lost my reservation
text: I booked with cancelon. Arrived at the hotel. They didnt have my reservation. Were not helpful. Asked that I call cancelon. I waited 45 minutes for cancelon and the hotel to resolve the issue. When they did, the hotel apologized and set me up on the 19th floor. When I got to my room, the front desk called. They asked that I come back downstairs because they gave me the wrong room. No one offered to come up. I went back down to exchange rooms. As I was on the elevator someone stopped to give me another set of keys because the ones they gave me might not work? The entire experience was unprofessional and frustrating. I will never book with cancelon or Fairfield again.

title: It’s the little things that add up!
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights and it was perfect! It began with the hotel letting us check in at 7am. What a blessing! They even offered us breakfast. The free breakfast every morning is delicious with a lot of variety. The rooms are clean, QUIET and large, as confirmed from our NY local friends. Not once did I see a maid, however the rooms and grounds were spotless. The lobby seems to always be crowded but it’s small, so that’s understandable. The gym was perfect with everything one would need for a work out, including TRX and NU Dumbbells. The location of the hotel is perfect, as well. I’m so grateful we chose this hotel. The pre and post-visit email is a nice touch as well. Good job, Marriott!! 

Foodie tip - Try Upside Pizza and NOT Joe’s Pizza. Trust me!!

title: Buona struttura
text: Hotel in posizione strategica, metro comoda, 5 minuti a piedi da times square, tanti ristoranti in zona. Molto comodo per chi arriva a Newark (30 min in taxi). Camere pulite e confortevoli, non molto spaziose. Buona la colazione, personale cortese. Consigliato come punto di appoggio per la visita della città.

title: Excelente Ubicacion Buen descanso
text: Hemos estado para el maraton de NYC y la ubicacion es espectacular, estas caminando a todos los sitios, precio alto pero lo vale por la ubicacion y la atencion, desde el incio los recepciones diurnos te hacen sentir como en casa (los nocturnos tienen siempre mal humor) el servicio de camareras es espectacular, un hotel muy recomendado para estar

title: Great value!
text: The location for the value was unmatched for our Thanksgiving parade visit.  The rooms are clean.  I saw reviews raving about the breakfast.  I would call it typical for Fairfield.  We arrived for breakfast around 9 and the place seemed a bit ransacked.  I think they have a little trouble keeping up with the volume.

title: Estancia muy satisfactoria
text:
El hotel se encuentra situado en pleno centro de la ciudad, a 10 minutos andando de Times Square, cerca de supermercados, bares, tiendas y en la misma calle de Port Authority Bus Terminal.

El servicio es muy atento, tratan de ayudarte con cualquier cosa que necesites. Cambian las toallas y hacen las camas cada día. Siempre tienes jabón, crema y papel en el baño sin que tengas que pedirlo.

El desayuno es variado y de buena calidad. El servicio siempre está pendiente de que no falte nada.

title: Great location, good facilities, friendly staff
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights over Thanksgiving Weekend 2019 and had a really great experience. Checking in was easy and simple, we were greeted with a glass of wine. The lady on reception chatted with me about how it was my first time in NY and asked what my plans were for the weekend, then proceeded to provide me with details on the Thanksgiving Day parade when I told her we were planning to see it.

The lobby is small, but there are public toilets for use (you may need a key card from reception  but they're happy to give it to you as a guest). There are 3 lifts for use - having read previous complaints about the lift, my personal experience suggests you can disregard these complaints. Wait was not long and on times when there was a queue for the Skyroom (which by the way was separate and those visitors had access through a side door), the security guard on shift always prioritised guests for lift use.

The rooms are very spacious with all the necessary amenities; safe, hairdryer, TV, iron & ironing board, complimentary toiletries, spare pillows, towels, wardrobe and free WiFi. King size bed is huge and very comfortable! Plug sockets and USB ports in multiple places all over the room, including by the bed. We were staying on the 21st floor and were not disturbed by noise during the night, from either the skyroom or the streets below. 

Breakfast was included, this along with free WiFi throughout were among the top reasons why I chose this hotel. We did have to queue on the Friday, but being the day after Thanksgiving I think this can be expected. On offer was hot food (Turkey sausages, sometimes bacon, lots of egg choices), cereals, fruit, breads, juices and hot drinks. The toaster wasn't the best, twice round and bread was still warm rather than toasted. Whilst I wouldn't say it was the best variety around, simply having a free option for breakfast was welcomed. It was an all you can eat type buffet allowing you to eat as much or as little as you wanted. 

The 24hr reception was also fantastic. Being tourists in NYC for the first time meant we were coming and going at all times of day - leaving at 5am for the Macy's Parade, returning at 1am one night having visited Top of The Rock and Times Sq. Staff were always cheerful and friendly.

Upon checkout, they were happy to store our luggage for the few hours we were still in the city after checkout. The bellman also arranged a taxi to take us to the airport, and then another bellman managed to bring our taxi booking forward when we queried whether we could leave earlier. All done with smiles on their faces!

In regards to location, I honestly can't see how anyone could feel unsafe in this area (referencing previous TripAdvisor views I read prior to my stay). The Fairfield is sandwiched between two other hotels, one of which is a Doubletree by Hilton, so there are people coming and going down the street constantly. This hotel is situated just off 8th Ave, around the corner from the Bus Terminal. It has easy access to a subway station (just at the end of the road) and many popular attractions are with a fifteen minute walk or so - Times Square, Madison Square Garden, Madame Tussauds, Big Bus Hop On Hop Off stops etc. 

All in all, a wonderful experience. Thank you to all at Fairfield for making my stay a comfortable one and for helping to make my very first trip to New York a pleasant one. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Great location, good staff
text:
I visited for almost two weeks in June-July 2019. 
Staff worked hard here and would do whatever they could to help you out.

Hotel is quite small, dining area is very busy in the morning (don't moan about it, just get up early!).

Rooms are small as you would expect from an NYC hotel. Most important thing was AC worked well, rooms were regularly cleaned by very helpful and courteous cleaning staff. 

The main reason I booked this hotel was for location.
Close to NYC Waterferry, closeby subway stations, very close to Staten Island Ferry Terminal, very close proximity to Brooklyn Bridge also. 

We happened to be booked over July 4th celebration period. We got a fantastic view of fireworks and had most of Fulton St to ourselves with only hotel guests and police officers allowed in that area. It was perfect.

I really enjoyed my stay and would use this hotel again.

title: Amazing location, and relatively low price made this a great value altogether.
text:
I found this via booking.com by filtering my search to include location on the upper west side, breakfast, and a fitness center, and I had the hotels listed by rate. I could hardly believe I found this gem for an amazingly low price compared to other hotels in the area, and after checking the beautiful photos and positive reviews, I decided to go for it. 

On the whole I was not disappointed. The room had a large comfortable bed and looked at least as nice as rooms in the more expensive hotels I've stayed at in the past. The fitness center was adequate enough for me to continue my fitness routine and the rate included breakfast which was great. 

Isabella Luo was an excellent front desk agent. She handled the check-in process in a quick and professional manner and was warm and smiley throughout the entire process. Definitely added to my stay as this was the very first impression at the hotel. She even saw me as she was leaving to finish her shift and made sure once again that everything was okay. 

Location really was amazing- 2 minute walk from Time Square, the subway, and a lot of cool bars. I really enjoyed just walking around and exploring.

Another nice surprise was the complimentary Starbucks coffee available every morning.  

There were a few things that can be improved:

1)  Waiting on line for breakfast was quite frustrating. Either add more tables and chairs, or perhaps consider allocating different breakfast times for different rooms? On my 3rd day there I actually gave up after waiting over a half hour to enter the breakfast and went out to buy a bagel.
2) The breakfast itself was very simple, and there were almost no vegetables or healthy options. 
3) I was staying at this hotel for work, and there was a business center advertised. This is misleading as in reality the 'business center' constitutes 2 desktop computers in a small crevasse right outside where breakfast is served, crowded by those standing online for breakfast. Not exactly ideal working conditions.
4) Individually wrapped plastic cups is a huge waist of plastic. Using plastic cups is bad enough, but each individual plastic cup in this hotel seemed to be wrapped in another layer of plastic, which I saw in my bathroom, the gym, and at breakfast. 

Despite the above points, I really enjoyed my stay and would recommend it to others. Next time I have a few days in NYC I would definitely consider staying again if the rate stays as low as it was. Excellent value.

title: Upgraded gem
text: For midtown Manhattan convenience (near Port Authority bus terminal) this renovated gem deserves your business. The front desk staff could not have been more helpful. Room was ready when promised. The breakfast was typical of the brand with the hotel's added twist. I'll definitely be back

title: Great value
Excelente Hotel
text: Hotel muito bem localizado, próximo a estação de metrô, Times Square, Madison Square Garden, entre outros. Fiz a reserva pelo Decolar e na ocasião paguei uma tarifa semelhante aos outros hotéis da região, o que não costuma acontecer, pois geralmente é mais caro que outros. Cheguei bem cedo ao hotel, ainda assim pude fazer o Early Check In, o que já me garantiu excelente impressão do mesmo. Funcionários foram muito simpáticos e solícitos. Me ofereceram ainda o café da manhã, mesmo antes do início da minha reserva, o que foi outro ponto positivo, já que o café é excelente... muito completo, com muita variedade e ótima qualidade. Absolutamente impecável. O quarto é bastante confortável, bem limpo, com banheiro e chuveiros muito satisfatórios. Possui cofre, armário, secador de cabelo. Wifi grátis e de boa qualidade. Noite de sono muito agradável. Resumidamente um ótimo hotel, com bom relação custo benefício... esse é o quarto hotel em que me hospedo na cidade, sendo certamente o melhor.

title: A great place to stay
text: Had the best view from our room.  Staff was absolutely amazing and friendly and helpful.  Efficient and a wonderful location.  The reviews say the breakfast is good but we stayed out shopping and sightseeing until after midnight so we never made it.  LOL. Very clean updated.  Beds slept awesome.  Shower was roomy.

title: Very good Hotel for its price
text: Good atmospheric hotel. We were lucky and we had a room on the 30th floor. Gorgeous window view of Manhattan. Clean enough, everything works. Perfect location near Times Square. Metro close by. Only breakfast was poor.

title: Homeless in the Lobby
text: The hotel was very good and very clean with two exceptions.  The neighborhood did not feel safe.  When I came down for coffee at 4:30 in the morning there was a homeless person sleeping next to the coffee machine - in the lobby

title: One Night pre cruise stay
text:
We recently stayed at this hotel for 1 night.  Approx 1 mile from Grand Central.  With NYC traffic, sometimes the walk is easier.  Check in was easy and they held our bags while we went into the city and waited for the room.
Five-ten (depending on how crowded) minute walk to times square.  Dunkin nearby as well.  Room was decent for NYC size standards.  8 Rooms per Floor.  We were on floor 20.  You need to use your room key to get onto the elevator so I thought that was good.
Breakfast was average, very busy which I expected but they kept up with it.  We stayed here for 1 night before a cruise and it wasn't too far from the terminal but for sure would need cab/uber with luggage.  I think it would have been a 20-25 minute walk but with luggage not ideal.  
Perfect location for what we needed--Would for sure stay longer also.

title: Recomendable
text: Fuimos por 7 noches. Hotel bien situado, al lado de un estación de metro y otra de autobús. Cerca de Times Square. Puedes ir andando a casi todos los sitios. Al principio te puede causar mala impresión la zona, ya que hay gente rara, pero te das cuenta que es lo normal allí. Excelente habitación,buen servicio y desayuno variado. Los trabajadores muy amables. Para repetir.

title: Très bon hôtel
text: Emplacement parfait pour cet hôtel . Proche de Time Square à pied . Semaine du 05 octobre au 12 octobre 2019 . Personnel très accueillant ,  souriant et vraiment à l'écoute de nos demandes . Petit déjeuner copieux qu'il faut prendre vers 07:00/ 07:15 si l'on veut éviter l' attente . Ne pas hésiter à aller voir le concierge pour différents renseignements, les visites en bus, la navette du retour . Les chambres sont de belles tailles et propres ainsi que la salle de bain .

title: Situé au coeur de Manhattan
text:
Nous avons séjourné dans cette hôtel à l'occasion du marathon de New-York.
Il est idéalement situé, proche des stations de métro, à quelques minutes à pied de Times Square, nous avons fait une bonne partie de nos visites à pied, Empires State Building, High Line, Rockefeller Center, Central Park etc...
Il est aussi à taille humaine contrairement à certaines "usines" hôtelières, le personnel est à l'écoute et efficace.
Nous avons pu échanger avec certains d'entre eux, une pensée amicale à Milena, présente  chaque petit-déjeuner, elle parle parfaitement le Français et elle est passionnée par notre culture. Une belle personne.

title: Good option if not full!
text:
Small room but to be expected in NYC. Good beds, shower and TV. Location fine with a lovely Italian round
 the corner. Metro close by. Breakfast was good quality and more than enough variety. Negatives were poor housekeeping standards and room not cleaned by 4pm. Also when the hotel was at capacity part way through our stay breakfast was so busy it was very difficult to get a seat and the lifts system couldn’t cope meaning 20 minute waits. When I complained about housekeeping to reception  the man suggested it was my fault  and wasn’t very customer friendly. Decent value for a family of four as breakfast included in our rate but won’t return.

title: Hôtel sympa
text: Géographiquement Bien situé proche de Time square du métro et de la gare routière. . Accueil cordial. Chambre propre et bien équipée. Literie confortable. Petit déjeuner compris. Mais un peu d attente car la salle est petite. Je recommande.

title: Great Experience in my birthday
text:
This was a total hit for my birthday. We spend the night before going to the theatre; welcome at front desk was fine, room with a view was a good choice. 
We received a thank you note from Rachel, who welcome us when checking in. Location of the Fairfield is priceless. Recommend to stay here when in Manhattan. T

title: Location Sucks
text:
This is a newer hotel, right by the bus terminal.  Calling this Times Square is a joke

Staff was very nice

Valet was never available, my car sat outside for 2+ hours before it was parked.   

Location was just plain awful.   Scary to walk around after dark with my son and the elevators in the hotel were constantly full of druggies going to the club upstairs.  

Room was clean and comfortable.  Bfast was kinda gross.   

Not what I would pick ever, ever again.

title: Très bon séjour !
text: Très bon séjour du 24 au 31 octobre 2019 en famille. Emplacement idéal pour visiter New York. Nous avions une chambre au 17ème étage, sans réelle vue mais très calme. Il faut en effet en fonction de l'heure patienter pour accéder au petit déjeuner mais cela reste raisonnable et c'est surtout très bien géré par l'équipe. Une petite mention spéciale à Milène pour son sourire et sa gentillesse. Le fait qu'elle parle français nous a été très utile ! Globalement une équipe très accueillante et disponible. Encore merci à Rachel pour son aide le jour de notre départ ... sans elle nous n'aurions pas eu notre navette pour l'aéroport ! Nous recommandons sans hésitation cette hôtel.

title: Girls trip
text: Great staff - friendly-always smiling! very accommodating!! Would definitely return!  Staff made great restaurant recommendations exact directions too!  Everything clean, breakfast was great with many choices.

title: What a little ‘gem’
text:
We have just checked out after a 9 night stay and it has been fantastic. 

The room- good size room with a great view! We could see the ESB! Massive comfy bed. Kept very clean by cleaning staff. Coffee making facilities (Starbucks) which were refreshed every day. Plenty of USB sockets for charging. 

Breakfast/ Food- breakfast was fab. There are very few hotels in NYC that include breakfast in the price. Lots to choose from including bagels, waffles, muffins, toast with pretty much everything you can think of to put on them! Milk, yoghurt, cereal .... plus hot food options including omelettes, scrambled eggs, bacon and sausage. Fresh fruit. In 9 mornings we only had to queue once for about 5-6 mins. The staff in the breakfast room were great. Getting tables cleaned and organised. 

Reception- check in/ out was very quick and the ladies on the desk were really friendly and always willing to help. They have kept our luggage safe until we leave for the flight home at no cost. 

Location- the hotel is in a great location close to subway (2 mins) bus terminal, Times Square, Penn station. All the main sights are within 10 mins walk. The area where the hotel is a bit ‘rough around the edges’ however we had no bother and felt safe.

Other- every morning there is free coffee in the reception which you can take out when you go out for the day. On return there is always ice water and tea for you. 

Lifts- I was concerned about the lifts before I arrived due to a couple of reviews- however, in 9 nights, the longest we had to wait for a lift was about 2 mins! No complaints there! 

We got a really good rate for this hotel and I would certainly stay again ! Great hotel.

title: Good location, nice hotel
text: I would like to start with this is a very good hotel . Rooms are lovely and the bed is very comfortable. Rooms are clean and there are coffee makers in the room and free bottle of water every day There is also free breakfast added in with variety of food which was very surprising comparing to breakfast in other hotel is the US. There is normally a bit of a que but you get seated quickly or you can have the grab and go. The only complaint was that they were short of staff and our rooms were cleaned in some of the days in late afternoon (you come back from a day in NYC streets to your room at 1800 and expect to find it clean). The location is great (next to port authority bus terrminal and 5 min. walk from Times Square).

title: Nice place and close to the action streets
text: Nice hotel although the rooms are very small. we were 4 people and it was 2 small for us. we arrived before the check in time and the guy in the reception saw that we are very tired from the flight and gave us the room so we can rest a bit. we had an issue with the hot water in the room and they fixed it quickly but the solution was to reduce the water Temp' which is more a workaround than a solution. we have asked to check it again the day after but no better solution. At the same days it was cold and rainy and we expected to get a better understanding,

title: Great hotel  but
text:
I would like to start with this is a great hotel . Rooms are lovely and what a great bed so comfortable had no problem falling asleep . Rooms are clean and there are coffee makers in the room with the most delicious coffee and free bottle of water every day 
 There is also free breakfast added in . There is normally  a bit of a que but you get seated quickly  or you can have the grab and go . I really can't say anything bad about the hotel but the area is something else . It could be the last time we were here we were more to wards the park side so it could be that I was sheltered from what new York was really like . When you come out of the hotel and walk towards 8th Avenue I was met with  homeless people  sleeping in door ways . Most were out their faces on weed or alcohol.  I will say they never bothered me but the smell of drugs being blown in my face was not what I wanted 
 I will say that most of the homeless that had cards up saying hungry still had money to have their cell/ mobile phones working . 
As I said lovely hotel  just the wrong place for it .

title: Always a great stay
text: Found a new way to enter NYC, we left our vehicle in NJ and took the bus from East Rutherford into the Port Authority Bus Terminal. This put us less than a block from the Fairfield.  We were very early but the securely stored our luggage while we wandered around the city...to the tune of 24500 steps!  Uggggghhhhh!  Hotel is clean, modern, comfy with great staff.  Perfectly located in the Times Square area and walking distance to great shopping, dining and attractions.   Breakfast is provided and will fill you up.

title: Great location
text: We sorted a new way to get into New York to save parking and trains. We now park in Jersey and take bus in. The bus authority is right across the street from the hotel and only steps from times square. Great stay. Super staff. Nice breakfast spread.

title: Great location, good service, would return and recommend
text:
Pros;
•centrally located, close to times square and good travel links
•staff friendly and helpful
•complimentary breakfast very good
•rooftop bar bonus
•rooms clean and well equipped
•overall property high standard of cleanliness 

Cons;
•late at night location can be a little sketchy, not sure i would recommend lone travellers to this area
•lobby lifts are very slow
•initial hairdryer in room was not working, called down to reception 3 times and waited a total of 2 hours to receive a replacement
•room lighting a little poor for make up etc
•bathroom towels strangely small

Overall, a good property, i would return and recommend

title: Good hotel and good location
text: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights.  This hotel was booked by accident as we thought we had booked the Fairfield at the 33rd Street location (booking error on our end).  However, our experience at the 40th street location was positive.  Our room was nice and comfortable.  We had a nice bed, soothing shower, good Wi-Fi and a decent amount of storage.  The hotel offered free breakfast, which worked for our needs.  A word of advice, try the breakfast as early as possible as the queue to get in gets a little long after 9 am.  The elevators for the hotel traveled fast (something that is rare in NYC hotels).  Location-wise, it worked well.  We were close to Times Square, Port Authority (next door) and not far from Penn Station.  We attended Comic Con at the Javits Center, which was only a 10 minute walk away.  The A,C and E subway line was just down the street from the hotel entrance, which was very convenient.  The staff at the hotel were very helpful and friendly.  The lobby is a bit small and can get crowded at times.  One note of negativity (and not directed toward the hotel) is there was some riff-raff and homeless folks as you got closer to 8th Ave.  We didn't get harassed, but it was troublesome walking through the crowd with their drug activity and such, especially later at night.  Maybe being close to Port Authority you get that presence.  Otherwise, a very nice stay and would stay again.

title: Lots of Good, but bad that is difficult to overlook
text:
First off, I wish half stars were an option because the hotel is absolutely better than a 3-star, but is not quite at 4-star level, it's a strong 3.5 that could easily be 4 if some issues that seem to be well known are addressed.

First of all, the good. I found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. Also, the room was spotless and quiet. I notice the little details when it comes to cleanliness and this is one of the few hotels that spends a little extra money to enclose a mattress in an impermeable zipped cover. I always feel so much better sleeping in a bad where the mattress is protected. A clean room and good night sleep are my two top priorities and this hotel met them. I was adjacent to the elevator and still did not hear a thing.

As far as the bad, hands down, the elevators. On a good day, it is possible to routinely wait 5-10 minutes for one of the two elevators. On a bad day, like the day I was there (with a broken elevator), I waited up to 15 minutes on multiple occasions. Clearly, this is not a new issue. There must be something that can be done to address the problem. Otherwise, one just needs to plan on calling an elevator 10-15 minutes before needed OR stay on a low enough floor to use the stairs. 

The location is what it is. It's not the fault of the hotel that the block its located on is a little sketchy. I wasn't bothered by it and did not feel unsafe. The hotel is quite convenient to major transit hubs at both Columbus Circle and Times Square. 

While this won't be my first choice to return, I would come back if the price was right. In face, I chose this time because the price was far less than other typical options.

title: FALLA LA LIMPIEZA
text:
La habitación era oscura y pequeña, situada en los pisos inferiores con una vista muy fea a unos patios interiores.
Poca  limpieza de la habitación.
El personal de recepción atento.
Muy bien situado.
Desayuno muy variado.

title: Ett helt okej hotell med bästa läget
text:
Rummet var helt okej, bodde på våning 26. Städningen och bäddningen var mycket bra.  Frukosten var inte imponerande, smakade just inget, kaffet var dock jätte gott, det kom från Starbucks. 
När vi anlände fick vi dra ett kort där man skulle göra en reservation för pengar som skulle dras den dag man checkade ut. Dock så drogs pengarna redan andra dagen vi var där. Hur eller varför, fick vi aldrig ett svar på av personalen som jobbade i receptionen. 
Hotellets läge var mycket bra nära huvudgata och tunnelbanestationer dock kantad av en del hemlöshet som man för övrigt såg på många ställen i New York. Skulle jag bo här igen? Ja det skulle jag på grund av läget.

title: Excelente hotel
text: Excelente localização, atendimento impecável e café da manhã muito bom. Quartos bem estruturados e limpos. Excelente custo x benefício. Lindo Rooftop, que pode ser usado tanto verão como no inverno. Eu recomendo.

title: Good hotel, great location
text:
We stayed here for 1 week for my friends 50th birthday. After searching for the right hotel for months before we found this and I was a bit dubious about some of the negative comments. 
Firstly it is on the same street as a liquor store so at the end of the street you get a few drunk homeless people but just ignore it and walk on, there’s usually police around.  However you get this in a lot of areas in the city anyway.

The roof top bar is in the hotel but it isn’t owned by the hotel and people had commented on people outside at all hours being noisy, we did not see this at all. Bare in mind the bar is only open Thursday- Saturday. There is a bar in the hotel, but it’s where they serve breakfast so not really a bar. This was only open once during our 1 week stay so it was a bit disappointing.

The facilities were excellent, free breakfast was great and you could get a takeaway as well. Really good variety of food to suit everyone. There was also coffee available in the lobby every morning. 

The rooms were excellent, ours was cleaned every day and the maid was lovely. The only thing about the room was the towels were quite small but other than that, the room was great.

The location is perfect for a stay in the city, right opposite port authority.  As previously stated the area can be a bit rough but it was absolutely fine and we had no issues. All the hotels are on the same street so there’s always other people around. 

Overall for the price I would recommend the hotel.

title: Great stay, great location, so so neighborhood
text: 2 night stay after a cruise so got to the hotel early (10 am) and they allowed us to check in early which was wonderful after an hour and a half uber ride from New Jersey.  Rooms were tight but clean.  Hallways old and dimly lit.  Staff was nice and free breakfast was a definite plus.   Walk to almost ever theatre, Times Square, subway entrance on the corner to the most popular subway stop in NYC.  Neighborhood is a bit rough around the edge

title: El establecimiento cumplió mis espectativas
text:
El hotel está muy bien situado, a 5-10 minutos caminando de Times Square, junto a la parada de metro 42 st Port Authority.

Al principio la impresión de la zona no es muy buena, ya que hay mucha basura, suciedad y mal olor en la calle, aunque pronto te das cuenta que es lo más común en toda la ciudad.

El hotel en general está muy bien, las instalaciones son nuevas, la habitación era lo suficientemente grande, una cama enorme de 2x2 metros, mesillas de noche, armario, minifrigorítico, cafetera, agua... 
Limpieza a diario y reponían todo.

Además nos encantó que había conexiones usb por varias zonas para cargar dispositivos, aunque si quieres usar enchufe, tienes que llevar adaptador.

El baño completo con ducha, wc y lavabo.

El desayuno es muy variado, hay casi de todo, aunque no tal y como podemos encontrar en hoteles españoles.

Caliente había bacon, salchichas, huevo revuelto, huevo duro...
Para tostar varios tipos de panes de allí, bagels, waffles...
Cereales, yogures, muchas cosas para untar como sirope, mantequilla de cacahuete...
Y algo de fruta y bizcochos también.

Además zumos (natural de naranja) y café de starbucks en grandes cantidades.

Personal de limpieza y del desayuno muy simpático y hablan español.

En recepción fue imposible encontrar alguien que hablase español, solo inglés, pero más o menos podíamos entendernos si no tienes buen nivel.

title: Buona struttura
text:
La struttura è pulita e ordinata.
Le stanze ed i bagni sono molto piccoli. Nel bagno c'è la doccia ma non il bidet. I letti sono comodi.
La colazione è varia, sia dolce che salata. Consiglio di arrivare presto poiché la sala è piccola sennò si resta in coda ad attendere il proprio turno.
Nelle stanze l'aria condizionata è regolabile, negli ambienti comuni fa freddo.
All'arrivo (check-in) chiedono un deposito con carta di credito che restituiscono dopo alcuni giorni dalla partenza.
Nel pomeriggio nella hall offrono bevande (acqua e te freddo) e talvolta dolci o pop corn.
Gentile e disponibile il personale alla reception ed in sala colazioni.
Molte volte la camera ci è stata pulita nel tardo pomeriggio. Quasi ogni giorno ci lasciavano una o due bottiglie di acqua da mezzo litro sul mobile in stanza.
Il wi-fi funziona perfettamente.

title: Buono ma i receptionist
text:
Complessivamente un buon albergo con la colazione ottima che ha parecchio dolce (tranne i croissant) molto buono e non molto salato (ma non essendo un amante del salato di prima mattina non ne ho sentito la mancanza). Per il resto le camere sono ampie e comode. Il problema principale sono coloro che stanno alla reception che sono una decina che si alternano e di questi solo 3/4 sono gentili e capaci, gli altri oltre che poco competenti sono anche arroganti e per nulla disponibili (con tutti i clienti). Come rapporto qualità/prezzo però complessivamente lo consiglio perché riassumendo ed aggiungendo:
- buona colazione
-ottima posizione
-ottime camere
-receptionist pessimi

title: Husbands 60th Birthday Trip
text: After trawling the internet to find a hotel for our trip we decided on the Fairfield on 330W 40th St, and what an excellent decision that was.  The hotel is superbly located for Times Square and all the Hop on Hop Off buses operate from there, but we also walked to Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, The Rockefeller Plaza, Empire State Building, Macy's and the start of the High Line with ease from this hotel.  The hotel is very clean and the staff are incredibly helpful and attentive, they also have a lovely complementary breakfast in the mornings, as well as complementary coffee and drinks in reception throughout the day.  As it was my husbands birthday trip they also went to the extra effort of putting balloons and a bottle of wine in our room.  We booked the 2 double bed room which was very comfortable and well equipped, as there are only 8 rooms on each floor we did not hear any noise from any other quests, you do hear a very slight amount of road noise but hey you are in New York. I would definitely stay here again especially as the Hotel arranged our taxi back to JFK at an all in charge of $70.

title: Really central and easy to walk everywhere!
text: We had a trip for honeymoon and really enjoyed it! Stayed 3 days.The location is really central for everything. And when we mentioned this is our honeymoon, receptionist make an amenity for us ( prosecco and friut bowl) It was so lovely! Thank you!

title: Just PERFECT !!!
text: The hotel is a good value central stay.Staff was awesome, breakfast was great.Rooms were modern & very clean.Great view from 24th floor. Good room and bed size.Excellent location close to Times Square and many sites.

title: Guys Weekend
text: Had a great weekend with the guys in NYC to go to the Browns Football Game. Go Browns! Hotel staff was friendly and room was cleaned.Overall great stay, and I will definitely be back. Please give my regards to the breakfast team they are amazing controlling the crowds.

title: Would not recommend
text:
I stayed here for one night for work and it was really pretty bad. I'll start with the good--they allowed me to check in early. I arrived around noon and check in is 4. I think I wound up with a lower quality room as a result, but I was really just happy to be able to check in. Also, the room was clean.
