Location was somewhat convenient in that you are not too far from Times Square, but the location was much more of a negative than a positive.

Now, here's what was bad about the hotel. The biggest problem is the street it is on. 40th Street between 8th and 9th Ave has historically been a horrible block. I lived in NYC for 15 years and this was just a street you would avoid. Well, not much has changed. The liquor store which attracts the scum of the earth is still there. There are numerous disgusting, unpleasant people on the street at all hours of the day. And you are directly across the street from the Port Authority Bus Terminal, the worst place in all of NY and possibly the world. As for the hotel itself, it apparently has a roof top bar which attracts a crowd. This makes the elevators really slow. I waited 5 minutes for one when I was trying to get to dinner, and I eventually gave up and took the stairs down 5 flights. This bar scene is really pretty unpleasant. The elevators get filthy and there was a lot of highly intoxicated people outside when I got back later that night.

Other problems was the street noise (I was on the 5th floor so maybe it's not so bad higher up?), a really uncomfortable bed, a long wait for hot water in the shower, and a horrible grinding noise when the shower was on. Also, cleaning equipment and supplies in the hallway the entire time I was there.

Definitely would not recommend this hotel. I hate to think of tourists spending a week here for their vacation.

title: Localização e limpeza irrepreensível
text:
Não gostei do tratamento no check-in. Frio e distante.  
O quarto é muito pequeno para 4 pessoas, mas está muito bem equipado. As camas de casal também são muito pequenas. A limpeza do quarto é excelente. 
A localização deste Hotel é o seu ponto forte, pois está a 5 minutos de Times Square e com Metro a 100 metros. É este o parâmetro que faz deste hotel uma excelente relação qualidade/preço. A rua onde está localizado, não tem um ambiente muito amigável à noite.
O pequeno almoço é razoável, quase bom, mas é a mesma coisa todos os dias. A equipa que aqui trabalha é muito simpática e eficiente.

title: Not good
text:
Habitación oscura, poca ventilación, 3 ascensores sólo funcionaba 1 a veces 2 lo que provocaba esperas de hasta 15 minutos en la hora de bajada al desayuno y en horario pick.
Está ubicado a 1 cuadra del
Estación de Subway y frente a Terminal de buses lo cual provocaba gran contingente de personas transitando por las veredas y mal ambiente de personas deambulando que da inseguridad.
Personalmente puedo decir que uno tiende a pensar que por la ubicación cerca de Broadway es bueno... pero no, barrio inseguro y oscuro de noche .
El personal de recepción no habla español.
Desayuno básico y repetido todos los días .
En la noche Se escucha mucho ruido de la calle , incesantemente toda la noche .

title: Good value pre cruise location stay
text: The hotel is a good value central stay. There is a nightclub on the roof that attracts attention but it didn’t interfere with our stay. The weather was beautiful so it would have been nice to sit and have a drink overlooking the city but the quiet bar was never open. The hotel offers good clean accommodation and a good breakfast.

title: Excellent Service & location
text: My husband and I went up to NYC to see Bat Out of Hell as an early birthday present to me and we spent the night on at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Times Square.  It was our lucky day because we were upgraded to the penthouse on the 32nd floor!  Sharika provided outstanding service checking us in, remembered us the next morning, and asked how the show was.  She even went out of her way to find ice for me in the morning as the ice machine was unfortunately broke.  Brian, who took care of our luggage and gave us some excellent restaurant recommendations, was also super pleasant.  I hope Marriott takes notice of these employees who provide a positive impression for Marriott while providing outstanding customer service.

title: Good location but hotel needs to improve
text:
The location to Times Square and subway is very good which is what you need in New York as you do not want to drive there.  When we arrived we were helped promptly and our car was taken by the valet.
The room was okay, not very big but adequate for New York.
The breakfast selection was very good.  Depending on when you went down to eat, you either walked in or there was a line up.  But they were very quick to clean up and see you quickly.
The staff during the day need to be a little more friendly.  I asked a simple question and the lady did not even understand what I was saying.  I even turned to another guest and asked if I was speaking proper English.
We did a problem in our bathroom on the last day.  When I called down to the front desk they informed me that someone would be right up.  Well it took them 30 minutes to come to our room to fix the issue.
The other thing was the elevators. There were only 2 running each day and you would have to wait at least 10 minutes or more to go downstairs.  Many people walked down the stairs.  This was very inconvenient especially when you are checking out with luggage, who wants to drag it down 20 flights of stairs?
If you are staying at this hotel on Friday or Saturday night...be warned for the Sky Room nightclub.  There are lines of people outside the hotel and again 1 elevator dedicated to the bar.  It was a little crazy those days.
Overall the location is what we wanted to Times Square, Broadway and the subway.

title: luxo, conforto, boa mesa,  proximo de muitos pontos turisticos, proximidade de transporte publico, limpesa excelente, qu
text: excelente escolha, tanto no verao como no inverno,.boa localização proximo ao transporte publico e algumas atrações bastante interessantes.Restaurantes com bom serviço,  aconchegante e bastante espaçoso.

title: Un piacevole soggiorno... nel posto più caotico del mondo: Manhattan!
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questa struttura per 6 notti ed ha rispettato le nostre aspettative in termini di posizione, pulizia, cordialità del personale e del servizio della colazione. Uniche note stonate sono state le lunghe attese per gli ascensori (stavamo al 30mo piano) e la temperatura glaciale degli ambienti comuni. La fila per la colazione era scorrevole e necessaria per consentire una efficiente distribuzione dei tavoli. Lo consiglio e ci tornerei volentieri, anche se non ha nulla di talmente esclusivo dal farmi rinunciare all’idea di provare un altro hotel.

title: Good location, lovely staff.
text: We just have returned from a 5 day break in New York staying at the Fairfield hotel.  The hotel is in a great location for exploring upper/mid Manhattan and lower Manhattan is only a short metro ride away.  The staff in the hotel were very friendly and the breakfast is good enough to set you up for the day.  There was sometimes a queue but we did not have to wait very long.  The wifi in the hotel is excellent, probably the best I have experienced in a hotel.  We never had a problem connecting or using it at any time of the day.  The lifts in the hotel were a problem with only two in operation.  We were on the 22nd floor and like others we found ourselves on occassion waiting over 5 minutes, particularly early in the morning and we took to the stairs to decend sometimes.  Most other times of the day it wasnt too bad.  We booked a double room for four, with two adults and two older teens.  The room was on the small side plus the beds were small doubles.  We managed ok but a larger room would have been better.  Overall we were happy with our stay.

title: לא חייבים
text:
‏1. ריח בחדר של המזגן היה נוראי, בקטריות, לא מטופל. 
‏2. מעלית לא עובדת חיכינו כמה שעות עם מזוודות כדי לעלות לקומה 11
‏וגם כדי להשתמש בהן אתה יכול לחכות 10 דקות לפחות בכל פעם שאת רוצה לרדת או לעלות שלוש מעליות עמוסות עייפה
‏החדר עד קומה 11 משקיף בתחנה מרכזית רעש  חזק מאוד של אוטובוסים נשמע 
‏3. הזמנו מונית סיכמנו מחיר בקבלה כשהגיע נהג ביקש  תוספת על כמות המזוודות חריגה פקידת הקבלה  צדיקה את הנהג הנהג ביקש ב-120 דולר לחמש מזוודות ושלחו אותי לצאת החוצה לחפש ,  מייד מצאתי מונית שעלת לי 57 דולר
צא החוצה תפוס מונית מהפינה אנחנו לא מזמינים מונית.
4.בקיצור, מיקום לא מי יודע מה
5. צוות לא שירותי
6. ארוחת הבוקר משעממת.
7. אם לא חייבים, יש יותר טובים

title: Nightclub on Roof; Stairwells Dangerous
text:
I typically pick Marriott due to their level of standard. The room was okay, however there were major issues with the amenities and service.

1 of the 3 elevators serving the hotel was our of order. This would normally be an inconvenience anyone could accept. It meant waiting 10-15 minutes for an elevator when coming in and out of the hotel to get to our room. 

The hotel features the SkyRoom nightclub on the room, so nights 1 of the elevators becomes dedicated to the night club, so this means 1 elevator for the entire hotel. The wait becomes even worse forcing hotel guests to take the stairs. It is one of the biggest night clubs in Manhattan. Thankfully we were only on the 8th floor.

We take the stairs on Fri, 8/31 and Sat, 9/1 at and the trash from the cleaning staff is sitting bagged on every floor blocking the stairs. This is a fire exit. We let the staff know and it is finally removed Sat, 9/1 in the afternoon.

We are woken at 3 AM on Sun, 9/2 to the sounds of drunk partiers coming down the elevator. At 4 AM we leave for airport only to once again not get an elevator as they are full for the night club guests exiting.

Once again to the stairs but the lobby exit of the stairs is blocked by hanger rack and coat rack for the night club. Again, where is a fire marshall when you need one. Somebody is seriously going to get hurt due to their negligence of fire exits.

The lobby and front of the hotel every night are full of drunk partiers. It was especially joyful at 4 AM on Sunday.

Every time we mentioned this to the staff, they said they know it is frustrating. Obviously Marriott’s priority is not their 30+ floor of guests, but rather their rooftop night club.

I wish I knew all this before I reserved here. Disappointing for the price you pay. Worse of all it is unsafe. 

I should have taken photos, so people truly understand unless you are looking for a party spot; this is not the hotel you want to stay.

title: Muy bien situado
text:
Estuvimos 3 personas en una habitación 5 noches el mes de agosto, las habitaciones son cómodas el desayuno es correcto, el trato del personal atento y educado, siempre que podían te ayudaban y se esforzaban por entender el ingles que les hablas.
Cómo negativo solo indicar las largas esperas al ascensor, tiene tres peronismo es tan reservado para el sky room y con solo 2 se tiene que esperar mucho.
A destacar que esta a 10 minutos andando de times Square, y delante de la estación central de autobuses,en pleno centro.
En algún comentario indican que hay vagabundos por la calle, es cierto pero en ningún momento te molestan o te dicen nada, hay bastante policía en la zona y no se tiene sensación de inseguridad.

title: A nice place to stay
text:
Good hotel with great logistic position to see a lot in Manhattan.

Rooms are clean and comfortable with lot of electricity plugs available.
Cabinet had space enough for two persons and rooms it’s quite wide considering Manhattan standard.

Breakfast room is not big but ladies handling service are fast, professional and very efficient to find out your seat.
Food choice is wide with good quality
This is a plus!

Clear mission of all staff is to have customers happy and they succeed!

Only negative point is the outside of the hotel, full of drunk people and very dirty but this has nothing to do with hotel level of quality.

Gabriella and Stefano

title: Un po' deludente
text: Seconda volta a NYC, ho optato per un hotel un po' più lussuoso (l'altra volta ho alloggiato all'hotel Element stessa zona, Times Sq West) e sono stata un po' delusa, ho sinceramente preferito quello dove sono stata tre anni fa. La hall dalle foto sembra enorme e non è vero; tre ascensori per 32 piani, di cui uno non funzionante e quindi attese interminabili ai piani. Grande caos per il rooftop: nessuna divisione tra clienti esterni e clientela hotel. Il rooftop a parer mio non vale proprio la pena: la visuale su Times Sq è limitata, uguale a quello che vedevo dalla mia stanza al 13 piano, il cibo è costoso e non un granché. Stanza carina ma quanta polvere! Lunghe code e attese anche per la colazione. Colazione abbondante e varia sia dolce che salata. Personale molto cordiale e disponibile.

title: Amazingly helpful staff, Excellent Times Sq location
text:
We had a short stay at the Fairfield Inn and Suites over the weekend, and were so well taken care of by the staff. We needed to add a second room on the second night of our stay, and Trisan at the front desk went above and beyond to help us with that. She actually was able to get the room right next to our original room.

If you want to stay in the Times Square area, this hotel is a great choice. We did not have a city view room, but that also meant that our 6th floor room  was quiet, and dark at night. Typical tiny NY hotel room but clean and serviceable. When we asked for extra items we got them very quickly.

The 3d elevator was out of service while we were there, which they told us on check-in, so we asked for the lower floor and used the stairs. I would suggest anyone who is able to take stairs choose a lower floor, just to avoid the rush times for elevator use even if all are operational.

Breakfast was the usual free buffet with hot as well as continental options, coffee was Starbucks Pike Place and replenished often and the staff managed the breakfast rush very well. Bellhops were also good and prompt.

All in all, if you don't mind the crush of people and traffic in Midtown and Times Square, this hotel is centrally located and the staff is quite attentive.

title: Convenient to Port Authority Bus Terminal
text: We took a bus to the port authority and stayed at this hotel.  The room was clean and staff was attentive.  The hot breakfast was filling.  It does get crowded and there is a wait at peak times.  Close to Times Square attractions.

title: Bel hôtel mais...
text:
Très bel hôtel, bien situé, avec des prestations de qualités mais le gros soucis vient du petit déjeuner. La salle et le buffet ne sont pas adaptés au nombre de client de votre hôtel. Quelle que soit l'heure, le moment est désagréable : manque de table, de nourriture, d'espace... 
Le ménage a également été oublié une fois, nous avons dû faire nos lits et utiliser des serviettes mouillées.
Dommage pour ces deux points, car sinon ce serait parfait, hormis le centime prélevé en solde... mesquin.

title: Personal
text: El personal de recepción es tremendamente asqueroso. No hablan español cosa que en un hotel me parece alucinante, tampoco hacen por entenderte y no preguntes dudas porque encima te contestan de malas maneras. No volveré.

title: Bien mais..
text:
Très belle hôtel idéalement situé. Personnel est petit déjeuner top pas d'attente si vous êtes des lèves tôt.Chambre confortable et bien équipée salle de bain correcte. Coffre fort et réfrigérateur très pratique. 
Seul bémol le rouftop ne devrait pas être dans le descriptif de l'hôtel il est réservé à des soirées privées. Le descriptif de l'hôtel est trompeur car c'est le rouftop qui incite les clients à choisir cet hôtel.

title: Buon hotel
text: Albergo nel centro di Manhattan a 5 minuti a piedi dalla subway. Camera non particolarmente grandi ma pulite con un bel bagno. La colazione non era compresa nel preZo ma si poteva pagare a parte. All’angolo della via dell’albergo c’è un luogo per fare colazione.

title: Au cœur de Wall street
text:
Hôtel très bien situé, proche des quais (embarcadère pour ballade en bateau et héliport) et de stations de métro. Chambre (1001) et SDB à remettre en état. 
Salle du petit-déjeuner beaucoup trop petite, nous avons dû attendre 20 mn pour dégoter un coin de table sale.
Personnel à la réception moyennement aimable et pas très efficace. Pour commander un taxi pour l’aéroport, ne passez pas par eux mais préférez un yellow cab qui passe dans la rue, c’est plus rapide et moitié moins cher. C’est ce que nous avons fait après avoir attendu en vain 40 mn le taxi commandé par l’hôtel.

title: C’è sicuramente di meglio
text:
Siamo stati a NYC 6 notti per un viaggio di famiglia e sicuramente avremmo potuto trovare di meglio.
Pulizia nella norma ma Hotel con stanze eccessivamente piccole e vetuste.
Si poteva soprassedere se non fosse in una zona piena di spazzatura maleodorante, barboni tra cui fare una gincana e odori a dir poco nauseabondi.
Dovessi tornare a NY eviterei la zona tra la 40th e la 47th , per quanto centrali credo siano le più invivibili di questa metropoli.
L’albergo pubblicizza il roof ma i clienti dell’albergo stesso non hanno accesso allo stesso liberamente e la hall dell’hotel
e la sala colazione sono vetuste e anguste a sufficienza.
L’unica nota positiva, la colazione che dati i prezzi di NY ha un valore doppio.
Se si vogliono evitare file e attese, basta recarsi entro le 8.30 del mattino.

title: Sisters 40th in new york
text: This hotel is so central for touring New York right down the road from port authority and in time square in 10 minutes, handy for subway and easy access to all sights, lovely choice of breakfast every morning, friendly and helpful staff,room was a good size for NYC and all aspects of hotel spotlessly clean

title: Location, location, location
text: Just a few blocks away from port authority. Walked 1.5 blocks from our broadway show. Close to Times Square. Had a roof top bar. Free breakfast but the line was always too long.  A little sketchy walking to the hotel.

title: A Quiet Hotel in a convenient location.
text:
The Fairfield Inn and Suites by Marriott provided a very quiet stay in a busy location.  It provided an adequate breakfast with good choices in the morning.

The proximity to Penn Station was great as it allowed ready access to the subway system which my daughter and I truly appreciated as it enabled us to move around the city quite readily.  The Citymapper app allowed us to see live timing of subway trains and helped us get around the city quite well.  In our brief 3 day stay, we were able to go to the "Fleet Week" events, take a cruise on the Hudson, see Ground Zero, Tour the new World Trade Center and the Empire State building.  We also highly enjoyed the Hop On Hop Off bus tours day and night tours.

title: 広く快適な部屋 有難い朝食サービス 便利な場所
text: バスタブ付きの充分で清潔な部屋、シンプルだけど毎日種類が変わる朝食、地下鉄駅徒歩 2分の利便性。ニューヨークに滞在するなら最高のホテルです

title: Ótima equipe de atendimento e café da manhã
text: Fomos em família, 2 adultos e 2 crianças, e atendeu muito bem nossas necessidades. A equipe é muito simpática e prestativa. Recebe encomendas sem cobrar por isso e não cobra taxa de resort. O café da manhã, de 7 as 11:00, é excelente para os padrões americanos. Pelo menos 3 tipos de fruta por dia, ovos, omeletes, hamburguer, iogurtes, rosquinhas, waffle... O quarto é pequeno, mas dentro do aceitável para o padrão de NYC. Conseguimos colocar as malas em uma lateral que não prejudicava a circulação. O hotel não é muito moderno, mas a localização é ótima, em termos de proximidade de estações de metrô, e de atrações bem procuradas (Times Square e redondezas). A rua é muito movimentada e fica atrás do Port Authority. À noite, há muita gente deitada do chão, mas não abordam ninguém nem passam sensação de insegurança, por ter muito movimento no local. Aliás, tem um bar no rooftop do hotel, o Ski Room, que torna o lugar bem movimentado.

title: Good location near Times Square
text:
The Fairfield is in a great location near Times Square on 40th between 8th and 9th sandwich between a cluster of 4 hotels in a row.

Check in was efficient and pleasant.  The room had two double beds with the standard Fairfield furniture and snug configuration.
  
Breakfast is served on the ground floor.

Overall, the room was clean & quiet and the stay was pleasant.

title: A descent nigh with a Nutella morning
text:
Our room #604 facing the walls of Port Authority is not what we would like to remember in Manhattan. However, the room was comfortable fair in space and accessories, enjoyable bed but no the pillows. It has a nice min fridge hidden under a night table which was convenient for us to have water, yogurt &  fruits. The bathroom had a pipe noise when opening the hot water, after a while, it would go away, although it had good pressure water. 
The staff service was #1 especially a lady name Andrise ( hopefully it is spell right). 
She did register us in, and a few minutes later she called up the room to ask if everything was ok. That is proper hospitality management. The breakfast included in the price, we will remember it. It how well organized, clean area, modern decorated and with a tasty variety of food, fruits, oatmeal, waffles, yogurts, eggs, sausage, and NUTELLA !!!!

title: Location location location
text: Stayed here with my family of 4 adults for 10 nights. We shared the double room. Was a bit apprehensive about room size, but all worked out well. The breakfasts were fabulous, lotsa variety. There is a subway station 2 mins away, a Jacks grocery store for drinks, etc just further along. The staff were friendly, thoroughly enjoyed the ice cold water/iced tea available in lobby every afternoon. Hubby enjoyed his daily Starbucks coffee, available from breakfast to 8pm. We phoned maintenance once, and within minutes they were knocking on our door & all was sorted. I would highly recommend this hotel on 40th street.

title: Terrible Customer Service
text: As a Titanium Elite Marriott guest I have come to expect a certain level of customer service.  This hotel fails miserably.  The front desk staff was so rude and unprofessional.  Every request was met with a condescending response. The room received was terrible for the money. Furniture in disrepair, bed uncomfortable and view non existent.  Every night you have to walk past a drug rehab facility which is sketchy at best.  Much better values can be found in a more welcoming location without the rude staff to deal with.

title: Good price, professional friendly helpful staff - slow elevators but overall good stay
text:
I am writing this from the hotel room. Overall a good hotel. My room is small but not atypical for Manhattan hotels. Mainly, the AC works really well. I believe it turns off when I leave the room, but it was able to quickly cool the room on one of the hottest days this summer. Room and bathroom were spotless.

I went up to the rooftop bar dressed in jeans and sneakers, and felt underdressed - drinks were pricey (normal for NYC) and food not bad. There are two levels up top. The top-level was loud and full of young 20-somethings looking to hookup, and fairly well-dressed. For some of the commenters complaining they were not allowed up there, my take is for me it was not a fit anyways. I felt more comfortable in the area one floor below the top level.

Cons:
Elevators are very slow. After waiting for 15 minutes, I decided to walk downstairs from the 16th floor.

Breakfast lines can be long unless you get up early when they start serving. They have signs in the lobby in the morning telling you the expected wait time based on what time you make it down for breakfast.

Tip: If you are in the breakfast line, talk to a staffer about a to-go box. I just walked up to the left of the line and asked. They had a staffer announce that to us when we were in line. That way you do not have to wait for a seat, and you can take your breakfast up to your room.

I have to hand it to the staff. They are very aware of the limitations of elevator/breakfast capacity, and in spite of it are cheerful and professional throughout. I would probably stay here again.

title: Good hotel, staff not helpful
text: Stayed here middle of June. Got a great price on the room so i cannot complain but staying in many hotels the service level here was just lacking. I know this is a fairfield inn but still. Upon arriving at 10-11 pm we were given a room with one king bed after requesting 2 double beds online. We were told the hotel was completely sold out. Which would have made sense if i didnt look online and see multiple rooms available, with double beds. Even after bringing this up to the front desk, they said we are sold out completely, without even checking the system to see there were rooms available. It was almost like the higher ups told them to just tell everyone they were sold out. Just weird.  Not too big of a deal though, we got over it and just slept together. My biggest suggestion for this hotel, is to open the rooftop to YOUR guests, at any time of day. We woke up early to have some coffee and relax on the roof but could not even get up to the roof top because it is only opened at night for the bar located there. We ended up just walking up the steps and hanging on the roof regardless but it was trashed from the night before. I also understand dress code, but i saw multiple guests staying at the fairfield inn, get turned away from going to get a drink on the roof because they were not properly dressed. a man and his wife were wearing very nice clothing but he had on sandals, and was turned away and told there was nothing they could do. Guests expecting a hotel with rooftop access, it is completely separate from the hotel and you will not be allowed to the rooftop unless dressed properly.

title: UM HOTEL BEM NO CORAÇÃO DE NEW YORK
text: Este hotel tem uma ótima localização estando muito próximo do World Trade Center e do Empire State Building. Embora sua aparência externa não seja muito sofisticada seus  são quartos são amplos e confortáveis. O café da manhã não deixa nada a desejar. Os serviços e o atendimento pessoal é razoável

title: bien ubicado
text: Esta muy bien ubicado, remodelado recientemente, el unico problema es que por las noches puede parecer un poco inseguro poruqe la calle es oscura y mucha bolsas de basura. Bueno el bufet autosrevicio del hotel, falta un poco de limpieza

title: Infrastructure needs improvement
text:
I’ve stayed here numerous times, and what follows is the culmination of the experiences. 

The good: no matter how busy, the hotel staff is very welcoming, helpful, and attentive. This includes the front desk, housekeeping, and the very busy breakfast staff. In a really busy morning, for instance, Keitha, who was probably managing to feed and find tables for over 100 people, was nothing but smiles, effectiveness, efficiency, and professionalism. The rooms are also very clean, which is always nice to find. 

The not so good: the infrastructure. Expect low water pressure from time to time, lack of hot water (which has happened to me here once, so I don’t want to make it sound like an epidemic, but I do wonder if a revitalized infrastructure project may not prevent it in the future) and a broken elevator, but I guess that’s to be expected? Kind of?

Also not so good: super long wait times to catch the elevator. This hotel can become very busy with very crowded elevators that may stop at every floor. The Sky Room adds to the hassle when the weekend non-guests want to party over your head.

The so-so: The location. It’s central and close to the subway, and a 24 hour Duane Reade just a minute away, but you also have to regularly walk by the not-so-uplifting Port Authority area.

title: Good value, would stay again
text: Great location near the major theaters. Room was clean and comfortable, but a bit small. Hey, it’s NYC. Included breakfast was average. Staff was helpful. Two minor negatives to be aware of. Front desk was understaffed compared to demand at major check in times, resulting in longer than necessary wait time. Also the elevator capacity is not up to demand at peak times. You can wait 5-10 minutes if you are on the upper floors. But pricing decent for the area, would stay again.

title: Bonne situation
text:
Nous étions dans une chb pour 4 personnes si vous avez les moyens prenez une chb pour deux car à 4 avec 4 valises la chb est lilliputienne. 
Le petit dej complet mais levez vous tôt car après 8h c’est compliqué, trop de monde et attente un peu longue pour avoir une table
La situation de l’hôtel est très bonne j’ai fait pas mal de truc à pied. Malheureusement il y a pas mal de mendicité dans la rue mais ça l’hôtel n’y est pour rien

title: Deludente....
text: Innanzitutto situato in una via dove bisogna fare lo slalom tra corpi di ubriachi e drogati spiaggiati sul marciapiede...puzza di urina ed immondizia....indecente!!! Finalmente a destinazione l’accoglienza è cordiale ma la stanza assegnatoci è piccola e il bagno datato e poco funzionale....odore di umidità terribile...per fortuna in hotel ci si sta il minimo indispensabile .... subway a pochi passi.... colazione ricca....personale gentile!!!

title: Husband’s Birthday Weekend
text:
PROS:  
1.  Newly build/updated hotel 
2.  Clean and modern 
3.  Comfy bed 
4.  Refrigerator
5.  Convenient sky roof top lounge 
6.  Huge bathroom 
7.  Free breakfast buffet & Starbucks coffee 

CONS:
1.  Long wait for elevators (almost 10mins)
2.  Homeless bums surrounding the outside perimeter 
3.  Sink didn’t have cold water so had to brush teeth with hot water or use shower water 
4.  Room was crammed 
5.  I requested a Timesquare view room however, didn’t get one.
6.  Breakfast wasn’t anything special (sausage patties, Canadian ham, eggs, toast, waffles, oatmeal, fresh fruit, etc) 
7.  No microwave 
8.  A little bit of a walk, this hotel is NOT right in the center of Timesquare

title: 立地は、抜群
text: LGBTの集まりがあり、たくさんの人が宿泊されていました。スタッフの方もいい方が多かったですね。価格的にも安めなのでおススメです。

title: Green washing
text:
Okey, don´t get me wrong here. Fairfields inn & suites is an okey hotel if you look at service, rooms, staff etc. What is wrong is their total ignorance of the environment. 

Like most other hotels they do have signs in the bathroom that they hope their customers reuse the towels to save water. On the door they kindly ask you to turn of the aircondition to save power for the environment. So far so good. 

The problem is when you enter the breakfast area in the morning and they don´t have anything else than single use plastic cups, single use plastic cutlery, single use coffee mugs and plates. This is where we can talk about wasting resources. 

I contacted Fairfield Inn about this and got a short answer. I quote:
"Unfortunately we are not a full service hotel so we do not have the opportunity to use glassware in our breakfast area." 

I won't stay there again until they have fixed this or leased the breakfast to another hotel nearby where their guests can have breakfast.

title: Skyroom Roof Top Bar in Times Square by Fairfield Hotel
text: Nothing bad about the hotel but the Roof top bar had a bad experience. Grace the waitress was very pushy with the dink’s, I was celebrating my friends bday and Just wanted her to wish my friend a happy Bday she said “they don’t do that”. It’s the 1st bar that actually said no. I was not happy with the service or attitude and left her a 15% tip. She actually followed my drunk friend to the elevator and requested more $$ for her tip. I hate to think, they actually target the persons who drink too much for more tip money. Very disappointed! This establishment needs too take a closer look at who they hire!

title: Rude!
text:
My husband and I came for an overnight date as he had been on business travel last week! My husband is lifetime platinum elite, and titanium the last year as well. He had ask for an upgraded suite they weren’t available, totally get it. Was told, oh you are in upgraded room. Also very rude, as if this annoyed her at check in. Nope it’s what we reserved, very small. Also wasn’t told at check-in  thanks for being a Marriott elite member and given our welcoming points. To some this is small but when your husband is in a Marriott 100+ nights a year and we go away for the night and the staff is rude it’s a real annoyance. The young lady at check out was just as rude. Hope management takes a look at this staff. The hotel is clean, kudos to housekeeping, oh and Eric he’s the guy who handles the luggage, went over and beyond. Marriott sends my husband surveys of each of his stats and he will let them know about the rude staff except Eric of course. 
When I asked the girl her name that checked us out she said it quick and turned to another guest. Glad this isn’t the norm at Marriotts or we would be doing the Hilton thing. 
Location of hotel is also not the grandest of areas.

title: Short break in NY
text:
We recently stayed at this hotel for for 5 nights. Great location, just off Times Square. Close to Metro.
Outside of hotel OK but as you walk up the street lots of rubbish and homeless people. Although the rubbish is collected on a regular basis there is so many people using the streets so the rubbish is replaced  quickly.
 Hotel staff are all very pleasant and very helpful. Breakfast was the usual choice of hot or cold buffet. The Coffee was Starbucks and constantly re filled, unfortunately for me the plastic cutlery and paper plates I felt was a lot of waste.
Entrance to hotel is small and the Skybar use one of the lifts, so lots of people around but hotel staff are around all the time so no problems. 
We stayed on 31st floor but lift quick and we never seemed to wait long for one.
The room was clean and up together the  king size bed was so comfortable, the best I’ve stayed in. 
Bathroom great with a big shower.
The room had everything  you need for a hotel stay.

title: Dove alloggiare a NYC
text:
Sono stata in questo hotel per 5 giorni con la mia famiglia
Camere sempre pulite e comode 
Colazione inclusa ottima anche se non variegata 
Personale gentile
Posizione strategica, vicino a time square e attaccato alla metropolitana 
Mi sono trovata davvero bene e tornerei subito

title: Birthday weekend
text:
Great location, great front desk service. Amazing breakfast included. 
Thank you, Jason, for guiding us to the right places. 

Conveniently located to everything. 

Highly recommend it especially if you want to do a lot of sightseeing. Great deli at end of street. Essin. 

Lyft was easily available after a day of walking through Central Park and beyond. Must have lunch at Plaza Food Court.

title: 타임즈스퀘어에 묵을만한 곳이에요
text:
타임즈스퀘어에서 가까워요
뉴욕 출장길에 이용했는데 다른 호텔은 너무 비싸서 200불 정도로 이용 가능해서 감사히 이용했습니다.
맨하탄에서 조식 포함에 나쁘지 않은 숙소에요
조식도 캐주얼하게 먹을만 했습니다.
역시 맨하탄은 숙박료가 너무 비싸네요 ㅎㅎ

title: Multiple smell complaints
text:
First, I have a terrible sense of smell. Now that is out of the way I must tell you that I was blown over when I walked into this room upon check in. Not sure if some well-meaning housekeeper was covering up a chain-smoking orgy or a glue gun project gone wrong...but, I’m on day 3 and I still walk in to, and wake up to, this smell. 

I brought it up to the front desk 3 times and they seemed nice about it...but it still smells like Laura Ashley’s or Holly Hobby’s basement.

Other important things- terrible water pressure (hope you’re bald). Right next to the Times Square parole office (hope you’re clean).

title: Poor Customer Service
text: Booked my resevation online at Amoma.com, Hotel says they could not find my reservation, waited for 45 minutes, the manager never came out , Hotel never appologized, but I guess they found my reservation eventually because I was billed for a room I never stayed in.

title: Good hotel, great location
text: This is a very clean hotel in a location close to Times Square. It is next to the Port Authority bus terminal, so be prepared for a bit of a dodgy neighborhood. The place is well kept up with free breakfast. Would stay again, good value for the price.

title: Gran experiencia
text:
Estuvimos alojados en este hotel previo a un crucero. Muy buena opción por la ubicación. Cerca de los puntos de interés.
Buen desayuno muy completo.
Lo que quiero destacar principalmente es la muy buena atención en el front desk.
Volvimos después del crucero y nos tenían reservada la misma habitación que habíamos estado previamente. Una con una vista preciosa al Empire States  building. Felicitaciones a todo el personal.

title: Friendly Staff
text: Stay here with some friends when we come into the city to hangout.   Rooms are kind of small, but that’s Manhattan.   Easy to walk to where you want to go from here.   Rooms are always clean.   I would recommend it.

title: Pleasantly Suprised
text:
We arrived early in the morning (8:00 am) after a 17-hour flight from overseas.  We had no expectation that we would be able to check in that early but wanted to drop our luggage in storage.  Jessica worked her magic and was able to get us checked in!  We were very impressed by that. 

Our room was fine.  The bed was comfortable.  The TV was a fairly large screen and worked well - we were able to use our Netflix.  No problems with anything at all.   We requested extra pillows and they brought them up very quickly - again, impressed.

Although there are 30+ floors (we were on the 29th floor) the elevators moved very quickly - no real waits.

The location of this hotel was great - walking distance to Times Square, all of the Broadway shows and even Central Park; a block from the subway; walking distance to the Garment District.  

We didn’t use the gym or the breakfast buffet, so I can’t comment on them.

The WiFi was pretty good in the room.  The only real ‘negative’ was that neither of the CPUs downstairs worked (they couldn’t get the internet working) so we couldn’t print some documents.

Overall, very satisfied - and the customer service was always top notch!

title: Average
text: Booked room in a bind...Friendly enough staff, very cold beer at the bar, rooms very small, bed OK, no decaf coffee, very hot water, limited parking. Would I stay here again? In a pinch, probably yes.

title: Pleasant stay
text: Stayed here for one night, got an upgrade to top floor suite (double room), clean and big room, in NYC u donot get big rooms but top suites r different :) , great view from window. Time's square is 10min walk, bus station is just next to the hotel even the train station, hotel is strategically located. Stuffs were good, breakfast is btr then many other similar category hotels.

title: Convenient To Cruise Piers
text: This property's entry is below street level with both stairs and ramp to access. There are two small elevators; narrow buildings and small rooms are typical of NYC. The room had a very nice city view ($20 extra and worth it) and very quiet and well-appointed. Walking distance to several restaurants and a short cab ride to the pier. Prices did go up quite a bit as cruise time drew close; we booked about 6 months out to secure two beds in the room. We asked for a good pizza place nearby; it was just around the corner and there was a small market nearby.

title: Week end de 4 jours
text:
Hotel très propre. 
Salle de bain grande. Literie très bien.
Personnel très acceuillant.
Nous étions au 19 étages prendre des boules caisse car on entend la clim extérieur côté cour.
Petit dej un peu serré quant tout le monde arrive à 7h00.
Mais très complet , fruit yaourt oeuf bacon gaufre pain de mie jus de fruit.
Métro à 200m , times square à côté .
200m de la gare pour les aéroports.

title: Parfait de A à Z
text:
Nous venons de passer 5 nuits avec ma compagne et nous en repartons enchantés. 
J’avais demandé par mail lors de ma réservation une faveur pour une jolie vue et en étage élevé.
Nous avons eu une chambre au 25ème étage avec une vue incroyable!!! , un plateau de fruits nous attendait aussi !!! 
Le personnel est très gentil. La chambre est très propre et fonctionnelle avec une machine à café et thé
Le petit déjeuner est parfait. 
La salle de sport est complète.
Nous sommes partis à 16h30, ils peuvent vous garder vos bagages pour profiter de votre journée.
Nous avons eu un petit soucis avec le bouchon de la baignoire qui ne fonctionnait pas. Je l’ai signalé à 21h, le temps de fumer une cigarette et le problème était déjà réglé quand je suis remonté dans ma chambre!!!!
Je suis très très exigeant et je ne peux rien trouver de mal à dire sur quoi que ce soit :)
Au niveau situation géographique, je l’ai trouvé top car il y a un métro au bout de la rue et Times Square est à 5 min à pied.
Le seul petit bémol vient de la rue qui est assez mal fréquentée avec beaucoup de personnes pas rassurantes mais pas agressives qui demandent de l’argent ou des cigarettes. ( leur façon de demander est souvent énorme avec des checks et tout le show américain...:))
Je conseillerais cet hôtel à un ami sans aucun problème.

title: Personnel autoritaire et désagréable
text:
Hotel très bien situé. Proche time square et métro. Chambre propre et literie confortable. Situés au 7ème étage sans vue mais donnant sur un intérieur cour immonde et sombre. Préférer un étage surélevé pour un minimum de clarté. Personnel hyper désagréable avec la palme pour celui de la sécurité qui n'hésite pas à vous crier dessus si vous ne comprenez pas ce qu'ils vous ordonne la première fois. Du jamais vu !! Salle de déjeuner minuscule pour le nbre de chambre de cet hôtel (32 étages), donc personnel qui vous place de façon militaire, sans vous laisser le choix. Petit déjeuner très moyen. 
Il est vrai que l'on n'y passe pas bcp de temps mais le peu de présence n'est pas très agréable. 
Donc note moyenne pour un hôtel de cet ordre.
Lamentable en ce qui concerne le personnel.

title: Wonderful surprise
text:
Check in . Very quick. No  frills
Rooms good.clean. a bit small for 3 people
A bit noisy. Because of location ( Port authority Terminal.. 8 and 9rh Avenue)
Breakfast. Very good . Good options
Starbucks coffee any time up to 19 hs
Staff. . very agreeable. Efficient
A very special congratulations to all staff at the breakfast room
Special congrats to Alicia. A new one staff worker a with a brilliant future

title: Nice Stay
text:
Liked both the Hotel and location. Very close to Times Square. Rooms were extremely clean and the Hotel staff were exceptional. Always helpful, which is unusual for this City.
Was upgraded to a Suite on the 32nd floor, which was quite nice.  Breakfast came with room. Breakfast room, while hectic with all of the tourists, was very good. Wide selection of breakfast items. 

If you like the general area, which has a lot to offer, this is the place to stay!

title: Small, dirty rooms with unprofessional service
text: We found the hotel to be very disappointing.  The front desk staff was unhelpful and not service oriented.  Even though as Marriott Rewards members and received an upgrade to a 19th floor room, the room was very small and carpet was dirty.  The hallways on the floor are exceptionally narrow, and the carpet is frayed and dirty.

title: Decepcionados
text:
Nos hospedamos del 6 al 11 de abril, 2019. 3 adultos y un niño.
Somos viajeros GOLD de la cadena Marriott desde hace varios años. Asi que, nuestra primera opción son hoteles de la cadena Marriott.

1. Ingresamos el domingo 7 de abril, de madrugada, a las 6am, por eso compré la habitación desde el día anterior, porque la noche del hotel rige desde las 4pm del 6 de abril hasta 12md del día 7 de abril.
El muchacho de la recepción no indica, que la reserva fue cancelada y que  no puede recuperarla. Pidió que esperemos al siguiente turno. Nos quedamos en una sala del lobby, durante 2 horas, con el niño durmiendo en un sofá y sin saber nada. Como nadie se acercaba, decidimos buscar a la nueva recepcionista y ella no estaba al tanto de nuestra situación. Bueno, media hora después nos dieron, por fin la habitación.

2. Entramos a la habitación y tenia el inodoro dañado, al rato bajamos y reportamos el daño para que lo corrigieran.

3. Tomamos un bus de recomendado por el concierge del hotel y nos fuimos. Nos fue pésimo, estaba sobrevendido. Por favor, no recomienden un tour que a la vista es pésimo.

4. Al día siguiente, nos informan que la cuenta de Bonvoy no hay puntos disponibles Revisamos y otra vez, la reserva fue, otra vez cancelada. Pierdo 1 hora resolviendo, entre llamadas y explicando la historia a la nueva persona de recepción. Se resuelve y ya. pero...

5. Para el cuarto día, otra vez me llaman de recepción que la cuenta Bonvoy no tiene puntos, y que la reserva fue cancelada!!!  Tengo que quedarme otra vez, 1 hora contando  a otra persona del lobby  la historia que empezó desde que llegamos. Cada vez que cambia el personal de recepción el problema volvía a surgir y lo peor, había que contar la historia otra vez. 

Cómo no le dan seguimiento? Saben la cantidad de horas que perdí contando la misma historia. Y, de paso, tampoco habían arreglado el inodoro!!!

Lamentablemente, este hotel no cumplió con el standard mínimo de un hotel y fueron muchas situaciones que que perjudicaron nuestro viaje, siendo tan SENCILLO corregirlas: aplicando un servicio al cliente BASICO, SEGUIMIENTO del problema con cambio de turno y ATENCIÓN a quejas u observaciones. 

Nos sentimos estafados, este hotel no cumplió el standard de la cadena. 
Fue una estadía realmente decepcionante.
Tengo fotos y videos si necesitan corroborarlo.

title: Ότι ακριβώς ψάχνεις !!
text: Τέλειο !! Κεντρικότατο , ένα τετράγωνο από την Times Square . Απέναντι από τον κεντρικό σταθμό των λεωφορείων . Μεγάλα δωμάτια , τεράστια κρεβάτια κ καθαρότατο . Καλό κ ευγενικό προσωπικό κ εξυπηρετικό . Το πρωινό είχε τα πάντα , κάθε μέρα το ίδιο βέβαια αλλά είχε πολλές επιλογές όποτε ήταν ότι έπρεπε . Είχε κ ένα μπαρ στον τελευταίο όροφο αλλά τον μήνα που πήγαμε εμείς ( Νοέμβρη )ήταν κλειστό όποτε δεν μπορώ να πω την άποψη μου , φαινόταν ωραίο πάντως . Αν ξανά βρεθώ νέα Υόρκη πάλι εκεί θα ψάξω να μείνω ! Good job guys , keep going 💪💪

title: Great location, but could do better. Rooms are -not- guaranteed however!
text:
We reserved a king bed directly with Marriott, and emailed the hotel directly to let them know that we would be checking in late and asked about a shuttle. They acknowledged and said they don't have a shuttle, but recommended cab or Uber. 

We ended up coming in a few hours later due to the fog over NYC and took a cab for a flat $35 (around 2am - to note they asked if we wanted them to book a flat rate cab back to the airport for $50 on checkout day.)

The front desk staff was friendly, and we checked in quickly and headed to our room and exhaustedly collapsed into bed (We had been up for ~24 hours straight at that point).

We both woke up in agony, our backs were in bits. It was only in the morning that we looked around and realized that we were in a queen bed, accessible suite. When we travel, we either book a king, or two queens. We went to the front desk and pointed out the error and said we wanted to get our original booking of a king bed.  She said they would store our bags while we went out to the city and when we got back they would find us a new room.

After repacking, we went down for breakfast. I don't know why people are saying the line ups are 20 minutes +, we have only ever waited a couple of minutes and have gone at various times throughout our stay. While nothing special, it was handy and had hot/cold variety and was a nice touch to get the day started. The ladies in the breakfast area were all incredibly friendly and worked their socks off keeping the food items stocked. Thank you ladies!

This location is great for walking everywhere, the subway has multiple lines within steps, there is a pharmacy on the corner.  There are a couple of undesirables gathered outside the parole office (a couple of doors down) at night, but they ignored us when we walked by.

We got in, checked into our new room. It was clean, to be fair both rooms were clean. The king room was a little cramped, but that's par for the area. Limited toiletries, but they have facial wipes, so that was nice.

When we went out for dinner, the third elevator was solely being used for the rooftop bar, so lines ups were long to get to/from your room. The lineup through the lobby side seemed to be early 20s guests. They weren't too rowdy, and outside they were roped off with security.

Biggest issues in the room itself:
-There are NO fridges - only a beverage cooler. We couldn't figure out how to work it, we just put an ice bucket in there and hoped for the best. Warm beer/pop and cheesecake is pretty gross FYI, so don't bring those back with you.
-The bed are ridiculously hard. We travel a fair bit, and this was one that continuously had us waking up in severe pain every morning. It felt like plywood with a moderately thick blanket on it. (we have a pillowtop at home, this was nothing like it)
- The heater was ridiculously loud. It got to the point we would just heat during the day and turn it off when we were in there just so we could hear one another.
- The shower apparently ran out of hot water, the pipes would make a very loud banging noise and only give lukewarm water. That only happened once, but it was awful.
- I had left a box of a small electronic item that I was meaning to return on the desk stacked with the tourist brochures, and when we returned to the room it was no longer there, along with a reloadable subway card. I unfortunately am now stuck with that device. Put all packaging in the drawers or safe if you want them to be there when you get back!

On checkout day, I emailed inquiring about possible credit/points for the initial check in issue for our inconvenience for giving away our room.  Although the email went to several people (standard), not a single person replied.
At noon when we went to checkout, I was told the manager wasn't in just yet, but would be back later to discuss.
When we returned in the afternoon, the manager told us that the room type was not guaranteed, although we had made the booking directly with Marriott, and had confirmed our late checkin directly with the hotel. For our inconvenience, she stated that she would give us a token pittance amount of Bonvoy points. We have not received those points. Why bother offering them? We're loyal Marriott customers, and have been for years now. I found being lied directly to my face incredibly insulting.

While we are headed back to Manhattan in June, we will not be returning to this location. As Bonvoy credit cardholders and frequent travel enthusiasts, we expected much, much better for a cobranded hotel.

title: Hôtel très bien situé
text: Hôtel idéalement situé à quelques blocs de Times Square mais loin des nuisances sonores. Métro dans la rue à seulement quelques mètres. Chambre très propre et bien insonorisée, lit confortable. Le buffet du petit déjeûner était assez basique mais bon.

title: Great
text: We were looking for a family hotel, centrally located which offered breakfast. This one meets its all ... and fantastic. Rooms are spacious.. breakfast ok. Location fantastic. Really great. Staff are friendly ... what more can i say

title: Family Reunion visit!
text:
Excellent service from all staff! Check-in was efficient and stress free! Front desk Manager Kendijah was professional and courteous and friendly. 
We spent some time at Sips bar where the breakfast is served during the morning. Great place to hang out. We brought in snacks and pizza and the service was exceptional. Our server Rich went above and beyond to provide great service. 

Breakfast was great. Plenty of options.

Rooms are clean and beds are very comfy! 

Would not recommend the rooftop bar! You have to take an elevator to get there and leave. While we were waiting to leave two guys starting shouting at out each other and it was escalating quickly. We could not leave and this made our group nervous and  we felt unsafe. The security showed up from downstairs and removed the persons who were very angry by the time security arrived.

title: super séjour
text: Nous avons passé une semaine à 4 dans cet hôtel. Accueil très amical. Personnel très compétent. Petit déjeuner copieux et salle ouverte à partir de 6h30. Les chambres sont très propres. Proche de Times Square et des salles de spectacle.

title: Lovely stay
text:
The staff friendly and helpful always say good morning
Check in was easy, fast and efficient
Our rooms were fine, beds comfortable and the shower was hot.
Breakfast was fab..lots of choice. One morning there was a huge queue we didn't have the time to wait but the other mornings were fine.
Would definitely return to this hotel.
Whitney on reception was helpful and friendly.

title: The only positive thing is the position
text:
The position is good, walking distance to the Empire State Building and Times Square and walking distance to the metro station, this is the only positive thing of this hotel.
The hotel is old, with no lobbyy, the breakfast area is small and you have to queue for 20-30 minutes every morning, then when you get a table the staff is pushing you to make it quick so that to have the table for someone else.
The female staff at the reception is rude and inpolite. The first room we got (2203) had a terrible umid smell, in fact part of the carpet was wet. We went to the reception to havethe room changed and they aked us to wait for someone to check the room. Nobody came for 2 hrs, then of course we left to visit the city!! When we came back we had a second room (303) which was even worst: the air conditioning was not working, the carpet was badly smelling and it was located at the same level of the bus paltforms so you can image how noise it was. The impression is that the hotel just gave us  one of the room they never use.... We decide to keep it but the quality of the sleep was very bad (noise and  warm....)I would not recommend to stay in this hotel. There is a number of hotels nearby which seemed to be more attractive...

title: Excellent Location
text:
Actual Date of Stay: January 2018 but it was no longer on the drop down date selections. 

Our family (3 adults and 2 kids) stayed in this hotel overnight. We booked 2 rooms and had a comfortable stay. Excellent location, close to Time Square. They served deluxe continental breakfast and all day Starbucks coffee which was a great addition. The concierge was very gracious  and helped us book a city tour. Also, the front desk staff were very friendly. They offered evening snacks to our 2 kids. It was a sweet gesture especially after an  exhausting but fun day. Will highly recommend.

title: A step up from some other Fairfield Inns
text:
We are Marriott loyalty customers. We've stayed at Fairfield Inns across the country and know what to expect. Our king room was standard. The bed, as almost always, was very comfortable. We had a very large flatscreen TV. The bathroom was quite tight, but there was plenty of hot water, strong water pressure, and some storage space under the sink for toiletries.

We noted two things that we thought were better than normal.
(1)  The breakfast room was always very busy, but staff tried to help people find seats rather than let us wander. The food was kept well stocked and refreshed. They had five or six thermoses of coffee, which were continually checked and refilled. Unbelievably, there was a constant supply of fresh, properly ripe bananas! These are usually cleaned out be early risers at other hotels and never replaced. That alone shows special effort and consideration.

Also, tables were cleaned up rapidly so that newcomers could find seats. There was plenty of staff to keep that area running smoothly and efficiently and they were cheerful and polite. 

(2) On our first night, a Sunday, at 9:30 p.m., we were unable to turn on the TV with the remote. We called the desk, expecting to be told that someone would look at it tomorrow. No--a pleasant maintenance man was at our door in five minutes! (Hardly time enough for me to get dressed!) Turned out that the little coffee maker had gotten pushed in front of the sensor button on the front of the TV that picked up the signal from the remote. Problem solved easily, but we wouldn't have figured it out ourselves. Kudos to the Fairfield for having helpful maintenance people on a Sunday night!

The location, as others note, is close to the action but on a cross street, so out of the mob scene. However, that block is a little seedy, as it abuts the back side of the Port Authority bus terminal. That said, we didn't feel unsafe; indeed there are several other budget hotels owned by major chains in the same block, so there are plenty of tourists around.

title: Very professional
text:
Very nice hotel with very friendly staff at desk. Room are small but like everywhere in NYC. Amenities in bathroom can be better. 
Breakfast is very diverse and good but be prepared : there is a queue . Room too small for the number of people but the staff there organized it very well

title: Very good option
text: Enjoyed our stay! Great location near the theaters and Time Square. Rooms are small which is expected in NYC, but clean, nice decor, comfortable beds. Large shower was nice also. Free breakfast buffet was nice, included hot items.

title: Perfect
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights. Brilliant location, Times Square and the theatre district on your doorstep. Subway entrance couple of minutes walk. Not as noisy as I thought it would be, after all this is NY. Room was cleaned daily and reception staff couldn't have been more helpful and polite. I thought the breakfast was good with a reasonable choice. It does get busy though and there were queues at peak periods. If you're in a hurry you can get breakfast to go.
My only slight criticism is the room was a little dated and is in need of modernisation. But the bed was huge and comfy. Fast Internet as well.

title: Nice hotel close to the Theatre District
text:
Stayed here a night to visit the theatre district nearby (45th street).  The location is great but note that this block of 40th street has some interesting street characters on the sidewalks (definitely at night and seems like during the day also). We didn't have any problems walking around and there are several hotels right next to each other. 

This is across from the bus terminal. There's a Dean & Deluca on the corner and many other restaurants and bars close by.  We stayed in a Penthouse room that was very roomy and has a sliding door separating the living room from the bedroom.

title: Great Stay, AMAZING Staff!!!
text: I’m super impressed with the staff here at this location! Eric, Claudia & Nancy went above and beyond to make our stay amazing! Everything from check in/check out, valet and concierge services were prompt and pleasant! Thank you for an amazing experience! Will definitely stay here again!

title: Comfortable room and very central
text: We had no problems getting around NYC while being in this hotel, everything is closeby, or the subway is a very short walk across the street to get to all the Burroughs of the city.  Location is perfect, and the room was clean, modern and quite comfortable.   Would stay again.

title: Great stay!
text: We stayed here last weekend and really enjoyed our stay. The desk staff was very hospitable...they even gave me a room upgrade when they found out it was my birthday. The breakfast was great (REAL FOOD!). Room was clean and the location was perfect. We were able to walk almost everywhere. Bus transit station was right next door, subway at end of the street, and yummy restaurants within a few blocks. Highly recommend this location!

title: Horrible Customer Service
text: I reserved a room here to check in 4/4/2019 for my daughters 13th birthday (She wanted to visit the Statue of Liberty, explore Times Square, and the 9/11 museum. Well, myself and my daughter arrived to the hotel safe and sound after a nice plane ride from Atlanta. Unfortunately, I lost my Drivers License after I’d taken it out in the airport to check in for our flight, I get to this location and speak to with Ozlem at the front desk. Well, I explained to her that my ID was lost at the airport she asked if I had a picture ID and I informed her that I did on my phone (a picture of my ID and Passport) she said okay. She then proceeded to check me in but then stopped and went to the back and then came back out and said that she couldn’t check me in without a valid picture ID. I asked for a manager and she went to the back and a African American plus size woman came and did not introduce herself and said that they needed a hard copy of a “picture ID”. So, I happened to have my work ID that had my name and a picture of myself as well as the copy on my phone of my Drivers License and Passport. The “manager” told me that she had to check with another “co-worker” to see if she can allow it. Obviously she was not the manager. They had me waiting for about 45 minutes after going up to the desk twice before they told me that they would not allow me to check in. My daughters birthday did not start off well because we were in New York (our first time) with no where to lay our heads.

title: À tester si vous hésitez ! Hôtel correct
text: Chambre très agréable et propre ainsi que la salle de bain. Je remercie vivement notre dame de chambre ( 1208 ) . Petit déjeuner correct, un peu de féculents auraient été bien venus ainsi que du Bécon. ! Situation géographique pratique à côté de divers restaurants et des bus et métros. Accueil chaleureux, bureau d’aide pour les excursions ( parlant français selon la personne) . Revenir chez vous pourquoi pas !

title: Nyc holiday
text: Family visit to nyc ..with 2 kids ..Hotel was amazing, comfy beds , good service , friendly staff , and yummy breakfast..enjoyed out stay specially the location was just few minutes to Times Square..for sure i will book again and repeat this lovely experience

title: Great location,  ok overall
text: We reserved here for our first ever trip to NYC, the hotel is centrally located on 8th and 40th street. It's a few blocks walking distance to the theater district, times square and other tourist locations in Midtown. The subway is at end of the block from the hotel and Penn station is six blocks away. The property is a typical Fairfield Hotel, nicely decorated and clean. The front desk staff and the concierge were friendly, responsive and gave us lot's of information about where to go and are good at responding to requests. The hotel includes breakfast and that is a huge plus since a typical breakfast at Midtown will run you about $12-$20 per person. The staff at the dining area keep the place well stocked and clean at all times. Very friendly as well. Our only negative was that housekeeping was subpar and in my opinion did not do a good job of cleaning the room at the normal standard for this type of hotel. We had a couple of days when we found the room had beds made and towel added, yet no trash was removed and the housekeeper did not vacuum the carpet or clean the bathroom floor. They also are a bit stingy with toiletries and for a family of four we only had one small shampoo bottle every night and had to call the front desk every night to get more. If this is a hotel policy it would be nice if they would let us know that way we would have bought our own shampoo. The room itself is smaller than the pictures represent, it would be perfect for one or two people yet it was a little cramped for a family of four. I've stayed in Fairfield Hotels before in California and for the price they charge I will probably try a different Hotel chain next time I travel.

title: Impossible to get to by cab... far from Times Square
text: Stayed here Thurs-Sun. Cab drivers wouldn't drop us off in front of the hotel due to Lincoln tunnel traffic. Had to walk in the rain :( This hotel is a good 10 minute walk from TImes Square it is not in the action rather down the street from a parole office. I saved a bundle by staying here but after paying for cabs everywhere...I think I came out even.  Rooms are rather small and the hallways are very dark.

title: Good Value, Great Location
text: We stayed here in March for the Big East basketball tournament.  Just a short .5 mile walk to MSG, and an even shorter walk to Times Square.  Subway location right on the corner, just a hundred yards or so from the front door of the hotel.  Location is great, breakfast is good, staff is very helpful and friendly.  Rooms are small like most every room in Manhattan, but clean and comfortable, so I think it overall it's a good value.

title: Familieferie
text: Dejligt hotel, der ligger i gå afstand til Madison Square Garden, Empire State building, BH foto (New Yorks største foto butik - ligger for enden af gaden) lige over for hotellet, var man i gang med at istandsætte det gamle postkontor til et indkøbscenter, som ligger oven på Penn station. Hotel opholdet var incl morgenmad, hvor der var vaffelmaskine, brød, juice, kaffe osv. På toppen af hotellet var der en roof bar (åbent i godt vejr)

title: Kätevä sijainti
text: Hotelli on ihan ok perushotelli. Ystävällinen henkilökunta. Aamupalaa tarjolla. Sijainti on loistava bussiaseman vieressä, kävelymatkan päässä Times Squarelta. Ylimpiin kerroksiin kadun äänet eivät häiritse.

title: FAIRFIELD IN ET SUITES
text:
nous avons passé 4nuits dans cet hôtel très bien situé puisque proche du MADISON SQUARE GARDEN , de la poste et de l'empire State building, vous êtes au centre de MANHATTAN, les chambres sont spacieuses  avec clim un peu bruyante et dégageant de l'air froid le matin ?propre , literie très bonne , réassort de produits de toilette tous les jours, cafetière et café ou thé , le petit-déjeuner est copieux  avec du salé, sucré avec appareil à gaufres, fruits frais tous les matin.
vous trouverez à disposition dans le hall de l'hôtel du café et de l'eau chaude pour vous faire un thé
bref très bon séjour que je recommande pour sa situation géographique mais aussi ses prestations

title: Fairfield
text:
Situado junto a port autorithy es perfecto  para ir al aeropuerto en bus o metro..
Muy cerca de Times square, con varias estaciones de metro en los alrededores.
El personal fue muy amable.
Las habitaciones no son muy grandes pero suficientes..las camas son grandes..
El desayuno tiene varias opciones, es Buffett  pero continental. Suele haber cola pero considero que es normal.en este tipo de hoteles en midtown, Manhattan. Y va rapido. 
Sin duda me volveria  hospedar.

title: Best experience EVER
text:
We were a family of 11 of all ages from babies to olders.
I personally travel all year long due to work and this was one of the best experience ever I had and our family had.

It was nothing else but perfect. The staff is so considering and sooo nice.

Thank you again for everything the team was beyond expectations on all points.

2nd time in NYC. All the others will be there for us.

All the best to the team.

title: Pleasant Surprise
text:
Of this class of midtown motels I found the rooms to be very nice. All rooms in this part of town, at this price are not large but this was good, laid out well and nicely furnished.

Breakfast was stand free breakfast trough, but not horrible like some. 

Traffic around this area is crazy so make sure to walk up to the next block if you are going in any direction besides the direction of the one way street is pointed.

title: Nice for business trip
text: I had to schedule a quick trip to NY for business.  It was my first time to the city and we figured Time Square would be the best location.  This hotel is in a very convenient location, and close to main attractions.  The bed was comfy and the room was very clean.  I had a king size room and it was perfect for me being alone.  I do not recommend this hotel for families as the room could be considered as being pretty small.  When you exit the elevator, you see immediately see a wall and you enter into a pretty tiny hallway to your room.  Breakfast was free and convenient...but not the best.  There are plenty of options- eggs, sausage, fruit, yogurts, bagels, oatmeal...and Starbucks teas and coffees.  All in all, it was a pretty nice stay and I would stay here again on business.

title: Okay for some, but not others.
text:
We stayed at the Fairfield during Presidents' Day weekend. It was my husband, me, and our eight year old daughter. We are Starwood/Marriott Rewards members and we've stayed at multiple Starwood/Marriott properties in various cities, states, and Caribbean islands. We used our points to book this hotel. Anyway, I'll start with the good first: The hotel is close to Times Square and two subway stops: Times Square and the 42nd St./Port Authority Bus Station. I'd say it's probably a 5-10 minute walk to Times Square. The hotel is clean, and our room was always cleaned when we came back. Our room was also very quiet. We were on the 12th floor (near the elevator, actually) and weren't bothered by any noise. There is also free breakfast, which is one of the reasons why I booked this hotel.

And now for the not-so-good. The OPs are correct when they say the rooms are small. I'm glad I followed their advice and had my family go with carry-ons, which I could store under the desk in the room. If we had all checked bigger suitcases, we would have been even more jammed in that room than we already were. There literally wouldn't have been room for them. The bathroom is also quite tiny. There really isn't anywhere to put things like a hair dryer or curling iron. The three of us were dodging and crawling over each other in that room. Even the hallways are narrow!

The hotel does offer free breakfast, which I thought was great since we usually don't like to spend much time on eating or searching for a place to eat breakfast. We'd rather eat something quick and get on our way. The breakfast place is small and you may have to wait for a table. It can also be quite crowded with people who aren't watching where they're going and bumping into you. Also, don't expect much as far as the quality of food. There are inexpensive places within walking distance of the hotel where you can go, so I wouldn't book a hotel near Times Square just because it offers free breakfast. We ended up going somewhere else for breakfast after our experience.

To conclude, if you just need a simple place to sleep and it's just you and maybe one other person, go for it. But if you're coming with your family, I'd probably pick somewhere else, unless you want to be crammed into a tiny room together.

title: Hotel muito bom!! Adoramos!
text: O hotel é EXCELENTE, muito bem localizado, fizemos grande parte das atrações a pé,muitos restaurantes no entorno, o metrô é na esquina e fica a 5 minutos da Times Square. O hotel oferece café da manhã incluso na diária e é muito bom, o quarto foi excelente para minha família (2 adultos e 1 adolescente), o serviço de quarto vem todos os dias e nos oferece amenities da Paul Mitchel, 2 garrafas de água e café Starbucks. Queremos agradecer a atenção do Sr. Anthony por nos orientar e ajudar em nossa estadia. Recomendo muito e voltaríamos com certeza!

title: Great location and comfortable hotel
text:
I took my 13 year-old daughter to NYC for a long weekend. It was our first time in the city and I had no idea where to stay. I wanted a place close to Times Square and the Theater District, so this fit the bill nicely.

After arriving very early in the morning, we dropped by the hotel with the intent of just dropping off our luggage, realizing it was unlikely a room would be ready. To my hapy surprise, we were immediately given a room. That was such a welcome relief after a sleepless red-eye flight. I was so grateful for this unexpected gift. 

Our room was small but I expected as much (I mean, it's Manhattan!). The beds were so comfortable and the was room was clean. I was worried about noise as we were right across from elevators and then had the Port Authority across the street but I was pleasantly surprised again - yes, there was some noise but nothing crazy and it was infrequent, usually trucks outside in the early am and once there was an ambulance racing down the street at 5am. No big deal. 

The breakfast is fine. There's plenty of eggs, breads and bagels to toast, some sort of meat protein like turkey and pork bacon, oatmeal, yogurt, fruit. It was helpful and got us off to a good start. My only complaint there was that the breakfast room was so hot, likely due to the constantly running toasters. 

The staff here was very friendly and we were always greeted with friendly smiles and hellos. The concierge was helpful and gave good advice. There are plenty of taxis outside, it's close to multiple subway stations, and easy for Ubers to pick you up. The location is great and I felt completely safe at all times of the day. 

I will definitely return the next time I'm in town!

title: Lies Kept Me in a Moldy Room
text:
Upon check-in, we were surprised by the front desk agent when she offered to give us an additional 1000 points for revisiting again. We thanked the agent numerous times, and it started us off to a great start. Even though our room had a moldly smell, we bore through it for the night. However, its been over a week now and we never received the promised points.

My wife called today to have a friendly chat to follow up about what the front desk agent had said when we checked in. What was supposed to be a nice follow up conversation quickly turned negative. The agent on the phone today could care less, with the conversation accusatory and terse. She stated there were no notes mentioning such a thing, and that it was our job to seek out and contact the specific front desk agent from our check-in about it. We felt awful to be treated as liars or thieves.

It really made the experience sour and we feel awful from the mistreatment of both the front desk agent (who toyed with our emotions) and the agent over the phone. We stay in a lot of hotels, and 1000 points is nothing. It's not worth fighting over. All we did was simply follow up on what was promised to us when we checked in, only to be treated in a hostile manner. I would not recommend this hotel and the unprofessional staff present here. It's your job to follow up with your staff. I don't know if this is a single instance, or if staff are trained to lie about points to guests to reduce the complaints during a stay. It worked though, because the kind gesture caused us to keep our mouths shut and remain in a moldly room. If this is not a technique of Fairfield Times Square, then I suggest you look into it and the staff who stated it to us on our stay, and the staff we spoke to over the phone.

title: A quick over night for the Bruins game
text:
Greta hotel with friendly and courteous staff. Valet service was great! (no issue with a pickup truck)...
Room was great (small but normal for NY city) bed was very comfortable / room was spotless / everything looked newer (or recently renovated) 10 min walk to MSG... and plenty to do within walking distance of this hotel!!

title: Great Hotel
text: Stayed at the Fairfield Inn for an overnight girls trip. The staff at check-in was great! They were very friendly and helpful. The elevators got very crowded and slow during peak times but other than that they were fine. Would definitely stay again.

title: Excellent !!!!!!!
text:
Très bon hôtel à côté de Times Square, dans rue calme, roof top chauffé , super petit déjeuner dans une petite salle un peu trop petite mais c est New York !!!
Un grand merci au personnel surtout au petit-déjeuner très gentille et toujours avec le sourire 😊 
Gare du terminal bus juste en face très pratique pour aller à Woodbury

title: Lovely hotel, great location
text: Stayed 3 nights for a long weekend, walking distance from most things in midtown Manhattan eg Times Square, Empire State, Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Station and Madison Square Garden. Didn’t attempt subway but there was a station right near. Staff all lovely and let us store our cases after check out as check out was 12 midday and our flight wasn’t until 8pm. Lovely clean rooms, we were only floor 6 so didn’t apply to us but there were 32 floors so can imagine nice views up there. Breakfast was served til 11am(I think) really nice selection of hot and cold foods. Had a coffee maker in our room with Starbucks cups and sachets. Really nice bathroom too.

title: Great Location
text: this beautiful hotel is situated in great location, walking distance to Times Square, Broadway, Fashion District and across the street from the Port Authority Bus Station. Friendly staff, clean rooms, full breakfast.

title: Very clean, wonderful staff, will stay here again!
text:
This hotel was wonderful. The lobby is beautiful, our check in process was quick, easy and everyone was so kind and helpful. Our room was clean, spacious, comfortable, and exactly what we needed. The free water and little extra touches were really great. The free breakfast had a lot of options and a great seating area. 
Before our stay we received an email from the staff asking if there was anything they could do to make our stay better. We requested early check-in and a room with 2 beds for the same price as the King that we had booked. They said they would do their best to meet our requests. When we arrived everything was perfect and we were given a gorgeous room with 2 beds! 
I worked for a hotel in NH for many years and found this one to be top notch. All my expectations were exceeded. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to NYC!

title: Good value near Times Square
text: If you’re looking for a reasonably priced hotel within a short walk of Times Square, this Fairfield Inn is a solid choice. The hotel is an easy walk from Broadway and Times Square. Located opposite the Port Authority Terminal, the street is a little on the gritty side, but not too bad. The hotel was nice, clean and fairly modern. The elevators ran frequently and the waits never seemed too long. Typical small floor plan and narrow hallways for this part of town. The room itself was a little on the small side, but still manageable. We weren’t planning to spend a lot of time during our trip in the hotel room, so it was fully adequate for our needs. Hotel staff was friendly. I would stay here again.

title: Fabulous hotel!!
text: This hotel was fabulous from start to finish! The staff were friendly, welcoming & helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The hotel itself was spotlessly clean, the rooms were very comfortable & we had a brilliant view looking over towards Times Square from our room on the 22nd floor. We couldn’t have been better located, right in the middle of everything with a subway at the end of the street which was easy to navigate. The breakfast provided was a great start to our day & we always found something we liked. I’d highly recommend this hotel to stay at if you’re visiting New York, fabulous place & great value for money!!

title: Tiny rooms
text: My wife and I stayed at the Fairfield Inn and were very disappointed. It was supposed to be a 3.5 star hotel but was more like a 2 star. The room was so tiny that there was not room to even put my toiletry bag on a self or counter. The halls are extremely narrow with piles a towels in the way. In the event of a fire this is dangerous. The walls are thin and you can easily hear people in nearby rooms talking and slamming doors. The valet cost $65. The complimentary breakfast was perhaps the best I experience with the breakfast included. As a Marriott Rewards member I expect better and cannot recommend this property

title: A gem on its own
text:
Great location. Nearest station is 42 St/Port Authority Terminal just across the road    
Easy transfer from JFK station via Jamaica Station. 

A block away from Time Square and near to many dining options. We walk to Pier 84 and Intrepid Museum, the High Line Park and Chelsea Market.
