Appreciate that breakfast is covered in the room charge. If it’s too crowded, no problem to pack and go. Water, coffee and tea throughout the day till 8pm. After that, they are happy to fill my vacuum flask with hot water in the late night 2x during my 5 nights stay. 

Bed is comfortable and housekeeping is responsive and clean. Free bottled water is a small gesture but many American hotels don’t understand it. Glad that the hotel mgmt understands! 

Thanks for making us feel so welcome. We will be back the next time we are back in NYC!

title: one night comfortable quick stay
text: next to port authority bus terminal and metro line A,C,E 42 street/times square station. Newly building with quiet air-conditioner. Breakfast buffet is OK, not various but enough according to North America standard. Walk 5-10 minutes to times square.

title: I would gladly stay there again
text:
This was my second trip to the US and my first experience with the hospitality sector was bad. Not this time. The hotel stuff was very helpfull and friendly from the moment we arrived. That's always a plus and it creates positive mood towards the hotel.

The location is perfect: only two blocks away from Times Square where there is a metro station where many lines meet. An entrance to this metro is also at the corner of the hotel block. It is very convenient to reach any point of interest.

Before booking a hotel room I had read terrible reviews for what is available in New York in my price range, so I was very relieved because the room size was decent and comfortable, the room clean, and there was free wi-fi (very important if you want to plan your daily excursions). There is a big flat TV in the room, which I did not use so I have no idea about the channel selection. The room was warm enough and there was a thermostat which you could adjust. Amenities included one set of shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, face soap bar and body soap bar. The bathroom had a shower. I was on the 16th floor and there was no outside noise.

The highlight of the hotel was the breakfast, which was plentiful. The hotel serves hot breakfast which includes scrambled eggs and/or omelette, sausages and/or bacon, and fries. There is also a selecion of bagels and bread which you can toast, cake, pastries, fruits, cereals, yogurt, boiled eggs and various beverages. In a city as expensive as New York this breakfast kept me full until the afternoon, when all monuments and museums closed and I was ready for dinner.

Every Tuesday they hold a small reception at the always full lobby and they serve wine and a selection of cheese and meat to whoever guest happens to pass through. There is always water available in the lobby.

The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because the heating system was noisy. I got used to it, however, and I did not care. There is not much of a view (just buildings to look at), but that is not at the top of my priorities anyway. The lobby is rather small. Finally, I was unable to completely switch off all lights in my room, but maybe that was my fault. That's pretty much all the negative stuff about this hotel and they barely register as an incovenience. 

Definitely a must choice!

title: Great hotel and location
text: Stayed here for six nights and was very pleased with the hotel. Really close to loads of attractions, Times Square and theatres. Restaurant’s a plenty very close by as well. The room was perfect bed very comfortable and clean. Breakfast was all you could eat buffet with plenty to select from. If we go to New York again will definitely look to stay here.

title: Zimmer etwas zu klein
text: Wir haben die Weihnachtsfeiertage in NYC verbracht. Das Hotel liegt in Manhatten unmittelbar am Central Park. Die Lage ist super man kann eigentlich alles zu Fuß 🦶🏻 erreichen. Für die bequemere Variante liegt die Sub „Columbus Circle“ direkt an der Ecke vom CP, ungefähr 15 Gehminuten entfernt vom Hotel entfernt. Der Service im Hotel war super 👍🏻, vor allem die Leute beim Frühstücksbüffet immer gut gelaunt, trotz des zeitweise doch hohen Durchlauf an Gästen. Einzig die Zimmer sind echt winzig - was eigentlich keine Rolle spielt, da man die meiste Zeit unterwegs ist. Wenn man jedoch länger in den USA bleibt und mehrere Koffer hat, dann wird’s sportlich und man stellt sich gezwungener Maßen den Ausgang zu 🤭.

title: Decepción
text:
El hotel está bien situado para poder ir andando a todas las atracciones turísticas en general las habitaciones son normales y están bien por el precio dado que Nueva York es muy caro tampoco se puede pedir mucho más.
Dado que Nueva York es un sitio principalmente para ir de compras hice unas cuantas compré 8 colonias las cuales revise que estaban antes de salir de mi apartamento y mi sorpresa fue cuando al volver después de la limpieza me faltaba una y una crema. Lo transmito al personal del hotel quiénes se han lavado las manos y no me han escuchado en ningún momento y tampoco me han dado ninguna solución me ha parecido vergonzoso el trato de ciertas personas del establecimiento ya que se les debería caer la cara de vergüenza he tenido que estar los 5 días restantes de mi estancia preguntando en recepción dónde estaban mis pertenencias y se han lavado las manos lo único que han hecho ha sido reírse en mi cara. Esto fue el segundo día de mi estancia y pedí que no hicieran más la habitación hasta mi salida.
Transmitiré lo ocurrido a su central Marriott ya que en mi vida me ha pasado esto en un hotel

title: Great jumping off spot for your time in NYC
text: This hotel has a great location in NYC, near Times Square.  The subway entrance for 42nd St Port Authority is on this street, and that makes it an easy jumping off spot to get to anywhere in the city.  The rooms are small, but the windows are great at keeping the city noise out.  The breakfast area was being renovated while we were there, so we only ate once in the new area, which was an improvement over the Roof top restaurant.  The hotel accommodated my early arrival too.  Don't worry about security - the elevator operates only by room card, so no one off the street can access your room.  Rooms were clean and the beds were nice and firm.  Definitely a great stay!

title: I love this place!
text: I know that people say that the rooms are small and they are, but this is NYC and steps from Time Square.  We stayed on points New Years Eve and I found the staff to be very helpful and kind, even emailing back and forth the night before our arrival to answer last minute questions.  Special shout out to Ozlem Isik - so helpful!  I was given an early check in on New Years Eve and a late checkout the following day.  I was there on points and was treated like a valued customer from check in to check out.  I know that people complained about the breakfast as well but, again, it is NYC and it is free!  I would like to have seen a bit more fruit but I marvel at the amount of food that goes through that room.  The people working in that area are efficient and as a family of 4, a free breakfast is a good start to the day.  There is yogurt and fruit as well as the usual carbs.  The location is great, we walk to everything when we stay here - Times Square, Broadway, Radio City Music Hall, even Central Park when the weather is good.  We have stayed before and will stay again - this is our go to hotel when we are in NYC!

title: Plein centre mais calme!!!
text:
En plein centre de Manhattan certes mais calme grâce à une bonne insonorisation même au 2è étage coté immeuble sans vue .  Très bonne literie, on dort bien , même si le lit queen size est un peu étroit pour 2.Douche sdb avec bonne pression,clim chauffage réglable et arrêtable si besoin, salle de petit dej sympa, un peu petite, d'ou la queue parfois mais jamais plus de 15 mn, et il y a de quoi à manger en quantité et qualité suffisante pour bien démarrer votre journée.
Pizzeria  pas chère au début de la rue, metro à 5mn, timesquare à pied, vraiment idéalement situé.

Seul gros bémol au check out : ma facture était fausse de plusieurs dizaines d'euros , car ils m'ont facturé un parking voiture pour plusieurs jours alors que nous n'en avions pas , donc vérifiez bien, j'ai été remboursé, ou plutôt pas facturé, mais étonnant tout de même.

title: Good hotel!
text:
Staying here Jan 1-4. Good hotel, good location, clean rooms, on a smaller side. Good breakfast. Staff is generally nice but some are sub-par, so one star removed for that. Examples:
- upon check in asked where we can park the car. Beyond being offered a vallet (which we at the end used), the lady receptionist’s answer was “I do not know a block or two this way”
- we had 4 people in a room. Asked for 4 card keys, was told I can get 2 max. Did not feel like arguing with the front desk lady
- just tried to get tea at the coffee/tea area next to business center. No tea bags were there, so asked the Chinese gentleman in hotel uniform who was standing there. He clearly did not care. Asked him again that there is usually a stand with tea boxes and he said they were not available. Clearly not acceptable answer, but did not feel like arguing

title: New years trip
text: Great stay yet again. Feet from times square, Penn station and Macys. Great staff. Great service. Upgraded to penthouse for celebration. Breakfast included. Will be back soon! As we always come by to new York annually

title: Great Value for money: Location, Breakfast
text: We just spent a week at the hotel.  The location is very convenient for the subway.  The breakfast is fine and the staff are all helpful.  The room is smaller in size but it's NYC so that's standard.  I would recommend.  If you stay, one block away is the pizza place- kiss my slice- great for a slice to take back to hotel.

title: Great stay
text: From the initial greeting upon arrival to the breakfast staff we were treated like VIP guests. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. Within walking distance of Times Square and other NYC "must do's" .  Would definitely stay again.

title: Perfect for us
text:
Let me start by saying that I booked this hotel having read reviews on TripAdvisor which pointed out some of the issues (eg poor breakfast was commented on in a few reviews) but the hotel still met my expectations, hence rated 4/5

Positives
- location superb, 5 min walk to time square station on 42nd which is a good metro hub to travel across Manhattan
- excellent value, £110/night on average for our 6 night stay (3 adults)
- decent view from rooms
- rooftop bar
- genuinely free breakfast albeit it is basic/ not fresh
- nice touch of providing free hot chocolate in lobby one of the days
Addressing some of the issues others raised
- I knew the breakfast was basic but was happy with it...its free!
- I had no issues with lift waiting time 
- i thought the room was reasonable size but we only had 1 large and 2 small suitcases 

Only slight criticism would be that the reception staff and concierge ladies were ok but not the most engaging or the type who made me feel like they were totally at guests service. It was more like 'here's your room key, off you go'. I've stayed in many places with warmer reception staff. That said, the man operating the lift and some of the ladies at breakfast had a great attitude. I asked the reception if I could get a room with a view or upgrade and was told 'no upgrades available'. The guy behind me in the queue to checkin seemed to know the lady at reception and I overheard him ask the same upgrade question and the receptionist gave him one. Just felt a bit rude as I was still stood within earshot

Overall excellent stay and a good 3* value option in a fantastic location

title: A Good Location Hotel
text:
As a minimum living space is no longer a secret in NYC, this hotel also not spacious even though it was not too tight as well, compared to hotels in Asia in general.

Starting from the lobby area, it was pretty spacious, with a waiting area next to the main entrance. There were 3 elevators serves all the guests just right in front of the main gate. As for the room itself, the room service was not bad, they cleaned the room pretty well, and never forget to provide the new towels and refill the amenities as well as the complimentary water and coffee. Oh, they provide a safe deposit box inside the wardrobe too.

Talking about the breakfast, they had a pretty good breakfast selection. Waffle, pancake, various eggs, huge coffee station, completed with plenty of TVs around the dining area. Some fruits and juices were also available, as well as children meal such cereal.

Other good service from this place was they have a luggage room for the guests also a wifi service.

title: Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel la scorsa settimana con mia figlia, camera 2204 al 22esimo piano. La camera era piuttosto spaziosa per gli standard di Midtown, con una vista splendida. Letto comodissimo (king size) e pulizia notevole. Mi è piaciuta molto la colazione , ricca e varia, e non ho riscontrato tutti i problemi rilevati da altri circa i tempi di attesa per l’ascensore o la sala colazione. Personale gentilissimo, che ha sorpreso me e mia figlia per il
Suo compleanno con dolcetti e palloncini. Wi-Fi funzionante. Piccole accortezze come bottigliette d’acqua in camera tutti i giorni e caffè disponibile. La zona di sera non è il massimo perché pur essendo vicinissima a Times Square la presenza del bus terminal la rende frequentata anche da qualche homeless e gente poco raccomandabile. La fermata metro blu è vicinissima, per la rossa e la gialla dovete arrivare a Times square. Non do le cinque stelle perché per tutta la nostra permanenza la tv non ha funzionato e perché i tempi per la restituzione della caparra bloccata sulla mia carta di credito sono un po’ troppo lunghi (due settimane dalla partenza, mi hanno detto). Per il resto soggiorno ottimo. Spero di tornare presto.

title: Tiny But Adequate Rooms - Good Value
text: We arrived here on a Saturday night, which was a bit startling.  There is a rooftop club on top of the hotel so one elevator, the common room, etc. is all roped off where lots of folks are lined up to go clubbing.  My teenage sons were quite amused.  The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Our room was SO TINY -- two double beds crammed in with an armoire/desk/dresser combo.   No closet.  With our suitcases there was literally very little room to move.  The rooms were clean and updated.  Breakfast was adequate.  We would stay here again only because the price was right.

title: Everything you need for convenience and comfort in midtown
text:
Over the years, I have stayed at many Marriott properties in the city, and this one stands out as a very good choice for access to midtown and many transportation options. 

Location 
Central to midtown, on 40th between 8th and 9th, the street is not too busy. Across the street is Port Authority, so you have access to many trains including the A/C/E, the N/Q/R/W, 1/2/3, the Shuttle to Grand Central as well as buses should you need to go upstate or somewhere further. If you need to work on the west side, you are not too far and there is access to the east side. There are plenty of food locations on 9th ave, as well. 

Room 
Small but has most of what you need, and have been updated to a modern look and feel with grey/silver tones and white bedding. Bathroom is large enough, and has a tub which is great for manhattan. Coffee maker, ice maker and iron are provided, although it would be nice to have a mini fridge if you are in the city for an extended time to tourist as oppose for business.   All in all decent size. 

Check-in/Staff
Checkin was extremely quick and easy, and did not have to wait for a room.  As a platinum member, i was provided with extra bonus points, water and a high floor room. Lobby is renovated to be very sleek, clean and modern with a silver and grey decor that is very nice. 

Other Amenites 
Free breakfast is provided and it’s decent for the price. Better than paying high prices elsewhere in the city. Rooftop is great and nice to relax at the end of the day with a cocktail.  A hidden little place away from the chaos of the city. 

Overall
This is a great value for your money. No frills but comfortable room that you will enjoy.

title: Macy's Parade
text: Very nice, efficient hotel reception.  Everything was fine; despite a maintenance man in our room when we arrived.  He was fixing a leak in the bathroom ceiling.  He was very polite and excused himself letting us know he would come back after we settled in.

title: Very pleased
text: We stayed here for 3 nights for a short break and we were very happy. The breakfast is more than enough to last the day. The rooms are very comfortable a little small for a Marriott but very nice. Staff very helpful and friendly. Would recommend staying here short walk to times square.

title: Hotel muito bom!
text:
Café da manha muito bom. 

A cama era muito confortável e nenhum dia me incomodei com barulho. Fiquei no andar 25°

Serviço de quarto veio todos os dias e muito bom.

Hotel bonito e bem localizado. Próximo de metro e em frente a uma estação rodoviária.

O quarto tem um tamanho muito bom para as malas

Realmente como algumas pessoas comentaram a noite tem alguns moradores de rua mas não me senti ameaçada em nenhum momento. 
Se você chega de carro não vai nem ve-los, eles ficam mais no inicio da rua.
Só verá se passar a pé, a maioria dos dias eu passava por ali no máximo ate 22h e foi bem tranquilo. Somente uma dia passei por lá entre as 00h30 quase 1h00 e dai deu medinho kkk

A localização é muito boa. Funcionários atenciosos. 

Foi uma boa estadia, voltaria lá novamente.

title: Typical Fairfield Served All My Needs
text:
I was in the city for a conference over at the Javitz Convention Center, which is an easy ten-minute walk.  This is as typical big city Fairfield as you'll find.  Located on 40th, just west of 8th, it's about as centrally-located as you'll find.  

The room is Manhattan small, but not too small.  The bed, linens, towels, and overall cleanliness were all spot-on.  The breakfast service and food seemed a bit tired (so tired I just couldn't bring myself to eat their food my second morning).  My second morning I hustled just a half a block east to Dean & Deluca - that did the trick.

The highlight of my stay was the front desk supervisor delivering a nice wine and cheese tray to my room soon after check-in "because I was such a nice guest".  In 65 years, that has never happened before.  Thank you, Fairfield Inn.

title: Outstanding service!
text: I finally took my wife to NYC in December to see the Christmas decorations and the historical sites. We stayed in the Marriott Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Times Square for 3 nights all on points. Not only was the redemption of points very easy using the Marriott App, but the everything about the Inn and the staff was outstanding. I will continue to be a Marriott Points Reward member.

title: Non family friendly
text:
Laying in bed here at midnight listening/feeling the dance music from the rooftop bar. ( we are on the 28th floor ) Breakfast is not great and you will have to line up as the eating area is tiny. I Stay in hotels prob 30 plus nights a year, always ask for feather free. Woke up day one eyes swollen shut. They argued that there was no feathers. Eyes don’t lie. Supervisor came in and 4 of the 8 pillows were feathered and so was one of the two blankets. Spent a lot of money here ! Won’t be back. 
Had a great weekend in NYC in spite of this hotel.

title: Play weekend
text:
We arrived on Thursday around noon, and even though check in wasn't until 4 they found us a room.  Tony and the front desk staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome.  This is a great hotel near Broadway. It also includes a decent breakfast (standard chain hotel food, eggs bagels, meat, cereal, breads and bagels).
It was a great location, just a 7 block walk from Pennsylvania station,  and a couple blocks off time square.

title: Decent room, terrible elevator
text: The room and comforts were fine. Good morning breakfast with great coffee and tea. Good location less than a block from the subway. Overall good experience except for the stupid elevator. It’s usually frustrating to wait longer than a minute, but here I was routinely waiting longer than 5 minutes, and even had to start planning my routine to accommodate this additional headache. Not like I could just hop on the stairs for the 22nd floor. I don’t expect it’s always like this since one of the 3 elevators was out of service, but it was so for the entire week, which caused a line for the elevator in the lobby almost every time I went through the front door.

title: Excellent renovated hotel near Times Square
text: Very nice renovated Fairfield at great rates only a few blocks from Times Square.  Adjacent to the Port Authority bus terminal, only a few blocks from Penn Station and Hells Kitchen right around the corner.  Stayed here for meetings two nights in November 2018.

title: Cramped spaces & loud noise expected for NYC, but not the crappy breakfast
text:
Went for a quick NYC getaway with the husband.  Was not surprised by the cramped quarters and loud street noise, but was NOT expecting the loud noise to include DJ/music from the on-site club filtering into the hotel room until the wee hours of the morning!!!! Plus, the volume and variety of people including the not so savory characters that access the club from the common hotel lobby is disconcerting to say the least!

The front desk staff was accommodating and so were the breakfast staff for as much as they could do, but was NOT expecting the subpar low quality "worse than my middle school lunches" breakfast.  Cold eggs, frozen waffles (not a waffle maker in sight!!), re-heated leathery sausage/bacon, etc...and that is when the food was brought out on time!  Please don't advertise complimentary breakfast if this is all you have to offer!

title: Great Location
text: We stayed here for 6 nights.Our room was comfortable and adequate for our needs. we were on the 14th (of, I think, 36) floors. Breakfast was provided and while the Continental breakfast is very good, the hot breakfast is very average. The property is in a great location. It is not IN Times Square - Times Square, seems to be an area rather than a specific spot - we were about 3 blocks from the actual "Times Square". We were immediately opposite the New Jersey Transit Terminal, from which you an catch most trains on the New York Subway, as well as Busses to New Jersey and beyond. Given the weather was quite cool, the fact that all we had to do was walk across the Street for Transport was a real bonus. There is no courtesy bus to pick you up from one of the Airports. All things considered, Fairfield Inn suited our needs very well and we would definitely stay there again.

title: Great value SUPER location
text:
Stayed 2 nights at this hotel.
Clean and modern hotel with free breakfast. Comfortable bed, nice room but not a large room by any means. Not Asian or European small however!

Super location and we were able to get a room for about $150 cnd including taxes.

Just minutes from Time Square.
Our only complaint was that they did not give us the room type we booked.
Otherwise a very good value.
NOTE: parking is out of this world expensive.
We did not need a car so we parked at a train station for $10 a day and enjoyed a train ride into Grand central!

Total cost about $50 for 3 days parking and round trip train.
That is less than a day parking in NYC.

title: Modern and clean
text:
Rooms were modern and cleaned to a decent standard. Bed was super comfy and bathroom was a good size with nice shower. 

Staff were always welcoming and polite and the entrance to the subway was literally right outside the door which was helpful.

Our booking said it was continental breakfast included but there was quite a wide range of hot and cold foods and drinks. It is a free for all in the mornings though and the size of the breakfast hall is definitely not sufficient for the number of guests at full capacity. Most mornings there were crowds of people with plates of food in their hands and nowhere to sit, also a lot of rude guests who did not know how to queue but this is not a reflection on the hotel itself. Breakfast is served til 9/9:30am but there was some mornings we got there 20 mins before closing and things had run out and were not topped up so I would recommend getting there early.

There’s only 2 lifts in the hotel which is not sufficient but the wait was rarely more than 2-3 minutes. 

I would definitely recommend the hotel as it’s clean, modern and staff are all polite and helpful.

The only disappointment for me was that I emailed Marriott in advance to say it would be my boyfriend’s birthday when we were there and asked if they could do anything with the room. They said they would pass on my request but nothing was done for him.

title: Good location, Walk to almost everything
text:
At first, it was interesting that there are 4 or 5 other hotels connected to this Fairfield but I think we picked the best of the block. The customer service was good, the free breakfast catered to both kids and adults while the room sizes were above average for NYC I’d say and more importantly clean! 

If you’re platinum at Marriott, don’t expect any perks or benefits such as upgrades to be available but keep a cool head as it’s probably the same at many hotels within NYC. We will be back I’m sure!

title: They went the extra mile for me
text: Having stayed in different hotels around NYC, I'm become used to busy lobbies and overworked staff, feeling ignored, and a meh experience. This hotel manager and staff were so completely considerate, they really cared about my experience there and worked to take care of me from the mix up in my reservation checking in, to dealing with me becoming stranded in a snow storm. The manager even offered to walk with me in 6" of snow to help me get my car! Oh yes, the room and hotel was clean and gorgeous. These people really treat the guests like guests.

title: Great location, friendly staff, great experience.
text: Me and my family went to NY for a long weekend we stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. Upon arrival they had iced tea in the lobby as well as a tea and coffee machine and then on another night they had hit chocolate with mini marshmellows which made the experience even better. The staff were unbelievably helpful and nice, especially the bell men - always greeting you on arrival and making sure you always had everything you needed and didn't have any worries. The information desk was great and allowed us to plan out our days to fit everything in we wanted. I would highly recommend this hotel -comfortable rooms and great facilities all spitlessly clean.

title: My best experience in a hotel
text:
It was a rainy day on my birthday. I went to check in extremely early around 9am just to leave my luggage in storage at least and Kendijah and Jess took care of me and for my surprise they had a room available for me and also offered me the breakfast from the hotel. They were very informative about everything. Very friendly and genuinely helpful. I continued my day as planned, the hotel offers complimentary umbrellas which was a plus. When I came back to the hotel in the afternoon, Jess came to my room and brought me a nice card and a cupcake as a nice gesture for my birthday. It actually brightens my day to see how they went the extra mile to make me feel special.

Definitely will come back to this property in NYC with my family.

title: Great Place to Stay and enjoy NY, Manhattan
text:
Decided to stay here after various research work on staying facilities in and around Manhattan. Compared to my earlier stay ,reviews of my friends from various parts of the World I was thoroughly confused. Being a Hilton Member for long even booked and cancelled many nearby hotels. Ultimately with my gut feelings and own way of looking at it I chose this. 
Oh my God what a place it evolved at the end.
Right from the cooperative front desk manager to concierge person to bell boy to restaurant people all were superb and highly efficient. 
We were 3 adults as a family in a great room with good space to cover. 
Morning coffee n tea maker worked nice. Bathroom was a treat. Air-conditioning was great so was the room upkeep. 
Lift was fine too though we stayed in higher floor. Key operations in lift should be proper. 
Breakfast spread were pretty comfortable with good spread and added hospitality.
24 hrs in lobby Tea n Coffee facilities with great variety were great.
There was surprising Managers reception varied every day if you stayed in hotel in the happy hours.
Closest to the bus and train stations were added advantage for the inter city travellers. Manhattan, Broadway were stone throwing and so were the BigBus, Hop on Hop off Greyline stops. 
Within 3 blocks were most Broadway theatres , Eateries all around with great varieties. 
Shopping was very easy and very comfortable. 
Close to most of the attractions. We felt better to go without Hop on Hop off.
Sky top restaurant was a treat too.
This particular review has been tailor made to be more descriptive as multiple negative reviews are spoiling this property.
Please try this property every time as it's budget friendly too compared to its rivals.
Thanks for the patience.

title: Minisemester
text: 4 nätter. Bra pris. Sköna sängar. Bra frukost. Rent. Trevlig personal. Utomordentligt bra läge nära Timesquare. Lite mörkt rum mot en gård och aningen trångt. Härlig rooftop 32 våningen. Synd dock att den inte var öppen varje kväll.

title: Emplacement idéal!
text:
Nous avons séjourné 6 nuits. 
2 adultes + 2 ados
Situé à 50 m du métro
A moins de 10min à pied de tile square, au milieu de bars et de restaurants.
La literie est impeccable.
2 lits dans la même chambre permet de limiter les frais.
Hôtel calme et silencieux.
Petit dej correct. A volonté. Vaut un 3etoiles.
Certes assiettes en cartons et couverts en plastique, mais cela ne nous a pas gêné. Tout est à volonté, sucré comme salé.
The et café à tout heure du jour et de la nuit.
Notre vol était tardif le jour du départ, nous avons pu laissé nos bagages sur place.
Mention spéciale pour le bar roof top ! Mojito avec vu sur la ville by night le Must !
De + le prix est raisonnable compte tenu de la prestation et de l’emplacement ! Cela aide à passer un bon séjour, quite à repasser à l’hôtel dans l’aprem pour la sieste avec les enfants, pratique.

title: FANTASTIC !!!!
text:
Fantastic !!!
The front desk management and staff were so welcoming, they made us feel so at home and comfortable. 
The housekeeping staff spoiled us, with daily freshening and restocking.
The breakfast, great selection and delicious. staff kept it stocked and the food bar clean.
Location...so easy to get anywhere. 
The hotel is clean, fresh, up to date, and stylish.
We loved it.

title: Localização privilegiada
text: Me hospedei nesse hotel e o ponto forte é a localização, pertinho do metrô e de todas as atrações da Times Square. O café da manhã é muito bom para os padrões americanos. Meu quarto não tinha vista bonita, mas era bem tranquilo. Quarto limpo, com cofre, frigobar, só faltou um local para colocar as malas e sacolas. Com certeza é uma ótima opção na cidade. O valor é um pouco salgado, mas paga-se por estar perto de tudo.

title: Great Staff!
text:
We really liked the location near the Times Square area and a block to a subway stop.  We could also walk to the High Line and up to Rockefeller Center and Central Park. 
There were many very good restaurants within walking distance too and of course, all of the Broadway shows.  The staff in the hotel do an excellent job and do it with a friendly smile.  They all have great attitudes and are very helpful.  The rooms are small but we rather expected that in an older building in a large city.  They were kept immaculate during the 3 nights we were there.  We never had a problem with the elevators even though we were on the 26th floor.  The lobby was the only disappointment as it is small/plain to almost non-existent.  Breakfast was the usual but I appreciated that they seated you as tables became available.  It kept the busy breakfast room from becoming chaotic.  Again the staff there were wonderful.  We did go up to the SkyRoom and the views were great.  But the loud music and the entire atmosphere was not for us so we just took a few pictures and left. There were several other nice hotels on this block, but also a few sketchy businesses, trash on the street & a few homeless people.  At the end of the block there is a great take-away for a $1 slice of cheese pizza!

title: Birthday Celebrations
text:
2 days before arrival they put a hold on payment so I was down $1200.. I had booked 5 rooms for family. I booked through booking.com I expected full payment at the hotel, as we were all paying individually.
Sorted all out eventually, the reception staff were very welcoming. My son's room had a busted air conditioner,  when my son went to complain they said they were moving them anyway as they knew about it beforehand .. still charged them full price.
The breakfast was ok .. cheese omelette,  scrambled egg or cold boiled egg. The usual breads, cakes and waffles a sausage that looked like hamburgers, the bacon... which was very very well done.
As much Starbucks coffee as you can drink.
Water in the rooms also. We could also take some breakfast to the room when our daughter wanted a longer sleep.
The area around the hotel was dirty ... lots of rubbish waiting to be lifted, although on the Friday it was cleaned. There was a parol office a couple of buildings down, a few homeless and shady character's but it was safe enough. Never made it to the sky room as we had 2 under 21s with us and they wouldn't let us up just to have a peak.
All in all a good enough hotel with friendly staff, but I wouldn't stay in this location again as it was extremely busy....

title: Great location if you want to be near Times Square and the Hudson
text:
Location is great if you like to walk Times Square area and down to the Hudson River. Eclectic area to walk. 
Rooms are good,but we were upgraded to a penthouse unit which was very nice. One of the perks of being a lifetime card holder.
Lobby is small and efficient, front desk is good but sometimes overwhelmed by the volume of guests.
Breakfast is average, but more than decent.
New gym is limited but clean and functional.
Only real issue is the elevators which are often overworked, especially if you are on the upper floors. Once you learn their quirks they become much more user friendly
We will return for the location and the staff

title: Several issues
text:
As a long time Marriott Rewards member I am very disappointed in this property on W40th in Manhattan.
The good: front desk staff upon arrival was great. They also called room to ensure all was great.
The bad: Toilet wouldn't flush, but they fixed while I was out.
The elevators are horrible. Coming from the 27th floor it was stopping randomly and bouncing up and down. Next morning it was out of service. The wait for elevators is horrific and I did not want to walk 27 flights of stairs in dress clothes.
Room has a strange odor. Skyroom rooftop only open on Thurs - Sat.
I asked 3 times for a receipt to be emailed. Still never happened. Unfortunately I will have to pay the $518 for one night as my Company will not reimburse without receipt.  I guess I go back to Hilton and beautiful new Homewood Suites on 37th. Too bad, I want to love Marriott, but with high priced poor experiences,  I can't.

title: Bien situé mais décevant
text:
Chambre et salle de bain très petites à 3 dans la chambre pas confortable. Clim vieille et bruyante.
Attente aux ascenseurs longue . Petit déjeuner au dernier étage au bar car travaux dans la salle des dejs, mal installés, couverts en carton dommage car il y a du choix au déjeuner 
Hôtel propre car il a été rénové, il est bien situé 
Mon avis est partagé mais je pense tout de même que je n’y retournerai pas. Dommage car il a tout pour plaire!!

title: good location for near Time square
text: The location was good and the rooms were fine as well. The service could have been better. We complained about the elevator button not working and it was not fixed while we were there for 2 days. There are a couple of subway stations near, so it is convenient for travelling around NYC when sightseeing.

title: Family trip
text: Great stay very welcoming and friendly staff had a nice stay the room was comfortable and convenient the hotel was cozy and the breakfast was fabulous the coffee was wonderful and all day long and surely I’ll get back there again.

title: Ottima posizione e disponibilità!
text: Posto a pochi passi da Times Square ci ha permesso di godere appieno del centro e di tutte le attrazioni più importanti (Moma, Public Library, Empire State Bilding, Central Park ecc). Vicinissimo ai teatri di Brodway. Visitate il Roof Top Bar Sky Room posto al 21^ piano e non rimarrete delusi! Ottima colazione!!!!

title: Ottima soluzione per soggiornare a Manhattan
text: Soggiornare in questo hotel è stata una piacevole sorpresa. La struttura è a soli 5 minuti a piedi da Times Square. Non abbiamo mai fatto code per gli ascensori né per la colazione (nonostante fossimo una famiglia di 6 persone). Ogni sera si veniva accolti con una piccola sorpresa: cookies, pop corn, aperitivo. Il personale è sempre stato cordiale e disponibile: in particolare il benvenuto a New York ci è stato dato dal night auditor Ivan Rodriguez ci ha accolti con calore e professionalità.

title: Terrific stay
text:
Arrived on an early flight from Asia and were able to get a room quickly . Very comfortable room ( 29th floor) and had all the amenities available . Clean and well appointed . Breakfast was included and had it all - very good. Super location and easy to walk to all areas and taxis available.
Super front desk staff. Enjoy the roof top bar with lovely city views at sunset and night.

title: Great stay and good location
text:
The room is decent size for a NYC hotel.  The location is perfect. It’s across from port authority (along 40th st) and is walking distance from Times Square.  Just close enough to be by the action but away from the noise and craziness.

Also very clean and the service was great and nice.  Breakfast was also decent for the typical hotel breakfast but line can get busy quick on the weekend.  Definitely would stay again

title: Great location
text:
We spent 6 nights. We were 2 adults and 2 kids so we got a room with 2 queen beds. We had a lot of luggage and we struggled to store it as the room has about enough space to walk around. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean and quiet. We got bottled water every day (Thanks Jenna!!!!).
Breakfast was busy, but we never felt rushed. There are waffles, bagels, toasts and English muffins, as well as scrambled egg, burgers (sausage as they called them in American) and, sometimes bacon or Canadian bacon. Yogurts, small muffins, apples, bananas and oranges. Juices, tea and coffee... Must say we ate so much for breakfast that we didn't need any lunch! They use disposable plates, cups and cutlery though!! (but there is a recycle bin). The staff were very attentive.
Location is about in front of Port Authority metro/bus station and about 10-15 mins walk to Times Square. We were in the 21st floor, so sometimes we had to wait a few minutes (not more than 5-6) for one of the three lifts to arrive. 
My kids got a little token on arrival as well as some popcorn... that just made their day after a long trip. THANK YOU.
The bus to Newark airport leaves from Port Authority too, so made our trip back to the airport cheap and painless!!

title: Enjoyable 5 night break celebrating my wife's birthday.
text: Looked for a central modern hotel with breakfast included for a reasonable price and settled on this one,so glad we did,the room was still large even with two queen beds in it, the bathroom included a good sized wet room type shower cubicle with ample space to move around in,plenty of hanging space in the wardrobe,coffee maker,tea, coffee and bottles of water were supplied everyday.Suggest you request a "middle" floor for a half decent view,and also check out the rooftop bar for a stunning vista.The staff in the breakfast room were very polite and attentive,the housekeeping was top class and a big shout out to Anthony on the front desk who went the extra mile and left my wife some prosseco and chocolates to celebrate her birthday.Also had friends come up from Orlando for three nights of our stay and they were also impressed with their room and the hotel.

title: A couple of fun days in New York
text:
This hotel was great for the price we paid . The lobby is bright and clean with a new snack or welcome drink everyday.  The room was clean with very comfortable beds. Large flat screen tv and good sized washroom. 
The breakfast buffet had ample eggs sausage bacon , breads pastries and fresh fruit yogurts and so much more. Starbucks coffee and zen teas. This really gave us a head start to our busy day ahead. 
The elevators were slow but there was a door man there to help out. 

Really enjoyed our stay would highly recommend.

title: Always a good time.
text:
We have been coming here for 10 years and love it. The location is perfect if your coming from the PABT. Sneak out the side door, cross the street and walk into the hotel. The subway is right there too! Times Square is a 5 min walk. 

Service is always good and the rooms are very nice and clean. 

Breakfast can get packed, but with so many great places to eat in the city, skipping the free Marriott fare is not a big deal.

title: Good &bad
text: We stayed 3 nights. The bed was large and very comfortable. Staff were v helpful and courteous. Bathroom small but adequate. Room very small. Hard to unpack. Cardboard cups and by second night plastic cup for water. Breakfast  food fine but more cardboard and plastic utensils. Crowded room like low end canteen 2 slow lifts inadequate for size of hotel

title: Amazing customer Service
text: We had such a great time here.  The location is close to time square and easily walkable.  The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. They even went out of their way to provide a small surprise for my husbands birhday. We will absolutely be back!

title: Ll recommend
text:
My daughter always  stays in Marriott her SPG account is active.though I have my own membership this time she booked room for me through her reward points.
With out any  harrasment they transferred points and booked room.very neat and clean family friendly and close to Times square allowed us to explore city in late hours.staff is cooperative.
Complimentary breakfast fast yet I have to take today.i am sure it will rate high.

title: Times Square Marriot
text: My family and I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It’s beautiful, very clean, nice breakfast buffet, and it’s in walking distance to Times Square. To top it off, theres also a nice rooftop bar to enjoy.

title: Fam Ramautar
text:
Een prachtige locatie op 41st bij Times Square. 
Familie kamer is voldoende voor 4 volwassen personen. Groter dan de familiekamers van het Hilton op nummer 232. 
Personeel is super vriendelijk, behulpzaam en altijd vrolijk in het bijzonder Jessica en Whitney. 
Ontbijt is prima wees op tijd maar in de rij wachten is ook niet verkeerd.
Rooftop van het hotel is prachtig en gezellig even het gevoel dat je in een soulfilm terecht komt.
Hotel ligt mooi centraal. Wij gaan zeker een keer terug.

title: Great Experience!
text: Very reasonably priced for the area.  Within walking distance of most everything we wanted to do for a quick long weekend.  Staff very helpful and courteous.  Room was on the small side but was spotless and very comfortable -  we were not in New York City for a hotel room.  We'll stay there again

title: Friendly and helpful Staff!!
text:
I stayed at the Fairfield on Thursday, September 13th. My stay was nothing short of fabulous.  The staff was super friendly and beyond helpful. 

We arrived in NYC well before check in and were allowed to store our luggage. This helped tremendously. 

We were running late to a talk show and walked into the hotel rather frantic, sweating profusely, and all out of sorts. 

The lady at the counter was beyond kind. She immediately offered us a bottle of water and quickly offered her assistance. A kind gesture goes a long way. She also assisted us with deciding the quickest and easiest way to get to the talk show we were going to view. 

When we returned later, she was there - along with a gentleman who was just as friendly. Tony, I believe was his name. 

The rooms are small, but clean and quaint. We were only there one night, and slept quite comfortably. 

I will definitely return to this hotel when I visit NYC in the future.

title: My Trip To The Big 🍎
text: New York Showed Me A Great Time!! I Stayed Here For 5 days 4 Nights, Everything Was GREAT I WILL REVISIT The BIG 🍎!! I Rode Subways From Uptown To Downtown, Brooklyn The Bronx Coney Island, I Went To Queens visited a M2 Lounge, It Was Very Fun NOT A Big Crowd Which Was Perfect!!

title: Good but cramped and limited
text: Very cramped. Only 8 rooms per floor. Bed was very comfy. Staff were friendly. Breakfast was okay. A housekeeping request for more coffee was promptly fulfilled. WSJ in the lobby, but limited lobby coffee service. In-room coffee uses pods that are 2x too big for the Mr. Coffee, resulting in a big mess. Soft towels. Cheap toilet paper. Nice furniture, but no easy chair; only a desk chair. Seating in the lobby is a mishmash and not comfortable. TV had terrible picture quality except on two stations. Lots of noise from the street, even 21 floors up; ear plugs provided. Plenty of outlets. Exercise room is sparse.

title: Vacanza
text:
ottimo hotel, con una bella vista sulla città, massimi comforts e servizi, tutti seguiti da    un'ottima ospitalità.
Personale disponibile a risolvere ogni tipo di problematica.
Luogo centrale vicino ai mezzi pubblici e Times Square è facilmente raggiungibile a piedi da questa posizione.

title: If u kow NYC u know the price tag in the city!
text: The hotel is great(nothing outrageous),if u come early u need to wait till its time to check inn! The rooms are small.(like most hotel in NYC) the sheets are clean room is clean too.Breakfast area is small u need to wait in line .The hotel is 10 min walk from Time Square.They have valet parking but u have to wait 45 min so they can bring your car,even if u call BEFORE! (when u are still in your  room like they ask u to do but...) u have to wait !!

title: TERRIBLE CUSTER SERVICE
text:
I had the worst experience at this property. I missed my flight at JFK so I booked this hotel for one night 8/27/18. I arrived at the property around 630PM. The young lady at the check in counter was having some problems with the customer in front of me. She had to call a manger to check him in.
When she helped me she could not find my reservation. I had given her my Marriott Premium Plus credit card and showed her my cell phone with my confirmation on it. I then asked her if there is another Fairfield in close by and her coworker told me yes. I told both of them the address from  my email confirmation; 330 W 40TH ST. The other lady told me I was at the wrong hotel and she gave me directions to anther property 6 blocks away. After walking for several blocks I decided to put the address in my google map app and I noticed I was being sent back to the property that I had just been at. 
When I got back I asked for a manager and he was able to find my reservation. He was very nice but only gave me 1K bonus points. I had walked several blocks with 2 pieces of heavy luggage for a 11 day trip to Greece. I had planned on going to see a Broadway show but because of this mess up I would have been late and I decided not to go.
The next morning I called the front desk for a check out at 1PM.
I thought with my Gold status it would be no problem. The lady told me since I did not book directly with Marriott I would not receive any of my elite status benefits.
I just looked on Marriott's website and I see that I am not eligible for points but I do not see anywhere that I would not receive any of the other elite status benefits.

title: Staff and Spotless clean comfortable rooms!
text:
Amanda does her job with LOVE: Breakfast staff is always willing to make your dining wonderful.
Anthony: Front desk staff, Whitney, Claudia, Edwin/ Irving Ivan :-) New hire with amazing eyebrows- ANYONE of them (names that escape my mind...)But NEVER the undying efforts they give to each guest that the stay. All ways stellar and beyond expectations. 
Housekeeping staff will NEVER say NO to a request and make sure they hand deliver it to your room with a smile.
Any problem with television, phone or plumbing? Not with this engineering staff! Total professional problem solvers.
First Impression, well that's going to be in the lobby. The BELL stand staff are always helpful and kind. You immediately feel the security of a safe place away from home.
JP (GM) has chosen his staff well and continues to be a delightful presence around the hotel interacting with guest and making sure all is well with their stay.
Improvement? Sure, the elevator  access can be a bit of a wait. Phones are not next to bed in some rooms. Microwave access by floor maybe..(if not in each room...Just a thought during the renovations.)  Which by the way, re:The remodeling, the previous design has better traffic flow for breakfast crowd. However, removing the counter eating adding the tables; are a far better choice. All this is minor to the many OUTSTANDING rooms options and customer service, which this ENTIRE location provides ongoing.

title: Malo por temas concretos
text:
Explicaré mis dos estrellas detallando cada aspecto, primeros positivos y luego los negativos que aunque no sean mucho si son de importancia destacada:

- Localización para mi perfecta. A 5 minutos de Times Square y a un 1 minuto de estación de bus y de parada de metro. Cierto que la zona no es muy buena pero tampoco sientes inseguridad sino más bien gente bebida y sin techo pero sin molestar a nadie.

- Amabilidad bastante bien en general sobre todo en zona de desayuno y zona de recepción una chica parecía cubana o dominicana y un chico que hablaban español y eran especialmente amables. 

- Comodidad de la cama muy buena y tamaño de la habitación más que suficiente para lo que es NY. Amenities de bastante calidad y con marca buena.

- PRIMER PUNTO NEGATIVO. No es posible que en horas punta de la mañana estés literalmente esperando el ascensor 15 o 20 minutos...tanto para subir como para bajar... el tiempo de turismo en NY no sobra y si haces cuenta a una semana un total de 45 minutos esperando ascensor (2 subidas y 2 bajadas) pues prácticamente te has comido un día esperando ascensor y no soy nada exagerado. Era desesperante y la gente lo expresaba con las caras de desesperación.... no se cual será la solución ni digo que sea fácil pero no pueden continuar así...Para empezar podían dejar de ocupar uno de los elevadores con la terraza de arriba pues la verdad es que quita bastante espacio esperando a los clientes que suben y bajan al bar de copas aunque para nada afecta a los horarios de la mañana y como digo es insoportable tanta espera...

- SEGUNDO PROBLEMA NEGATIVO. El desayuno durante las obras se sirve arriba en azotea y aunque las vistas son espectaculares no es nada cómodo comer agachados en mesas bajitas y pequeñas de pub, Además me consta que con el cambio provisional han retirado embutidos y otras cosas del desayuno típico que ofrecían abajo. Si ya antes de las obras he leido que era repetitivo pues ahora mucho más pues hay menos variedad. Entiendo que las obras son provisionales pero no tengo culpa durante mi estancia y debo verme perjudicado en la menor medida posible.

- TERCER PUNTO NEGATIVO Y MÁS IMPORTANTE QUE JAMÁS ME HABÍA OCURRIDO EN ESTE GRUPO DE HOTELES. En el cuarto día de estancia descubro que en la sabana inferior de la cama a la altura de la almohada aunque por la parte lateral de la cama había una mancha enorme de sangre seca... buahhh que asco la verdad. Con la limpieza no se juega y eso es asqueroso, perdonen la expresión. Mi pareja llamó a recepción y todo hay que decirlo que inmediatamente enviaron a un Sr. a comprobarlo in situ y así lo hizo pero como era de noche no tenían limpiadora y nos ofrecieron una compensación economica de 50 dolares y nos daban unas sábanas limpias y que nosotros las cambiásemos y ellos al día siguiente. Tengo que decir que fueron muy amables y jamás pusieron en tela de juicio lo ocurrido pues era evidente pero aunque la compensanción sea de agradecer creo que no existe compensación posible para tal marranada y deberían tener mucho más cuidado.

CUARTO PROBLEMA. No había ningun canal español y la verdad es que entre tantos como había podían tener sintonizado alguno. La verdad no tiene mayor importancia pero me gustaría reseñarlo como punto a mejorar de manera bastante sencilla. 

Si ven mi historial verán que no suelo votar negativo sin motivo alguno, más bien todo lo contrario y es una pena pues este hotel podrían tener mejor puntuación cuidando esos aspectos tan importantes...

title: Solid, as long as you know what's reasonable to expect of a hotel in the city
text:
Pros: Close to Times Square, clean guest rooms, excellent air conditioners, reasonable prices
Cons: Not close enough to Times Square, small guest rooms, elevators and cramped and not immediately available

We usually stay at the Marriott Marquis when visiting Times Square but were priced out of it this particular weekend, so we stayed within the Marriott family a few blocks away from the action. On one hand, this is close to everything- just a few blocks. On the other, it felt a world away from everything that was going on. At least the location was quiet, despite the bus terminal across the street.

This hotel is typical of many in the city, with small guest rooms (barely larger than the king bed) and a few elevators that can't adequately service all of the floors (this building was about 40 stories, and with eight rooms per floor, you can imagine how tedious it was to get anywhere most times of day).  Because the floors are so small, ice and vending were... well, somewhere else in the hotel.  After having climbed the stairs and found nothing on a few floors, I gave up the search.

At least the staff is friendly, and proud of the fact that this is one of the better-rated Marriott properties in all of NYC.  And while our room was small, it was clean and comfortable, and we welcomed the excellent air conditioner that kept things frosty on a couple of hot summer days.

At about half the price of the wonderful Marquis a few blocks away, this was about half the experience- very good, but nothing special.

title: Hotel que descuidó nuestra atención. Buena ubicación
text: El hotel está cerca de Times Square, luego a la ubicación no se le puede poner ningún pero porque tiene la estación de autobuses y metro prácticamente en la puerta. Los alrededores del hotel con gente muy rarita (mucho mendigo). El desayuno caótico porque el espacio es pequeño y, si no bajas temprano se forma una cola considerable y además hay poca variedad, todos los días lo mismo. Y ahora viene lo peor: dos días la habitación sin hacer. La primera vez lo dejamos pasar pero la segunda bajamos a protestar y hacerla la hicieron pero también se dejaron la puerta de la habitación abierta con todas nuestras pertenencias a la vista de quien quisiera entrar. Para mi gusto, las disculpas insuficientes. Si reserváis pedid habitaciones altas, yo estuve en un segundo y la ventana es translúcida, deja pasar luz pero no vez nada de lo que tienes enfrente con lo que yo me agobié un poco.

title: Short visit to NYC
text:
I finally had the opportunity to tag along with my husband on one of his business trips so this was my first visit to NYC. We used his travel rewards for our stay and were quite happy with our room and the service we received. After telling Claudia this was my first visit to NYC, she sent up a sweet welcome gift to our room. Thanks for making my first visit even better. 

The room was clean but smaller than other FI&S rooms I’ve experienced, but my husband said it was large for NYC rooms. We had no major issues in the room other than the fact that something went wrong with the TV/remote our last 2 days so we weren’t able to watch the news in the morning/evening, but we managed to figure out the weather for planning our days. 

If I were to complain about anything, the beds were not the best. They were hard. I like a firm mattress and can sleep just about anywhere, but with these beds it probably took me 10 minutes to fall asleep instead of my usual 3-5 minutes. Fortunately, the pillows and air conditioner worked perfectly. 

They are in the process of remodeling the lobby, but that wasn’t a major issue. All of the staff we spoke with were helpful and friendly making it an enjoyable visit. Breakfast is served on the top floor which provided some nice views. Breakfast was simple but most importantly had coffee — which was also available downstairs. 

The location was perfect. It was only a block to the subway for the A,B, and C trains. Only a couple of blocks to the madness of Times Square and Broadway, and in the other direction only a block or two to Hell’s Kitchen (away from the craziness).

I will definitely be back again!

title: Muy ruidoso
text:
Estamos pasando una semana en Nueva York en este hotel y no lo recomiendo porque da a una calle muy ruidosa porque tiene la estación central de autobuses enfrente. El desayuno no es muy variado pero abundante, lo malo es que aprovechan para darlo una zona de copas con lo que desayunas en puf y sillones de pub y las mesas están a la altura de las rodillas lo que resulta incómodo.
Las habitaciones están bien y el personal agradable. La situación en Manhattan está también muy bien porque estas a un paso de Time Square.
Se me olvidaba decir que si estas en las habitaciones de arriba se oye la música de arriba sobre todo el fin de semana.
En resumen, no lo recomiendo.

title: Verbouwing tijdens hoogseizoen.......
text: Wij hebben 4 nachten in het hotel geslapen. Kamers zijn klein maar schoon. Waar ik mij werkelijk over verbaasd heb is dat het hotel momenteel verbouwd wordt....... tijdens hoogseizoen!!er lagen oordopjes in de kamers. Om 8 uur smorgens begon men met boren in de muren. Omdat wij op de tweede verdieping sliepen was dit goed te horen. Onbtijt werd nu tijdelijk geserveerd in de sky lounge op de 32ste verdieping. Eén van de drie liften was 2 dagen stuk......je moest soms lang wachten om naar bijven en weer naar beneden te gaan. Als ik dit van tevoren had geweten had ik zeker dit hotel niet geboekt.

title: Avreste potuto stupirci.....Cronaca di 10gg di vacanza in East Coast.
text:
Conosco molto bene tutta la catena Marriott da diversi anni e devo dire che sono sempre stati ineccepibili.
Qui purtroppo, anche a causa del building piuttosto datato, non era alla solita altezza. La causa principale della ns. delusioncina è stata la doccia che normalmente ha un getto potente e caldissima. Qui getto floscio e al massimo tiepida.
Personale buono, colazione media anche se era una ressa continua, ma in pieno Agosto ci sta. Ben insonorizzata, sì devo dire che c'era un livello di silenzio molto buono. Location eccezionale, vicinissima a Broadway, Times Square. Empire State Building, Rockfeller, etc. etc. Abbiamo girato tanto, Philadelphia, Atlantic City, Lancaster (Amish County), Niagara Falls, Shopping a nord di New York e poi gli ultimi 5 giorni in lungo e largo a Manhattan. Viaggio organizzato quasi totalmente "fai da te". Chi avesse piacere di avere alcune informazioni più in dettaglio, siamo a disposizione.

title: Pochi pregi e tanti difetti
text:
Hotel silenzioso anche se a due passi da Time Square. Ottima colazione. 
Camere e bagni piccoli, noi siamo 4 amiche e non sappiamo dove appoggiare neppure gli asciugamani. Ascensori lentissimi con attese anche di 20 minuti. E la nota più dolente il personale scortese.
Forse si può trovare di meglio.

title: Hôtel fait Field suites Newyork
text:
Bonnne hôtel, correct et propre, les chambres sont grandes et les lits agréables.
Situé à 16 mn de Time square à pied, c est un bon choix pour un séjour de quelques jours pour visiter Manathan.
Par contre pas de parking, prévoir un parking privé entre 50 et 80 dollars la nuitée.

title: Great choice
text: My sister and I spent a few days in NYC and we wanted a cheap, convenient location that included breakfast. This hotel was that and more. Every staff person we saw was ultra helpful and friendly. They are remodeling the lobby which wasn't a problem at all.  They moved the breakfast to the top floor due to construction, which gave us a wonderful city view. We only realized after the second day that we could have sat on the extra top floor where they have a rooftop bar, probably more room up there when crowded, but the view was actually not as good if you are short like us. The breakfast -juices, milk, yoghurt, bagels, toast, waffles (heat in the toaster), oatmeal packets, scrambled eggs, omelets, bacon or ham and  sausage depending on the day, fruit, Starbucks coffee, tea, and assorted add ons (cheese, dried fruit etc) and more. It was crowded, but if you went early it was fine. We requested a corner room and got it on the 29th floor, with a view to the side of the Empire State building. Much better than the usual view of building across the way. Also they upgraded us to a double room rather than one bed. Quiet rooms and not small especially considering it's NYC. Beds clean and comfy along with plenty of pillows. Paul Mitchell toiletries. Good location on 40th so not a far walk to the middle of Times Square, the A, C, E subway and everything else basically Midtown. The hotel was directly next to Port Authority so we just had to walk out the door to catch our bus home. All in all we would absolutely stay there again.

title: We picked the wrong two days!
text:
The first thing we noticed when arriving at the hotel was new mattresses being delivered. We didn’t think much of it at first, but it ended up causing a few issues. Arriving at 10 AM, we didn’t expect to check in, but to leave our bags. The friendly staff took our luggage and told us that check in was at 4 PM. We came back at 5:15 PM, tired after a long day, and our room was still not ready. We rested in the lobby with a cup of tea for half an hour. When our room still was not ready, we decided to go out for dinner. Our room was finally ready when we returned. The first thing we wanted to do was to wash our hands, but there was no soap. After calling the front desk, soap was brought up. Then, we noticed there was no toilet paper.

The following day, breakfast was being served up on the 34th floor lounge, maybe as a treat for the mattress situation. The views were fantastic but there were issues. The tables were small and low- difficult for breakfast. There was a problem with the toasters blowing a fuse so only one working toaster. There was a long line waiting to toast bread, waffles, bagels. If you were looking for a quick breakfast, this wasn’t the day for that.

This was also the day the staff were removing the old mattresses.

There was no tea/coffee/hot chocolate available in the lobby for the final two days of our stay. The last issue was the long line in the lobby for the one working restroom on our 
check-out day.

The hotel was clean, quiet, and comfortable. The staff worked very hard through the mattress situation. Breakfast the next day was in its usual spot and was excellent.
The location of the hotel was convenient, near Port Authority and Times Square, but was not  our favorite area. Less than 5 minute walk to the subway (lines A, C, E, N, Q, R, S, W, 1, 2, 3, and 7).

We understood that we came in an inconvenient time (February 2018). It would have been nice to know in advance that there would be disruptions. Also, some form of compensation would have been appreciated.

title: It was okay.
text: The hotel was okay, nothing too special. It was in a good area but I thought there are some things the hotel can improve on. We were on the 18th floor and there were only 2 elevators working. It had to take 20-25 minutes sometimes to catch an elevator which I thought was a bit absurd.

title: Location strategica
text:
Quando ho deciso di prenotare un albergo a NYC, ho deciso di scegliere una location centrale e questo Hotel direi che è perfetto.

Punti positivi:
Location
Silenzioso
Pulizia
Doccia molto spaziosa
Colazione ottima e abbondante con vista sui grattacieli di Manhattan 
Personale gentilissimo
Lounge bar sulla terrazza di sera

Punti negativi:
Camera per 4 un po’ piccola
Ascensori che non arrivano mai , nelle ore di punta( quando dovevamo scendere e uscire dal 12 piano preferivamo usare le scale)
Come al solito MANCA IL BIDET ( ma noi italiani siamo viziati in questo senso)

title: DÉCEVANT !!!!
text: En arrivant, nous avons pu constater que la chambre était très petite pour 4, et très sale, la chambre sentait l’urine, et les chaussettes noires après 2 pas sur la moquette de la chambre. Ne parlons pas de la salle de bain à peine 2m carré, petit lavabo, absolument aucune place pour poser nos affaires de toilettes ou bien même nos affaires sales le temps d’une douche. Celle-ci sentait l’humidité. Quelle déception lors du petit déjeuner, une saleté pas possible et surtout pas beaucoup de choix. Pour finir le tout, nous avons dû attendre 1h30 afin d’avoir nos billets d’avions imprimés, que nous avons dût au final imprimés tout seul. Cependant la concierge est très agréable et nous a était d’une grande aide.

title: Camere piccole
text: Abbiamo soggiornato per sei notti per la nostra seconda volta a New York. Nonostante fosse abbastanza vicino all'hotel della volta precedente questa zona si è rivelata veramente degradata: sporca, con parecchi ubriachi a qualsiasi ora e barboni. Veramente vicino a Times Square e alla fermata della metropolitana ma anche alla stazione dei pullman che comporta caos a tutte le ore. Camere assolutamente piccole: noi siamo in quattro e non sapevamo come girarci; condizionatore rumoroso (in dotazione infatti danno i tappi per le orecchie). Nota molto positiva la colazione ricca e varia: unica cosa la zona dove viene servita ha pochi posti e capita di fare delle file. Non lo consiglio.

title: Buon albergo per gli standard di NY
text: Abbiamo soggiornato al Fairfield della 40th st per 7 notti. Prezzo colazione inclusa 1750 euro comprese tasse. Albergo abbastanza pulito con personale gentile e disponibile. Tuttavia le camere sono un po' piccola. Noi avevamo una quadrupla e abbiamo dovuto disfare i bagagli e mettere via le valigie per poterci muovere. Altro problema sono gli ascensori: la mattina per andare in sala colazione al 34esimo piano era un vero incubo: se tardavamo oltre le 7.30 si aspettava anche 10 minuti. Non vi dico per scendere dalla nostra camera al 19esimo piano fino alla hall. Siamo andati giù per le scale ogni mattina. La colazione è buona anche se semplice e uguale ogni mattina, ma c'è la possibilità di prepararsi dei boxlunch con la roba che si vuole portar via. Abbiamo trovato la reception in ristrutturazione quindi l'aspetto generale era un po' disordinato. Ma aldilà di tutto l'hotel è centralissimo: 5 minuti a piedi da Time Square. Noi abbiamo girato a piedi ma volendo dietro l'angolo c'è la fermata dei bus e della metropolitana. Mi sento di consigliarlo vivamente

title: Great choice near everything
text: I enjoyed my stay at the Fairfield Times Square. I booked just a week before my travel and it was one of the few hotels I found that could guarantee 2 beds in a room.  The room was small but adequate for two people.  The beds seemed like fulls, not queens.  Breakfast was okay.  They are remodeling the breakfast room so breakfast was served in the Sky Lounge, on the top floor.  The view is amazing, but it's a club at night so it's not really set up to serve as a breakfast area.  There was a faint scent of bug spray when entering my room so I'm guessing an exterminator had been there recently...I'm not sure if that's a good or a bad thing.  The room was clean.  There is a club on the roof so on evenings that it's open, elevator service is really really slow.  The best thing about this hotel is the location.  It's near Broadway, Times Square and plenty of shops.  We walked everywhere during our visit.

title: Great place to stay, clean, well-managed
text: Location great, professional services, clean. Breakfast complete, lots of choices, some rooms have great views (ask for them), would definitely stay there again, friendly staff, obviously well-managed and staff is well-trained.

title: Ottimo servizio ma può migliorare
text: Sebbene la posizione sia ottima e il servizio eccellente, avrebbe bisogno di alcune migliorie. Le camere sono comode ma un po’ datate . Danno una sensazione di sporco. Il bagno ha l’odiosa tendina !!! Il riciclo dei rifiuti poco chiaro. Solo posate in plastica a colazione. La colazione abbondante e molto variegata.

title: Pobyt w centrum Manhattanu
text: Hotel przyjemny. Pokój średniej wielkości, dla dwóch osób idelny. Stołówka mała, kolejka do stolików. Brak możliwości późnego wymeldowania,ale jest przechowalnia bagażu. W hotelu znajduje się pub na jednym z wyższych pięter z widokiem na miasto. Taksówka zamówiona przez hotel droższa od żółtych taksówek. Kierowca pobrał sobie dodatkowo samodzielnie napiwek.

title: Kayla was a rockstar!
text: We stayed this past saturday and had a rough day before getting to the hotel.  Kayla answered our call right before we got there and advised us on where to park.  She then checked us in and made us feel welcome from the time we walked in the door.  I told her it was my wife's birthday and shortly after getting up to our room she called to say she had a bag that she put together for my wife.  She brought the decorated bag up and it had a couple beers, peanut butter cups (my wife's favorite) and protein bars, among other items.  She made our day!! We will definitely be staying here again in the future and want to thank Kayla for her kindness.  She really went above and beyond to make us feel welcome.

title: Great location and staff
text:
Great location Within less than a block to a subway station and quick walk to time square. Great location to go anywhere in the city. The breakfast experience was among the best I have experienced with actual hostess seating to avid the chaos and herd mentality.  Very impressed with the entire breakfast experience.
Drawbacks were homeless people on sidewalks near hotel and the rooftop was only open at night to adult.  With all the families in tourist would like to have seen this open to. Everyone during certain hours as a plus to be a valued guest.  Do that and 5 stars.

title: Un hotel genial
text:
Estuvimos durante 15 días y la atención fue genial. Desde el recepcionista Edwin,quien nos ayudó bastante hasta las chicas de la cocina y el servicio de desayuno. 
La habitación era muy cómoda, incluso pedimos estar en una planta superior ,y fue genial ver desde allí las pantallas de Time Square desde nuestro ventana, Siempre teníamos café de Starbucks en la habitación, así como dos botellas de agua diarias.
Las toallas y la limpieza es diaria, y aunque en alguna ocasión no fue muy exquisita siempre estaba todo totalmente correcto. 
El desayuno est muy bien, sin embargo faltaría algo más de variedad. A pesar de tener varios tipos de cereales, frutos secos, leches,mermeladas, mantequilllS, y bollerías,los platos calientes eran cuatros algo monótonos. Echamos en falta algún tipo de embutido, o algún plato caliente diferente. El café es de la cafetería Starbucks, y cuentan como muchos tipos de infusiones. 
Recomendable ir a desayunar pronto, te ahorras colas y comes muy tranquilo.
La situación del hotel es genial, estas a dos minutos de Times Square y de todo lo que necesites. Las salidas a las excursiones en la octava a  sólo cinco minutos. 
Sin duda repetiremos.

title: City break family of four
text: Staff helpful and friendly. Close to many main attractions. Hotel room size, pretty comparable to others in this city. Loved locations, easy reach of taxi rank and Penn station for transport to airport.

title: Buena hubicacion, mala atención en el check in.
text:
Un hotel que no parece "by Marriott.
Mala atención del personal recepción. 
Muy buena ubicación, pero su relación calidad precio no es muy buena. 
La limpieza es buena. Muy mediocre la atención del desayuno. 
No volveré allí

title: Hotel en Times Square
text: Bien situado vs Times Sq, pero ojo en zona de copas, gente extraña, habitaciones pequeñas y muy ruidosas. Lo mejor el servicio y el desayuno, que es rápido y completo. Lo peor la gente de la zona de alrededor y el ruido.

title: Bar sur le toit super
text:
Petit déjeuner excellent, vraiment super, à volonté.
Chambre parfaite.
Mais il manquait la bouteille d'eau habituelle....
Le bar sur le toit avec vue sur la ville, super. Possibilité de faire de magnifiques photos.

title: Short Stay in NYC
text: Stayed over the weekend for a reunion with long time friends. The four of us shared a room and believe it or not it worked out perfectly even though the rooms are on the small side though it is expected in a big city hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and well kept. The included breakfast buffet is plentiful with all sorts of choices. Hotel location was perfect for us. It is located alongside the Port Authority on 40th Street.

title: Ubicación excelente
text: Estuvimos una semana en familia, limpieza muy correcta y ubicación extraordinaria. El desayuno correcto (aunque muy repetitivo para 1 semana). Ofrecen agua gratuita en las habitaciones, sólo hay que solicitarla en recepción. El hotel es perfecto para conocer la ciudad por su buena ubicación.

title: Charmant hôtel à deux pas de time square
text:
Hôtel réservé sur Booking, 

à 225 la nuit à deux avec petit déjeuner plus que correct vue la situation. 

Salle de sport, petite déjeuner salé sucré à volonté. (Pas d'attente entre 7h et 8h30 ou 2min max)

Hygiène parfait même toilette commune au RDC
Chambre propre qui sentais bon le propre et pas la javel. 

La salle de bain plus que suffisante pour un petit séjour
Literie plutôt dur mais ça allez 
Clim puissante 

Très bon accueil rapide chambre disponible le premier jour sur les coups de midi

title: Perfect location
text: We always use Marriotts, so after much research, we picked this one, mainly for its location. We drove in from the Detroit area so we needed a place to park our SUV. The hotel lists parking as $67/day. Well, if you park it yourself, the rate is actually $50/day. The $17 includes valet. The garage is literally around the corner so it was very easy to access our vehicle if need be. Port authority is right across the street. The attendant there is excellent as far as directing you to anywhere in the city and exactly how to get there. The hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I liked coming "home" to a less busy area after being out all day in the city. Yet Times Square is only a 5-7 minute walk from the hotel. The only cons were the small rooms and double beds. For two adults and two teenagers, the room was pretty tight. The bathroom did not have any counter space. If you're prone to being claustrophobic, this might not be the hotel for you. We were on the 27th floor and our room was right in front of the elevator. The hallways are super narrow and lower than the average hotel. I understand and expected small rooms, but wow I was still surprised. The city view was just ok. It's a smaller window that overlooks the top of the parking garage. Do the cons outweigh the great location? I guess that depends on what's the most important factors on your vacation. If we were traveling without the kids we definitely would stay here again!

title: Soggiorno piacevole
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato presso questo struttura nel mese di Maggio e siamo rimasti molto soddisfatti, la posizione eccezionale, in pieno centro, a due passi da Times Square, proprio di fianco alla stazione dei bus port authority ed alla fermata della metropolitana.
La struttura è ben tenuta, noi alloggiavano al 37esimo piano in una camera con due letti queen size, se la camera fosse stata appena più grande saremmo sicuramente stati meglio, diciamo che lo spazio per i bagagli era veramente limitato, il bagno molto comodo con una doccia molto grande (logicamente nessun bidet).
La colazione compresa nel prezzo, era bella ricca e varia con una buona scelta sia di dolce che di salato e tre tipi di frutta, arance, mele e banane.
Il personale molto gentile ci ha accolto con un bel sorriso, non posso dire nient'altro in quanto pagando immediatamente al check-in non abbiamo più avuto a che fare, l'ultimo giorno abbiamo trovato la fattura di pagamento in camera e dunque abbiamo solo dovuto riconsegnare la chiave.
Mi sento di consigliarlo, hotel con buona qualità prezzo (considerando i prezzi di NY) e con colazione inclusa, da non sottovalutare.
Unica nota negativa  se proprio devo trovare qualcosa è la strada in cui è ubicato, diversi negozi di alcolici e locali penso a "luci rosse" rendono la via un pochino spiacevole per via delle strane facce che si incontrano, noi comunque non abbiamo mai avuto problemi a qualsiasi ora, anche a tarda notte.
Tornando a NY potrebbe nuovamente essere la giusta soluzione.

title: We would stay again in a heartbeat!
All you need for a short stay in NUY
text: I stayed for 20 days with my 18 year old son for a vacation of museums and theaters. They were replacing all mattresses so it was a bit hard to get on the elevator - but other than that, all was well. Front desk people very cordial; great breakfast included, location perfect to go everywhere because the metro is across the st. There is a pizza place on the corner that stays open for that late night snack. You are in the middle of midtown and its crazy - but you are walking distance to everything. Good price. Good linens. Would definitely go back.

title: DON'T STAY AT THE FLOOR BELOW NIGHT CLUB
text:
I have so far stayed at about  a dozen hotels in the timesquare areas in last 2 years, all for business purpose.
This is the first time I stayed for a connecting trip to Washington dc for a short vacation. Fortunately all me previous stays were average to excellent. However I have to give this one a Poor rating. I was given the room right below the night club(don’t remember the floor) which I had no idea about before we went to bed. I stayed with my parent who are in 60’s and 70’s and even knowing that fact they gave me that room. We could not sleep until 3 a.m as the entire room vibrates for the whole time. 
In comparison to the Fairfield near Penn station where I stayed earlier this year, this hotel is not at per quality at all. The breakfast, room service, room quality is much better in the other hotel.
Room size is not that big, but that is as per standard of the TimeSquare. The room is so called City View, but there is a big closet in front of the City View window. :-)  Overall never staying at this hotel again.

title: Best thing I can say is the beds and pillows were extremely comfortable
