text: As for the rest, I imagine it was a typical small space NYC hotel. No lobby to speak of. Limited seating, a bench to wait on. Tight spaces everywhere. It did have a nice fitness center for its size. But with the air conditioning not working in July in the hallways, lobby, and common area, it made for a tough stay. Luckily the air in the rooms worked or I would have checked out. Inconvenient to have to go to the bottom floor for a vending machine. The elevators were small and took a ridiculously long time to appear at breakfast time. The result of a 38 floor hotel with about 8 rooms on a small floor footprint. The breakfast food was great and they had everything they needed to and more, just no space to sit and uncomfortable wooden chairs and no elbow room. Look elesewhere.

title: Good location
text: Location was good and central to all areas.  Staff was very nice and helpful . Breakfast was good and even when there was a line only waited a few minutes  the gym was great. Only real negative were the Elevators they were very slow.  Room was decent size for NYC.  Would stay again  very affordable

title: Home base for 11 days
text:
I chose this hotel because it was reasonably priced for this city and well located. It is a short walk to the blue or red line subways, to the lower part of the theatre district and Times Square. It was also walking distance to the pier where my boat cruise was to take place.  

My room on the 17th floor was large with a king bed, tub/shower, small drink cooler and a view towards the New York Times building. Street noise was not an issue. There were free water bottles provided and a decent breakfast. The staff were wonderful. I agree with another reviewer that the elevator waits during peak periods were long and crowded. There were also lineups for breakfast but I always asked for a takeout container so I skipped past the line and took my breakfast up to the room. 

There is only an ice machine and vending machines in the lower level (LL).

title: Shady environment, poor at best, avoid this place
text:
- Property is right next door to a NYC Parole office.  What does that mean? Every morning you walk outside around 7:30 - 8:00am and is there is a huge line (25+ people easily) of characters waiting to check in the parole office and more hanging around throughout the day.  Not exactly what I am looking for when I stay at hotel,.  No thanks.

- Coming into the lobby at all times there seemed to be a bunch of random people sitting around loitering, can't tell if they are staying at the hotel, just hanging out, or what.  It was unsettling.

- The "Sky Room" takes over one of the tiny three elevators each night, making the wait to get to your room even longer, and filling the tiny lobby with even more random people.

- I asked the concierge where I could get a quick bite to eat somewhere good and they looked at my incredulously and said "there is an Arby's around the corner". Really?  That is the answer I get in NYC?  Lazy at best.

I'd avoid this place like the plague, there are way too many better options at similar or lower prices in NYC.

title: Great location time square area
text: Close to subway and across the street from the transportation authority.  Easy access by subway to and from JFK.  Centrally location for walking to time square, the high line, Empire State Building, Top of the Rock, Rockefeller Centre, and  Radio City Music Hall.  Good hot breakfast.   Cold water available in lobby and bottled water provide in the roomStaff very nice.  Only complaint is the long waits for the elevator. We were on a lower floor so opted to take the stairs many times.

title: Comfortable and friendly accommodation in Chelsea
text: My husband and I had the good fortune to stay at the Fairfield Inn and Suites Manhattan/Chelsea for one night following a family wedding in nearby New Jersey.  We are frequent visitors to NYC and it seems we found our new home base! The location on foliage lined 28st street made an initial positive impression (numerous garden stores) on a very balmy day.  We were delighted to arrive and discover that we were “Guests of the Day”.  We were received warmly, given a free room upgrade and a welcome gift (chips, granola bars and bottled water). Thanks to the upgrade, we had a good sized king room. It was clean, comfortable and featured Paul Mitchell toiletries.  Breakfast was much better than the average complimentary fare, including a variety of hot options, fresh fruit, yogurt and decent bread products.  Most importantly, Starbucks coffee was served.  For once, Our caffeine needs were met in the breakfast offerings (I usually find hotel coffee weak and of poor quality).  Finally, checkout was a breeze and we were given some fresh baked cookies “for the road” when we asked. All in all, it was a great stay and we will return!

title: 員工專業有效率
text: 在這裏待了幾晚, 一切都很滿意, 酒店的管理非常好, 尤其是櫃台員工專業有效率, 他們很清楚客人的需求, 可以在短時間把事情妥善處理完畢. 客房內的設施很新, wifi 網速快, 床也舒服, 可以好好休息. 對了, 不要忘了早點去吃早餐, 晚了人會很多.

title: EXCELLENT LOCATION IN MID TOWN
text: Good location to see all the various tourist sites in midtown. good rates over the weekend as well. decent breakfast, check in was easy and smiley. rooms were a bit small, but i was solo on this trip so it was fine. had a room facing back side, and one window opened so that was nice to get the cool breeze at night. The area is behind the port autarky building, so taking a bus from any airport, drops you right there at hotel. easy to get to from local airports.. walking distance to times square and all the action. would def stay again.

title: Early summer visit to the Big Apple
text: The Fairfield Inn, Manhattan is located near Wall Street, the 1 subway, and the 9/11 memorial. The Fairfield is pretty conveniently located. Our room, a bit small was clean and tidy. We were up on the 22nd floor, so we were away from the street noise. The complimentary breakfast was a time and money saver. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. We stayed for 6 days and tried to do and see as much as we could. Battery Park and the NorthCove Marina at Brookfield Place were within walking distance. Take the Staten Island ferry at dusk and get great views of Manhattan, the Statue of Liberty, and Staten Island. The ferry is free and is very popular. What can you say about New York? Central Park, the Highline, and Times Square are awesome. 6 days wasn’t enough time to do it all. We’re going back at some point. A friend recommended to stay in south Manhattan instead of near Times Square because it’s always busy near Times Square.

title: Ever Reliable
text:
The Fairfield on 28th Street is reasonably priced and more than adequate. Ever reliable, I stay here when I need to stay in the City. It is near my office and is a good  location for an early morning walk or run. The flower district  wakes early and it’s nice to see the workers putting out all the plants and flowers as the morning dawns.

The staff is exceptional (as always with a Marriott property). My only complaint is that the AC unit in my room was so loud, I could not sleep. I am a light sleeper, but this unit was just too 
loud,  and turning if off, when Manhattan had reached 100 degrees, was not an option.

title: Viaggio di lavoro per fiera al Jacob Javits convention center
text:
Albergo comodo in posizione centrale. Metropolitana nella stessa via, Port Authority Bus Terminal di fronte, Jacob Javits Center raggiungibile comodamente a piedi (10-15 minuti, a seconda del passo). E' il mio secondo soggiorno e confermo il buon rapporto qualità/prezzo.
Colazione abbondante, anche se non eccelsa. Prevista la possibilità di asportarla, vengono anche fornite pratiche vaschette in polistirolo. Si fa un po' di coda nel rush hour mattutino, comunque al massimo 10 minuti, Personale professionale e gentilissimo, lo stesso dell'anno passato (quindi basso turn-over, buon segno). Il bar sulla terrazza è frequentatissimo dal''esterno, molti party privati organizzati ogni sera.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: Greeted by a friendly Anthony, the reception was easy. Room was clean and had all the amenities (including bathtub) I needed. They let you know when to go for free breakfast, and they are right--I gets crowded around 8 a.m. Can walk to Times Square, Port Authority, theater district etc. Also easy access to taxis and lots of good restaurants, souvenir shops, etc. Free newspaper. Reliable internet. Easy checkout--got to stay until noon. Price was very good, especially for NYC.

title: Très bon rapport qualité/prix
text:
Situé près de Times Square, cet hotel est vraiment un excellent choix pour qui veut loger à Manhattan à moins de 200 euros la nuit. J'avais lu les avis précédents et les inconvénients attendus ne sont pas insurmontables : clim un peu bruyante ? oui, mais on s'y fait. Ascenseurs un peu longs ? je n'ai jamais attendu plus de 2 minutes ! File au petit-déjeuner ? Pour y échapper j'ai déjeuné à 08h30 maxi, aucune attente. Il est vrai qu'en sortant de la salle à 09h00 j'ai vu une petite file. Le petit-déjeuner est copieux, chaud et froid, sucré et salé, bref y'en a pour tous les gouts.
La chambre est petite mais fonctionnelle, lit très confortable, bureau, télé géante, placard, fer, salle de bain moyenne. Impeccable pour mon voyage solo.
Accueil plutôt impersonnel mais c'est normal pour un si grand hotel (30 étages, 8 chambres par étage). Service de "concierge", à savoir une dame pour les idées de visites/tours.
Je reviendrai très très volontiers dans cet hotel.

title: Ótima opção em NY
text: O hotel é muito bem localizado, com ponto de metro na rua e muito próximo à Times Square. Tem um Shake Shack e uma Carlo´s Bakery virando a esquina!!!! O hotel é limpo, quarto novo e confortável. Não é grande mas acomodou bem nossa família de 4 pessoas (02 adultos e 02 crianças). O café da manhã é uma ótima pedida, já incluso na diária, o que é mais raro em hotéis de NY. Para uma família como a nossa, isso já é uma economia de uns 40 dólares por dia! Ficaria lá de novo certamente!

title: Great day in New York
text: I was recently diagnosed with skin cancer and had to go through surgery.  By the time my birthday is here in August I will be undergoing another round of surgeries to get this under control.  So I decided to go to New York for one night and see my favorite bank in the world (Depeche Mode who were playing at the Barclays Venue in Brooklyn).  I wanted to stay at this hotel because it is close to everywhere and relatively near to Penn Station.  I had a wonderful room on the 26th floor with a bathtub. How I loved having a bubble bath as I was getting ready to go. Then they have a bar so I had a complimentary drink and the bartender was so awesome. She knew how to make one feel welcome. The following morning, complimentary breakfast was provided and I was impressed with the nutritious choices we were given as guests. Another think worth noting was how safe I felt in this hotel. The door is opened using your key fob from the elevator, therefore reducing entry of unwanted guests to the floor where one is staying.  My room was small and yet so pretty and the view from my room simply incredible.  Thank you so much for a great time.  I was moved by the efforts made by all staff to make me feel welcome. They were so kind.  I definitely recommend this venue to anyone who has a special celebration, a get together with family or friends; or simply wants to go away and be a hero 'just for one day'. Thank you Marriott.  I adore you!

title: Gute Lage, in 5 min am Times Square aber...
text: Gutes Hotel, Zimmer recht klein aber sauber! Klimaanlage sehr laut, Bett ok. Frühstück leider typisch amerikanisch Kaffee und Bagel. Unangenehm wenn komplette Bedienung dauern mit Blauen Gummihandschuhen im Essbereich rumläuft.

title: Clean hotel, friendly staff
text: Convenient location to Times Square. The hotel is clean, room was small (2 double beds) but comfortable and quiet. Includes breakfast each morning, the breakfast was good with several options. The staff was very friendly.

title: Terrific location, good breakfast, and friendly staff
text: I couldn't be more pleased with our experience at this excellent hotel. The location was perfect for us. It's just a couple blocks from Times Square and Broadway shows and close to bus stops for the Grey Line Sightseeing Hop On/Hop Off Bus Tours.  And it only took us about 25 minutes to take a cab to LaGuardia for our flights home. Though the room was small, it was was clean, quiet, and comfortable. The breakfast offered more variety than I expected and was very tasty. We especially enjoyed the fresh Starbucks coffee. Make sure you do go down to breakfast as early as you can, because it does get very crowded later in the morning. I would absolutely choose this hotel again at our next stay in New York.

title: Excellent location and friendly staff
text: Friendly and efficient staff. Comfortable room - love Marriot’s bed and bedding! Good location. Ideal for our final leg - overnight stop en-route home. All staff were friendly and helpful. Typical American breakfast - not a great fan but as good as others.

title: Good functional hotel
text: Good room, clean, professional staff and very good location. On edge of Times Square but closer to the restaurants on 9th avenue to avoid the masses. No issues, except free breakfast was super crowded at 830am with lines. But other attributes make up for it.

title: nice hotel
text: Hotel was nice and convenient for local attractions. Rooms are small but buffet in breakfast is nice. Would recommend for your next visit to NY. We have stayed at several locations and really enjoyed this one

title: Great Hotel
text: Room was just the right size and location accessible to our needs.  Concierge, Christine was very helpful in giving us info for tours of the city and answering any questions we had.  Plenty to choose from for breakfast each day.

title: Good location for tourists
text: Even though it is right next to the Port Authority, this is a very good location for getting around the city. Clean rooms, subway close, free breakfast, and a rooftop bar. This hotel is centrally located for anyone coming in to visit. I'd request a high room because of noise but be warned the elevators take forever. Tiny gym

title: Cheaper,  wonderful,  close!
text: Immaculately clean.  Comfy to the highest Marriott standard.  Typical hotel breakfast but extremely well managed. Only negative was i prefer closer to 7th/Broadway area.  But lower price makes up difference.  Plus being next to port authority,  half block to many cabs. Extremely small room just like most nyc hotels. Can get 2 double beds,  free breakfast and free wifi. Please let me know if this was helpful!

title: The BEST hotel in NYC/Times Square!
text: Truly top notch Cust Serv, Amazing modern spacious rooms, great location, delicious and plentiful breakfast. Truly one of the best hiotel experiences in NYC I have experienced. from the moment my GF and I arrived Saturday morning at 9am(they even allowed us the early check in), to the consistant great customer service, to the late check out at 3pm Monday, we truly felt like we were valued as a customer of theirs. The entire staff was so amazing and professional, always asking if we needed anything, offering to help. We truly had one of the most amazing experiences ever at a hotel in NYC. We will look nowhere else but here when we coem to NYC, and we come at least 4-6 times a year, for 2-4 days each time. Anthony Pichardo and his staff were truly what the Marriott Brand stands for and all of Marriott International should look to the staff at this hotel as how they should run their own properties. Thank You Fairfield Inn & Suites-Times Square and staff!!

title: Ok ma attenti al conto e alla pulizia
text:
Potrebbe meritare 4 stelle tripadvisor ma hanno influito la mancanza di pulizia ed un intoppo sul conto. 
Un consiglio? Stampate la prenotazione di booking e fate attenzione al conto che vi presenta l'hotel. Ho letto altre recensioni di questo tipo e purtroppo anche a noi il conto preteso dall'hotel non era quello indicato da booking. Le tasse e imposte di soggiorno sono previste dal conto di booking quindi non dovevano esserci grosse sorprese se non un differente cambio al momento del pagamento, ma... arrivati in hotel il conto che ci presenta la struttura alberghiera differiva di più di 200 USD... Appena arrivati in hotel la receptionist ci chiede la carta di credito, ero sicura che ci fosse capienza poichè la carta nel mese non l'avevo usata per niente. Passa la carta per pagare l'intero importo del soggiorno e mi dice che la carta è stata rifiutata, ne proviamo un'altra e niente. La receptionist allora ci dice che la prima notte era stata prelevata, di andare a dormire tranquilli (certo come no!) e di chiamare la nostra banca per risolvere il problema, ma entro le 12. Così alle 3 di notte, quando in Italia erano le 9 di mattina, chiamo la banca e mi dicono che la carta è attiva ed è tutto ok. Mi illumina la ragazza del call center della banca e mi chiede se fossi sicura che l'importo che avrebbe voluto addebitarmi l'hotel fosse corretto... e infatti!! Praticamente la mia carta ha un plafond di 1500euro, il conto di booking era di 1400euro, mentre il conto che l'hotel intendeva addebitarmi era più di 1600euro... ecco perchè la carta veniva rifiutata... stanchi dal viaggio e dal jet lag non abbiamo pensato che potesse essere quello il problema... 
Facciamo colazione (più o meno tranquillamente) e trovo al banco della reception un altro ragazzo, gli spiego il problema della sera prima e del fatto che forse loro cercavano di addebitare sulla mia carta un importo che andava oltre al mio plafond e gli chiedo inoltre di controllare la mia prenotazione di booking con quella a loro sistema. Sta lì un pò a fare calcoli e poi scusandosi mi dice che... sì c'era stato un errore nel conto, trovato il problema (il problema era una differenza di più di 200usd!) e ci fa pagare  le restanti notti come da costi previsti dalla prenotazione di booking. 
Abbiamo trovato pulita la stanza il primo giorno, nei giorni successivi mai pulita moquette e mai tolta la polvere, hanno giusto cambiato gli asciugamani che lasciavamo a terra e rimesso shampoo. Le amenities sono un pò scarsine per due persone: una crema per il corpo... e va bene, uno shampoo che fa anche da bagno schiuma in due... e un conditioner per i capelli... Solo il primo giorno ho trovato una confezione con una salvietta struccante... Ogni giorno una sola bottiglia di acqua. Diciamo che per il prezzo pagato (230euro a notte) forse non tutto è andato secondo le aspettative di un 4 stelle, ma capisco anche che siamo a NY e che in questa città il rapporto qualità prezzo purtroppo è un punto dolente. 

Il punto di forza dell'hotel è sicuramente la posizione: in una via non troppo trafficata, facile da raggiungere dal JFK, la metro all'angolo, tutte le maggiori attrazioni si raggiungono a piedi. Altro aspetto positivo è la colazione, farla fuori per come la facciamo noi (cioè mangiando in modo abbondante dolce e salato) costerebbe troppo. Il personale della sala colazione è gentile ed in particolare una ragazza che si ricordava ogni giorno che non volevamo stare nella prima stanza perchè c'era l'aria condizionata forte. La stanza è ampia per essere a NY, noi abbiamo prenotato una camera con vista e devo dire che era notevole, Empire State Building e altri grattacieli di notte davvero magici, quindi per questo ne è valsa la pena pagare un pò di più la camera.

title: Maggio a New York
text:
NYC bellissima..ci sono stata  una settimana. Bellissima  posizione a 5 minuti da Times Square . Di fronte a Port Authority..comoda anche  x la metro.Camere x 3 persone troppo piccine ma confortevoli molto  pulito ma strettino.
Ottima  la colazione anche se dovevi scendere presto perche dopo le 8.30 dovevi aspettare pochi posti a sedere inoltre con due sale di cui una con Ac al massimo e il caffe si ghiacciava all istante. Il resto tt di ottima qualità  e molto vasta  da accontentare tt. Personale cordiale e attenti alle tue richieste. Pecche dell hotel: camere x 3 persone troppo strette, non hanno il bidet cosa a noi italiani  molto gradita, poco accessoriata no bagnoschiuma solo schampo e saponette. In camera avevamo boul x acqua calda  e filtri caffe con 2 bott acqua  al di. Se scendevi x le 9.30 dovevi  aspettare xche 3 ascensori che andavano  su e giu continuamente sempre carichi. Al 23 piano bar con skyline bellissimo

title: Staff went out of their way to be helpful
text:
I stayed here three nights and everything was excellent. The first night we went up to the SkyRoom and took advantage of their Taco Tuesday & Margarita specials, which were very good and quite the bargain. We went early and enjoyed the views and the living room-like setting. We left as the music and activity were picking up. Our room was modern, spotless and quiet. The breakfast was ample and delicious. This is a convenient location as we walked to Times Square and the Javits Center, which are in opposite directions. 
The best part about staying here is the people. They went out of their way to be helpful. On the day I was departing, Uber had surge pricing and I was having problems connecting with Lyft. One of the men in the lobby told me about Juno, a new ride-sharing service, but they also had surge pricing. Then he double-checked with the concierge about an express bus shuttle direct to the Newark Airport. It was only $18 and was getting ready to leave as I walked up. I so appreciated their extra care and concern. A big tip of the hat to general manager, Jean Philippe, as he has not only trained his staff on the courtesies of helping a guest, but he exemplified it first-hand. Thank you! I look forward to staying at your hotel again.

title: Clean Property
text: The property as well as the guest room were very clean. Location was convenient for what I had to do for business. Front desk were very helpful in terms of advice on directions and getting around the city. Pricing is up there, but it is NYC. Elevators can be slow, especially in early evening when they are moving people to the rooftop lounge. Waited more than 10 minutes for an elevator - I'm a hotel guest!  The other people are only visiting the bar!

title: Excellent location, clean room but small
text: The hotel is located along with several others right opposite the bus terminal. The cleanliness in the room and toilet were excellent but it was a small room with hardly any place to move since it had 2 queen beds. Breakfast was average and involves waiting in a line since the cafe is small and everyone is offered free breakfast.

title: Sister and wife Birthday
text: Nina and Joe at the front Desk is Amazing a true asset to the company we are still here Staying another night because they are awesome we had plans to go to another hotel but they have shown us so much love and care it's truly comforting to be away from home and feel like I'm home thank you Joe Nina

title: Buena opción para disfrutar de Manhattan
text:
El hotel nos gustó mucho. Las habitaciones algo pequeñas pero compensa por su excelente ubicación a escasos minutos andando de Times Square, con boca de metro en la calle del hotel y con numerosas opciones de restauración en 8th Ave. Quizá lo peor un grupo de borrachos que se suelen situar en la misma acera del hotel a escasos metros de la entrada.
El desayuno es de lo mejor que he encontrado en mis viajes por USA incluidos en el precio del hotel.

title: Au top !!!
text: Tout est parfait! Chambre hyper confortable, petit dej génial, service de concierge à l’accueil qui a tout géré pour notre retour à l’Aeroport! Hôtel propre, beau et calme. Le must : idéalement situé à 5mn de l’Empire State Building et de Times Square. Super tarifs régulièrement.

title: Solid Option
text: We chose this hotel because of the location and Marriott rewards. We were pleased by the cleanliness, accommodating staff and friendly service. We liked that we could grab coffee anytime, plus the breakfast was surprisingly good with more options than expected. We’d stay here again.

title: Please do not stay here!
text:
The hotel is well located but the staff and service is terrible. I have stayed in marriot properties all around the world and this by far my worst experience. I have never stayed in such a bad hotel. Had to wait at least 30 minutes for the lift to come to my floor free calling the reception multiple times. The hotel front desk was directing the lifts and unresponsive to the needs of the guest. I was told a large group that is why I cannot come down. In the middle of the day, the lift was not coming up again and I called the front desk saying that my Uber is waiting. I was told this is NYC and an Uber should be called from the reception. I have stayed in hotels all over NYC and never faced this problem. Furthermore, the breakfast was all frozen food and the staff extremely rude and yelling customers while seating them. This was after the customers had waited 30 min to come downstairs.  

While checking in, we did not get our second room until 6:30 PM. When we asked for the front desk about this the manager said that we had requested rooms on the same floor and that is why the second room was not ready. He also said that they 200 othe rooms ready. 

This is the worst marriot hotel. Please do not waste your time and money here.

title: E agora ? Onde alojar minha família?
text:
Reservei pelo Booking 6 diárias e passei os dados do meu cartão Mastercard Black . Qual foi a nossa desagradável surpresa quando , após passarmos a noite inteira no avião vindo do Brasil , ao chegarmos a recepção do hotel , sermos informados que o hotel estava lotado e que a nossa reserva havia sido cancelada porque não conseguiram validar nosso cartão de crédito .. Isto é um absurdo , e uma inverdade porque , como disse , passei os dados de um cartão Mastercard Black sem limites . Agora imaginem a minha situação : a família inteira cansada pela longa viagem , um monte de malas para carregar e não termos onde ficar ..É justo isso ?
É correto ? Fiquei muito desapontado , e a única saída foi , por conta própria , arrumar um hotel de última hora , sem termos feito uma pesquisa e planejamento e pagando um absurdo porque está tendo um evento na cidade e os hotéis estão cobrando muito mais.

title: Wonderfull location
text: This hotel was a half a block from Penn Station.  We flew into Newark, NJ, took the NJ Transit from the airport to Penn Station in New York.  30 minute train ride.  It was easy to wheel our luggage to the hotel.  Our room was not ready, and because we were traveling as a family, they wanted to get us in adjoining rooms.  We checked our luggage with the concierge and went for a walk.  Our rooms were large, very clean, well equipped with all the essentials, and had good storage for a weekend worth of clothing.   The staff was always willing to offer assistance.  They had just opened the roof top bar on the 23 floor and believe me it is a beautiful view of NYC at night.    My daughter had arranged with the concierge to have a bottle of champagne, chocolates and balloons brought to our room the first night,to celebrate my birthday.  I think the staff had as much fun as I did with the surprise.

title: Great location and nice staff
text:
Our group stayed here for a trade show at the Javits Center. It’s a ten block walk to the show, and ten blocks to the center of Times Square. Great location. 
The rooms are very nice. 
Breakfast is included in the room charge. 
The elevators need an upgrade. Very slow and long waits. 
At night the breakfast area converts into a bar. 
Enjoy.

title: Du bon et du moins bon
text: Hotel tres bien situé, en plein centre à equidistance des attractions top of the rock,Empire state building,Macys...métro direct pour embarquement statue de la liberté. Literie super top.Mais petits soucis avec attente trop longue aux ascenseurs, et surtout petit déjeuner décevant,couverts en carton et plastiques,peu de patisseries,pas assez de choix ...pas à la hauteur pour un Marriot. Salle de bain :Après une journée de marche on peut espérer prendre un bain, impossible avec bonde bloquée Ca ne peut etre qu'intentionnelle.

title: Great Place to Stay - Pleasantly Surprised - Will Stay Again!
text: I travel to NYC probably once every 4-6 weeks for work and I tend to stay in the same places but when the rates rise I shop around.  I read the reviews for this hotel and they were pretty positive so I decided to book. The location is great for midtown if you want to be close to Times Square (but not so close you can still sleep), Subway and Penn Station. The check in process was very easy and the check out process was done using the app.  I stayed in a King size room on the 23rd floor.  The room was very comfortable and was set up well. I liked the night light above the bed and the fact there were plenty of USB ports and outlets in the right places. The bathroom was small but more than adequate. I liked the marble floors and walls that extended into the shower (which was also a tub).  Water pressure could have been better.  I would have liked to have more counter space for when you need to use the hairdryer but managed okay with my toliletries because they plenty of shelves. The hotel provides Paul Mitchell shampoo, conditioner and lotion which is a nice touch. Besides being well set up and clean,  loved the fact that it was super quiet at night and I could sleep.  This is very rare for NYC. The closer you to stay to Times Square the louder it is. The room also had complimentary bottled water and a Keurig although I preferred to get coffee downstairs at breakfast.  Breakfast was pretty impressive for being included in the hotel rate. You wait in line and they make sure they have tables.  They had hot items such as eggs and bacon, plus bagels, muffins, toast, fruit, individual yogurt, granola, and cereals.  They also served Starbucks coffee which was just as good as going to Starbucks. I opted not to get my room serviced in exchange for points. They gym is small, located in the basement but definitely adequate if you want a treadmill, a bike and an elliptical. The elevator can be slow.  On the first day one was broken so it took some time to get down.  The following day it was quicker. They do have valet but no in and out privileges and it's $67/day so you might want to park around the corner where the garage is only $55/day. This would be a great hotel for families if you can get a suite.  I will definitely add the Fairfield Inn on 40th to my list of go to hotels when I'm in Manhattan.  Thanks for making my stay great.

title: Consistently Responsive Staff
text: While meetings brings me to Manhattan on an ongoing basis, truth is that , I never need an excuse to be visit a city I love. When I do have need to spend the night in  NYC,   Fairfield Inn has become  my "go to"hotel. The friendly, responsive staff staff is one of the primary  reasons for that decision. Of course another reason continues to be  the location. Whether your destination calls for taking public transportation or better yet, walking, the W. 40th Street location is perfect.

title: Simply very good.
text: THis hotel is by no means a luxury option. But it is slap in the middle of things in Manhattan. Breakfast is economy-airline style, but it works ! And you can upgrade to a more yummie lunch experience later on after round 1 of shopping. Rooms are not large but they can swallow suitcases full of credit-card loot from the likes of Macy etc. Since the hotel is walkable from Penn station you are in convenient distance and travel time from both Newark and JFK airports. Times Square is close. And the Metropolitan Opera is a fast taxi run away.

title: Hotel perfetto
text:
Ho sggiornato presso questa struttura a fine aprile.
L'hotel è situato nelle vicinanze della stazione della metro di Columbus Circo e in zona tranquilla.
Le camere sono molto confortevoli, la colazione veramente ottima, pulizia accurata
Ma il fiore all'occhiello è  lo staff:gentile, attento e sempre pronto ad aiutare il cliente.
Ringrazio molto Robert per la sua gentilezza ed assistenza e Daniel per la sua cordialità 
Veramente un ottimo albergo da provare!

title: Excelente!
text: Localização excelente!  O metro é na porta do hotel! Muito comércio em volta, lojas, restaurantes, cafeterias, mercados, farmácia. Bem perto  do memorial, da estação de barcas para a estátua da liberdade e da Wall street. A limpeza impecável e café da manhã americano. Sempre que chegávamos no hotel tinha um mino para os hóspedes na recepção, um dia foi cookies quentinhos outro balinhas. Suíte novas e muito bem decoradas, com cama e travesseiros confortáveis, frigobar, secador de cabelo e cofre. Excelente atendimento! Com certeza essa escolha fez nossa viagem ser inesquecível! Recomendo!!

title: Tres bon hotel...
text:
Nous avons réservé notre chambre en Aout 17 et notre sejour était du 14 au 20 Avril...
En arrivant à l'aeroport j'ai reçu un mail que ma réservation était annulée..l'autorisation de payement n'était pas passé. ..Oups...après 2heures de taxi et 5 appels en route from JFK   nous avont enfin pu parler à quelqu'un. .ils ont repassé ma carte et tout est rentré dans l'ordre...Merci au Staff qui est tres aimable et efficace. ..très bon hôtel très très bien situé. ..petit déjeuner sympa ..café Starbucks offert toute la journée pres de la salle du pt.dej.. .
Grand merci à la dame de la conciergerie qui nous a aider pour notre taxi..je recommande cet hôtel. .

title: スタイリッシュなホテル
text: 典型的なマンハッタンのノッポホテルですので、部屋は大変狭いです。しかし、内装がスタイリッシュでアメニティもしっかりしています。ポートオーソリーバスターミナルに近いので便利な位置にあります。一歩大通りから外れたところだったので治安悪そうな雰囲気でしたが、夜でも安心でした。唯一残念なところは、朝食会場が狭いこと。壁に向かって座るカウンター席があっても混雑しており、構造的な問題ですね。フロントの人は実に懇切丁寧でした。

title: PERFECT !!!
text:
From check-in to check-out, everything was perfect. Friendly, professional staff, outstanding housekeeping and perfect location. This hotel is located mid-block so you have so many options - the end of the block has a subway station, two blocks to 42nd St and all the area has to offer - close to everything you need to make your stay convenient. The rooms are immaculate, including the bathroom, and the beds are very comfortable and, relative to NYC, the rooms are large. High floor rooms offer a view and the elevators are quick. Although close walking distance to everything, the hotel is very quiet at night. They offer a free breakfast - which is crowded but organized...you can also take out the free breakfast.
Everything about this hotel was PERFECT and I will definitely stay again !!

title: Хороший отель с прекрасным местоположением
text: Отель находится в центре города. При бронировании мы просили номер на высоком этаже, и нам его предоставили. Вид из окна был чудесен) Сам номер симпатичный, чистый и уютный. Немного бедноват завтрак (или просто надо пораньше вставать), но в любом случае голодными не останетесь.

title: Excellent Service
text:
I stayed here with my boyfriend for my birthday over the weekend, and was amazed with the staff. Check in was excellent- Anthony was very friendly and accommodating. At my last few stays in hotels I've had poor to average front desk interactions, so Anthony's welcome was very refreshing. I said I was tired, and he pointed me to the complimentary Starbucks coffee. I needed a food recommendation, he pointed me to a place 2 minutes away. He went above and beyond during my stay, even giving me a late checkout when my bus was delayed, which was a huge relief for me. The staff can make or break a hotel, and Anthony made my stay excellent.

The lobby was very pretty and modern. Starbucks coffee is complimentary, and there are multiple fantastic cafes on the block. 
Location is great- close to Broadway, Times Square, and the subway, but the street wasn't super busy.

The room had more traditional decor, but was functional and very clean. Honestly one of the first hotels where I didn't feel like I needed to sanitize the bathroom myself. There was towel folded as a pretty swan folded on the bed.
I didn't pay for the city view, but my view from the 24th floor was still pretty. I couldn't hear much outside noise, only when a loud horn or something honked. This is a big deal for me, because I live out in the country and don't sleep well in noisy environments; I slept fine.

Breakfast was complimentary, and had coffee, bread, yogurt, fruit, scrambled eggs, sausage, and a large selection of hot sauces. The eggs I got were way over-salted, and were the only negative thing I experienced during my stay. I'm guessing they were an mishap, as the omelet I exchanged them for tasted fine. The space is crowded, but they had a worker seating people as not to waste space and to maximize efficiency. 

Overall, it's a good hotel with excellent service. If I ever return to New York, I'd definitely stay here again.

title: Will stay again!
text: I traveled here as part of a large school trip. Hotel was fantastically located- everything a short walk away, including Times Square, pizza, coffee, pharmacy, liquor store, etc. Room was exceptionally clean, staff were very friendly. Breakfast was really good. Will defiantly stay here again when traveling to Manhattan!

title: Winner of the most smiles
text:
Everyone smile at this hotel.  From the greeting at the door to the staff on the floor...everyone smiles and seems genuinely friendly...A welcomed change...in a city that does not sleep.

The room was adequate and the overall service is good... but if there is one thing that I will remember about the stay is everyone smiles😎

title: Muy buena opcion
text: Tiene todo lo que necesitas para estar comodo aunque no hables el idioma, tiene desayuno y muy bueno, buena atencion en recepcion, te solucionan todo, por ejemplo yo perdi el candado de la valija y el personal de mantenimiento me lo solucionó. Todo impecable

title: Helt ok!
text:
Bodde här en vecka, ja dyrt tycker jag det är men så är ju tyvärr priserna i New York.
Personalen trevlig, bra städning i rummet.
Frukosten helt ok för att vara en frukost i Usa...tips mellan 09:00-10:00 är där köer till frukosten!
Hotellet ligger kanon om man vill gå till Times Square eller till tunnelbanan.

title: Fab spot near Times Square
text:
I stayed at this hotel for a night after returning from a trip to Spain.
It was about a 40 min drive from JFK via taxi. NYC’s taxis have a flat rate for when they pick you up/ take you to the airport which is very affordable and reasonable!
The hotel is located on 40th Street W,  which is like a 5 min walk or so from Times Square. It is also located across the street from a Bus Depot, which stays busy (but so does everything else in NYC)! If you are going to a show on Broadway or doing anything in Times Square, you are in a prime location for walking (if the weather is nice). If you desire to catch the metro, there is a location very close as well.
The hotel itself is very nice and modern. The interior decoration is nice. They have Starbucks coffee near the dining room area that they offer to guest complimentary. There is also a reception area for evening g snacks and wine.
My room was located on the 30th floor (it goes up to 32).  I had a city view room which gives you a beautiful view of the city. If you are not a fan of bright lights, don’t get this room.
It was a typical NYC size, which is small.  The bed was with a firm mattress, which I am a fan of. There isn’t a fridge or microwave, but there are plenty of restaurants nearby that delivers!
They have complimentary breakfast, but I had to check out early due to the snow storm that was on the way, so I can’t tell you about it. But the dining room was nice.
Due to the hotel being downtown, the building is very narrow, especially the hallways. Something to consider if you plan on bringing a lot of luggage or equipment.
The staff is amazing. Had to catch a cab when checking out due to the weather. The staff member at the desk went out and flagged one down for me, then assisted with loading my luggage. Little things like that makes your stay SO much more enjoyable.

title: Basic Hotel with Mediocre Front Desk service
text:
To start I found this hotel based on reviews and pricing that was reasonable compared to other properties in the area.

To be brief:  I found the bellman(valet) etc to be professional and attentive.  I found the housekeeping ladies to be very friendly and thorough.  

The room was clean and efficient.  

The front desk has poor follow up and follow through.  I had called down to complain about someone coming into my room without knocking while I was in the bathroom.  I was told they would look into it and do something for me.  Nothing was done.

The next morning I called down for my car and was told they would call me when the car was brought up.  I received no call even though my car had been down there for 15 minutes.

I won't be staying here again.

title: Great hotel
text: 2nd visit to this hotel and had a great stay. Staff are helpful and the room was great. Beds are spotless and comfortable, room was cleaned every day. Tried out The Sky bar this time, found it to have amazing views but expensive even for New York. Staff not very friendly behind the bar. Didn’t spoil our trip just didn’t go back. Great location,great breakfast, great hotel. Definitely would come back again. Excellent location too.

title: Lokasi strategis
text: Saya mendapatkan kamar yang tidak terlalu besar, tetapi cukup nyaman. Staff cukup membantu seadanya. Keunggulan hotel ini adalah lokasi yang strategi, sehingga sangat mudah untuk pergi dari titik ini.

title: Cool accommodation
text:
Right on the center of street 17 story high

Rooms: Avg size of 10x12 with a work desk and small closet 

In room coffee machine that never worked 

Small restaurant that serves breakfast. Min options for veggie 
Coffee all around but nothing after 9pm literally as they don’t have restaurant 

Friendly staff

AC central but noisy at times 

Easy access to Empire State bldg two blocks away
Underground three blocks away on 34th street

Overall good but pricy even by NY std for facility offered

title: Updated hotel, nice great staffs and well organized breakfast
text: Very nice updated room, location is close enough to everything. Breakfast area is well organized, if you don't want to wait to seat you can go on a different line and just get a to go box and pack whatever you want and leave.  Elevator get crazy at night because lots of people line up for the roof top bar, but staffs are very accommodate to make sure you get on right away.

title: Exceeded my expectations
text:
I usually stay at another Fairfield Inn in Manhattan but I feel fortunate to have found this location. Our flight was canceled due to weather twice - arriving and leaving and both times the reservation person and hotel staff were great in changing my reservation and not charging me extra - in fact I got a better price. There was even an extremely helpful man at the desk at 2:30 in the morning who was able to add another day to the two reservations I had.
It is a very busy location to be sure and it took a little persistence on my part to find the right person to help me with the changes I needed to make in getting the two rooms I had reserved next to each other but once I found him - he was great.
I wanted to give this hotel 5 stars but held out because I did have to ask a couple people before I found someone to help me get my rooms together - once I did it was no problem for him but it was like the other people I spoke to didn't want to be bothered. Also our second room was not really clean. Our first room was great - no issues but second one they had to come and change the bedding on one of the beds.
The double beds room was definitely tighter than the king room but both had more space than the Chelsea Fairfield. Noise level in the rooms was also much better. No earplugs on the nightstand here = )  We had two different floors, the 21st back of building and the 12th front of building. The back of the building was quieter but neither really had any view to speak of.
Breakfast was basic with variety in meat and fruit. The breakfast staff was always friendly and quick to clear your used items - which is nice. The one woman even brought my father-in-law a gift because she found out he was going to be having his 90th birthday soon. 
Took the express bus from Newark Airport which drops on 42nd and picks up on 41st and 8th so just a couple blocks to walk to the hotel. Also there is a subway entrance at 8th and 40th which is supper handy. Located far enough away from Times Square to avoid that mess if you choose to.

title: Un excellent rapport qualité/prix
text:
L’hotel est hyper bien situé à qqes metres de Porth Autority, station de métro, et de Times Square 
L’accueil est agréable, propre, la concierge très aidante.
Chambre au 15eme etage, de type familiale (2 queen size) , taille du lit un peu juste pour deux adultes quand on est habitué au 160cm. 
Propre, mobilier ok
Rangement un peu limité mais ok pour une semaine 
Salle de bain propre, avec baignoire, serviettes changées tous les jours, produits d’accueil disponibles mais qualité bas de gamme
Petit dejeuner ok meme si dommage que la variété des produits ne changent pas trop ou surcuisson des elements chauds (oeufs brouillés) 
Café Starbucks, jus d’orange quali (pas l’habituel mauvais tang plein d’eau)

Consigne dispo pour les bagages le dernier jour gratuitement 

En bref, un bon rapport qualité prix, nous recommandons sans souci

title: Un buen lugar
text: Está muy bien ubicado, es muy agradable, tiene buena atención y muy buen desayuno. Solo pasé una noche y lo reservé a último momento, por un cambio de vuelo. Eso hizo que consiguiera un precio más bajo que el habitual, porque de lo contrario me resultaba caro.

title: Muy buen hotel y excelente ubicación
text: Estuvimos 7 noches alojadas, 6 amigas en dos habitaciones dobles. El personal súper amable, el desayuno súper completo (aunque debería ser más amplio  el lugar para desayunar) y las habitaciones súper cómodas y limpias. Siempre nos dejaron 2 botellas de agua de cortesía y café para consumir a diario hasta 7pm.  Nos recibieron paquetes de Amazon que habíamos comprado y los guardaron sin problema. Lo recomendaría 100%! Claro está que el único punto negativo que tiene es que al estar sobre la calle 40th y la 8va avenida suele haber mucha gente en la calle y no es tan bonito pero nunca nos sentimos inseguras.

title: very good
text:
Date arrival 4/8-8/8/17
 The hotel is located about 10-minute walk to time square.
  The big advantage of this hotel its location. the hotel is very close to port authority bus terminal. so one day as we plan we take a direct bus to visit the mills at jersey gardas.it was very good.
 the hotel looks nice from the inside. the room was comfortable for 3 adults.  very comfortable beds. the breakfast was good and tasty. the staff were friendly and very helpful. they help me to fix booking mistake. we enjoy our stay. we take direct bus from port authority to Newark airport flying to Vegas it was very comfortable bus. wish you all the best

title: Fairfield Inn Times Sq
text:
I arrived very early, for my almost 10 hours flight arrived at 6am. The hotel let me enter the room as soon as I got there, so I didn't have to wait until 4pm. The catch was, it was a different room, smaller and didn't have a view, unlike the one I booked. The room was fine, it had 2 beds as I booked, good ones I might add, good shower. I found it odd that my 2nd floor room didn't have a window. I mean, The window was there but the curtains wouldn't open and the glass on the window weren't transparent. 
The hotel let us have the conplimentary breakfast the day we arrived, which was very kind and I appreciate it. The lines in the breakfast room can get big, but we never waited more than 5 min for a place to sit. All the employees coordinating the guests and tables were very kind and did an amazing job. Congrats to all of them! Breakfast is good, with bagels, eggs, cakes, Starbucks Coffee, no complaints. 
I stayed only 2 nights, but had an amazing time there.
Oh, before I forget, the location is good, right in front of Port Authority, which came in handy since I had plans to visit the outlets by bus. Also walking distance to Times Square.

title: Excelente
text: Quarto acomoda muito bem 2 adultos e 2 crianças. Aquecimento funciona muito bem. Muito bem localizado, em frente à central de ônibus ( que leva ao outlet) e meio quarteirão do metrô. Café da manhã excelente mas como o salão é pequeno depois das 8 às filas ficam grandes! Funcionários muito atenciosos. Encomendas recebidas sem cobrança.Voltaria com certeza.

title: Posizione  e colazione ottime
text:
Lo scorso Agosto ho soggiornato qui per 8 notti con la mia famiglia ( marito e due bimbe di 11 e 6 anni).
Ottima posizione, ci ha permesso di girare comodamente a piedi per ogni dove, e di godere anche la sera della magnifica vita di N.Y.C. 
Ottima colazione a buffet, provvista  anche di Nutella per la gioia delle bimbe.
Note negative:1) la mattina bisogna scendere abbastanza presto altrimenti si fa la fila per accedere ai locali per la colazione, in quanto con pochi posti a sedere.
2) camera veramente piccolapulitissima ma piccola per quattro persone.
Nonostante questo lo consiglio vivamente

title: Great Location Usual Marriott Standards
text: We are Marriott platinum members and have stayed at many Marriotts throughout the city. The best thing about this one is the location. The rooms are tight (you can find more spacious rooms at other locations in the city) and the usual breakfast but without the make your own waffles. The lobby is small but who spends time there. This hotel suited our needs to be close to the shows with typical Marriott standards.

title: Lovely stay
text:
We recently stayed here for 5 nights and had a lovely stay. The hotel is very clean, beds are comfortable and the location is great.

Breakfast is included in the price and there is a good selection - although it can get very crowded. 

The main downside is that all of the plates, knives, forks, etc... at breakfast are paper or plastic and disposable. Terrible for the environment!!....and so I would suggest that the hotel has a think about using non disposable items.

title: Excelente Ubicacion
text: Excelente Ubicación, pieza algo estrecha si llevas muchas maletas quedaras muy apretado pero en si son cómodas las habitaciones y las camas muy ricas., muy buen servicio. A Pasos del terminal de buses

title: Excellent
text:
Hôtel à 2 pas de Times square, super petit déjeuner copieux ,superbe chambre avec vue imprenable, le personnel est adorable.
Très propre, literie très confortable je renouvellerais volontiers l’expérience.

title: Voor herhaling vatbaar
text:
Een super centraal gelegen hotel,vriendelijk behulpzaam personeel, en voor Amerikaanse normen een super ontbijt.
Propere nette kamer,enkel de kamer met 2 bedden was klein voor 3 personen de grote kamer was fantastisch
Wij komen zeker terug!!

title: decent stay
text:
Front desk: staff listen & communicate well.

Public space: out of 3 elevators, only 2 were for guests.  The other one was for rooftop, a revenue center.  During the rush hour, there's a long wait for elevators.

Room: the shower was rather tight.  Instead of a real fridge, hotel decided to use a small beverage cooler.  The earplugs were a nice touch, but what would that suggest?

Breakfast: decent offers, nothing breathtaking.

Gym: small but got everything that I needed.

Overall, decent location & experience.  However, the small bath was slightly disappointing.

title: Excellent stay
text:
I had a wonderful stay at this Fairfield with my daughter. The room, although small if there is more than two, was comfortable and had everything we needed from drink cooler in the nightstand to foam ear plus left for you, hairdryer, safe, iron & ironing board and a bottle of water each day for each of us!

The location was great, not even five minutes from Madame Tussauds & Dave & Busters and literally across the street from the Port Authority from where we took a $14 return bus ride to Jersey Gardens Mall (about 35 minutes each way). There is Pizza by the Slice place just steps away and plenty of other food options if you want something quick. The hotel provided complimentary breakfast which was better than average and tea/coffee facilities in the lobby and in your room.

The staff were kind, helpful and gracious.  Even though the lobby is not big there is enough space for a Concierge who helped us secure tickets to a Broadway show and with tour information. I had several packages sent to me at the hotel and was happy to see there was no package receiving fee! The room was  ready for us when we arrived at 12:00 and they also allowed me a late checkout of 2:00.  Really great service!

I picked this hotel because of the good price and location and favorable reviews and am so glad I did. Would definitely recommend!

title: hotel excelente, vizinhança ruim
text: A vizinhança é ruim; por causa da estaçao de onibus, ficam varios mendigos na esquina, mas apenas nessa rua; se nao fosse por isso, diria que a localizaçao e otima; mas o Hotel é muito bom, uma vez la dentro, os quartos sao bons, cama confortavel, banheiro com bom chuveiro; O Staff é sensacional, fazem a gente se sentir acolhido. desde a recepção, gerencia ate arrumadeira dos quartos; O cafe da manha muito bem organizado, tem espera na entrada e em seguida o hospede é direcionado para uma mesa. Nao fica uma luta pra achar lugar. Cafe do Starbucks;  Enquanto estávamos la, fomos convidados pra uma noite de queijos e vinhos, parece que o hotel oferece um happy hour por semana; Sala de ginastica 24h, pequena mas com aparelhos novos

title: Per noi ottima scelta
text: Hotel pulito ,con personale gentile,stanze nn grandissime,ma noi eravamo in 4 perciò comunque numerosi.Colazione ottima con vasta scelta x tutti i gusti ,non le solite brioche.Non abbiamo avuto il problema dell'attesa il sala colazione perché  uscivano presto per nn perdere niente della città,avendo solo 6 gg.Rooftop bar molto carino riservato agli adulti (+21) con bel panorama.Consigliato

title: Superb
text:
My wife, daughter and I spent 2 nights at this fabulous hotel. Everyone went out off their way to make us and everyone feel welcome from the valet that parked the car to the front desk people that checked us in to Yvette, the breakfast hostess. Even the staff that kept the dining room spotless to anyone we had any contact with,it was always friendly. The room was clean and well kept and a pleasure to stay in.
On our 1st night, there was a complimentary wine and cheese that was well set up and the staff explained the wines, the cheeses and the rest of the nibbles.
All in all, we had a very, very pleasant stay.
Thank you

title: Posizione strategica, colazione ricca, prezzo ottimo
text: La posizione è veramente ottimale a soli 5 minuti da Times Square, a 200m la fermata della metro con 4 linee, andando verso la 5th avenue trovate altre due fermate della metro con tutte le linee. L'albergo è confortevole, la colazione molto ricca, presente bollitore in camera e due bottigliette di acqua gratuita a notte e prodotti bagno comprese salviette struccanti. il Prezzo veramente ottimo e all'angolo con la 8th avenue il pub Beer Authority che consiglio.

title: A good place to stay nearby Times Square
text:
Location near Times Square and yet not much crowded next by the port authority Bus terminal.
Surprisingly spacious and clean Room.
If you are on a business rush trip, you may face delay on the breakfast, waiting in line for your turn.

title: belle surprise
text:
Très bien placé à 2 pas de Time square. On s y sent bien. 
Petit dej copieux ( il faut y aller tôt) literie impec le personnel discret mais disponible.
Silencieux malgré la boite sur le toit. 
Une belle adresse à retenir.

title: l'abbiamo scelto per la sua vicinanza a Time Square
text:
Ottima la posizione vicina ai teatri di Broadway dove avevamo prenotato per lo spettacolo del mitico Boss! Abbondante la colazione, anche se non  eccessivamente varia. Camere comode e pulite,personale accogliente e sempre disponibile. Buono il wi fi anche nelle camere ed apprezzabile il rapporto qualità/prezzo.
Unica "pecca" la finestra sigillata con carta stagnola!

title: A pleasant surprise
text: I'm a Marriott Platinum member and have had hit or miss luck with Fairfield Inns. This location is top notch. The room was spacious by New York standards (six feet of walking between the bed and bathroom!), all of the furniture and fixtures were clearly recently renovated/replaced, the TV is one of the new Marriott models with Netflix, and, as I was given a corner room on a high floor, it was incredibly quiet. As noted, the location is excellent - just far enough from Times Square to be away from noise and nonsense, but a couple of quick blocks to get there (also, there is better food, like the Westfield Diner, on 9th). As a bonus to this good experience, the room was also exceptionally low-priced (granted, it was January, but I love the cold so I'd rather visit then, anyway) and well, well, WELL worth the $155 per night. I usually prefer a full-service Marriott, but this might be my new go-to choice when in the city. Also, I am not a breakfast person, but theirs seems to be unusually generous for the price of free.

title: Average hotel with very good location and some terrible check in staff
text:
The hotel is very near Times square and just a walk over the street to port authority bus terminal.

The room we stayed in (4 adults) was to small, the room and the comfortable beds was to small, not enough space to put your luggage and jackets.

The A/C when turned on is very noisy, so the other good thing is the big TV!.

Breakfast was good, but the same for 2 weeks, got a little bit boring i must say.

Cleaning staff and the staff when we did eat breakfast was very nice, but some of the check in staff where very unprofessional, the only positive here is that they checked you in very fast.

When i checked in i was told that i had to pay the first nights room fee to ensure the reservation, i agreed and payed.

After a week our room was locked, i thought it was a mistake and i contacted the check in staff.

They told me that the room has been locked due to my card was declined, i thought this was a joke, because my card was not blocked (I contacted my bank later and got that confirmed), but they refused to lock our room and kept claiming that my card was declined, so i was "forced" to pay with my mastercard and losing over 30 min of my day.

When asked what kind of service this was, and when told i already payed for the first night to get my stay ensured, they told me that was not the case, i had paid 200 dollars to ensure the reservation.

They told me that was their policy, i told them, so the policy is to lock your costumers from their rooms with false claims? They did not answer, but said that i must not think that they would fool me, but that was exactly how i felt and told them so.

They could have put a note on my door, or in my room to contact the reception, knock on my door or call when i was back in my room, this was a very rude way to treat your costumers, i have never experienced this kind of behavior anywhere in the world.

I would chose this hotel for its location, and not chose it for the some rude check in staff, your choice.

title: The best place to stay in Manhattan
text: Lovely stay at this hotel. Such friendly staffs, clean confy room with a great view. Water and coffee in the room, clean bathroom with toiletries. Room cleaned and new towels daily. Anything you would want for breakfast (omlette, sausage, bagels, yoghurt, fruits, butter, cheese, oatmeal, nuts, cornflakes, cookies, tea, Starbucks coffee and hot chocolate, skim/soy/cream milk, honey, peanut butter, waffles and breakfast syrup). Never waited too much for the elevators. Breakfast can be taken to go though they have a lovely sitting area. Wifi works great and luggage storage is available. Definitely  recommend.

title: Recomendable 100%
text: Muy buena ubicacion, excelente atencion, sobre todo de Antony en la recepcion y de la encargada de limpieza, de nuestro piso. Buen desayuno, con fruta, platos calientes y panaderia. El cafe muy bueno. Habitaciones comodas y limpias. Reciben paquetes sin ningun problema. Lo recomiendo sin dudas.

title: Can't beat the price or the location!
text: Just a few blocks walking distance from Times Square. This was a wonderful place to stay and hard to beat the deal. When looking for accommodations it was hard to find anything in New York under $100. But when I went to book this hotel it was right in that ballpark. The room was comfortable and quiet with a huge flat screen TV. Breakfast was wonderful. would definitely stay here again.

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: I really had a great stay at the Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Times Square.  From the moment, I entered the hotel the person that make the check in make me feel I was home.  The location of the hotel is nice, near the subway entrance, walk distance from time square.  The room was clean with lots of usb port to charge my phone, tablet, smartwatch and all my gadgets.  Definitely, I will go back to the Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Times Square.

title: Very good location and breaksfast
text: Very good location! Subway (A, C and E) on the same block, others just a few blocks, at Times Square. Easy to go everywhere. If you want to avoid tourist areas to meals, you can go to 9th avenue and try many different restaurants. Breakfast very good, a small place but very organized.

title: Hotel em Nova Iorque
text: Os quartos são bem limpos, camas confortáveis d cheirosas, o atendimento na recepção e pelos mensageiros é muito cordial, o café da manhã é super bom e tem variedade pra agradar vários gostos. A localização é ótima, próximo de tudo, metrô, rodoviária e pontos turísticos.  Já estive hospedada no Fairfirld por duas vezes e super recomendo!!!

title: Fair hotel for a fair price
text:
The Hotel is adequately located next to the port authority and not too far away from Times Square and The Garden so very convenient for walking.

The room whilst compact was very nice, clean with a very big TV and bed the amenities where excellent I cannot fault the room one bit.

The hotel offers free Breakfast for all guests and the range offered was excellent, from scrambled eggs and sausage, to cereals, toast and yoghurts.

My only issue with the Hotel was the lifts one was broken, and the other two took far too long on occasions and often they stopped at every floor when nobody wanted to get in.

Had the lifts been working this would have been a 5 star review.

title: Some good Some not so
text:
Good : checking in is swift and friendly 
Room is clean, comfortable, huge tv, plenty of places for clothes
Bathroom good size and clean and decent pressure in the shower, clean soft towels 
Facilities everything is pretty much catered for 
Location - GREAT short walk to a ghost bar, time square, broadway everything 

Not so good 
Lifts !! I was only on the 7th floor and was on average waiting 15 minutes - going up to the rooms depending on time you may have to wait your turn - one lift not working at all in the four days we were there - don’t offer me cookies- get the thing fixed 
Entrance - doors also broken so had to use small side door
Breakfast - WORST I’ve ever come across - paper plates, bearly warm rubber scrambled egg- turkey sausage was not fit for a dog let alone what ever it was they called bacon - no continental offerings- it was so bad I ate elsewhere 

Price - this is difficult as on location it is good value but the lifts and breakfast let it down and would put me off staying he again

title: Excellent Location
text: Excellent stay for one night on business trip. Very close to Midtown Manhattan and Times Square, yet far from all the rumbling noise. Very quiet rooms. Also the rooms themselves are spacious enough, with comfortable beds, and speedy internet in the rooms. Spending my time in the room to finish work, was not a problem :)

title: This Hotel is clean, good customer service, good location in Mid-Manhattan New York
text:
Nice upper floor location with view of Empire State Building. Clean and good customer service. However, the free breakfast they serve everyday was the same hot meal we have eaten for for five nights stay we have in this Hotel. The management has to look for a better alternatives to improve their breakfast menu at least every other day.
Because we stayed before and during Christmas 2017, it was a little bit pricey.
 Only two elevators out of three are working at the time of our stay and very slow.

title: Customer Service is HORRIBLE!
text:
I unfortunately have to give this hotel a Terrible review. I had no issues with my stay, it was fine.  However, I unfortunately left behind my FitBit charger when I checked out last week and have been calling for literally 5 days to get my property back.  When I called the first time I spoke to Claudia who told me that a charger had been found in the room I checked out of on that day but that I needed to call back because the Housekeeping employee with access to the Lost and Found area was not in.
So, I call back and Claudia answers again and puts me on hold.  Then another front desk agent picks up, I believe his name was Carlos.  I again explain the reason for my call and I received better customer service from him, he seemed to care more or so I  thought.  He took my information and told me he'd call me back shortly.  Needless to say I never received a call back.
As I type this review I am on the phone with the hotel now.  Claudia answered again today and when I told her why I was calling she proceeded to put me on hold for 10 minutes and 23 seconds.  There is no on-hold music or pre-recorded info, so you really don't know if you're still connected.
Finally someone from housekeeping answered and I am now reaching 26 minutes on this phone call with 99% of it being on hold.
I mean this is RIDICULOUS!!!
What's ironic is that I worked for a luxury brand under the Marriott International umbrella for 10 years in upper management positions at several properties!!! So, I know the process and protocol for how these employees should be comporting themselves. Epic FAIL!!!
I suppose their training hasn't included the fact that customer service goes beyond a guests' stay.

Oh and yes I am still on hold!  WOW... 34 minutes!!!  Very sad.  Maybe I'll get a response from the AGM Julia V. as well... I won't "hold" my breath...

title: My 'Marriott Experience'.  Happy Christmas, Ha, Ha. Is Lift 1 Working Yet?
text: Paid a lot of money for a lousy stay. Comfy bed and beautiful room cleaning and breakfast attendance staff that is it. One lift of 3, for 34 levels of guests, and to get patrons to the nightclub on the top floor,  and cleaning staff and equipment around, was not working for the entire 11 days I was there. Reasons varied - it will be fixed in a couple of days, to staff who said it hadn't been working for weeks, to eventually signs in the lift and out the front of the lift in the lobby saying that they got it wrong, the lift was to undergo annual maintenance, and to come to drinks and nibbles at 4pm. Why would you plan maintenance at Christmas time? Why was the lift not working in the interim? Why was I not told of this before booking and paying a lot of money so that I could to make an informed decision and go elsewhere? Up to half hour waits for lifts up and down, many folks getting in and going up to ensure getting down. On my last day, a couple set off down the stairs - 27 levels - they commented that 17 minutes waiting was more than enough. On Christmas morning there was nothing special - no greetings, no nothing. Oh yes there was. They ran out of bowls so we ate cereal off cardboard/disposable dinner plates, and they ran out of hot food. Something to do with ordering and holidays, the manager advised. Not our problem, we had all booked and paid well in advance. You are a hotel. People stay in holiday periods. Duh? So rug up, and out in the cold, to buy breakfast/a meal, and bring the receipt back, said Mario, and we will reimburse you. Ha, no one was interested in that - the front desk person told me that it was not his problem and to email Mario. Please keep my voice down and then just totally ignored me. I emailed Marriott USA. What a joke. Lots of talk and advertising bull...about the Marriott experience, but no substance. Mario had attended to me, they said. No he hadn't and still hasn't. Finally on my last day - a week after Christmas, and after asking every day and being ignored, Carlos lifted the cash tray and pulled my receipt out where it had been stashed and gave me the cash equivalent. Felt very weary, embarrassed but determined by this stage. What is my Marriott experience ? - a damn expensive and regret I did it experience. Fury at the total couldn't give a s.. dismissal by Marriott corporate staff. Lots of words about the Marriott experience. One lift of 3 totally out of action from well before arrival, according to staff, and still when I left. Sharing a lift with folks going to the nightclub on the 34th floor - yes, nightclub patrons sharing a lift with hotel guests and having access to accommodation floors.  One occasion, just me, and 6 solid men. They could have gotten out at my floor and I had no way of stopping them/seeking assistance. No key/access security for floors in the lifts - the first person into the lift put their card into the swipe and we all could then select any and all of the 34 floors to go to. Waiting and waiting and waiting for lifts. Watching the hotel staff manage entry to the lifts on the days the night club was open to ensure they all got there quickly and shoving as many of them in with me and other hotel guests as they could. Coming back to my room to find a restaurant menu shoved under my door - level 27. It appears no security or management of access to floors. One day an announcement over the PA system telling us that one of the remaining 2 lifts was not working, for at least an hour and walk if possible. Great. Even longer waits. Massive queues for breakfast. People in pajamas at breakfast. Lots of talk and not an ounce of action - oh yes, Marriott said, 40,000 points for my stay. No thank you, I have had a Marriott experience. I don't ever want another one. It ruined my Christmas. Why would I ever stay again? Of just as much concern, as a paying guest for 10 nights, and a Marriott member (not for much longer), why was I not asked to provide a review? All reviews are glowing on the Marriott site. Why is my review and those of other furious folks not included?

title: Right Across the Street from the Bus Terminal Port Authority
text: Stayed here 3 nights during the blizzard of Jan. 3-4. Convenient walking distance to most locations. The self-serve hot breakfast was wonderful! Much better than trying to find a restaurant and standing up to eat. Only eight rooms per floor. They have 3 elevators, but only 2 were working when we were there. The porter was pleasant and helpful. Parking was $67/day. Rooms were adequate size, clean and well-maintained. Would stay here again.

title: Fantastic Penthouse Suite for our family
text:
I have stayed at this property many times during my business trips. There were also a couple of time when my family had joined me. It serves its purpose....clean rooms, shower, free hot breakfast, with great access to public transportation (Port Authority was just a few steps away). 

For this visit, we timed it for us to check in on New Year's Day. Julia V. took care of our needs. We informed her of our planned arrival, and that we were staying there for 5 nights. We stayed in a very comfortable Penthouse Suite, very roomy for my family. We had great view of Midtown (Time Square). We were also there during the blizzard, and there were no issues at the hotel at all. 

The staff were very accommodating with our needs, and had a smiling face whenever we  spoke with them. For a hotel in Times Square, this was such a great value whether you are paying in cash, credit card, or using points. We love going to the theatre, and watch 11 Broadway shows during the 1 week in NYC. This was the perfect location to be close to the Theatre District.

I wasn't surprised that I chose this hotel for our vacation, and was so glad I made that choice. Thank you, Julia, for taking care of my family. We hope to return again someday soon.

title: Anniversary
text:
We stayed for 4 night for our anniversary. The staff was super nice and very helpful. The night manager Joe is awesome and attentive . The rooms were clean and also quiet for sleeping. The housekeepers were very friendly and asked several times if they can provide us with anything. No extra hidden fees was a plus. Continental Breakfast buffet with large variety of foods. Free Starbucks coffee and free water w/lime. Rare to get anything free in NYC! We even received a small gift bag w/gourmet chocolate and an anniversary card hand signed by staff. Sweet touch! The sky room club was a bonus when we wanted to go out but not leave the hotel. As it implies you can see the skyline and beautiful views of NYC. Lounge style couches with sky views. 

Location was great. Super close to Times Square main attraction. Within walking distance, not immediately in the action but close enough. Two Subway entrances around the corner close.

Only downside was the elevators during busy time. Only 2 out of the 3 were working. But honestly that was not a big deal. Definitely not a deal breaker. 

Decor was modern, clean lines, very upscale looking. Mattress was extremely comfortable. Plenty of pillows, plenty of towels. Heat worked perfect. 

We would definitely stay here again!

title: Christmas Getaway
text: Although one of the elevators was broken and they charge $55.00 we day to valet park and once you hand your keys over you can not get your car until check out our stay was bug free and pleasant. The rooms are small however they are clean. The free breakfast is wonderful and although it’s very busy they have a great seating system. The location was great as well. It took a very long time to get my car from valet at the end of our 2 night stay but that was my biggest complaint so I would definitely recommend the Fairfield Inn!

title: NYC
text:
I am a Marriott rewards member,  so  needless to say,  I want to earn points so I try to choose Marriott properties for vacations.    I am very satisfied with my decision to stay here!!   The staff was very accommodating,  room was clean,  amenities excellent!!  Also,  since I was driving in from Buffalo,  I was VERY ANXIOUS about driving in the city,  so I was VERY pleased with the location as I dodged most of the city driving fears!   This hotel was literally right off the Lincoln tunnel.   Two turns and I was at the front door,  where I took advantage of the valet parking.    Parking is always expensive in NYC,  but for me,  was worth it!   I was greeted with a glass of wine and a cookie!   Nice touch and well needed after my drive.     
I had a double room for 3 guests,  was a bit cramped,  however tolerable.   Very clean and comfortable.  The rates were very reasonable at this time of year!    Was on the outskirts of Times Square,  so very reasonable location for everything!   The only cons I had were,  the elevator situation,  VERY VERY small inside and VERY long waits!   One elevator was out of order,  so that definitely made the situation worse!   And.. .. There is a complimentary breakfast,  HOWEVER,  the lines were a mile long each day we were there!   It really irritated me.   Overall though,  it was a positive experience!

title: Should be a 3.5 star review...
text:
Stayed at this hotel for 3 days with my wife & 2 teenage kids. PROS: The room is typically small (NYC hotels of this calibre) for 4 people, but I expected it that so that's OK. The breakfast is pretty good with a wide variety of choices (cereal, scrambled eggs, fresh fruit, Chobani yogurts, etc, etc. !!!). We like having hearty breakfasts & this was a great way to start the day. Coffee is from Starbuck's & available from breakfast til 10:00 pm. If you do not wish to wait to get a table in the breakfast room, make sure you go before the crowds. There are line-ups to get a seat if you go after 8:30 a.m. We'd like to mention that the ladies managing the breakfast room are very efficient, professional & personable. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from Times Square, Bryant Park, subway stations-well situated if that's what you like. It is also situated right next to a parole office so there can be some sketchy characters in the neighborhood, but nothing to fear as the street is very busy from all the other hotels & Port Authority Bus Terminal across the street. We came & went at all hours without any incident.
CONS: There are 3 elevators in this hotel & 1 of them was not functional while we were there. There are 31 floors in this hotel so the wait times for the elevators was 10-15 minutes !!! If you can, ask for a low floor so you can walk up & down from your room. If you drive there: Parking fee of $67/day + tax is ridiculous, even for NYC. They valet your car onto an outdoor lot so while we were there, there was a blizzard & my truck was covered in snow. The hotel (Staybridge Suites Times Square) right next to this one has a $35/day parking fee & the Port Authority Bus Terminal lot charges a $50/day tax incl. fee. Only found out about that one at the end of my stay. Shop around on the internet before coming to NYC, you will get a better rate & get peace of mind. I've reached out to the hotel Manager about the fee & did not get any response. 
We got a great rate for our 3 day stay so all things considered, our experience was good. If not for the elevator situation & parking fee being a little more reasonable, this would have been a 4 star review. I would recommend this hotel.

title: 舒適的空間地點方便
text: 坐機場巴士到中央車站下車走路5分鐘可到達走路到時代廣場約10分鐘,下午3:30check in時櫃台很貼心的給了小禮物有餅乾和糖果還有水房間很大床很舒服!!

title: Disappointing
text:
Very disappointed in the hotel, now let me be very clear, its New Years weekend, you have an elevator that is not working and over a million people coming into the Times Square Area? Unacceptable, my family and I waited at one point on the 26th floor for over 30 minutes, to the point we took the stairs, yes that right the stairs down 26 floors!  During our stay another elevator shaft was broken as well leaving the hotel with one working elevator. 

Free Breakfast-Sure if you want to wait in line for a month, on top of this the hotel is, well tired, it is a Marriott and being a Platinum Elite Member I thought I would get the rooms I reserved, nope my kids, teenagers mind you had to share a king, yeah that went well. Although our stay in NYC was great, the hotel was a continued source of anger and frustration for all of us.

title: Friendly staff, decent location and affordable room rate make it an adequate choice when visiting NYC
text: Curb appeal and lobby are just ok but accomodations were very comfortable and had no issues with noise at all (we were quite high up~26th floor). Major plus...They stored our bags upon arrival so we could start exploring even thought our room wasn't ready until mid afternoon. Location was just about perfect! We could literally walk to everything or catch the train.
