Most people will head straight to Times Square but if you are looking for a more authentic experience try turning left out of the hotel and explore that area. We found Rudys (dive bar) which was super fun and also the amazing Thai restaurant (hotel recommended). Fairfield room rate was excellent and the main reason I booked here because New Years Eve weekend was pricing out at like 400 a night!  Staff was helpful and really did their best to make sure they were meeting our needs at all times including making sure my husband had a great view as a first time visitor to NYC to recommending the best THAI restaurant EVER! Breakfast was OK and it's free so no complaints from me however it is extremely tight spacewise. The Starbux coffee is def a nice touch. There is a nice Sky room bar on top of the hotel that was fun to visit at happy hour. Beers are 5 dollars and there is a nice view. Hotel guests need to get stamped before heading up and attire at Sky room is business casual. The complaints about the elevators are true. Only two are working and they are SMALL. My advice is to expect to have a slight wait during busy times and honestly I'm really impatient and I was able to deal with it. Loved the toiletries that were provided. In Summary,  If you are looking for super BLING then this isn't the hotel for you but if you like to get the most bang for your buck then this just might be the right up your alley! FYI...there were a few reviewers who commented on Port authority being across the street. I never found this issue to be a problem and felt safe at all times. I used the location info as marker when getting off the subways and knowing where to exit...follow the port authority on 40th signs!! Safe travels everyone:)

title: Absolutamente recomendable.
text:
Salida con amigas.Estadía  desde el 24 de septiembre al 3 de octubre 2017. Habitación cómoda, muy limpia aunque el tamaño era un poco justo para 3 personas.  
La habitación disponía de un pequeño frigobar  y de una cafetera (realmente muy útil). Diariamente reponían cafe, azucar, crema, además de agua embotellada. Esto se agradece al llegar al hotel después de un día de caminata.
El desayuno estaba incluido en el costo de la estadía, abundante y con opciones para todos los gustos (aunque no muy variado).
Todo el personal muy atento y educado.
Lo mejor de todo, la ubicación.  Realmente  cerca de muchos lugares para visitar caminando, y a pasos de estación de metro y buses. Absolutamente ecomendable.

title: Bom custo benefício
text: Hotel muito bem localizado, pertinho da Times Square. Os quartos são limpos e de bom tamanho para os padrões de NY. O hotel recebe as encomendas da internet e guarda aguardando sua chegada. Ponto fraco é o café da manhã que apesar de ter o Starbucks como referencial, não tem muita variedade de comida, sem contar a enorme fila de espera pra sentar em um pequeno espaço que não comporta o tanto de hóspedes que o Hotel tem. Me hospedaria novamente apenas pela excelente localização e pelo custo que é bem justo pelo padrão do Hotel.

title: Vale somente pela localização
text: O café da manhã é razoável, o chuveiro é bem ruim e o quarto apertado. Terrível é o elevador, algumas vezes ficamos 15 minutos (literalmente) esperando em nosso andar que era o 26o. O hotel não é bom, mas o preço vs. localização para quem só usa o hotel para tomar banho e dormir pode valer a pena.

title: Natale a NY
text:
Ho vissuto 5 gg nel pieno cuore di Manhattan...hotel con una posizione centrale, molto accogliente, con camere non grandissime,  ma comode per trascorrere qualche giorno, pulite e sempre in ordine. Bagno comodo dotato di ogni confort .
Colazione abbondante, ma per niente varia e attesa x avere un tavolo se non ci di presenta all' apertura...le due salette offrono circa 70 coperti ! La mia camera era sl 16' piano e l'ho trovata silenziosa .Consigliatissimo anche perché in una fascia media come prezzo ed adeguata per l'offerta

title: Permanenza piacevole
text:
L’hotel di trova in ottima posizione a 100 m dalla metropolitana e a 2 passi da time Square.
La colazione era molto buona, anche se la sala è un po’ piccola per il numero di stanze.
Personale garbato e gentile.
Stanza impeccabile tutti i giorni.

title: Fairfield Hotel was excellent
text: Excellent service , great location and the breakfast buffet is awesome! Front desk and bellman provide superb service!! Definitely would stay here again :) very honest and knowledgeable staff :) awesome:)

title: Great time thanks to great staff!!
text: Returned to Ny and decided to stay near Times Square and so happy with the decision to stay here!! Claudia the front desk agent was so friendly and helpful, not to mention nice eye candy 👀. Keep it up

title: Well Run Fairfield Inn, No Major Hitches nor Huge Surprises
text: We found the room (2802) to be clean, comfortable and well serviced throughout our 4-day stay in early December.  The breakfast room was clean and well managed as well.  It had to be to efficiently seat everyone when the hotel it at or near full capacity.  There is a roof top bar open to the public at night that we never visited, but it caused the elevator service to be spotty and slow as one of the 3 elevators was out of service during our entire stay.  We were told it was in need of a major repair and that is why no one was working on it.  The only downside for those of us who make use of UBER for our transportation is its location next to the main artery feeding the Lincoln Tunnel.  Drivers had to deal with heavy traffic to reach us at the hotel in spite of cruising in the vicinity.  Bottomline:  Your get what you would expect from a well-run mid-priced Marriott property.

title: Ok. There is better
text: Stayed 2 nights. Good location. Rooms adequate. Euro tight. Has sky club on roof which is ok but no big deal really. Another bar on ground floor which was a joke. A bartender that does not know a Cabernet from his butt is really not helping things. Only 1 wine glass available though only 5 people at the bar. Ridiculous. Made it up to us with huge pours into tall glasses. This same room doubles as the free breakfast room. Just stupid. Breakfast was awful with rubbery eggs etc. surely we can do better. Room small. Bathroom smaller. A long wait for elevators. Staff actually helpful but building is overwhelmed by staff and guests and people going to the  sky bar.

title: The Best you can find in NYC
text:
We reserved in the other web page starting with "B".
Great surprise!!! A wonderful Hotel in the center of Manhattan, no more than 10 minutes walking to Times Square, and 3 minutes to the nearest underground station. Who wants more?

Polite nice and helpful staff. 
After a long journey, arriving tired and find in the lobby a free fountain with cold water, was like being in a Oasis.

Nice rooms, no too big, but this is normal in hotels in Mahattan. Very clean and tidy, not only the rooms but also all the building. 
Our room window was at the back, with residential buildings, and water tanks, we could also see the top of the Empire State Building from there. By night was great, I played with my niece to look for Batman there!!!

Breakfast included with the reservation. Is great to find hotels in Manhattan including breakfast. You can choose between take away breakfast or have it in the restaurant.
The restaurant is not big enough to serve all the people at the same time, so sometimes you have to wait no more than10 minutes to have a seat. You can taste Starbucks coffe in your breakfast, two o three kind of cereals, sausages, bacon scrambled eggs, yoghurt, fresh fruit... Quite varied menu.

Our stay in Fairfield Inn Suites, was wonderful. Next time we'll back to NYC will repeat our stay.

Excellent price/quality relation.

title: Birthday in December
text:
Brought my guy to the Big Apple for his birthday. Chose this location because it is located in mid-town. 

Location- located steps away from the bus terminal, short walk to the subway, about a 10min walk to Time Square or 15-20min to Empire. 

Staff- friendly, helpful and available

Room- King bed a plus, surprised with the space - roomy for NY. 

Cleanliness- good

Safety- good

While we didn't spend much time in the room the location, space and cost worked well with our purpose of site seeing, getting around and having a nice bed to sleep on.

title: John at the Reception ... nightmare
text:
I'm a frequent travel and I have never found a so unprofessional receptionist as John at this hotel. He was not able to swipe a credit/debit card ... he didn't know how to use the chip side of it and he was very arrogant and sarcastic.
The hotel is working with only two elevators ... which means... long waiting .
SPG? 
They have no idea how to do it
Breakfast?
Ahahahaahahahahahaha breakfasts .. but the ladies are very nice, especially one lady, who sounds like the most experienced there.
Rooms?
Awful 
Position?
Very good 
SkyBar?
Nice

.... coming back? Never
... John?
Forget it ....

title: Location, location, location
text: Am a frequent guest at this conveniently located Manhattan hotel. From the minute you enter and engage with the front desk, what you find are staff there to provide excellent service. Everyone is extremely friendly and eager to please. Recent renovations have made rooms more inviting than ever. That said, it is the convenience of mid town that is most appealing.

title: Small Room - Questionable Location
text: The rooms are clean, but really quite small.  The staff is friendly and helpful, but be aware that there can be a wait for the nice breakfast.  Real downside is that the hotel is across the street from the Port Authority, which made us uncomfortable at times at night.

title: decent, but room very small
text: One night business trip.  Rarely hit NYC and room size is disappointing compared to LA, Chicago, etc.  Price, for NY is good, for anywhere else, absurd.  Comfortable bed, small bath.  There is a fridge.  Two would be cramped, but there was a party of four staying down the hall - wow.  Breakfast was not crowded and yes, there is a take charge lady there who will fuss over your needs - real or imagined.  Lobby is small, with a cold anteroom despite a glassed in fireplace.  AM elevator wait long enough that I walked down 8 floors.  Times Square a short walk.  Adequate, no more, no less.

title: Good value hotel.  Well located.  No room service
text: Stayed thanksgiving week for 6 nights.  Room wasn’t particularly big but was clean and the bed itself was big and comfortable.  Breakfast is buffet style and there is often a small queue but you won’t wait for more than a couple of minutes usually.  There is no room service or lunch/dinner options in the hotel but there are plenty of places to eat as you are next to 9/10th street and Hell’s Kitchen which has lots of good value places to eat with lots of variety.  WiFi was very good.

title: BIRTHDAY CELEBRATIONS IN NEW YORK
text:
I booked this holiday in January 2017 and specifically asked if I could have adjoining rooms as there were 6 in our party and adjoining rooms would have been very accommodating (this was done as a special request).   When I arrived in November 2017 at the hotel I was told that there were no adjoining rooms available and therefore I was given 2 separate rooms on different floors.   This was very disappointing as it had been requested well in advance.

The rooms were adequate although not very big.    The staff at the reception were very helpful and the vicinity of the hotel was excellent for getting about.   The breakfast was very well stocked although you need to be down early to avoid the queue.

title: Superbe emplacement!!
text: Hôtel très bien situé à Times square! Chambre avec une literie très confortable. Petit déjeuner copieux avec du choix! Personnel super sympa Avec une personne une personne à l'accueil pour conseiller et vous orienter là où vous souhaitez aller! Génial! Hôtel à deux pas du métro, gare routière, Times square..

title: Honest Review
text: As it was my first trip to New York I was not sure were to stay. I was pleasantly surprised how good this hotel was. It's roughly 3-5 minute walk to Time Square (close enough to walk to but far enough away from the noise). The hotel I found was a little out dated however the staff were brilliant and were very helpful. Free breakfast in the morning. I would recommend this hotel and would return.

title: Small room nothing super special
text:
So this property is very small and directly up. The staff were super cool which gets me to 3 stars vs. 2.  I would say the room was super small and the shower (a big gating factor for me) was odd. It pulsed as you used it making it feel ike the shower head had that old school puslator setting.  The biggest issue i had was the small size of the bath (no place to put anything) and the room was super small.  
 
The other issue is the area they are in is surrounded by homeless so you nee dto understand that is there.  But the staff are friendly, the breakfast is decent an free and overall standard Fairfield.

title: In the middle of downtown / Times Square
text: Spent two nights and the staff were really friendly, There is a women there in the breakfast area who makes you feel like your home and your mom is taking care of, she has a warm and friendly appearance and will get you coffee or whatever you need..  The front desk staff are also friendly and if your a member you get snacks and water to bring to your room.  The room I had was smaller then usual for me but for NY I am sure it was large.. Nice showers and very clean..   they are close to everything in walking distance.. So overall nice experience

title: Cortesia e ottima posizione
text: Hotel in ottima posizione per visitare New York, metropolitana molto vicina, personale gentilissimo e sempre disponibile. Buona la colazione. Ottima la pulizia delle camere, anche se un po' piccole quelle da quattro persone. Io lo consiglio.

title: Great Hotel Near Times Square
text: Stayed here for two nights for a short getaway.  The hotel staff was very friendly and professional.  The hotel is very well maintained and up to date.  The neighborhood is a bit sketchy at times with its locale next to the bus terminal and parole office, but we were not bothered by anyone in our comings and goings.  I loved the hotel and would likely stay again in the future.

title: Average at best
text:
My partner and I stayed at this hotel for two nights following seeing family for Thanksgiving. 

On our arrival the staff were polite and allowed us to leave our luggage with them as we were early to enjoy our day in the city. 

When we came back later we went to our room which was on the 30th floor and the view was amazing. The location and views from the hotel is very good. We then went out for the evening still content with everything and when we returned this time there was a queue outside of the hotel. A little unsure of what was going on we then returned to our room and as we got to our floor it sounded like a loud thumping bass from the Sky Bar. It was so loud still at 1am and our nights sleep was greatly disrupted. 

A little annoyed from lack of sleep we came down to breakfast to discover a very basic choice of food served on PAPER plates and with PLASTIC cutlery. The hotel immediately lost its class in our opinion considering the price you pay to stay here at a weekend. The only thing keeping us awake now was the Starbucks coffee they serve on tap which was a nice touch. 

We went to express our disappointment to the staff and the response from them was why we had not called the front desk as they could have turned the music down. The fact the staff thought we were that naive annoyed me further. At this point they offered us a 10% discount for one night. This was an insult in our eyes so the front desk agent spoke with his manager and returned to inform us he could offer us a 20% discount. At no point did the manager introduce themselves and apologise which I think is appalling. 

Not wanting to let it ruin our day we went about the city and had a fantastic time being so close to Times Square. Our friend was also staying at the hotel that night so we met them on their floor. As soon as the elevator door opened there was a very strong smell of cannabis coming from one of the rooms. Not exactly what you want to smell. Well we went to inform the staff and they seemed very attentive to the issue. When we went back up to my friends room the staff member tried to tell me he couldn’t smell it and that it must be the cleaning products. I can tell you all now it was not cleaning products, it was cannabis. 

Needless to say overall the hotel I found to be very over priced and disappointing with the service received. However the location is great and you can be at Times Square in minutes. 

I will not be returning to this hotel based on the service.

title: Buen hotel, con buena ubicacion.
text:
Nos alojamos en el hotel durante 7 noches.
Del hotel cabe destacar su limpieza y lo comodas que son las camas, la habitacion no es muy grande pero cuenta con todo lo necesario. Esta incluido el desayuno, que es buffet, es muy completo y tiene de todo(bolleria, fruta, yogures, huevos, bacon.... zumos de varias clases, cafe).
Lo mas comodo del hotel es su ubicacion, a 5 minutos de times square, al lado de la estacion de autobus, tiene una parada de metro al lado, recomendable 100% para hacer turismo.

title: Emplacement idéal
text: L'hôtel est situé à proximité de Time Square (3 min de marche), et offre des chambres confortables et propres. Seul petit bémol, la salle de petit-déjeuner est trop petite pour la taille de l'hôtel, il y a des files pour y accéder tous les matins.

title: Weekend in New York
text:
This hotel could not do enough for us.
Breakfast was cereal, hot sausage and eggs, waffles, pastries, fruit, yoghurt and cake. It really set us up for a busy day of sight seeing.
The room had two queen size beds so 4 adults shared one room easily, clean towels and bed made everyday, tea, coffee and water in our room.
There is a sky bar attached to the hotel which means you can have a night out without going out to far.
The hotel is located 6 minutes walk from Times Square and 9 minutes walk to Macys so it was perfect for us.
I will be going back to this hotel.

title: Клопы в номере
text:
Первый раз в жизни столкнулся с проблемой клопов, только дома выяснил что это было - думал пищевая аллергия, выяснилось что покусали клопы. Проверяйте матрацы, закрывайте чемоданы чтобы не привезти эту гадость домой.
Пытался связаться с customers care, получил стандартную отписку с сожалениями и обещание что со мной свяжутся после того как решат проблему. Связываются по сей день. Останавливался там несколько лет подряд, устраивало все и питание и расположение, но больше я туда не вернусь.

title: Pleasant surprise
text: Hotel appeared to be new. Counter staff was very helpful and friendly. We were impressed with the cleanliness and size of its standard room is good with 2 queen size beds. The room also comes with a microwave which comes in handy when travelling with kids. The room also fitted with bath tub. Gym has 2 new treadmills, a climbing machine and a row of weights. The hotel even comes with a heated pool although size of pool is rather small. All in all, we are very happy with the hotel.

title: UNA RICONFERMA
text:
avevamo soggiornato in questo hotel già 7 anni fa durante un nostro viaggio a New York e c’eravamo trovati molto bene così in occasione della nostra nuova vacanza a New York abbiamo voluto andare sul sicuro e abbiamo riprenotato questo hotel e devo dire che ci siamo trovati anche meglio della prima volta.
Camere molto pulite, letti molto comodi.
La sala colazione è rimasta sempre la stessa, un po’ piccolina per il numero di ospiti che contiene l’hotel ma organizzata in modo diverso e molto molto funzionale. 
Personale gentilissimo, insomma se dovete fare una vacanza a New York questo hotel è la giusta soluzione, rapporto qualità prezzo ottimo e posizione strepitosa, difronte alla stazione di bus e metro e poi a 2 isolati da Time Square.

title: Breakfast is a bonus
text:
Clean room and clean bathroom, large shower.
Beds and pillows surprisingly comfy!
Complimentary bottles of water, handy as you set off exploring.
The breakfast is a bonus, yes it's paper plates and cutlery but you've got Bagels, waffles, pastries, Yogurt, fruit, Cereal, muesli, it's great. Or there's bacon and eggs. Coffee on tap, juice on tap. We again were pleasantly surprised. The coffee is available all day, another bonus.
Close to Times Square, Macy's and loads of delis, cafes and restaurants.
We'd stay again.

title: New York con amigas
text: Me pareció un poco costoso, pero tenía una excelente ubicación, es lo mejor del hotel. Es un hotel limpio y con buenas camas para descansar y un desayuno muy completo (bajar a desayunar temprano es la clave, se hace mucha fila), queda a unas dos cuadras de Times Square y a todo el frente de la estación de buses (port authority bus terminal new york) lo cual te da fácil acceso a buses para ir a Washington o a Woodbury Outlets. Mucha gente, muy ruidoso en la planta baja y definitivamente no es un hotel para ir con niños.

title: Perfectly fine hotel, not a particularly great part of town
text: I stayed here for one night on a last minute business trip and as the rates at the usual place I stay at were very expensive, so I decided to give this place a try. It is across from the port authority, which isn’t great but is an easy walk or subway trip to other parts of the city. My room was as nice as all the other Fairfield Inns in New York and the staff was very pleasant and the room rate was quite reasonable for NY. Breakfast was included but I didn’t have time to try it.

title: Molto carino
text:
Albergo molto carino, pulito, in posizione strategica X muoversi a New York , con colazione inclusa  che si è rivelato un valore aggiunto.Ci siamo trovati davvero molto bene.
Lo consiglio. Inoltre in un laterale tranquilla dove non si udiva il rumore del traffico.

title: Otima opcao
text: O lugar é super bem localizado,a 2 quadras da time square e na frente de uma das principais estacoes de metro/onibus de NY. O valor foi justo,principalmente considerando que o cafe da manha estava incluso. Recomendo a todos. Confortavel,limpo e bem localizado.

title: Voyage New york
text:
Un hôtel au top, y compris en famille. 
Chambre avec 2 grans lits double, salle de bain avec baignoire. Chambre propre, un buffet parfait pour le petit dej. Un rooftop génial 
Très bien situé car proche de Times Square.

title: NYC Marathon visit
text:
After reading the reviews I booked this hotel for the NYC MARATHON week it was overpriced because of the marathon, but so were all the other hotels. After reading some of the negative reviews I thought I would address some of them.
Elevators, there are 3, and it is a 32 floor hotel with a roof bar (Sky Room) that in the evenings they reserve 1 just for it, with that being said the waits were not that long, the elevators move very fast and the hotel was sold out when we were there. So don’t let that scare you away. 
Breakfast is served every morning on the main floor, seating is limited, but the staff moves you in very quickly and are very friendly. We never had to wait more then 5 minutes the whole week and sometimes we never waited. We went down to breakfast from 6:30 - 7:00 ( no wait ), also as late as 9:00 - 10:00 (less than 5 minutes). As for the breakfast quality it is just so so, there is eggs, little cheese omelettes, turkey & pork sausages, sometimes bacon and Canadian bacon, fresh fruits, toast, bagels, waffles, yogurts, cereal and a few pastries. Nothing fancy but fills you up. For those that complain about the quality, most NYC hotels do not offer free Breakfast, so if you want better, go to a restaurant and pay for it, if they served higher quality, the rooms would cost more per night. It is the same with the paper plates and plastic utensils if they used regular plates and silverware they would have to spend more labor washing the dishes and that would drive the cost of the room higher. 
They offer free coffee, tea and water all day.
Some say they feel the area is a little unsafe as it is near the bus station, it does have some homeless people around but so does most of New York, besides asking for some money once in a while they never bother you, if it does bothers you to walk by them, then just go down the north side of the block until you get to hotel which is in the middle of block and then cross the street, a couple of them will sit on same side of street just up from hotel. They are never on the other side of street. There also are 2 or 3 other hotels right next door to this hotel, so lots of people coming and going all the time. We never felt unsafe.
The bus station (Port Authority) is a positive because it is real easy to get to and from the airport, we flew from  Newark and it cost 17.00 per person, one leaves every 15 minutes and only takes 30 or 45 minutes. No need for a taxi as you just go across street, around front between the two buildings and look for the bus marked Newark Airport and you can pay right there, cash or credit. The same when coming from airport just go out the front doors of airport and look for Newark Port Authority bus to NYC ,also comes every 15 minutes, and get on and pay on the bus. 
The rooms are small as most NYC hotels. The hotel only has 6-8 rooms per floor, so not much noise from the other guests on your floor. They have many, (lots) of places to to plug in charging devices with plug-ins & USB ports. Room was very clean and was always cleaned when we came back for the day, it has good lighting, showers always had hot water, the one negative is they have little mini fridges, which are not refrigerators at all, they call them coolers and they only cool to 58 degrees instead of cold like a refrigerator so the water and things are just luke warm, might as well not even had them. They should replace them all with real refrigerators.
As with most NYC hotels staying on street side lower floors you will hear all the street noise, the first night we stayed on 11th floor street side as it was late when checking in and had the street noise, the next night we moved to the 22nd floor back side and it was absolutely quiet (room 2208). 
The hotel is 1/2 block from 8th Ave. Times Square is roughly around 42 & 7th Ave. a short walk  with a lot of shops, shows and restaurants in between, a great little restaurant close by is Black Iron Burger, Midtown (245 W 38th St.) just two blocks down and in the middle of the next block.  It is a small and you might have to wait, but it has very good burgers.
I would stay at this hotel again.

title: Great location and new property!
text: If you're coming in via The Lincoln Tunnel, this is just a few blocks away. Just understand as you get close to Time Square, traffic moves at a very slow pace. The staff was all friendly and helpful and the rooms are small, but well appointed. The Roof Top bar is worth a trip up to view the city at night, but if you're older than 30...probably not the scene your looking for.

title: 2017 NY Marathon stay
text: Spent three nights here during our stay for the NY Marathon!  The hotel is super clean and the staff extremely helpful!  Breakfast staff friendly and very accommodating! Location convenient for everything we wanted to do.  You may come across some homeless on the streets but we were never bothered.  For us , we felt safe ! Again very nice hotel and staff

title: Albergo molto molto carino
text: Albergo in posizione centrale. Pulito e silenzioso. Colazione abbondante. Adatto a famiglie. Camera un po piccola per 4 persone. Lo consiglio x vedere time Square senza troppa confusione. Di fronte all' albergo bus station e metro.

title: Very good choice, close to everything
text:
Very good choice to stay in NY. Close to port authority and Times Square. It s close to everywhere and gave you the feeling of security. Friendly staff, very clean room and rich breakfast. Although the hotel was crowded and our room was at 23 floor, there was no delay to come/go to the room
Or for the breakfast. Strong wifi and good idea the available pc for the customers.

title: Au top
text:
Hôtel top , chambre silencieuse , propre , personnel accueillant et souriant .
Nombreux services et idéalement placé, 5 min de time square, bouche de métro à proximité. 
 Nous y retourneront certainement pour notre prochain voyage à NY !

title: Great price, great location, great staff
text: We were not planning on staying right in the city, due to other hotel prices and having a car; but we are so glad that we did- we drove into the city- and they made it so easy for us. Very easy to get to and find. The location is perfect- very close to everything and very close to the subway line! The rooms were cozy and comfortable; everything was clean and well maintained. The staff was helpful with everything and made sure we got the most out of our 1 night stay in NYC. We would definitely come back.

title: Excellent value: pleasant, nothing fancy, great location. Recommended.
text:
Very pleasant hotel. Nothing fancy but perfectly good - and very reasonably priced.

Breakfast was good: we had two hungry teenagers who managed to eat their fill. It isn't fancy, but this is not an Intercontinental and you are not paying those prices. 

The location is excellent: 5 minutes from Times square, judst neat subway - what more could you want?

I'm surprised by the more negative reviews: given this is NYC I expected the rooms to be small - and was actually pleasantly surprised by how spacious they were.

The staff were EXCELLENT - very helpful, courteous, kind. Indeed, some of the best hotel staff in a long time (even in places far more expensive).

We did go up to the SKY BAR which is amusing. Odd, a bit faded and non-glamourous, but great views and (again) very friendly staff.

title: Room OK, breakfast poor
text: I stayed for 8 nights on business. The room was OK, with a comfortable bed and enough space and amenities. The nearby road junction of 40th/8th is very busy so there were lots of car horns at all hours of day and night, and the sound insulation in the hotel was poor so I did not sleep well. The breakfast was awful. Paper plates and plastic cutlery, and a poor selection of hot food. The wait time for the lifts was very long during busy times. The location was good for the Midtown area, with fairly short walks to 42nd St, Broadway, Times Sq, MSG, Penn Station.

title: The place to stay if you like your room smelling like wet sponge
text: I stayed at this hotel for business one night this week and was disappointed; I won't stay here again. The room was updated and would have been ok, except it completely stank.  The source of the smell was the shower curtain -- completely reeked of that wet sponge smell; the smell was so powerful it took over the whole room.

title: great hotel, could use a little work
text:
This was for a 2 night business stay.

CHECK-IN: (2/5)
I made this booking online the day before on Booking.com. I came to the hotel in the morning around 8:30-9am to see if early check-in was possible just so I can drop my things off in the room before heading to work. Unfortunately, the person that helped me couldn't find my reservation. They had a print out of my booking, but it wasn't in the system. What should have been a 2 minute max check-in time, turned into about 15-20 minutes because they couldn't find my reservation. I don't know if the front desk ever found my reservation in their system or just made a new one, but I was finally able to get a room. Unfortunately, it was a second floor room out of a 30+ floor building...

ROOM: (4/5)
The room itself was very nice. It was spacious and clean, probably bigger than most hotel rooms that I've stayed in. The one pet peeve I really had with the work was the TV. Sure, I'm not in the hotel room watching TV all day, but it kept blacking out and coming back over and over again for a split second. It kept kicking me out of my Netflix account (which is a great feature for the TV, but would have been better if it actually worked). Eventually, the movie I was playing just stopped working and so did anything else I tried to play. I don't know if it was because the connection was crappy, but it was really frustrating.

Also, I don't know if it was because I was on the 2nd floor, but it took FOREVER for the water in the shower to turn even a little bit warm. I probably had to wait at least 10 minutes with the shower running on maximum high setting until it started to feel warmer. Did not do me good when rushing in the morning. Same went for the sink water.

FOOD: (3/5)
Breakfast was included with the room rate, which is always nice. Though I was not all that impressed with the spread. It was mostly carbs that were available. What impressed me most was the refrigerator stocked with a variety of yogurts and the hot drink station. The eggs and protein could really use some work, tasted like cardboard as did most of their bread selections. I would recommend going as early as you can. They seat you like a restaurant and there will be a line during peak morning times. It's a pretty tight space too so if you wanted to get breakfast before checking-out, leave all our stuff in your room and get it after.The breakfast area turns into a [sports] bar at night, which was neat. Coffee and hot water is available 24/7 by the area which was nice too.

GROUNDS: (4/5)
Other than the tight space for breakfast, the elevators are devastatingly slow. I was actually grateful about the second floor room because all I had to do was walk up and down a flight of stairs. The hotel in general is on the smaller side. Hallways are narrow and you can tell the design was to make the most of the space given as possible. The building is almost as if it was one building, but split right down the middle for two different hotels. The lobby can get really crowded so try not to stick around and linger if you're on the claustrophobic side.

SERVICE: (4/5)
Despite the less than perfect check-in, everyone was nice and hardworking. It would have been nice to see a bit more "I care about you, the guest" but I didn't get that kind of vibe here, even with the mishap. It's nice to be known by name because of these kinds of things though. I like it when they do that, it makes it seem that they pay extra attention.

OVERALL: (3/5)
I would stay here again if the price is right and I'm on a budget. Breakfast was disappointing but the rooms were really nice - minus the water temperature and the TV. If those few things were improved, I would definitely come back again.

title: Small rooms but great location
text: We had a Double/Double room with our two kids so this was a little cosy for 5 nights but as a place to rest our heads it was fine.  The beds are really comfortable and the location of the property itself is excellent - walking distance to Time Square and easy access to Subway etc.  The internet access was also excellent but the 'free' breakfast is a bit like cattle being herded into a seating area and with the lines etc and very basic offerings we chose to eat out on some days just to miss the crowds.  There is a laundromat just down the road and around the corner too which was handy.

title: falling apart
text: I hope you have a compelling reason to stay here.  New York isn't cheap, but there are places close for a few dollars more or the same.  The place is dirty, and falling apart.  I moved three rooms and all of them were dark, dirty and worn out with leaking plumbing, broken HVAC, TV's that didn't work, oh and dirty...the crazy thing is the folks working there were super nice, when I complained the response was, yeah the place is falling apart, wish there was more we could do for you.

title: Excelente
text: Me hospedè con mi familia en este hotel y la verdad , es que me encantò la amabilidad del personal, la ubicaciòn ideal para moverte a pie o metro por toda NY, el desayuno muy completo, la habitaciòn para 3 pers : còmoda y con lugar justo de guardado, totalmente recomendable. Vuelvo sin dudarlo !!!

title: Hotel bom
text:
Hotel bom, mas muito caro. Bem localizado mas muitos mendigos dormindo na 42 St. o café da manhã é bem fraco mas muito concorrido. Chegue cedo pois tem
Muita fila e acaba cedo. Pegamos um quarto no 26 e à vista está em anexo.

title: Great value
text: I stayed here with my 2 daughters and granddaughter for 5 nights and enjoyed our stay at the hotel. Bedroom, although a bit small was bigger than a previous hotel we had stayed but as we were in the room just for sleeping it didn't matter. Good choice for breakfast. 5 minutes from subway and a short walk from Times Square so good location. Finally all the staff were friendly and helpful. Would  definitely stay there again

title: Ottima soluzione
text: Abbiamo prenotato questo hotel all'ultimo minuto e non potevamo fare scelta migliore. Situato a due passi da Times square è una struttura moderna che offre parecchi conforts. La nostra camera con due letti alla francese non era molto spaziosa per 4 persone ma con un minimo di organizzazione nel disfare le valigie diciamo che non siamo stati assolutamente stretti. Camera abbastanza pulita, con un bagno spazioso è ottima ricezione del Wi-Fi. La colazione seppur ripetitiva è stata abbastanza ricca e l'attesa per avere un tavolo per sedersi non ha mai superato i 10 minuti. Il rooftop all'ultimo piano è davvero spettacolare. L'unico neo è che, data la vicinanza alla stazione(che si traduce in comodità se ci si vuole muovere), la via dell'hotel è frequentata da parecchi balordi e senzatetto che non fa piacere incrociare soprattutto la sera. A mio parere è preferibile soggiornare tra la 30ima e la 35ima street in quanto la zona è più alla moda. Per concludere direi che comunque è una struttura presso la quale soggiornerei nuovamente.

title: Decent hotel, shady street
text: The hotel itself is fine.  Great staff.  The location leaves a bit to be desired.  Saw a couple of drug deals 1/2 block outside of the hotel on a Saturday night, around 7:30pm.  There is a reason this place is more affordable.  I regret my decision to book here seeing as it was my kids first time to NYC.  Oh well, live and learn!

title: Poor bedbug response
text:
We all know bedbugs happen in NYC. that is why upon check in I looked at my bed thoroughly. There was definite staining on the mattress cover indicative of bugs but I tried not to panic. I was alright until I pulled back the sheet to find a dead bug. 
     The management moved us next door, but all through our Broadway show I couldn’t relax for fear of the results of sleeping with bed bugs. I have seen it, and it is ugly!!!!  We decided to leave the hotel and check into another Marriot at 11pm. We hauled all of our stuff across town at our own effort and expense. 
     Instead of trying to make things right as you’d expect after such an experience, they became belligerent all the way up the ladder of “customer service”. We did not receive any refund and to add insult to injury, we were charged an early check out fee!!!
     Their answer was to offer us HALF OFF a future night’s stay!!!!  As if we would ever return there!!!  Stay away if you value your sleep and sanity.

title: Decent stay for the cheapest around
text:
We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel in a double double room.  First impressions were good, the reception was friendly and very helpful, upon entering our room it was clean and very quiet but quite small, especially the 'double' beds that we would be sharing!  Our view was disappointing, looking out onto a dirty alleyway with an office block where the staff could see right through our window. 
We were on the 13th floor so always needed to take the lift, a couple of times it would take a while but the majority of the time it was efficient enough.  We were impressed by the maid service, she came every day and with clean towels, the only thing that was a little annoying was that she only ever left 2 bottles of water (even though the room fits 4 people) even after we asked if she could leave some more.  Breakfast was alright, plenty of choice although wasn't very impressed by the bacon and whatever the horrible looking turkey thing was, avoided that side of the breakfast bar and kept to the bagels and fruit!  Sometimes we had a little wait but it was never long, the staff were always on top of it making sure we got seated as quickly as possible.
There is a skybar next door to the hotel but unfortunately we didn't get the chance to go up, it's not open until 5pm, on the Saturday evening we planned to go up but there was a bunch of young people queuing to enter so we decided against it, the following night there was a sign saying it was closed and then on the Monday we were told it's only open on weekends.  
Location was a little bit dodgy but I think most of Times Square is anyway, lots of homeless people and drunks on the street trying to get money from you.  The hotel is also directly across from the bus/subway station which was handy for getting to Brooklyn/Lower Manhattan for a day but everywhere else is within walking distance to an extent.  
Overall not a bad stay, if you've the money to splurge then I would suggest staying in a nicer area but really, this place isn't too bad for a bed to sleep in and a refuel in the morning.

title: Good Location
text: Just a few blocks from Times Square, plenty of bars, restaurants, theatres in easy walking distance. Rooms small by most standards but stand appointments, reasonably clean and tidy . Night club/bar on top floor a waste of time..

title: Awesome trendy but reasonably priced hotel in the heart of NYC
text: I stayed here for one night in a city view room. The room was compact but perfectly adequate with good AC, a brand new bathroom and plenty of plugs, USB ports etc. As a platinum Marriott member I was given a cool gift which included the very trendy VOSS water. The best platinum gift to date!! Breakfast is busy from around 0730 and I had to wait around 10 minutes arriving at 0830. It was a decent breakfast. The service was also very attentive in this hotel and to date, this is the best Fairfield Inn I have stayed at.

title: Esperienza ottima su tutti i fronti
text: La posizione..a 2 passi da Times square ma al contempo in una strada più tranquilla..e di fronte c'e il terminal bus/metro per l'aeroporto..la colazione sensazionale e le code ci sono se la fai nell'orario 830/930..si può anche portare via qualcosa..r il caffè e il the sono a disposizione tutto il giorno w anche in camera..tutti della linea starbucks..Wifi funzionante..personale cordiale e pronto a soddisfare tutti i dubbi..ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo e camera pulita..direi la miglior soluzione per chi vuole stare a Manhattan..

title: 5 Star Service!
text: We came in for NY ComicCon and stayed here for the 3rd time in 6 years. The hotel is always clean and with friendly welcoming staff. But this year in particular, Shaquane Richards at the front desk made it feel a little like home.  Thank you Shaquane!

title: Sehr gute Lage
text: Wir haben uns wohlgefühlt. Das Zimmer war sauber. Das Boxspringbett war ideal.Die Lage des Hotels war sehr gut. Leider konnte man nur mit geschlossenem Fenster schlafen weil man sonst die Geräusche der Lüftung im Innenhof hörte. Die Klimaalage war auch nicht gerade leise. Es ist halt ein Stadthotel.

title: Of very goo value if...
text:
...you manage to get a good rate!!! The location is excellent but the surrounding noise can be absolutely deadening if you end up on a lower fllor, or facing the bus terminal building, across the main façade of the hotel.
Rooms are clean, well-equipped and rather pleasant in general.
Brkfast despite the variety of items offered is a very annoying experience. Way too many people crammed into a limited space. Reminded me a a chicken house when a fox' s around.
The staff goes through the motions , not hostile, but totaly uninterested in the clientele. Until you started to really express your dissatisfaction...

title: Everything we needed
text: I stayed here at the start of the Summer and choose it mainly because of its location. It is in very close proximity to Times Square and it is right beside a bus depot for anyone who may be leaving the city. We stayed on the 29th floor and were quite concerned that there would be a lot of street noise; especially since they provide ear plugs, but we did not have any hassle. The room was nice; equipped with a safe, coffee machine and a small enough wardrobe, but this was not a problem. The bed was very comfy too. The best part about our stay was the breakfast; I have a major sweet tooth and absolutely loved having waffles as an option every morning. The staff were lovely, especially the ladies in the restaurant. My only complaint was that on our last night we went to the bar (which isn't actually a bar, it's the same room that breakfast is in) and we were charged $29 for two glasses of wine and were ignored when we asked for a receipt. Now I know there is the sky bar which is only open on the weekends but I thought 29 was far too much for two glasses of wine. But overall, I enjoyed my stay and the staff at reception were more than happy to order us a car to bring us to the airport.

title: Great stay with thoughtful touches
text: The stay had everything you could ask for - quick and friendly check-in, bottled water and snack as a Gold Marriott member. The breakfast spread was good and the room was well laid out, with a beverage cooler as a night stand and free bottled water in the room. The bed was comfortable and clean and outside noise was minimal. I will stay here again.

title: Excelente mas pequenos quartos
text:
Estávamos em 3 adultos no quarto , são duas camas de casal , quarto pequeno mas as 4
malas grandes couberam se ficassem fechadas e em pé , acredito que se fosse pra 4 adultos ficaria muito apertado ,não tem microondas , mas tem uma adega que mantém temperatura quebra um galho pra manter alguma comida que não precisa ser congelada , descobri que tinha depois do segundo dia hospedado onde achei que era apenas uma mesa de cabeceira , ar condicionado fica grudado ao lado da cama o que é ruim durante a noite porque o vento vai direto pra para os pés , tem cofre , ferro e tábua . Esqueceram de repor papel higiênico , liguei à noite pedindo e não enviaram apenas na manhã seguinte quando liguei pedindo denovo , café da manhã tem fila em alguns horários mas vai bem rápido , o café é do Starbucks bem parecido com o nosso , sempre tinha frutas cortadas como morango e mamão , alguns dias uvas e sempre banana e morango , tinha bolos , cereais , aveia e pães , ovos , bacon e sucos , para os padrões de café americano achei muito bom , check in e check out rápido , escolhi por causa da localização, terceira vez em Nova York e sempre prefiro essa área para fazer tudo a pé  e sempre tem as opções de comidas pra levar pro hotel perto , como seven eleven , comida chinesa e pizza ,excelente localização e hotel excelente , os preços dessas aéreas são altos mas já esperava porque reservei com 2 dias antes da viagem .

title: Great hotel
text: Stayed here in March. Great location within walking distance of Times Square and lots of other great places to go. Hotel was very clean and staff were polite and friendly. Breakfast was help yourself and had a good selection to choose from. Rooms were clean and a good size. Great big tv. Really enjoyed our stay. Due to location we are going back next year. Would recommend a visit to The East Village, plenty to see here and if you like music take in a music tour. Such a great two hour tour and the guy really kept us entertained with his knowledge of so many bands.

title: Great stay!  Great value!  Great customer service!
text: Will look to stay here again when in NYC.  Rates were very reasonable for NYC, and especially for the Times Square/Broadway area.  Right off of 9th, which has an unending selection of local restaurants.  It is next to the probation office, but I would say it is just like any other local street in NYC with everyone going about their business with an occasional interesting situation (did not feel threatened at all).  Needed to leave a day early, and front desk was very accommodating, helpful and friendly.

title: Cozy rooms in the heart of manhattan
text: Though a short stay but liked the place mainly because of the location and friendly staff. The rooms were small compared to no of baggages we Indians carry but still comfortable. The breakfast had vegetarian options though very limited. The best thing I liked was the out lobby where we had lot of business discussions.

title: Excellent Location for Almost Everything in NYC
text: This is a great Fairfield Inn.  Free full breakfast and wonderful staff.  The rooms were a good size for NYC standards, clean and comfortable.  We were surprised that even though on the street side, we did not hear any city noise.  At times there was a wait for the elevators but because of the price point and location I would highly recommend this hotel.  Easy walk to Times Square and across the street from the subway.

title: Outstanding value, will have to wait for elevators ...
text: Booked here because I got a great price for Manhattan. The room is very clean and comfortable. I had a nice view of midtown from my window. The basic breakfast was just fine. But the main issue are the slow elevators. If you are prepared beforehand to wait, it was not a big deal to wait an extra few minutes, especially at the rate. One other item - on a Thursday night, one of the elevators was booked for use of a rooftop club. Please note that this location is not exactly near Times Square - it's still a little walk to there. The service was very friendly throughout. I would definitely recommend this place.

title: IRONIC NOISE
text:
"How nice to leave us earplugs," I thought. Accompanied by a nice note about how "as you are so near Times Square, the noise may bother us."

The noise, however, comes from the hotel itself! Music blares in the elevator, lobby and breakfast area. I asked the receptionist to turn it off to make a phone call, which he did, but it went back on after.

(By the way, this hotel isn't anywhere on Times Square. It is in front of the bus station. The Times Square subway station is actually not the closest subway.)

Then there was a weird snafu where the desk needed to see my credit card since "we cannot charge it to that Visa." (My companion's "loyalty" Marriott Visa card!!)  So they put a huge block on my card, but....wait until you hear this...charged it to her card anyway!

title: Wisteria Club trip to the Big Apple
text: I am pleased with this hotel.  Centrally located to times square.   The decor has a modern feel.  The hotel is nice and clean.   The staff is friendly.  Breakfast is included.  It can get a bit crowded on the weekends.

title: Fairfield Inn
text: So-so hotel. Small lobby, crowded elevators on the weekend. Breakfast was packed....not worth the wait. Walked to nearby Dunkin Donuts. Street was dirty with lots of "people" hanging around looking for handouts. Port authority is on the corner and adds to the crazies hanging around. Rooms are super small, bathrooms also small...no tubs. Halls are small and we had to walk down 13 flights because elevators were so slow. Won't book here again!!

title: Good hotel; well located ; pleasant serve mindd staff; good breakfast
text:
Room service was excellent and rooms were clean. Pleasant front office and the staff was always kind and helpful. location is excellent. if you do not mind walking Times Square is at  walking distance and that is also the case for the Broadway shows. 
One disadvatage is that there is only one icemaker and that is on the lowest level and according to me there are 30 floors..
As there are only three elevators it is wise to plan when you are leaving as the elevators may come down full. One other small point is that the elevators may have more light.
Breakfast is very good but mind the rush hours which are indicated by the hotel.
All in all a hotel I would certainly recommend
Breakfast is excellent only avoid the rush hours indicated by the hotel itself.

title: Great location
text: We stayed in this hotel for a short sight-seeing trip to NY. Great location, comfortable rooms, helpful staff. Breakfast included, which makes for a good start to the day. Rooms at the front of the hotel are very quiet, as there's nothing opposite apart from the wall of the bus terminal, which is very quiet at night. Would recommend.

title: bien situé dans Midtown
text:
les + : propreté, clim, personnel agréable, petit déj ok
les - : panorama

L'hotel est idealement placé à 20min de central park et de times square, le quartier n'est pas trop fréquenté, reste le bruit présent mais à NY , impossible d'y échapper !
Aucun problème pour une famille de 4 personnes.

title: Vacation
text: I am a lifetime Marriott member and I was a little disappointed in this hotel.  Room was very small for 3 people.  If there are only two of you then the room would be ok.  The hotel is in a great location with lots to do within walking distance.

title: Good stay, centrally located
text: This was a nice, clean and centrally located hotel. Subway station right on the corner, Bryant park around the block. Staff was friendly, rooms were clean, reasonable price for Manhattan, it was a good stay.

title: Convenient Location
text: The hotel is beautiful on initial entry.  The white makes it look new and fresh.  The initial location can take you aback but it is conveniently located right across from the Port Authority Bus Terminal. You are a ten minute walk to Broadway, 15-20 minute walk to Grand Central and near the subway lines. The front desk staff was very friendly. I thought the room was a bit small but comfortable and clean. Full breakfast included, which was great and that I never got up in time to get.  Ha! Ha!   The only thing that annoyed me were the people who hung out on that street.  They made you uncomfortable and you felt unsafe as I was approached a couple of times by a man who was there everyday.  I decided to walk on the other side of the street from that point onward.  I cannot deal with them and shouldn't be subjected to harassment.

title: la colazione inclusa è un plus da tenere in considerazione soprattutto se con bambini
text:
Siamo stati molto in dubbio quando dovevamo prenotare perchè a NYC l'offerta è talmente alta e i prezzi altrettanto che è difficile definire un criterio di selezione.
considerando di voler stare in zona Time Square (cosa di cui io dubiterei per le mie prossime eventuali volte), questa alla fine è stata un'ottima soluzione. non a buon mercato, come tutto a Manhattan, ma comodissima per le zone più turistiche e per la metro (davvero a due passi).
L'hotel è carino e pulito, con personale molto gentile; noi abbiamo avuto uno dei bambini che non è stato bene e quindi siamo stati in camera molto durante un giorno e le signore delle pulizie sono state gentilissime come il perosnale alla reception.
La colazione inclusa è a mio avviso un plus da tenere molto in considerazione; è vero, come letto in altri commenti, che la sala è piccola e negli orari più gettonati c'è un po' di ressa, ma, se in vacanza come noi, basta avere un po' di pazienza (noi in 4 non abbiamo mai aspettato più di 10 minuti) e ci si siede senza problemi. Il cibo è abbastanza vario e buono.
Tenendo conto del fatto che la zona è molto turistica e carissima, è sicuramente una buona soluzione per iniziare la giornata

title: Comfortable, Good Location
text: The initial location can be a bit off-putting since it is right across from the Port Authority Bus Terminal, but it is fine.  You are a ten minute walk to Broadway, 15-20 minute walk to Grand Central and near the subway lines.  The front desk staff was very friendly.  The room was a good size, comfortable and clean.  Full breakfast included, which was great.  I'll nitpick that the scrambled eggs were slightly rubbery and the oatmeal soupy but, overall, there was a good spread.  They have Starbucks coffee, which it my favorite outside Starbucks shops.  Don't know why, but when others brew it it tastes great.

title: Looking for some danger!?!
text:
So if your looking for some danger in the big city, this hotel is the right place for you! I have stayed at Marriotts all over the world and never have I seen one loacted next to a NYC correctional facility or on such a shady street. The walk to and from the hotel is littered with less fortunate people sleeping on the side walk and harassing pedestrians. The hotel needs to work with the NYPD to address this issue.

As for the actual hotel, it is nice with no issues. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful.

As an aside, I am not saying there is anything shady going on between Apple and Marriott, but if you search for this hotel on Apple maps, the NYC correctional facility does not show up. However, If you search for the hotel with google maps the correctional facility does show up. I hope this is just coincidence and not an attempt to hide the location of the facility in relation to the hotel!

title: Gutes Hotel, gute Lage, teuer wie alle in NYC
text: Das Hotel gehört zu Marriott-Gruppe. Der Standard ist wie immer im Fairfield, daher alles gut. Die Zimmer sind wie immer in NYC klein, das Bad ist dafür in gutem Zustand und relativ groß (mit Dusche). Das Frühstück ist ein Continental+...also Toast und Bagel mit Plastiktellern und Besteck. Aber das ist in Ordnung. Die Lage ist mit 10 Minuten Fußweg zum Times Square sehr gut. U-Bahn ist auch in der Nähe, somit kommt man gut überall hin. Ich war mehrfach hier und komme gerne wieder her.

title: Great service, location and amenities
text:
The staff were very friendly, even the gentleman dealing with checked luggage after we had to bug him three times for our bags before we got a room (we arrived at 6:30 am!!). 

Although the room wasn't huge, it was very nice.  The bed and pillows were very comfortable...and I've spent 5 nights in a room where the bed hurt my back so much I almost cried...so I'm always thrilled when I get a great night's sleep.  We were on the 12th floor and I didn't find noise to be bad, but earplugs were left for us on the night stand. 

I loved the toiletries, too.  Very nice scent.  And the breakfast was better than the one I'd paid over $10 for earlier that morning when we'd been walking around.  Everything was well stocked and flowed nicely.  

The location was perfect for us...only a half block from the red line subway which goes all the way up the west side of Central Park (we went to Tom's Diner from Seinfeld fame) and all the way down to South Ferry (the last stop where you can get off and catch the free ride on the Staten Island Ferry to see the Statue of Liberty).  

I'd definitely stay here again.

title: Lovely place❤️❤️
text: We stayed in Fairfield with our friends. Friendly people, clean rooms, near city center and subways. Breakfast was best for America. We could taken coffee all times when we want. There is a Roof bar but you must have a dress code. If we'll go New York, we stay here again.

title: No compassion no help
text:
Hi
Never ever book in this hotel Fairfield inn by Marriott at Times Square. 
I had 5 nights booking but was unable to reach NYC as all flights canceled due thunderstorm on 2 Aug. 
I requested but still they were ruthless and said will charge for one night since I didn't check in. 
How could have I checked in if the NYC airspace Was closed for air traffic 

Absolutely pathetic and hopeless customer service. Hope they could understand the customers problem

Never ever will book them

Unhappy customer 
Sherezad Jokhi

title: a Wonderful stay
text:
We spent with the family 8 days in Central New York Manhattan. The front desk staff Anthony P. went beyond in assisting us with our reservation and all our needs.
The hotel was clean, near all sites with free Wi-Fi and excellent breakfast and Starbucks coffee included.

title: BABY GIRLS SWEET 16
text: I really enjoyed my stay here. My first time in New York and i will go back. The staff were kind and courteous, the room was great and very clean. Props to Miss Theo for cleaning up after us thank you. And to the breakfast staff Ty for the meals. Thank you all for making our stsy great. Keep up the great work and God Bless.

title: Très bonne adresse
text:
L'hotel est très bien situé, à 2 rues de Times Square et des bouches de métro. Pour autant, les chambres sont calmes. la vue n'est pas super (parking ou rue) mais sans bruits...
le petit déjeuner est copieux et de bonne qualité. Le wifi gratuit est performant.
Le personnel est disposé à vous aider et tout est propre.
Je recommande fortement !

title: Excelente custo-benefício
text:
Muito boa localização, dá para ir a pé a vários pontos turísticos. Um dos poucos hotéis que encontrei com café da manhã incluso em Manhattan e por um bom preço.
Só não digo que o Hotel é excelente porque o quarto é pequeno, mas isso não atrapalhou nossa estadia. Voltaria com certeza.

title: ottimo hotel e ben posizionato
text:
trascorse 6 notti a ny in questo hotel. hotel pulito,silenzioso,personale molto cortese e disponibile e colazione varia dolce,salato,yougurt,frutta,macedonia assolutamente di qualità e buffet molto pulito e ordinato.
vicinanza alla metro sono 5 minuti a piedi fermata di columbus circle molto comoda x raggiungere tutte le attrazioni.zona tranquilla con molti supermercati ristoranti e locali.
unica pecca di questo hotel ripeto camere ben pulite,moderne e ben fornite di macchietta x caffe the frigo bar ma un po troppo piccole. noi con 2 bagagli di cui uno un trolley medio non sapevamo come metterlo. prezzo nella media di NY. cmq consigliatissimo.

title: Great location but significant problems with elevators and breakfast room
text: This hotel is perfectly located, if you want to be in midtown and near public transportation.  Staff was very pleasant and also professional.  Both location and staff get an "A".  However the elevators and breakfast room both get a "D".  Three tiny elevators service the entire 33 floors.  Luckily we were on the 21st floor, so were able to squeeze into an elevator on its way down.  Every few floors, we watched the doors open to disappointed guests who saw there was no more room.  This happened over and over, until we finally reached the lobby.  The return to our room required waiting in a long line for an open elevator.  Free breakfast was adequate but the tiny breakfast room was completely inadequate for the number of guests.  A very long line trailed all the way to the lobby, waiting for an open table.  Don't wait for a table; get a "to go" box and take your breakfast to your room.  But then there is that wait for the elevators to get back to your room....

title: NO sleep on the 32 floor
text: This hotel is very nice and well maintained. I loved the suite we had. Unfortunately when I saw the complimentary ear plugs I should have requested a room change.  The associate failed to mention there is a night club on the 33rd &34th floor.  I checked in on Thursday that night was peaceful. However Friday was terrible.   Thank goodness we checked out Saturday.

title: Can it be worse for 3000$??? Absolutely not !
text:
I have never stayed in a worse hotel in my entire life!
We booked this hotel on account of its proximity to Javits center since we attended Fancy Food show.
Room was stuffy, full of dust, bathroom smelled of damp and filthy bathtub curtain.

I asked several times to clean it, but nothing happened.
Air condition was working as a small hurricane.
Next to my head was a fridge, on the other side of the bed was that horrible AC.
Area is problematic and a lot of non - guest people go to the roof terrace, making you feel unsafe at the hotel.
Breakfast is extremely basic and you have a funny notice in the elevator that  the best time for breakfast is between 6-7 in the morning, or otherwise prepare for a long line.
On top of everything, they wanted to charge us higher rate than on the bookings.site, although room was booked thru Marriott directly by a platinum member.
Unwillingly,  they corrected the rate!!!
3000$ for a 7 day stay!
What a waste of money.
Hardly worth third of it for what we had.
Shame for a Marriott chain for sure!

title: horrible
text: Rooms were dark and dingy but the worse was the parking. The hotel website says it has parking for $40 but it doesn't.  It is actually an independent lot they direct you to and you have to move your own bags up the hill.  It is not a charge to your bill and if you stay past the time the garage says you owe another $40 not an hourly rate.  Lining up your stay with the garage time is difficult. You either have to get your car out early or stay another night in the hotel.  The hotel staff was not helpful and with only two elevators getting in and out is awful. The breakfast is a free for all with the standard Marriott breakfast food but poorly done. With so many other options in NYC don't stay here.

title: Emplacement ideal
text:
Hôtel sans prétention mais très propre, avec un excellent accueil et un petit déjeuner buffet gratuit et très bien achalandé.
 Les chambres sont un peu petite mais bien décorées et fonctionnelles.
L'emplacement central est ideal, à 2 rues de Times square. Toutes les principales attractions sont facilement accessibles à pied depuis cet hôtel formidable.

title: Convenient location and reasonably sized rooms
text: Don't get me wrong - you're certainly not going to be impressed with the size of the rooms, but I've stayed at other hotels in this area for pretty much the same price where the rooms were incredibly tiny.  I was here for business, but this would be a good landing place if you're just visiting NYC.

title: Tudo ok
text:
Hotel bem localizado, pertissimo da times square. Com inúmeras opções de comércio e restaurantes em volta. A limpeza é bem básica "por cima". As toalhas eram muito limpas e cheirosas assim como os lençóis. Quarto pequeno porém pra dois acho bem ok.

Só não dou nota máxima pelo café da manhã, era muito desorganizado. Se não chegar bem cedo, não tem acesso a todas as opções do cardápio. Algumas coisas acabam e eles nao repõem. Fora que o local não tem capacidade pra todos os hóspedes. Dessa forma se formam filas de porta do restaurante a espera de uma mesa. Como íamos cedo, não tínhamos maiores problemas. 

Resumindo, acho que ficaria de novo pelo preço da diária.

title: Saudades de New York
text:
O Hotel é muito bom, limpo e confortável.
Super bem localizado.
Tem um café da manhã muito farto e bom para os padrões americanos. 
Se voce preferir pode fazer uma "quentinha" pra levar seu cafe, e degusta-lo, posteriormente.

title: Close to everything
text: Great location. Close to everything but not noisy because not right on Times Square. Great breakfast; was crowded but staff worked hard to seat people and keep food stocked. Nice and helpful staff. Concierge was informative and helpful in navigating the city.

title: A notch above all other brands under Marriott
text:
just checked into the hotel and decided to write a review immediately. something which i have never done before. 

hotel is literally right next to Port Authority Bus Terminal. make it so much easier for me when i have just taken a 5 hours bus ride from Ithaca. just 3 mins away. 

check in was quick and friendly. Joe made me feel very welcomed. i have just stayed at 2 renaissance ( 2 nights) and 1 marriott (14 nights) before here and i have never expected much from a Fairfield. i was indeed pleasantly surprised. maybe my expectation was lowered for a Fairfield but Joe has proved me wrong. I even received a call from him 10 mins after i checked in to ask of the room was ok. no other hotels under Marriott has done that before. 

breakfast is included in the rate which is a good gesture.
and there are even chocolates on the bed placed by room attendant. how sweet. 
room is practical and clean though not luxurious. size is typical of NYC

i will highly recommend anyone to choose this hotel to explore NYC!

title: I don't think that it is a good idea to live in this hotel .
text:
The hotel is terrible . I booked this hotel only because they have the free access on the roof with a view ,and today l wanted to go where , and enjoy the view , but they said that I need to be 21+ , my brother is not 21 and this wasn't wrote in a description of the hotel , so it is very awful and not right , why I have to pay 2000$ and can't enjoy the view? And staff clean rooms very bad , today I found a bag with boots from previous guests behind the wardrobe. And in my room we can use only one bed , because in few inches of the other bed is conditioner , and I can't sleep there because it is very cold , but without conditioner it's very hot. Get back my money! So guys I don't think it is a good idea to live here.

Review wrote by Chernova Evdokia.
07/07/2017

title: Хочется поскорее уехать и никогда не возвращаться
text: Я просила улучшить комнату чтобы получить красивый вид из окна. С меня взяли дополнительные 300 долларов, однако никакого красивого вида нет. Обманули. Комнаты очень маленькие и тесные - фотографии врут, не верьте.  На завтрак очередь  но небольшая.  Выбор еды небольшой, несмотря на это все основное есть (Хлеб, молоко, яйца, мюсли, кофе, чай, фрукты). Еду можно брать с собой. Местоположение удобное, прямо в центре.

title: Sceglietelo con la colazione inclusa
text:
Albergone incastrato tra altri due sulla 40th western. Comodo per la posizione, vicino alla subway, a Broadway e Times Square raggiungibili a piedi.
Camere piccole, letti comodi davvero, colazione super (se inclusa, altrimenti cara).
Un po' datato, avrebbe bisogno di una rinfrescata, ma per un tre stelle americano ci sta.

title: Albergo centrale
text:
Albergo carino, abbastanza moderno in ottima posizione, vicinissimo alla metro e soprattutto a Times Square. Ottima pulizia
Stanze come tutte quelle di Manhattan piccolissime e strette.
Colazione deludente, piccola, incasinata e soprattutto troppe persone in un piccolo spazio

title: Not Fairfield at its best
text: The hotel is just OK, but at $400 per night I expect a lot more. I realize its in "the city" but it's also in a crummy part of town with a lot of street vagrants around. True, short walk to Times Square but perhaps a bit dangerous getting there if you're alone.  The rooms are small, the bathrooms even smaller, free breakfast OK, the girls work hard to make it nice, but it's way over crowded and crazy trying to eat there in the AM.  Front desk staff helpful but honestly I've stayed in Fairfields across the country for $69 per night that were better. I realize it's the city, but it's also across the street from the Grayhound bus station if that tells you anything

title: Enjoyed our stay
text: Stayed 6 nights and were happy with our choice. Lovely comfortable beds, modern and clean room, quiet even though facing the street, and a great breakfast to start the day. Concierge very helpful. Location was very easy walking to the various sights and to access transit.  Would stay here again.

title: Very Impressed
text: I will definitely be staying here the next time I am in NYC. My room and bathroom were immaculately clean and modern. The rooms are a bit small, as are the hallways, but that is to be somewhat expected in Midtown, and a large room was not necessary for me anyway. The staff is attentive and flexible, and were eager to allow me to check-in two hours early, and check-out three hours late for no additional charge. It is in close proximity to major transportation hubs including the Port Authority Bus Terminal, as well as attractions such as Times Square, Penn Station, Herald Square, Rockefeller Center, etc. For the price, I was extremely impressed!

title: Quietest room in NYC
text:
This modern boutique hotel is a gem in the heart of NYC. Situated around the corner from Times Square and within walking distance from Bryant Park it offers the best of both worlds. It's close to subway stations and is literally across the street from the Port Authority (bus station). 

On the weekend we visited we arrived early. We expected to have our luggage held until the afternoon while we explored the city. Instead we were offered a room on the second floor if we wanted to check in early. We appreciated being informed that we might hear traffic, if that would bother us we could check in later. We took the room and we're glad we did. Room #204 was the quietest room we ever had in all of our city travels.  Our room: space was ample, handsomely appointed and kept clean and stocked throughout our stay. There is no view from this room, however, as a privacy film covers the bottom half of the window. But we didn't book the room for a view of the city, rather to experience it.  The hotel gym was also clean and very well equipped, a big plus. 
I also want to mention the staff who were friendly, helpful and engaged. From check in with Michelle, to the ever helpful Edwin and we cannot forget to praise our lovely and amazing breakfast ambassador Yvette ... All made this hotel experience superb. We will be back!!

title: Albergo centralissimo e nuovo
text: Per fortuna che abbiamo scelto questo albergo!!!!  Stanza grande, nuovo di ristrutturazione, piano alto, colazione abbondante( dolce e salata), wi fi funzionante, vicino alla metro e vicinissimo a piedi da Times Square, prezzi competitivi per Manhattan. Lo risceglieremo assolutamente! Noi abbiamo soggiornato al ventesimo piano.

title: Excellent Choice
text: This is a great location as you can walk to TImes Square within 5 minutes and next to Port Authority Terminal if you are taking coaches. Likewise walking distance to take subway at Times Square 42th station. Breakfast included and free wifi. Room is super clean and seems relatively new with city view option too. Staffs were friendly and one of the Manager goes above and beyond just to get a wine glass from next door-sister hotel. Pro: If you are looking for rooftop bar, Skyroom is just on top of the hotel. Price is definitely reasonable for a hotel within Times Square. I will definitely recommend this hotel to all readers and I will be back too

title: Great Service and Location
text: This is a nice mid-priced hotel close to the Lincon Tunnel and only 5-6 blocks from Times Square and a number of Broadway Shows. The staff was very helpful and attentive. We travel a lot and we will return to this hotel in the future.

title: Good Option for NYC on a Budget
text:
Pros - Location and Breakfast. Situated in Chelsea and in walking distance to both the Empire State Building or Greenwich Village, we found it's location both comfortable and charming. And oh wow their breakfast was both complete and delicious!

Cons - Tiny tiny bedrooms, terrible views and not so helpful staff in reception.

But if you are planning to be out all day it's fine.

title: Perfect location for a trip to New York
text:
We visited New York last month and stayed for 5 nights in the Fairfield Inn & suites. On arrival to the hotel, the staff were very friendly and told us where to get a late night drink and something to eat. 

The hotel is situated just off Times Square and is great for walking to most of the sightseeing areas. It's located close to the bus station which links to the metro!

With the comfortable and spacious rooms, came a nice breakfast which was good for a quick bite before rushing off.

Would strongly recommend this hotel and would happily return.

title: Dentro la Big Apple..!
text:
Siamo tra i grattacieli, 30° piano, terrazza sulla Grande Mela, teatro di migliaia di film!
E' già un'emozione essere a New York, viverla comodi è ancora meglio !
E' tuttavia un lusso permettersi certi Hotel perché molti soffrono di stantio.
NON è questo il caso: moderno, pulito, staff cordialissimo, prezzo nella media con un buon rapporto qualità prezzo.
Siamo stati bene e non ci é mancato nulla.
La nostra camera era abbastanza confortevole per 3 persone, con due letti matrimoniali ma...se fossimo stati in 4 saremmo stati sacrificati.

title: Nice Times Square Hotel
text: This hotel is located on 40th street between 8th and 9th street.  Very easy walk to all of the Time Square activities and sights.  The hotel is very clean and comfortable.  The folks working there are very nice and helpful.  When we go back to NYC, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: Muy buen hotel!
text:
Si bien no es la mejor zona, la ubicación es excelente, muy cerca del time square y principales líneas de subte, muy bien servicio de desayuno y agua todo el día.
Como guest del hotel tenes acceso al sky room, pero podrían mejorar la música y pensarlo para el turista.

title: Buena situación, amabilidad, buen desayuno, habitación pequeña
text:
Estuvimos una semana 4 personas en una habitación con dos camas dobles.

Todo el personal muy atento, eficiente y amables.

El desayuno bastante completo, la única pega, como en todo New York, el café americano.

La habitación era demasiado pequeña para cuatro personas, camas también algo pequeñas aunque confortables.

Buena limpieza a diario.

Muy bien situado

title: Buen hotel, muy masificado
text:
El hotel está bien cuidado. Muy bien situado, en frente al intercambiador de autobuses y metro, por lo que tenéis salida en todas direcciones. A Times Square se llega caminando en 10 minutos.
Lo peor del hotel es la masificación, tienen muy poco espacio destinado a zonas comunes, por lo que desayunar se convierte en una aventura, teniendo que esperar cola para sentarse y peleándose para conseguir la comida.
El personal es atento y amable, pero se ve que trabajan a destajo y no pueden atender todo lo bien que se requiere. En la habitación llegaron a no ponernos papel higiénico un día, aunque se había agotado.
Pese a los inconvenientes, no tendría problema en volverme a alojar en este hotel.

title: Good, basic Times Square Hotel
text: The rooms are small but tolerable and quiet. The breakfast is motel-grade and the dining room is very crowded, but you can bring food to your room. A terrific location; the airport bus stops a block away. Entrance to Port Authority Bus Terminal right across the street. We've stay there several times.

title: I would recommend this hotel.
text: This hotel is very well located in Manhattan. The check in was quick. Our room was ready for us. The sleep quality in a kingsize bed was very good indeed, Everything was spotless, The breakfast was more than adequate- piping hot porridge, cereals,  bacon, scrambled eggs, cheese omelet, some kind of meat patties, fresh fruit, yoghurts, bagels waffles, bread for toasting and Starbucks coffee. Ok! so the  dishes were disposable but I certainly didn't care. In most budget Manhattan hotels  one has to go out for breakfast.

title: Smaller than normal NYC rooms but very clean
text:
As a platinum Marriott member, I've stayed at my share of properties in NYC. 

Obviously, NYC rooms will be smaller than property is located in other areas. This room, however, was exceptionally smaller in size. It's fine for solo or couples, but I stayed w/ my daughter and it was cramped getting ready.

I did have a Cityview on the 31st floor so I had plenty of sunshine & the room was very clean. Had small fridge, plenty of adapters, bed was good.  The bathroom has 0 counter space.
