The sink is quite large, so we put a towel in it to place makeup, etc on while we got ready. It does have a magnified separate mirror which we appreciated. The breakfast was good- complete w NYC bagels, eggs, oatmeal.

title: Separate beds
text: Tee checked in as a couple and separate beds were given to us all efforts to change the room were futile and the help desk assistant was of no help.............first ever experience @ a hotel. The room was clean though with basic amenities but this was a spoiler for my husband and I who hadn't spent time away from the kids for the last 5 years.

title: Prima hotel op een top locatie
text: Ik ben net terug van 4 nachten hier. Prima hotel kamer modern schoon en met een goed bed. De locatie is top 7 min van Time square. Ontbijt is ruim voldoende en keuze ook prime enige wat me opviel is dat de ontbijtruimte vrij klein is en dat je eet van papierenbordjes en met plastic bestek. Had ik niet verwacht van een hotel in deze klasse.

title: Great location, clean, quiet
text: On an overnight business trip to the city. Room was clean and quiet (relative to NYC). I was on the 30th floor and everything met my expectations. I did not utilize the provided breakfast or any other hotel services. Location is great, close walk to theaters, Time Square, restaurants, etc.

title: Great Location for Traveling
text: I stayed here for Cinco de Mayo weekend. First time at this particular hotel. The hotel is located right next to Port Authority so those arriving in public transportation can easily find it. It is a a 5 min walk to get to the center of time square or anywhere fun. It is located close to everything you would need to enjoy your stay. The hotel itself looks upscale with a welcoming lobby. The staff attends you quickly and with a great attitude. The rooms are small but that was not a problem as I was not in the city to stay in the room. The beds are large the bathroom is roomy and there is closet space for your clothing. The rooftop bar is a great place to hang out with friends and breakfast in the morning was enjoyable as were the staff. The staff working Cinco de Mayo weekend were very helpful and went above and beyond to resolve any issues. If you are looking for a great hotel to stay and enjoy the city this is the place.

title: Nel cuore di Manhattan
text: Struttura posta in posizione centralissima, tutto facilmente raggiungibile a piedi, pulizia della camera soddisfacente e servizio reception efficiente. Colazione più che buona per essere compresa nel costo della camera.

title: удобное расположение, приемлемый сервис,  пластиковые тарелки
text:
Отель находится в  самом центре Манхэттена, рядом с Тамс-сквер, в 5 минутах от любой ветки метро.  Приветливый персонал.  В номерах чисто, каждый день меняются полотнеца. Завтрак не роскошнй, но вполне приличный. Довольно небольшое помещение для  завтрака, и в последние часы могут быть очереди. Но больше всего меня удивило то, что вместо посуды даются пластиковые тарелки и пластиковые вилки/ложки. 
Если бы не это обстоятельсство, по соотношению цена - качество поставила бы  твердую пятерку

title: Very pleasant stay
text: I would like to thank Joe who did exceptional work checking us in. Not only he gave us higher floor with nice views he also sent us complimentary bottle of wine. He made sure that our NYC stay would be pleasant from the beginning.

title: Top
text:
Les +
-Hôtel situé à proximité de Time square (7minutes à pieds), de la station de metro Port authority(1minute à pieds), et pas mal de bons restaurants dans les alentours.
-Accès direct au Sky Room  (rooftop réputé de NY)
- Une superbe vue sur la ville(de notre chambre au 30 ème étage.)
-Une Salle de sport très propre et complète. 
 
Les - 
-Le tarif qui peut vite être élevé selon la periode
- La salle de petit déjeuner très petite et vite bondée.

title: Fine hotel - prices vary, lower floors can be dark
text: This is a perfectly good hotel with a reasonable location and facilities. The rooms seem to have loads of USB ports, and a hard Internet connection. Breakfast was adequate. You night find that the lower rooms are a bit dark - I was on the 8th floor facing south and found it a bit dark. If the price is right, I'll be back.

title: Buena ubicación
text: Hotel muy cerca de Times Square, pero en calle tranquila así que la ubicación genial. Entrada al metro muy cerca. Habitación algo pequeña con armario muy pequeño pero según lo que nos han comentado lo habitual en Manhattan. Desayuno incluido en la parte baja del hotel, con cubiertos de plástico y cola esperando para entrar en algunos momentos.. no era una maravilla en cuanto a calidad y variedad pero pasable. El personal muy amable, te ayudan en cualquier cosa que necesites incluso una vez nos imprimieron itinerarios de metro con paradas para saber cuál era la ruta que teníamos que hacer. Botellas gratis de agua todas las que quisiéramos, solo teníamos que llamar a recepción y las subían a la habitación. Muy atentos y serviciales, especialmente Antonio.

title: Good location for a night or two
text: This was a good location for a night or two.  However, we were on the 16th floor and elevators ate VERY slow.  Waited far too long every time.  Also, breakfast was a long wait as tables fill up quickly.  Not sure it was worth it.

title: A solo unas calles de Times Square
text: Hospedarce en un hotel en Manhatan no es barato, pero tienes que encontrar la mejor opción en cuanto a precio, ubicación, ademas que te incluye el desayuno, casi frente al hotel hay una estación de subway y de tren, las vistas desde las habitaciones no son tan espectaculares ya que esta rodeada de edificios mas altos, pero en si el hotel esta limpio y la atencion de su personal es buena.

title: Attentive staff
text: The staff (kudos to Mario) went out of their way to straighten out reservations that I had screwed up. The rooms are small but clean, new in appearance, and there's a busy but nice breakfast service. The hotel is located between Hell's Kitchen and the theater district. As a result, it's convenient if that's where you want to be, but the surrounding area is far from tranquil and close by is a parole office, Across the street from the bus station.  The neighborhood is active all night. Less than ideal.

title: Hotel génial
text:
Nous avons séjourné moi et mon conjoint 4 nuits à cet hôtel. Ce fût parfait. Super décor, propre, très silencieux. En fait on entend dans les corridors et dehors mais lorsque les gens sont dans leur chambre on n'entend rien. Comme on est collllllé sur time square (5min de marche et vous voila dans l'action) vous aurez le chant des taxis comme bruit de fond dans la chambre mais l'insonorisation est impressionnante. Déjeuner style buffet: fruits, oeuf brouillé, omellette au fromage, saucisse, bacon, muffin, bagel,toast,muffin anglais, yogourt grek, bar a jus et café starbuck.

Si vous chialez comme individu dans la vie vous aurez de quoi à redire, mais si vous avez 1 tête sur les épaules ne tenez pas compte des mauvais commentaires isolés et go pour ce magnifique hôtel.

title: Great hotel for tourist!!
text: Great location and close to the action of New York City. The service has been awesome and the continental breakfast is tasty and has Starbucks coffee!! Rooms are a decent size for New York. An excellent choice for hotel in New York!!

title: Bom custo beneficio
text: Estivemos em março de 2017 nesse hotel pela segunda e apesar de ter tido um problema com cobrança indevida da primeira vez, que foi resolvida, voltamos devido ao bom custo beneficio e ótima localizaçao

title: Posizione eccellente
text:
Non e' certo un hotel di lusso, ma la posizione e il rapporto qualita'prezzo ne fanno certamente una proposta da valutare per un soggiorno a New York.
A solo 10 minuti a piedi da Time Square, 20 da Central Park, metropolitan a 200 mt.
Le camere sono pulite, bagno grande con comoda doccia, e cosa non da poco, colazione inclusa.
Con una offerta trovata sul sito booking.com abbiamo pagato 950 dollari per 4 notti camera per 4 persone:davvero un ottimo prezzo!!!

title: Fair hotel in the hurricanes eye
text:
This is an OK 3-star hotel in the middle of Manhattan. However, beware of the noise from the street and ask for a room above 12th floor.

Pros: cleanliness and very well equipped rooms power-wise. Lots of power outlets including a horde of USB charging sockets which is excellent for charging mobiles, tablets etc. Excellent wifi speed.
Empty fridge in the room for your own beverages.
Breakfast is included and you are very close to the centre of Manhattan/Times Square.

Cons: lots of trafic noise from the Bus Terminal and on the lower floors the ventilation. The breakfast is quite simple and without many choises and you eat from disposable tableware. Moreover the breakfast staff is more focused on having as many guests through the breakfast as possible than making it an enjoyable moment. Lots of queing to the breakfast due to limited seating of which on third is in a very cold room.

Staff is otherwise very helpful. We were initially placed on the 3rd floor but due to noise we asked for another, more quiet, room and was immediately moved to the 16th floor. Moreover, the consierge can help with various issues like transport to/from the airport at a lower price than the taxis and other limo-services.
However, I would recommend another "hop on - hop off" bus service than offered here (Grey Line) since it is a very low-cost and low-tech company.

title: Excellent hotel and wonderful guest services team!
text:
I am a regular guest in this hotel. Excellent service, wonderful team and very close to NY City attractions and business.

The breakfast is great start for the day as well as newspapers. If you are a Marriott rewards member, you get a special welcome.

title: Super emplacement de cet hôtel
text: Nous avons appréciés l'emplacement de cet hôtel qui a proximité de tout car il est vraiment au centre, la literie au top! J'ai passée les meilleures nuit de ma vie dans cet hôtel grâce a la literie. Le petit déjeuner appréciable mais les employés du petit déjeuner très désagréable

title: Nice hotel
text: Efficient staff, central location, clean and well furnished rooms, good and complete breakfast... I will certainly come back if I ever go to New York again ! Moreover the price is totally correct compared with the quality provided. Only bad side would be the elevators, we were so tired of waiting for then that we used to chose the stairs instead.

title: Great position and room big enough
text:
Hotel is in a very good position. 100 m from
Port Authority subway station (and bus station) and you can get to other subway lines directly following the underground metro path. Time square is 10 mins. The room was clean and big enough for 2 people (with king bed). Breakfast and reception staff should be more smiley. Breakfast doesn't have a wide range of choice, but you can take it with you if it's crowded.

title: Excellent hotel
text: I stayed at the Fairfield Inn & Suites for just over a week, and had a wonderful experience. The hotel is very clean, the wifi is free and fast, and there is free breakfast included. The location of the hotel is great, and all the workers are very friendly. I really recommend staying at this lovely hotel. Enjoy!

title: Very good value for location
text: We stayed at this Fairfield between March 23 and 26, 2017.  The location was very close to Times Square, the theater district and many eateries.  The rooms were clean and well appointed, service was good and security was also good.  I will definitively stay at this location again in the future.

title: Served its purpose
text:
This hotel was ok.  It was in good walking distance to Time Square.  Our stay was nice.  My only issue was for more than 2 days were were unable to get a drink from the hotel vending machines.  The breakfast area was extremely crowded and the staff were not pleasant at all. One staff member was constantly having a private conversation with two guest me loudly use foul language.  Want pleased with that at all. Otherwise, it was an ok hotel.

The car service the hotel uses for airport pick up was a very nice touch to the end of our trip.  I appreciated the wonderful driver we were assigned.

title: Excellent Location
text: This is a great hotel that's in a great location.  The hotel is newly updated and clean, the staff was very helpful and professional.  The room was small, but it is Manhattan.  The elevators and breakfast were often busy, but again, it's Manhattan.  The breakfast was good, not great, and the attendants were helpful. During one trip down in the elevator, a hotel staffer exited before his floor to make more room for guests who were getting on the elevator.  The valets were also friendly and helpful.  The hotel let us check our belongings in a locked room after we checked out so we didn't have to leave the city until the afternoon.  The rates were great, even with valet parking (which was still cheaper than taking a train and dealing with parking garages, etc.).  Beds were comfortable and there were complimentary earplugs in the room, which we did not use.  We asked to be on a "quieter" floor and they accommodated us, putting us on 18, about halfway between street noise and the club on the top floor.   I would recommend this hotel.  I read a few not so great reviews before staying, but I think they were complaining about things that you just can't change when you are in Manhattan, e.g room size, drop off area for valets, etc.

title: Great Place
text:
We came for one night for a family girls
Trip (my aunt is serious germaphobe) we ALL loved our stay, it was extremely clean all of the staff was incredibly nice and accommodating , nothing seemed dated and the continental breakfast was literally the best I've had. We will definitely stay he again when we return

title: Pretty good
text: Overall, this is situated fairly close to Times and therefore you can easily access the great things that NYC and Times Sq. have to offer. I liked the service, the rooms were cleen, though the breakfast area was pretty poor. I recommended it if you are on NYC spec'ed budget.

title: Great stay, great location!
text:
Immaculate rooms & great staff. Loved that we could skip the line for the sky bar. Even found parking on 39th. Restaurants right around the corner. 
Capizzi Brick Oven Pizza was delicious! Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Good hotel!!
text: This hotel is awesome!! The rooms are very nice and it has a cool sky room at the top!! The hotel is around every thing and the breakfast is good!! I definitely recommend this hotel if you are staying in Manhattan and looking for a nice hotel!! The views from rooms are amazing!! It is a tiny bit expensive.

title: Broadway? Times Square?  STAY HERE!
text:
I read all the reviews.  I looked at many hotels in the city and out of the city.  If you're looking for convenient, affordable, comfortable lodgings close to all the midtown Manhattan attractions -- this is the place.

One adult and two older teens had a marvelous time during a busy week in New York.  The hotel was completely booked.  There were large groups and we did not have a problem -- not one.  We stayed on the 14th floor.  No tremendously long waits for the elevator.  I saw the room attendant on our floor, but she was super quiet and kept the room tidy.  The bathroom in our double room was very spacious.  The room faced the parking garage on W. 40th -- it was high enough to give a great view of the cityscape -- but no loud street noise.  The breakfast area is small, but for a free full hot morning meal to be included in the great AAA rate is nothing I'd complain about.

This trip was a special birthday gift and this hotel made it affordable for us to stay in Times Square. Extra kudos to Mario Paredes for making us feel so very welcome in the the big city!

title: Нью Йорк
text: Отель очень удобно расположен все рядом․ номера небольшие но удобные․ Завтрак достойный﹐все есть омлет﹐каша ﹐мюсли кофе натуральный и тд․обслуживание хорошее﹐ быстрый интернет смотрели фильмы онлайн․для экскурсионной поездки идеальный вариант соотношения цены и качества для Нью Йорка․

title: A Wonderful Experience!
text: I highly recommend this hotel! Long weekend visit with my daughter- perfect location, and the front desk, bell desk and breakfast staff were so friendly and helpful. Rooms- very clean and upgraded, King bed deep and comfy, air controlled, showers strong, large TV. Ask for room away from elevator. Plenty of storage for clothes. Elevators worked great, never more then a few minutes wait. Free breakfast perfect- skip the lines and just go through for a to-go container. We had an early checkin and late checkout. Did not visit Sky Room bc it was 21+. They use a separate elevator for people going up so it doesn't impact guest elevators. They call for a car service to take you to airport. We will always come here for our trips. Thank you for making our trip to NYC so wonderful and issue-free!

title: Tiny elevators.
text: There are three very small elevators, with only two dedicated to guests as the third is exclusively for the rooftop bar.  You could squeeze in 5 guests, or 4 with small suitcases.  We arrived at the hotel late afternoon on Friday and there was a bus load or two of young guests waiting on the two elevators.  After waiting about 20 minutes, I walked up the 8 fights, and my husband waited an additional 10 minutes for the elevator after the staff moved the large group to one elevator and allowed other guest to use the remaining elevator.  I  can't rate the breakfast as the area is extremely small and we did not want to wait what would have been a long time for their breakfast.  The hotel room was adequate, but not what you usually get from Fairfield Inn and Suites,  There is a beverage cooler not a refrigerator and when I asked I was told you had to go to the lower level for ice, so we did without as I did not want to wait on the elevator to get ice,  I was concerned we would be late Friday evening for the theater as it took a while for an elevator to stop that was not crammed with guests.  The shower floor is very slick, so be careful in the shower.  we had a view of the side of the bus station from our window and eight avenue had trash bags on the street all three days were at the hotel.

title: 4 GREAT reason to choose this hotel
text:
For a GREAT time in the city, you must stay at this hotel, my conclusion is as follows :-
Great staff,
Great breakfast 
Great facilities & also important
Great location
+++ for those who loves bowling because there's frames 1 min walk away. What a great view from my room. Hats off to Front desk staff Janeay & Michelle Granados for their high level of customer service and professionalism. Will recommend 100% this hotel.

title: Trip to enjoy plays
text: We really enjoyed the whole trip but The Fairfield was exceptional.  Everyone there went out of their way to make sure we enjoyed our stay.  This hotel will be the only place we stay in the future. This hotel off a value in service and cost.

title: Confortável, equipe nota 10.
text: Minha hospedagem nesse hotel foi top demAis, principalmente pelo atendimento. Fica próximo ao metrô e pertinho dos pontos turísticos de NY. Só à noite que dependendo do horário é melhor voltar de uber ou táxi.

title: Convenient Location, unprofessional staff
text:
We came for an anniversary trip. 
It earned 2 stars because: The hotel room/bathroom were fresh and updated, and not too cramped like other hotels in the city. The location was convenient to Times Square and the subway. The thermostat in our hotel room was wonderful and responded very quickly to the changes we would make.

It is missing 3 stars because: 
1- the staff was not up to par. At check-in, the girl asked me if I was expecting. I am not. In fact, I miscarried 2 months before our trip (at 9 weeks pregnant, long before you show anything). I have a thin build, am not overweight, etc... It was embarassing and painful, a difficult reminder of the loss I experienced recently. You NEVER ask that question.

2- After checking in, there were not extra towels in our room like we requested in our reservation made directly with Marriott. We called to request them when we got to our room at 3:30. At 4:30 they still had not come so we called again. We left at 5:30 for dinner/a show and when we returned at 11:30 we STILL did not have the towels. When we called at 11:30 they came quickly. It should not take 8 hours and 3 phone calls to get extra towels.

3- The water pressure for the shower is non-existent. Shaving was difficult b/c there wasn't enough water pressure to rinse the razor. Also, and more importantly, there was NO hot water. We turned the shower as hot as it could be, and the water coming out was lukewarm at best. Showering in cold water is not a fun start to the day. What was interesting was the hot water from the sink faucet was so hot it would burn your hands if you didn't also turn on the cold. How is the sink so hot and the shower so NOT?

The doors are VERY thin. Our room was near the elevator and we were woken up at 2 and 3 am each night by somebody else from our floor being LOUD while waiting for the elevators. Some common sense would go a long way. Stacked extra pillows along the crack under the door, but it did little to help.

Sidenote: The bed was very firm. A little too firm for our liking, but others may prefer it that way. No stars lost here.

So we would stay here again, but with lower expectations. And hope that it is warm so I don't need a hot shower to warm up after a cold rainy day.

title: Vacaciones en NY
text: Excelente ubicación ... a 1 cuadra de la  grand estación de la 42st .. la terminal de buses está a media cuadra ... caminando a 10 o menos tienes el centro de manhatan. . Time square,  brodway ,rpckefeller center etc..  caminas unos 25 minutos y llegas al empire state... para que tengan una idea el hotel está ubicado en la 40st y todo esta entre la 42 en adelante ... y el empiere  state está en la 34 st... en NY es fácil caminar cuadras y cuadras para llegar a los sitios ... y si no pues las estaciones están super cerca del hotel ... las instalaciones siempre limpias la habitación con toallas limpias a diario el desayuno justo lo que uno necesita para empezar un día largo de caminatas .... en general super recomendado ... para el precio la ubicación que ofrece y el servicio está muy bien ... tienen mapas de lugares a visitar etc ..y el personal muy amable sobre todo el de servicio en el desayuno y recepción

title: Bom hotel
text:
Hotel confortável para os padrões de NY. Ótima localização. Quarto com tamanho bom, uma cama confortável e um bom
chuveiro. Camareiras atenciosas. Ambiente limpo. Café da manhã fraco, não vale a pena incluir na diária. Próximo aos restaurantes e metro. Recepcionistas atenciosos. Bom preço. Recomendo.

title: First visit to Newyork
text: Good value clean hotel. Busy but reception staff were very helpful. Rooftop bar/club has great views at night and free entry to guests. Your only a 10 min stroll from times square and only 5 mins from bars and resturants in Hells kitchen area.

title: Good Value
text: Comfortable rooms with all basic necessities king size bed fluffy blanket with basics to stay for a few days in new york near times square bryant park, walking area and feel safe, good attention from the employees in general good reasonable price I felt well attented And worth the relationship between value and comfort I recommend this hotel good choice in New York, excellent breakfast

title: Solid option near Times Square
text:
The hotel itself is located very conveniently for folks wanting to be near Times Square, and provides very good value for a NYC booking. 

A couple of standouts (in both directions): 

- The counter staff were very awesome. Michelle, in particular, was marvelous at check-in. 
- Breakfast is top notch for this category hotel. Pay attention to the warning signs about timing and you'll be impressed. 
- The room was very clean, well-maintained, etc. 
- The hotel elevators are abysmally slow; with ~30 floors (with only 8-10 rooms on each floor), the two elevators can cause a significant wait in either direction. 
- Thank goodness they have a pull-up/valet area for those of you who might be bringing cars.

There's a lot of construction in the area, but don't fret; just put your head down and cruise on through. And watch out for buses - the bus terminal is across the street, and the street can be busy.

title: Fantastic Experience
text: We came in on a Wednesday around 11:00. Clearly check in is not until 4 o'clock. We were greeted by a very nice young lady named Jennay. (Probably spelled wrong). She was very personable and took our phone number so she could call us if a room opened up early. About one hour later she did exactly that.  We did not expect that she would call but she did and she was extremely helpful and friendly and even found us a larger room on a higher floor. Beyond that the room was very nice as was the hotel itself. Breakfast was excellent as well. The view was pretty cool too.

title: Excellent Value Minutes From Times Square
text: Of the many hotels we've stayed at here in here in New York, this is by far the best value for location and what you get. A short walk to Times Square, the hotel is clean and modern. Decent room size, and the breakfasts are great (if there is a line to get into breakfast, skip it and get a carry out container).

title: Good value
text: Clean,comfortable and a nice room for the price.  Not necessarily considered Times Square since it's right across the street from the Port Authority bus terminal.  The rooftop bar is only open Thursday -Saturday. The elevators are tiny. 4 people fit fine. 5 is too many unless your married to the person in front of you. Staff is friendly and they even have a concierge.  A nice touch for a hotel at this level.

title: El Hotel Ideal
text:
un excelente hotel para los que no quieren estar en Manhattan o bajar los costos, esta ubicado cerca del subway y estas ebn plenoManhattan en 10 minutos, la atencion excelente el desayuno de primera.
llegamos el 31-12-2016 a las 6 de la mañana y ya tenian lista la habitacion sin ningun cargo extra 
un fin de año exclente

title: Friendly Fairfield
text: This location provides clean, comfortable, quiet accommodations at a reasonable rate.  The staff is helpful and courteous.  The breakfast is included in the rate and provides many choices for the perfect way to start a day.  It is a great place to stay and is accessible to the subway.  Many attractions and restaurants are within walking distance.  Wifi is available.

title: Good nights sleep
text:
The hotel is clean and offers a free breakfast and wifi. Valet was easy considering there are three hotels in a line on the street. The hotel is in a gear location. Across from Port Authority. A block from the heart of Times Square. 

My only complaint is the fee for Valet parking. On the website it says $55 / $65 for oversized. I drive a Jeep Compass in no way is that an oversized vehicle. Not to mention because of the marathon valet took over an hour to get cars. Nothing was offered for that inconvenience. 

Other than that the stay was pleasant, beds comfortable  and toiletries actually good. The shower was amazing! Very clean and spacious.

title: Buen hotel
text:
Buscamos un buen hotel con desayuno, cerca de las calles principales de Manhattan por lo que cumplió nuestras expectativas, no pudimos subir a La terraza porque hacen fiestas privadas.
El desayuno completo, nos permitía estar unas cuantas horas recorriendo con lo que habíamos desayunado.

title: NAVIDAD EN NEW YORK
text: Fuimos con mi familia a pasar la Navidad en New York, nos alojamos en este hotel, fue una decisión muy acertada, pues nos sentimos muy cómodos en él, las habitaciones amplias, la limpieza excelente y las camas muy confortables que nos permitían un descanso reparador. Además su ubicación es privilegiada, cerca de los puntos más importantes de la ciudad. El único punto que no me gustó fue la hora del desayuno, pues el espacio es muy pequeño para la cantidad de huéspedes, pero todo lo demás fue muy positivo.

title: Típico de New York, pero con más de lo esperado!!
text:
En NY uno busca un hotel para poder dormir y después, salir a recorrer la ciudad. Este hotel encaja muy bien. Muy cerca de Times Square, con acceso a los subtes en la esquina, con habitaciones de tamaño aceptable (para la media en NY) y con personal muy bien predispuesto, junta las condiciones necesarias para hacer base ahí. 
La calificación debería ser BUENO. No llega a Muy Bueno, pero es MÁS que Normal. Estuvimos con mi flia la última semana de Febrero, pero había bastante gente. Pensé que al contar con solo 3 ascensores ibamos a tener problemas, pero no fue grave, nunca me tocó esperar demasiado. El lugar de desayuno definitivamente es chico, pero nunca esperé más de 5/7 minutos para sentarme a desayunar. Es cierto que una vez que te sentás, es algo incómodo para moverte y recoger lo que quieras comer. Pero si no podés/querés esperar, te dan una caja descartable donde poder llevarte tu desayuno y comer en tu habitación o dónde quieras!!
Se encuentra en una calle (la 40, entre la 8° y la 9°) en la que de noche no anda mucha gente, pero nunca nos sentimos inseguros (aplica a NY en general). Y el personal del hotel, por lo menos los 4 o 5 con los que interactué por distintas cuestiones, siempre nos dieron una mano. 
Aclaración: Apenas llegamos, y producto de una feria de la Industria del juguete que había pasado por la ciudasd, a mi hija le regalaron un set muy completo de muñecas muy chiquitas, que le encantaron!!! Hay que reconocer que eso significó empezar con el pie derecho, y de entrada nos dió una buena sensación. Pero tampo tuvimos grandes inconvenientes durante la semana. En resumen, ideal en la relación Precio/Calidad!!!

title: NO!
text:
ROOMS: Small stinky room, very small beds (I mean it), two veeery slow and always too full elevators. 
FOOD: Breakfast was a disaster - I hardly found anything edible. 
LOCATION: Neighbourhood quite shabby, although it was really close to Times Square.
Never again.

title: First trip to NY, pleasantly surprised
text: The hotel was very nice. The lobby was beautifully decorated. The rooms were small but nice. Everything was very clean and well kept. The elevators were very slow, there were three operating at all times, but it was a busy place. Breakfast was very nice and actually very spacious I thought. There is NO parking aside from valet which was VERY expensive, $65.00 per 24 hours for my SUV. We really had no other option, but it worked out ok as we rode the subway to most all of our destinations. The hotel is also within walking distance to Times Square which was great. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Great location and hospitality
text:
We stayed here for two nights. Great location. Walking distance to Times Square, and the subway is just steps away. Our car arrived within 10mins of us requesting it. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Concierge was helpful. Wait staff and housekeeping were very nice. Breakfast was decent... I especially like the option to grab & go with takeout container. Rooms were clean and updated.

There are three elevators but they were often slow and are VERY small. Sometimes when it finally shows up, you can't fit in it. One elevator was dedicated to taking people to the rooftop bar in the evening which slowed down the service even more.

Only other challenge was that we were charged for 2 days parking. In the past, some hotels won't charge for 48hrs of parking if you don't actually stay 48hrs. In this case, we were charged even though we checked out after 44hrs. Not a deal-breaker but a nice gesture when it's not charged.

title: Group Dance team trip!
text: Just awesome!! Very clean and nice room. Small but good use of space! From check in to check out, the staff was very kind and accommodating! I called the front desk to inquire about where to purchase a bottle of water. Within five minutes there was a knock on the door and a gentleman gave us bottles of water! Evette in the dining room, greeted me each day with a big smile! She made me feel like family and I can't wait to stay again....just to see her!!! Jason helped us with our bags during check out and was so kind! This hotel is literally right across from the Port Authority Transit center, you can go anywhere from there! Nice walk to Times Square! Great food close by!! The room had no traffic noise, very quiet! Temperature easily adjusted! I never saw housekeeping! I think they have fairies who magically clean the room and make beds! ;) I was never worried about my safety or the safety of my possessions! Though there is a safe in the closet if needed!! I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Great location and modern
text: Stayed here for a long weekend for my 40th birthday. Room had a view of the Empire State Building which was an added touch. Arrived slightly early so room wasn't ready so we left our suitcases and went out for a few hours. Lobby area and reception very clean and modern. Room spacious with free wifi and good choice of tv channels on widescreen TV. Didn't really enjoy the breakfast, food was below average and served on plastic plates and plastic cutlery?? Felt like I was back in a school canteen. Perfect location to Times Square and other local attractions. Nice little bar area at the top of the hotel which can be used by members of the public.

title: Nothing Special
text:
Stayed with 3 friends on a mini break. 

Room very small, booked a family room but in my opinion not adequate for 4 people. The sink in the bathroom was dirty on arrival, someone else's toothpaste remnants down the side of the sink & over the toilet roll holder. Not nice!  

Breakfast room, very very small.  Everything was throw away - plates, cutlery, dishes, plates. Very busy whenever we were in there & it was like a bun fight trying to get to the tiny food areas. The food was nothing special.  The very minute we had finished our food (we had to take our cardboard cup drinks with us), we were asked to vacate the table as the queue was long for people waiting to be seated. I was not impressed. 

What I thought was very strange, the bar is only open 3 evenings per week.  We had been out all day, returning early evening, looking forward to a glass of wine or cocktail, to be told we would have to go back out as the bar isn't open. I have visited hotels all over the world & never experienced this. 

The only positives:
the hotels location (good for popular sights)
Wifi was efficient 

Other than that, I wouldn't visit again. Of the hundreds of hotels in New York I will do more research to find one that is superior.

title: Marzo a NYC
text:
Personale disponibile e gentilissimo, ottimo hotel ed ottima la posizione, ottima la relazione qualità / prezzo. 

Colazione adeguata e pulizia dappertutto.

Bagno grande e doccia comoda, camera con dimensioni nella norma e con grande televisore.

Nonostante le dimensioni, e l'afflusso di gente, poca coda sia agli ascensori sia alla colazione. 

Da tornare sicuramente.

title: Ottima sorpresa
text:
Sono stato a New York diverse volte e devo dire sono stato ben sorpreso da questo hotel. Ottima la posizione, praticamente in Time Square, vicino alla metro, insomma punto di partenza perfetto.
Inutile elencare che intorno trovi qualsiasi tipo di ristorante e/o bar.
Io mi sono trovato molto bene, a partire dal l'accoglienza al check in alla camera, per essere NY ha delle ottime dimensioni.
Al mattino nell'orario di punta pur avendo a disposizione 3 ascensori c'è un po da aspettare..... ma ripeto siamo a Manhattan!
Per quanto riguarda la colazione è assolutamente nello standard Americano, dove la colazione non è mai compresa e se come in questo hotel lo è, a disposizione dei clienti trovi il minimo indispensabile, sempre e comunque sopra la media di categoria.
Altra nota da aggiungere al locale/bar che si trova dentro l'hotel, TOP roof skyline, i clienti dell'hotel hanno precedenza sui visitatori che non hanno la camera.
Io consiglio al 100% l

title: bellissimo ricordo
text: abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel a gennaio 2017, prima volta a New York ed è stata una ottima scelta. posizione eccellente , ci si può spostare a piedi e raggiungere tutti i più famosi luoghi della grande mela o prendere la metro a due passi. hotel moderno pulito ed accogliente, stanze della giusta dimensione ben arredate, con temperatura regolabile, bagno comodo,pulito. Biancheria di buona qualità e letto molto comodo. Prese USB dislocate in tutta la stanza di una comodità assoluta. per quanto riguarda la colazione noi non abbiamo mai fatto file anche perchè merito del fuso orario ci alzavamo presto. Qualita del cibo buona e varia e apprezzabile la cura nei dettagli come conservare latte e cibi deperibili in frigo chiuso. Da consigliare  vivamente.

title: Nice stay
text: We got a great offer for 3 double bed rooms for 9 nights in February. The hotel is just a block away from the nearest subway station and it is nicely decorated. Breakfast was included and though it the same everyday and you had to wait for a table it had a little bit of everything and to go boxes. The rooms are New York size, smaller than an average hotel room so don't exaggerate with luggage. Besides that they have a sky room bar that had a lot of movement but we couldn't go because it was business casual and we didn't bring any dress shoes. Instead we went to the little improvised sports bar, the bartender is talented but he barely has any equipment and for the ambiance drinks are too expensive. Besides the sign says open until 1am but by 11:30 the bar is closing up.  Could improve those little details, and water daily water bottles would be appreciated. There vending machine that sold water and drinks at the lower level was sold out of everything except sparkling water for two days. Also walking distance form Carlos's bakery, Hell's Kitchen and Times Square.

title: Last minute deal!
text:
Got a great price last minute and was not disappointed!
Usually I only come into the city for the day, however I decided to splurge on a one night stay. I had been to The Sky Room before and loved the rooftop lounge so when I found a great deal I booked right away. 
The location is great, close to Time Square and all its attractions and restaurants. The staff were courteous and helpful. And the breakfast was one of the better hotel breakfasts I've had. It is pretty standard but they offered two types of eggs and two meats. Lots of coffee and tea and juice options. Also fruit, yogurt, cereals, and breads, etc. 
The room was very clean and modern, the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom was spotless. 
Each floor only has 8 rooms as far as I can tell so even though we were near the stairs and elevator there wasn't too much noise. 
We even went up to The Sky Room around 1 am! By then it was in full club mode (to be expected on a Saturday night) but the place is well staffed and seems to handle the crowd smoothly. The views are amazing (I believe it's the 33rd floor) and as a hotel guest you don't have to pay a cover or wait in line. 
Due to the late night we were a little slow in getting ready to go in the morning and figured it was worth a shot to call down to ask for a late checkout (right before 11) and the front desk obliged and let us hang out until 12:30!
We used their valet as well and as long as you retrieve your car prior to 24 hours after leaving it with valet they charge you for one night of parking @ $55. 

All in all a great experience, would definitely stay here again.

title: Great staff!  Great Location!
text: My husband and I recently stayed here when we came to NYC to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary!  We had an early check in and when we arrived we found we were given an upgrade and our very comfortable and clean room was ready!  The staff could not have been better.  In the morning the breakfast area was crowded, but the breakfast staff did an excellent job of keeping the tables clean and seating guests, so even though the line for breakfast looked long, it moved fairly quickly.  During our stay the concierge Tony was very helpful with directions and after listening to our needs took care of making the perfect dinner reservation for us!  The location of this hotel is perfect to take advantage of all that Times Square has to offer, but is also close to the subway making it easy to explore the entire city!  After a wonderful dinner and great Broadway show we returned to our room to find a bottle of champagne and a very nice hand written card!  A big thank you to everyone on staff for helping to make our anniversary such a special and memorable time!

title: Nice hotel, good service but cold room
text:
The room was cold. I was there in January when the temperatures were really low. The heater could only go up to 26 degrees. I got an extra duvet but it didn't help much. The employees at the hotel said there was nothing that could be done to make it warmer. However on the last day as I was checking out the receptionist told me that if I had booked from the hotel website as opposed to through booking.com they would have been able to resolve my issue of the cold room. Why punish visitors who find hotels through booking.com? It's unfortunate.

Other than that the location and staff were very good. The room was big and clean and the bed was very comfortable. They also gave me a late check out which was quite good.

title: Good but....
text: The reason for my mediocre review is the front desk. It is amazing that there were no tea bags when I needed some tea at night and the front desk was less than helpful. I am a regular at the Fairfield Inn Penn Station, NYC - a hotel which I absolutely love. It is mind boggling that how can there be two Fairfield Inns separated by just seven blocks that differ so much in quality. Disappointed.

title: Good location
text:
Rooms were very comfortable but not very spacious. That is New York City!!  Breakfast was included with the room rate, but it was a little crazy getting in and out.  They do have signs in the elevator about the breakfast times.  The earlier, the better.  They are right!!!
You can get grab and go, which helped!!  Staff were very helpful and went out of their way to help my friend who was also staying in the hotel and got injured while walking outside.   Would definitely recommend this hotel if the location meets your needs.

title: Enjoyable Stay!
text:
Travelled to New York in a group of 4, first time visiting and do not have a bad thing to say about the hotel! We arrived around 1am and the young gentleman on reception was very welcoming and friendly. Staff at check out were also helpful, and arranged us a taxi to the airport and also stored our luggage. 

The hotel is very close to Times Square, and all other attractions are within walking distance. We stayed for 3 nights and throughly enjoyed our stay. 

The hotel offers breakfast however, you have to get down quite early as it gets very busy and q's are long! 

I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again if I were to visit :)

title: Great location
text:
Attempted an early check in, however the hotel was crazy and they didn't have any rooms available at the time, they offered to keep my bags so I could go out for a few hours. Hotel is in a good location, however the street can be a little sketchy at night. At our rate- the hotel was a great steal! Close to Time square and right beside public transit. We took the shuttle from EWR right to the hotel for $29 round trip. The only downside was the breakfast- although they posted signs, we figured "ah most hotels have it..." however at 8:30 am, there was very limited seating and it was PACKED..decided to go to a local bagel shop instead. 
Overall the stay was a good one and would most likely return.

title: Muito bom
text: Hotel muito bem localizado, em frente ao terminal de onibus e na esquina tem metro, perto da times square, da pra ir andando e aproveitar para conhecer tudo ao redor, otimo cafe da manha. So precisa ser esperto e levantar cedo pois em finais de semana os elevadores ficam lotados e tambem no cafe da manha.

title: I've been 3 different times
text: I've stayed here on 2 business trips and one vacation with my wife.  The staff at this hotel is incredible.  They've helped me with faxes, I've had packages delivered here, and they've given me two very late check-outs to accommodate my schedule.  The location is fun and the breakfast helps save a few bucks in the expensive city.  I'll definitely be back on future visits!

title: Superbe situation
text:
Hotel situé en face de la gare de "bus autority" qui vous permet de rejoindre les aéroports. Métro situé à 100 mètres de l'hôtel, c'est ce qui a déterminé notre choix pour l'hôtel. Vous avez pleins de resto à chaque coin de rue et le choix est très large et pour tous les budgets.  
Nous étions 3 dans la chambre, je la trouvais un peu petite, mais à nyc on ne reste jamais dans l'hôtel. Chambre propre, tres grande douche, manque de place pour les produits de beauté.    Pas de place pour les valises ce qui a rendu la circulation dans la chambre difficile. Climatisation très bruyante, nous avons donc demandé une autre chambre avec une clim moins bruyante.  
Le café starbuks dans la chambre est top.
Petit dej bien, tous ce qu'il faut pour bien commencer la journée.  Vous pouvez même faire des doggy bag. Conseil: y aller tôt car à partir de 8h c'est l'embouteillage.  
Rooftop bar sympa, pour y siroter un verre et écouter de la musique.

title: Great location and stay
text:
The location is perfect. Near Times Square and to many lines of subway! Entering by the Porty Authority building (Just across street)you can avoid traffic lights, and the cold weather by going underground. You can access the A C E 1 2 3 7 N Q R W lines. There's also many shops and food there. 

Breakfast was pretty good, but avoid the busy times! Room not big enough for everybody. 

Our room was tight but it wasn't a big issue because the bed and bathroom were really good.

title: Excellent Experience
text: Super clean , excellent staff, wonderful breakfast! Couldn't have had a better stay anywhere. Updated rooms & bathrooms. Great shower. Full breakfast, from soup to nuts and especially good coffee. Plus after I checked out and was already traveling home I discovered I had left my very expensive medication in the room fridge along with some other items. The staff was super professional and returned everything I had left, even some water bottles. Can't say enough about their professionalism!

title: Хороший, недорогой отель
text: Соотношение цены и качества. В стандартном номере чисто, есть стол для работы. Скорость интернета хорошая. Завтраки разнообразные: фрукты, хлопья, каши, омлет, сыр, бекон/котлеты, пр. Расположение удачное, рядом с метро и автобусным вокзалом. До аэропорта JFK 1 час общественным транспортом. Немного мешает шум, поэтому лучше просить номер на верхних этажах.

title: Convenient Location, Very clean, Great Staff!
text: Great location near Times Square and across the street from Penn Station.  Very clean and modern rooms, albeit on the small side - but it is NYC so I expect that.  The staff went out of their way to be helpful and courteous.  One evening I wanted Peppermint tea and the woman at the front desk tore the kitchen apart looking for it for me.  Although she couldn't find it, she sent me across the street to the mall inside Penn Station.  When I returned she had a care package of all the needed accessories (cups, stirrers, cream, etc.) already assembled for me w/o me even asking!  It was a nice surprise and I really appreciated the extra effort and thoughtfulness.  I stayed 4 nights and didn't have any issues with sleeping, noise, elevators, nothing.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Good NY Timesquare stay
text: The Fairfield Inn location was great for me, with just 2 to 5 min walk of everything. I stayed for three nights for business and found them much better than the expectation i had owing to NY hotel. The breakfast was good so as the internet. The best thing i liked about the hotel is the attitude of staff and never resting efforts to strive for the excellence. I reported one issue and it was very well followed up by the management of hotel and that for me is the winner and the reason to stay again. Wishing you best everyone at Fairfield.

title: Amazing staff and excellent venue. We will visit again and again.
text: This place is a medium range, value for money and having excellent location. Nearer to times square, empire state building and subways. The staff was very very friendly ..unfortunately i don't recall the names. I will definitely visit again and again.

title: Great location and stay
text: The hotel is 2 blocks away from Times Square. They have a lounge on the 34th floor called the Sky Lounge which overlooks the city. What a view. Breakfast is very good too. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

title: Gayet güzel
text: Check in yaptığımızda 10dan fazla parça valiz bıraktık ücret talep etmediler ve gayet ilgiliydiler. Odalar, banyolar güzel ve temizdi. Odalar dar ama beklenen de bu. Kalvaltıları ise süperdi ben çok beğendim. Yumurta peynir tarzı geleneksel veya yoğurt gibi hızlı bir kahvaltı yapabilirsiniz. Lobide her daim Starbuck kahvesi var ama tek beğenmedim oydu, öğleden sonra bayatlıyor. Konumu zaten 10 numara, Times'a 5 dk.

title: 5 Yıldız
text: Times Meydanı'na sadece 5 dakika yürüme mesafesindeki bu otelde 6 gece geçirdik. Otel genel olarak temizdi. Kahvaltısı ise bir çok New York oteline göre daha çeşitli ve lezzetliydi. Günün 24 saati kahve (Starbucks) ve birçok içeceği ücretsiz sunuyorlardı. Yatakları da gerçekten rahattı. Birdahaki NYC ziyaretimizde tercihimiz yine bu otel olacak.

title: Small Rooms and Huge Breakfast
text: This hotel has a fantastic location, its entrance faces one of Port Authority s bus station s doors so it makes your life really easy to visita any place in and out New York .  The staff is really nice and helpfull. Our room was lovely but very small for a family of 4.  But it was spotless clean and the bathroom has a good shower. The beds are not great and the street is really noisy.  The breakfast was suprisingly good with good choices of fruit and hot buffet. I would stay there again but will ask for 2 rooms.

title: Lovely Hotel
text: Stayed here over Christmas and new year for our 25th wedding anniversary and had a lovely time. Staff very nice and breakfast fantastic. Would recommend as central to everything .Walking distance to many attractions

title: GREAT Hotel and AWESOME Staff!
text: This was the BEST experience for my kid's 1st trip to New York. I travel for work and need to be in the Garment District. I've stayed in other hotels in the area and I will say we will book this hotel again next time. The rooms were clean, spacious, and the staff made sure our stay was comfortable. Everyone at the front desk was extremely accommodating down to bring ice to our room! The breakfast can get crowded but we have no problem (and would much rather) bring the food to our room which was encouraged if you didn't want to wait. The only thing I wish they had was a mini-fridge instead of the little beverage cooler which is not cold enough for my kids boba tea. Over all it get's 5 stars from me!

title: I was celebrating my 50th bday in NYC, the staff hand-signed a card, leaving a gift in my room....so thoughtful
text: Our room was nicely taken care of by Yoselyn even though our coming & going was sporadic.  Front office supervisor, Katherine, provided some great restaurant ideas & directions to JFK.  The concierges were very helpful with directions and ideas.  The breakfast, although busy, was well maintained and had some pretty good offerings!!  Everyone was so helpful!!

title: Boa  localização e cafe da manhã
text: Ótima localização , quarto razoável , café da manhã ótimo, com salada de frutas  frescas e uma boa variedade de matinais:ovos , paes, castanha,cereais.Wi fi bom no hall é razoável no quarto. Na esquina tem uma padaria Dean and de Lucca , ótima para lanchinhos quando se chega com cansado a noitinha.

title: Tremendous staff!
text:
The hotel was so clean and the staff was so helpful and courteous.  Janeay was most professional and accommodating. My Husband and I will definitely return to that hotel.
I would definitely recommend this hotel to family and friends.

title: Small Room - Marriotts are not what they used to be - What's the point of the APP ?
text:
I have a lifetime Platinum Elite status (over 1000 nights credits) with Marriott which these days means very little to Marriott or its franchises.   I checked in on the Marriott App about 3 hours before my arrival with an indication of a 2:45 PM arrival.  I get there at 3:05 pm and room is not ready.  They give me another room.  I am not satisfied with that room - small room; low floor; handicap room that needs improvements - but they have no other option.  I call the Platinum Elite phone line and after being bounced around, I am told that someone would call me back.  2 days later - still waiting for that return phone call.
About 1/2 hour after check in, I receive a phone call from front desk - Am I happy with my room - I tell her NO and explain why - she apologizes but can't do anything to help - why did you call - Ohh it's a courtesy phone call.
I receive an email from the front office supervisor - again an apology with no solution.
Later that night, I receive a phone call offering me a bottle of wine - I decline and explain again the issues and tell her how the matter should be resolved - she has to check and will get back to me. - Still waiting.
I am attaching 2 photos which would make Mr. Marriott (the original) very upset.

title: Macy's Parade Amazing Stay
text: I booked this room less than 3 days before the Macy's Thanksgiving Day parade, although I had another reservation at the Fairfield Inn on Front St.  I changed my reservation to be closer to the parade route. My rate was $199.00!!! On a holiday in New York City!!! Great rate.  The hotel was full. The room was nice for NYC and somewhat spacious. I had a king size bed and stayed with my 2 kids (wasn't supposed to do that, but it worked perfectly fine for us.) Breakfast buffet was decent, not great. Lobby is small but clean. Staff was very pleasant from buffet folks, to housekeeping to front desk. Hotel very convenient to everything Time Square. One con..the hotel can be very slow ESPECIALLY at night when the nightclub that's part of the building is  open. The hotel then only has one elevator available for all the guests. My room was quiet and heard no outside noise from hotel nor streets.

title: Great location for reasonable rate
text:
Stayed here by myself . Easy location in Midtown to access theatre. Right next to Port Authority.

Clean, free wifi, free breakfast.

Would be good for families or business. 

Valet parking available. Would stay here again.

title: Ótima Opção em Manhatan
text: Padronização dos quartos, todos com camas King-size. Café da manhã bom em se tratando de EUA. Atendimento cortês dos recepcionistas. Ótima localização. Esquadrias do quarto anti ruído. Colchão e travesseiros muito bons. Box para banho prático e moderno. Evite tomar o café da manhã após 7:30 h ou enfrentará fila, já que o local é pequeno para a grande demanda. Além disso nesse horário não terá problemas com os elevadores. Rede Wi-fi grátis e excelente.

title: Good value, needs improvement
text: This hotel is in a great location and rooms are typical for NYC.  The experience we had was one step below an expected Marriott experience.  The service provided by staff was okay but not great. Upon check in we were given key cards that did not work, then key cards to an occupied room before finally getting access to our room.  The roof top bar is nice but the fact that they isolate an entire elevator when it is open is extremely inconvenient for the hotel guests.  Average wait for an elevator was 10 minutes.  We also had issues with the wifi.

title: Nice Hotel
text: We really enjoyed our stay.  The location is a block or two to Times Square and convenient to public transportation.  The hotel was really nice and the bed was extremely comfortable after walking around all day.  The staff were all really polite and helpful.  Overall the hotel was a great value for the location and ease of access to public transportation.  The Sky Room bar on the roof was a lot of fun too.

title: Emplacement génial !
text:
La chambre est très bien climatisée l'été, le service de chambre est bon, le petit-déjeuner vaut vraiment le coup mais il est vrai que c'est un peu long d'attendre les ascenseurs car il y a beaucoup de monde et que l'immeuble est très grand (il n'y a que 3 ascenseurs).
L'emplacement est génial à côté de Times Square et à quelque centaines de mètres du Flat Iron Building, de l'Empires States Building et de la Librairie.
Je vous conseille fortement cette hôtel.
Et le rapport qualité/prix est excellent (pour NYC).
🗽🔝

title: Solo correcto
text:
Un hotel sólo para dormir. Si bien está muy cerca de Times Square, no es la mejor cuadra para caminarla de noche. 
Tampoco es tan barato para lo que ofrece. La habitación (en mi caso para 3 personas) es excesivamente pequeña, al igual que el baño y la zona de guardado.
Ofrece desayuno: Lo peor del establecimiento. La zona es muy chica para la cantidad de gente que hospedan y el trato del personal es pésimo. Pareciera que lo dan de favor cuando en realidad lo estás pagando bien caro. Y cuando la comida se acaba, se acaba. Aunque sean las 8.30 hs y se ofrezca hasta las 9.30.
Otro tema: No pidan en el hotel que le busquen taxi. Este costará exactamente el doble que si lo buscas tu mismo

title: Muy acogedor.
text: Hotel muy acogedor y bien ubicado para acercarse a todos los lugares que se desean visitar, ya sea en metro u otro tipo de transporte. Limpio, moderno, confortable, con desayuno y wifi incluidos. Los empleados son amables y atentos a las necesidades de sus huéspedes.

title: New Year's Getaway
text: My husband and I stayed here during New Years and after. The hotel and room were amazing. It was clean, close to Times Square (without being in the the super crowded area) but still very convenient to the Subway and walking to many great sites, restaurants and landmarks! The room had a great view and despite being a busy time of year, the hotel was quiet. We used the hotel valet parking and it was very easy for us! We would definitely stay here again!

title: a real surprise
text: booked the stay expecting the usual place in New York.... a very very nice hotel right off of Times Square, easy location right out of Lin, Tunnel the price $ 120,00 King size room.very clean and comfortable. had them garage the car. the price also included Breakfast.  Wait staff at breakfast was excellent.... don't hesitate to book this hotel.

title: Access to Transportation
text:
This is my second time in NY. Stayed for 3 days and 2 nights. Fairfield Inn is a good choice if you want to stay near Times Square. 

Breakfast is ok, except for the long lines during peak hours. 

Best feature I would think is its accessibility to NY terminal. Plus access also to the hop-on hop-off tour buses.

title: Good location, good breakfast, dirty carpet
text:
The location of the hotel is great, only 10 mins walk to Time Square but is quiet enough.

2 mins walk to Port authority station and 10 mins walk to 42nd time square subway station.

Free Breakfast selection is decent, however, it can get crowded in times.

Staff are friendly and helpful.

Very dirty carpet in the hotel room, when we arrived there are dirt and crumbs on the floor and during our four nights stay the carpet was not vacuumed even once, bring your own slipper just in case...

title: Very vertical....Port authority, subway....Good straightforward place
text:
Pretty much what you'd expect at a fairfield inn...just steps from the port authority bus terminal, half a block to the subway stop and a five -ten minute walk to penn station...

only a few rooms on each floor...there are several very narrow hotels on the block

I know one person says it was extremely overpriced...I got it for less than 100 bucks the week before Christmas...shop around

title: New year stay
text:
We stayed here for 5 nights over NYE. 

Pros: Location is good, 5 minute walk to times square. Complementary WiFi was also pretty good and we had a smart TV in our bedroom. Bed was a good size and most importantly, it was comfortable! Toiletries and hairdryer were also provided. 

Cons: We had to make several complaints about the room next door. From vomiting in the corridor to smoking a very strong substance we had all kinds of smells coming through our bedroom door. Despite making several complaints nothing ever seemed to happen. The vomit was left all night / next morning with a towel thrown over it. The smell was all over our room. It was cleaned when we brought it up at the front desk for a second time but smell remained. Smoking also continued. It really put a bad spin on our stay. 

Other points: Breakfast was provided during our stay. Choice of cereals, waffles, muffins, toast, tea, coffee and juices. Queues formed from around 8am onwards so best to get down a little earlier. 

Side access to Port Authority Bus Station is right across the street. As mentioned by others, the Parole Office is very close to the hotel but we never experienced any issues.

title: Sencillo y correcto
text: Hotel en Manhattan, muy céntrico si se desea estar cerca de Times Square. Estuvimos una família de 4 personas. Habitación correcta y limpia con 2 camas grandes muy cómodas, pero algo pequeña para 4 personas. Baño sencillo con todo lo necesario. Un buen detalle son la gran cantidad de enchufes y puertos USB para cargar móviles y baterías. Desayuno suficiente sin ser excelente, tiene lo mínimo necesario. Tiene pocos ascensores para tantas plantas y en horas punta (desayuno) se colapsan y tienes que esperar.

title: Not bad, especially for NYC
text:
I normally review on a curve because you wouldn't expect a Super 8 room to be as good as a Hilton (or a Hilton room to be as bad as a Super 8).  Apart from that the baseline for all hotels is whether everything was clean and worked as it should.  This Fairfield Inn is pretty good all things considered.

First, it's not a typical Fairfield Inn.  Over 30 floors (insufficient elevator capacity noted in other reviews) with a few rooms on each floor.  The rooms don't look like most Fairfield Inn rooms -- almost everything's smaller in New York despite the sky high prices.  That said, the room was basically clean and well-furnished for its size.  Indeed it was quite cramped (only one chair at the desk and you have to move it for two people to navigate to the closet armoire).  Bathroom clean, appropriately stocked and the shower was acceptable.  The room cleanliness was better than many "normal" Fairfield Inns elsewhere in the country (ditto for the furnishings that were there).

There were some minor issues.  I think the third set of room keys was ultimately the charm so it took us quite some time to get into the room.  The heater/air conditioning unit behaved erratically, putting out cold air when it shouldn't.  We had to elevate the temperature on the thermostat considerably to work around that issue.  There is no refrigerator in the room -- instead a marginal beverage cooler.  Also no microwave.  So as far as things working as they should I'll say "mostly" but there is room for improvement.

Staff was friendly, professional and very responsive (even to the point of making sure we had enough bottled water to get started).  There is a concierge desk.  The hotel is on kind of a side street so it may be a bit more difficult getting a cab although it's about a three block walk to the Port Authority Bus Terminal.  

Would I stay here again?  Only thing that might cause some hesitation is the cost. $275 with taxes for one night is not a good omen for a Fairfield Inn, even if it happens to be in New York City.  The Fairfield brand was intended to be Marriott's answer to "budget" lodging.  Room rates nationwide have been climbing higher than inflation as well but despite how good this place it I think it needs to be more realistic.

title: Very good for midtown
text: Stayed in a king room during the week following Christmas. The location is very convenient for midtown; closer to 40th and 9th than 40th and 8th, though. Clean; staff was courteous and made us feel very welcome. The room was actually larger than expected for midtown. Price was reasonable. The complimentary breakfast was OK - cheese omelet, bacon (limp), muffins, juice, coffee - quite crowded, but served the purpose. I would definitely consider this hotel the next time I'll be staying in midtown.

title: Hotel excelente
text: excelente acomodação, bem como um ótimo café da manha. quartos espaçosos. Localização muito boa, proximo a penn estation, e autorith porth bus, times square ao lado, carlos bakery. Enfim super recomendado.

title: Extremely overpriced!
text:
I stayed in this hotel from November 30-December 2, 2016 and I can very well say that this hotel is extremely overpriced.  I paid USD 774.00 for a two-night stay in this 2-star hotel which is extremely higher than the USD 216.00 a night I paid at the swank Crowne Plaza hotel nearby. This hotel's entrance door is irritatingly constricted and can hardly accommodate jumbo-sized guests, while its lobby is as small as a kitchen.  Breakfast has an unlimited serving of cheap convenience store stuff but the assortment is so few.  The food they serve are not palatable to Asians like me.  They use environmentally hazardous  styro plates and plastic utensils.  While the rooms are comfortable, they do not have drinking glasses inside the rooms.  Again, they have plastic cups. Is this a Marriott?

While I was told by front desk people that the property is not a full-fledged Marriott hotel, whatever that means, the room price are way way above what I normally pay for a night's stay in a Marriott hotel in other parts of the world.  But then they would always argue that this is NYC and hotel rooms are not very cheap.  If that is the case, what could be a more plausible reason for their rates which is 50% more than the rates charged by Crowne Plaza, a hotel  better located in the heart of Times Square.  They have good breakfast, you drink on glasses and not on plastic cups, you eat on china plates and not on styro plates.

All I can say is avoid this hotel at all cost if you don't want to be ripped off.

title: Boa Localização
text:
A excelente localização, o preço, o Pequeno almoço e a simpatia do pessoal conseguem fazer esquecer o minúsculo quarto que nos foi apresentado... mas lá conseguimos sobreviver uma semana...
Apesar do quarto minúsculo não hesitarei em repetir o hotel.

title: Clean, comfortable rooms and good management
text:
We stayed here in order to attend a friend's wedding in Chelsea. We were concerned about service levels because it was the NYC Marathon weekend, but we had a great stay.  Even though the hotel was jam packed with French marathon participants, everything ran smoothly and we felt we received personal attention. Even though breakfast was super busy, we never had to wait for more than a couple minutes for a table. The food was good, and service was friendly. 

The rooms are a good size for NYC, and they were kept very clean. They were quiet as well - we almost never heard other guests. 

Location was great - a 5/10 min walk to the theatres, Bryant Park, etc and 20-30 to Central Park. We didn't even use the subway except to go further down to the financial district to visit the 9/11 memorial. 

Overall a very nice stay - we commend the staff for a great job on a crazy busy weekend!

title: Un Buen hotel
text: Su ubicación es estratégica pues desde nuestra habitación se veía el empire espectacular y queda muy cerca a todo en midtown. Hotel remodelado con habitaciones amplias para el estándar de Nueva York, con caja de seguridad, refrigerador y desayuno incluido. Al igual que los demás de esta cadena, el desayuno es demasiado concurrido. Cuenta con el Sky Room de libre entrada para huéspedes y aunque tiene buenas vistas la atención es pésima. La temperatura de la habitación imposible de hacer confortable.  Los ascensores muy congestionados en todo momento, parece que el hotel se satura con el número de huéspedes. Dejan el carrito de la mucama toda la noche en el corredor, convirtiéndose en un obstáculo peligroso no sólo para el paso con maletas pues no me imagino en caso de una emergencia el corredor obstruido. En general, la experiencia fue buena.

title: Buena opción en Mid town
text: Hotel remodelado con habitaciones amplias para el estándar de Nueva York, con caja de seguridad, refrigerador y desayuno incluido. Al igual que los demás de esta cadena, el desayuno es muy concurrido. Cuenta con el Sky Room de libre entrada para huéspedes y aunque tiene buenas vistas la atención es pésima

title: Seul point positif : l'emplacement
text: Séjour du 21 au 28 en famille avec enfants, le seul point positif est l'emplacement proche de Times Square. Sinon, comme l'hôtel est grand (environ 30 étages), nous avons attendus les 3 malheureux ascenseurs pendant des heures.... Arrivés dans la chambre minuscule à 5 que l'on nous avait vendu, nous nous sommes marchés dessus. Pour le petit déjeuner, pareil, salle minuscule pour accueillir autant de personnes dans l'hôtel. Pour le rooftop, la question est vite réglée puisque les enfants de moins de 21 ans ne peuvent pas y accéder. De plus, une tenue de standing y est réclamé, autant dire que lorsque vous êtes en vacances, vous venez pas avec votre smoking pour aller boire une bière. De plus, au contraire de ce que j'avais pu lire, le personnel n'est pas agréable du tout, plusieurs fois le matin, une personne ne prenait pas de gants pour nous faire dégager et laisser la place au petit déjeuner. Et le personnel à l'accueil pas sympa. Il y'a sans aucun doute beaucoup mieux que cette hotel

title: Best kept Secret
text: Great hotel with a great location.  Manio and the staff really go the extra mile with upgrades when possible. Not a better value in NYC hate to say too much good about it as I will not be able to get a room when I need one.  Stayed there before and will many more times AAA++++

title: cerca de todos los lugares , excelente atención del personal
text: excelente habitacion, impècable todo, muy buen desayuno.Viajamos en invierno no pasamos nada de frío en el hotel , la cordialidad y amabilidad del personal es extraordinaria, El hotel esta a una cuadra de la estación de buses  y a media del subterráneo. Excelente experiencia

title: EXCELENTE UBICACION Y SERVICIO
text: Buena ubicacion, servicio, el desayuno bastante variado y agradable. El gimnasio es pequeno pero bastante completo. Las habitaciones son comodas y espaciosas. Tienen cerca estacion del tren y varios lugares de comida accesible.

title: Great Location
text: We stayed in a king room that was fairly sized for a NYC hotel room. It was very clean (and housekeeping was wonderful) and the bed was comfortable. Front desk staff was fantastic. The elevators ran well, the entire facility was clean. I'd stay here again.

title: Bra boende med bra läge
text: Ett bra boende med bra läge närma Times square. Rummet var bra med sköna sängar men lite trångt, men det är ju inte på rummet man ska vara när man är i NY. Frukosten var helt ok. Kan varmt rekommendera detta hotell med ett bra prisläge.

title: Great hotel near to Time Square
text:
Very closely located beside Penn station. Easy to get around and accessible to get to anywhere. Hotel is well maintain, clean and Modern looking. 
Room itself was really small though ; however it was very comfortable with all amenities equipped.
Breakfast is included, but it gets real crowded so my advise is to have it early. 
Overall I had a wonderful 3 night stay in this property. The location and comfort level are definitely are huge plus ; will definitely come back here again if Im heading back to New York.

title: Best weekend EVER!!!
text: There is no place I'd rather stay in NY then at this hotel. From the hotel staff, to the wonderful room and the yummy breakfast, it was all first class. Even the price was amazing for what you get in the city. It's a wonderful value. My husband and I stayed there December 16-19, 2016 for a surprise trip for his 50th birthday. I was in contact prior to our trip with the front desk supervisor Michelle Granados. She went out of her way to give us early check in after a red eye flight, a city view room upgrade and even sent us wine and a birthday card signed by the staff. She was so professional and nice. Even calling us by the name the remainder of the trip.They went above and beyond. Our room was on the 20th floor and perfect size. The TV was huge, bed was comfortable and met our needs in every way! The front desk staff helped with directions or whatever we needed. The breakfast staff were hard workers and super helpful. The cleaning staff was courteous and sweet. The hotel was close to everything so it was convenient to wherever we went in our jam packed 3 days. Some people complained about the elevators, but there was only one time that I noticed it being a little long. Noting to really complain about. We did go up to the rooftop bar just to check out the view Saturday night. Got to cut the line since we were hotel guests. Basically came right back down because it was too foggy to see anything. The breakfast was good. Plenty to choose from. Waffles, eggs, bagels, bacon, sausage, fruit, yogurt, cereal. Enough to fill your bellies before heading out for the day. They have to go boxes so we preferred taking breakfast up to our room a couple times so we could stay in our PJ's. The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas and the fireplace was so welcoming after coming in from the cold.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to New York.

title: Beautifully Furnished
text: This hotel is beautifully furnished, super clean. We arrived early and had requested an early check in, but it wasn't guaranteed. The room wasn't ready upon arrival but it only took maybe 20 min. It was extremely busy with the holidays, but the staff--as busy as they were--were so nice and helpful. Room was quiet. Valet parking was so helpful and a breeze.we didn't try the breakfast because there was such a long line and it didn't look like any seats avail. Saturday it ran 7-10 and we were down just after 7. I understand space can't be helped but maybe start earlier to accommodate. Driving here was so easy as it was just on edge near Henry Hudson Pkwy, but we were still close enough to most things to walk.

title: Muy buen hotel
text:
Muy buen hotel, excelente precio calidad. Habitaciones pequeñas pero muy cómodas. La limpieza muy buena. Buena calefacción. 
Excelente ubicación a una cuadra de la estación Pen station del metro. 
El desayuno muy bueno, abundante y variado. Cafe disponible todo el dia.
Reciben paquetes sin costo. Personal muy amable.

title: Excellent
text: This us a great hotel for NYC breakfast is good it's a 5min walk from penn station the rooms are small but bathroom have walk in shower it is very good value fir money in this expensive city. Desk staff are pleasant and helpful would definitely recommend it

title: Business Day Trip
text: The Fairfield Inn & Suite was walking distance away from Time Square, Macy's, Broadway, etc.  Accommodations were perfect. The room was very clean and cozy.  The view was decent allowing us to see some architecture.  I love the history, sites and sounds of the city.  it never sleeps.  Shopping is crazy out here. There are designer clothing stores all over the city.  Whatever your little heart desires.

title: Impeccabile
text: Io e la mia famiglia abbiamo soggiornato recentemente in questo albergo. Ho trovato tutto perfetto, camere accoglienti, letto grande e comodo, personale gentile, buona pulizia e vista mozzafiato sulla grande mela dal terrazzo. Buona la posizione e colazione discreta. Quando tornerò a New York prenderò sicuramente in considerazione questo hotel. Paola milano

title: Location is its best feature
text:
We booked this hotel a whole year before we were due to travel, and after a lot of research too. It appeared to be the best value, with it being centrally located and only about £1000 for 5 nights (which between two people isn't that much, especially at Christmas!)

Overall I'd say it's definitely three star. The rooms and bathrooms are very good - clean and modern and comfortable. HOWEVER for two days in a row, we came back to our room at around 6pm after a long day walking, to find our room hadn't been cleaned. Once I complained about it, a cleaner was up with us in about half an hour...but still, I don't expect to have to prompt any hotel to clean my room.

The Sky Room bar was one of the reasons we were attracted to this hotel, but the hotel doesn't actually own it. So it's open to the public (and only for three nights a week during the winter months) and it gets pretty busy - we could see all the locals queuing up to get in as we left our hotel each evening. Because of that, we didn't bother with it. They also supposedly have a Sports Bar open from 5pm each night, although I couldn't find it! What this hotel is lacking is a bar area that you can grab a coffee or a snack from during the day, if you need a break and don't want to go out.

I echo everyone else's comments about the breakfast area too - far too cramped and the staff running it are rude. They do have take away containers down there though, so we tended to get down there early (pre 7.30...any later and just forget it, you'll be queueing!) and then stock up and take it back to our room. They also don't give you proper cutlery - it's all plastic. Not impressed with that at all!

Staff on the front desk are very accommodating and polite. The lobby area is lovely. There aren't enough lifts for the quantity of rooms...but we didn't experience anything too bad - the longest we ever had to wait for a lift was 5 mins.

The location is perfect and so convenient if you want to be based near Times Square. There's a subway station at the end of the road, but we tended to use the TimesSquare 42nd street one because it's got better direct links and we didn't fancy changing lines constantly!

TIP: check out restaurant Il Punto - it's one block away and delightful!

title: Pre-Xmas stay
text: My wife and I stayed here with friends for 5 nights last week for a Pre-Xmas visit to New York.  The hotel's location is excellent and is a 10 minute walk from Times Square. The staff on the front desk were efficient and really friendly as were the concierge staff. The room was pretty spacious for New York and was clean and tidy and had a comfortable king size bed.  The bathroom had a shower but no bath. The room had a hairdryer and an iron and ironing board too which was useful.  Previous reviews have mentioned waiting a long time for the lifts and sometimes we had to wait about 5 minutes but no more. Breakfast was included in the price and the selection and quality of the food was very good.
