The only downside was that it was served on paper plates and plastic knives and forks which has prevented me awarding 5 stars, but hey we could live with that. Check out is 1200 but the hotel provides safe and free storage for your luggage which we used.  I would definitely stay here again on any future trips.

title: Quiet and simple
text: Stayed here for business for 4 nights. The location is nice and is quietly tucked away in the street across ports authority terminus and a few yards from the metro terminus. You can directly see the NY times building. There are lot of eateries around to fill your tummy and some infamous NY pizza too. The Hell's kitchen is also close by so you have a ton of options. Book in advance to get a king bed else most rooms have two queen beds. All basic amenities are available in the room and is decently sized. Its quite comfortable in the room but no real glass view areas. Every floor has their own housekeeping, so getting some extra stuff is easy. Service is excellent and hassle free. The bfast spread is good too. All american and no nonsense. The staff is friendly as well.  Parking comes at a heavy price though.

title: Отлично
text: Хорошая сеть отелей. Они расположены как на юге города, так и в центре, как этот. Соответственно, до всех популярных мест недалеко. Недалеко от железнодорожной станции Penn Station. Достаточно фешенебельно

title: Great hotel
text: Had a lovely stay at fairfield inn and suites. Great location directly across the street from the port authority and a couple of blocks from times square. Breakfast was a great bonus we enjoyed each morning.  Its $16 for a glass of wone in the hotel so stay clear of the bar. They only issue I had is that our credit cards were pre authorised when we arrived and we were to pay cash when leaving but the cards were debited rather than pre authorised and our final day bill showed as zero. Next time I would pay upfront so we would have the funds on our credit cards in case of emergency. Other than that we really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were small as is normal for nyc but perfectly formed and spotlessly clean. I would definitely stay here again

title: Buen  y bien situado Fairfield
text:
Estuvimos aquí en diciembre de 2016.
El hotel está situado en la 40 entre la 8ª y la 9ª

Justo en la esquina de la 8ª con la 40 tienes una salida del metro de la parada 42. En escasos 5 minutos estás andando en Times Square y en menos de 10 te encuentras en la 5ª avenida, a una muy buena altura.

En cuanto al hotel es un Fairfield con todas las características de todos ellos. La habitación es completa y el baño también lo es.

La única pega que podría ponerle es que la sala de desayunos no es muy grande, no tuvimos problemas en sentarnos sin esperas ninguno de los días, pero si que se puede decir que teniendo en cuenta el número de habitaciones que dispone el hotel, es bastante pequeña.

En cuanto a la atención, muy buena.

Opción muy recomendable para Manhattan.

title: Perfect
text: I honestly couldn't fault this hotel. For NYC the room was a great size, the bed was comfortable, shower was amazing and the towels were soft. There was an in room safe and the tv was massive.  The breakfast was all you needed to start your day and if it was crowded they supply containers so you can take it back up to your room. They also had fruit - apples, bananas, etc that were very fresh.  The staff were lovely and helpful. Location was great. Out of the hustle and bustle so not as noisy but close enough to walk to Times Square and surrounds and feel safe. I went up to the sky room. The view was awesome but the drinks were quite expensive. The little sports bar down stairs was more my scene and with cheaper drinks. I would definitely stay here again and would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Bucket List trip
text: We checked in on Dec 4th for a week visit with my two sisters and brother-in-law. From the minute the front door was opened for us throughout the whole week, everything was fantastic.  The front desk staff was so friendly, smiles everywhere. Got us checked into our rooms in less than 5 minutes.  Rooms were fine as we had already been told they were on the small side, built up, not out.  It was fine for my sister and I, plenty of room.  It was spotless.  The bathroom has been updated very nicely. Housekeeping staff was wonderful. Breakfast was great.  No complaints. Concierge was great helping us to get where we needed  to go.  Hotel is located  very near Time Square.We were never the least bit anxious walking to and from the hotel after dark.. We walked everywhere, by choice, except when we went to Grand Central Station, and to the ferry boat ride around the islands. Subway very close by. Cannot say enough good things about the hotel. When it was time to check out, a cab was called for us and waiting when we checked out at 10:00 to get back to the airport. Hotel was recommended to us by my sister-in-law who has stayed there.  We would definitely recommend to our friends and family. Thank you everyone for a great week.  Another check off my bucket list. The only thing I could see missing is a snack bar, beside the Sky Room.  After dinner and walking around, it would been nice to have somewhere to grab a late nite bite to eat right in the hotel.

title: Muy buena ubicación y la gente del hotel muy atenta y amable
text: Ubicación excelente,el desayuno incluido y bastante bueno,las habitaciones lindas y bastante espaciosas,y tienen enfriador de botellas y buena limpieza, nos permitieron entrar temprano antes del horario de check in y salir más tarde

title: Ein zentral gelegenes Hotel aber ........
text:
Da wir in NY für Besichtigungen wenig Zeit hatten, haben wir dieses Hotel gebucht.
Da das Hotel rel. teuer ist, glaubt man einen mind. Standard zu bekommen..
Wer gerne von Plastikgeschirr isst inc. Messer und Gabel bei voller Dröhnung
von 7-8 Fernsehern im s.g. Frühstücksraum ( viel zu kein ) Tische unmittelbar 
vor der Wand, der ist da gut aufgehoben.. Die Verfügbarkeit der Aufzüge war 
ebenfalls "gewöhnungsbedürftig" ... Wir sind öfter zu Fuß vom 6. Stock runter
gelaufen, da 5 min. Wartezeit zu den Stoßzeiten normal sind.

title: Nice hotel, good value
text: Nice comfortable rooms, good sized for NYC. Free breakfast with eggs, bagel, fruit, yogurt etc - good selection, moderate quality food. Very helpful and friendly staff. On W40th, good access to Times Square, but not the greatest block - a bit on the sketchy side. Lowest price I could find in the area.

title: too expensive for what you take
text: I thought it had bigger rooms. The location is too crowded since it is next to Bus Terminal and there are a lot of smal business around. The room was clean. I think that you pay too much for what you get.

title: Great Base
text: Room wasn't ready when we arrived but it was not a problem as we had some trips booked so just left our bags! When we got into our rooms they were modern and well kept but heating was very noisy through night! Fresh bottled water every day in our rooms and coffee machine was a plus! Breakfast was buffet style and fantastic, we were there for 7 so not so busy but only a small room and a long line waiting when we were on our way out so go early! Very small and busy reception with lots of people sitting around waiting for transport to airport! Hotel staff pleasant and gave good advice on places to eat etc and arranged taxi back to airport for us.  Will visit again.

title: Nice visit
text:
The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. We had a king city view. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only small complaint was the there is only one soda machine for the entire building and it was empty every time I attempted to use it,so I bought some and brought it back to a "drink chiller" that doesn't  get anything cold. No refrigerator in our room. 
We had a great stay in NYC.  The hotel is close to everything but just far enough away you aren't bothered by noise or traffic. It is only about 2 blocks after you get out of the Lincoln Tunnels so very easy to get to. We will be going back!!

title: My Bittersweet Good-bye For NOW!
text: Having relocation to Indiana in the works this was my official last weekend splurge in this Magnificent CITY! The folks at Marriott/Fairfield did not let me down on this blue occasion! Janeay at the front desk gave me complete compassion and understanding while i gave my sad story! As usual and exactly why we are true Marriot fans...hotel is perfectly located nxt to port authority!

title: Comfy hotel, convenient midtown location
text: Found this midtown hotel to be quite nice.  Stayed for two days over Thanksgiving to attend the Macys parade (it is not on the parade route). It is a short, pleasant stroll from Penn Station, walking with rolly suitcases and young children. Hotel has free breakfast.  Lots of selections to please all eaters.  Though not many choices if you are gluten free. Good start to the day without spending a fortune. Go early or it gets crowded.  The Port Authority Bus Terminal is literally across the street giving you easy access to some subway lines.  Easy walk to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. Room was smaller than standard Marriott rooms we have stayed in but standard size for a Manhattan hotel.  There is a soda and snack vending machine, an ice machine, and a workout room on the lower level. On the top floor, there is a nightclub bar. That didn't bother us in any way - noise wise or clientele wise. To help keep things safe, the elevators to rooms require a room key to activate. Room has a beverage cooler, not a refrigerator.  Would like to see that upgraded. Beds were comfy and the room was clean. No issues there. We would stay again.

title: Forget the rooftop bar
text: Generally this hotel is well located - although in a slightly run down but quiet side street - within 5 minutes of Times Square. The breakfast room is too small but we waited no more than 5 minutes to be seated and the cutlery and crockery is all plastic. Breakfast is not a pleasurable experience merely a chance to get fed and the food is OK! However the biggest disappointment was the much vaunted roof bar. In fact this is operated by a third party and is only open on Thursday, Friday and Saturday evenings. It is not just for residents and plays loud music until 04.00 am. The operators clearly advertise it widely so there are usually lot of people. Rooms on the lower floors are better if you are a light sleeper. Despite all this the hotel has clean well appointed and well serviced rooms and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The concierge will book tickets and generally advise on anything. The location is in the heart of everything and all main attractions are within walking distance except the 9/11 memorial which is at the end of the subway route. All in all not too bad an experience but Marriott need to sort out the roof bar or make it clear on the website.

title: Thanksgiving Goodness
text: We spent 4 nights in NYC over Thanksgiving and found this Fairfield to work perfectly for our needs, two adults and two college kids. Located less than a block from the busy Times Square area it had easy access to everything, including the Metro. It's next to the bus station and part of the sidewalk was closed to construction so the street could look a bit dark but we still felt safe. The room wasn't large with 2 double beds but we used it mainly just for sleeping. It was very clean and very well maintained, even the bathroom. The lobby was modern, clean, and had a nice fireplace area to wait. Breakfast was toaster waffles, bacon, muffins, juice, bagels, and eggs. Carb heavy but such a value to have included and you could take it back to your room. The staff was helpful and provided maps to the area with subway stops. NYC is always an expensive trip but Fairfield had one of the better rates and was one of the only ones with breakfast included.

title: Da evitare
text: Arrivati ieri l'altro con il soggiorno già pagato non avevano posto  e ci hanno spostano in un altro albergo. Ci siamo trasferiti li il giorno seguente e dopo aver dormito iuna notte siamo usciti dall'hotel alle 9,30 del mattino. Rientrato alle 17,30 la stanza non era ancora stata fatta.  Sconsigliatissimo.

title: Everything perfect
text: We stayed in the hotel for a week, staff was great, all the services were great, staff is very nice and very helpful. We got a king quiet room with view, room was not very big, but sufficient and clean. Big plus is you can make your own coffee in the room, as we were quite jet legged and up early in the morning before breakfast opened. We travelled with our 2yo, and immediately got baby crib upon arrival. I was little bit worried from the beginning as I read reviews, that there are long lines during breakfast and for elevators but we waited in line only once on Friday, and this peek was excellently managed by the stuff. In elevators you can find a guide what is the best time for breakfast, so I see, that the hotel listens to their customers and tries to navigate them. And the location ... for a family with a baby and stroller bit busy, but a few minute walk to TSQ, top of the rock, Fifth ... Thank you Fairfeld Inn for a pleasant stay, we will definitely come back.

title: Good Hotel in the Heart of the City
text: My family and I visited the city for our first time and chose this Marriott property.  I am a Marriott rewards member and was pleased with this hotel.  It is clean and the staff was friendly.  Rooms are small, but I know that in NY, that is expected.  Breakfast is decent, but you need to get there before 7:30 am or you will be waiting in line.  The location is great as well.  It is a few blocks from Times Square and walking distance to many other attractions and the subway.  If we ever visit NY City again, we would definitely stay here again.

title: Excelente hotel super ubicado
text: La ubicación del hotel es buenisima, las tarifas algo caras debido al precio del dolar pero en esta zona es razonable, calidad en las habitaciones, cama muy comoda, ambiente agradable, a dos cuadras de times square

title: Awesome location
text: This is a very nice hotel with awesome location. The Port Authority Bus Terminal is just accross the road and Broadway a nice short walk away. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Also a good and tasty breakfast.

title: Very Pleasant
text: We stayed here one night after attending an amazing performance by Richard Elliot at nearby BB Kings. It was a quick few blocks from BB Kings. Yes, the neighborhood is gritty. Get over it. The hotel is quite pleasant. The room was clean and nicely furnished. The bath,  though small, is well laid out and stocked with lots of towels. The bed is comfortable with four nice pillows. It served our limited purpose, a pleasant place to sleep.  The rooms in the back, away from the noise of the street, are very quiet. Breakfast looked nice. We did not partake, but I did grab a coffee (Starbucks Pike Place Blend) which was hot and rich.  The key access for the elevator was problematic. It just would not work. Other than that, no issues.

title: First time in NYC
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights, previously had a night in la quinta inn but so glad we moved. Very clean hotel, pleasant staff and in prime position close to everywhere.
Lovely room at the front on 13th floor huge comfy bed, safe, coffee and bottled water left every day.
Alot of reviewers complained about the lift we never had an issue even when one was being used soley for the sky bar.
Breakfast was a bonus, buffett style plenty of choice..always got a table and we went down at different times each morning.
Felt safe security in lobby and u could only use elevators by putting your keycard in.

title: Perfekt beliggenhet
text:
Fint hotell med god beliggenet rett ved siden av Port Autoruthy bussterminal. Gåavstand til Times square og ellers super beliggenhet med et godt utgangspunkt for mange severdigheter. 
Hyggelig personell, må nevne spesielt Jason, svært behjelpelig og serviceminded! God frokost med godt utvalg! 
Kommer gjerne tilbake! Anbefales! Vi hadde med to barn, 9 og 17år.

title: colazione triste e posizione ....
text:
la colazione molto triste: sembra di essere in una catena di montaggio, con piatti e coppette di plastica. la posizione è ben oltre times square, e poco prima sulla stessa via c'è un "cinema per adulti" ed un negozio di liquori dall'aspetto non raccomandabile. 
Con i ns figli abbiamo sempre fatto il marciapiede opposto.

title: bon hôtel  bien situé et agréable
text: Pas mal, bien placé pas trop loin de Times Square, salle de bains un peu vieillotte , propreté parfaite, et service excellent.  Petit déjeuner inclus très correct,  Je le recommande et j'y retournerai certainement

title: First visit to NYC
text:
Really good hotel which is very centrally located. We were on the 18th floor and never had a long wait for the elevator as some of the other reviews on here seem to suggest. Not much of a view from the room, just looking in to some offices. The room in general was great, lovely big comfy bed and plenty of room for luggage. Bathroom was fine with a good shower and some toiletries were provided. In room safe easy to use and the wifi was excellent all the time we were there. Only ventured down for breakfast on only one of the four nights we were at the hotel, once was more than enough. Very busy and poor quality of food, plenty of places outside hotel for breakfast.
I would recommend this hotel and would stay in it again if was ever to go back to the city...

title: Not a nice experience
text:
Proximity to port authority may be convenient but yeh neighborhood is unpleasant and noisy. When you enter the hotel the atmosphere remains the same - noisy lobby where there are also many people in line to enter the night club on the roof where hotel guests are not welcome ( at least no one indicated to me it's existence or no hotel guests can enter...) . Reception staff was indifferent and not welcoming , room was unclean l, dark and with a bad smell .
 Go to the Fairfield on 33 rd - no comparison !

title: Great Experience
text:
We visited New York the last May, and stay at this hotel. The service was excellent, very good location, easy access to all interesting places. 
Keep doing what are you doing great.
Thanks to all the staff.
We specially wants to thanks the Colombian guy, sorry I don't remember his name, but he always was ver attentive as soon as he saw us.

title: Perfect place to stay in NYC!
text:
I brought a group of 9 people to NYC to run the Marathon and booked 5 rooms under my name.  Marriott Elite allows you to check in the day before we arrived, so I called the front desk and Mario was able to put us into 3 rooms on the 30th floor and 2 on 31st so that we were all close together.  When we arrived, Mario was there to greet us with a smile and helped us with whatever we needed.  We were greeted with a chocolate Hershey's bar per room with my name on it!  Everyone at the front desk were always professional, friendly, and very helpful.  They always called me by my name.  Mario and the front end group sent up a welcome gift of goodies to say thanks for bringing my group to their hotel.  I've never had a nicer group of people at any of the Marriott's I've stayed at and I only stay at Marriotts.  Between the maids & workers in all areas everyone was friendly and helpful.

Even though there are 32 floors we never waited very long for elevators.  We paid for the rooms with the view of Times Square and we loved the view.

Breakfast is included.  It's rather basic but very convenient in the back area of the main lobby.

The location of this Marriott is the best for NYC as it is just a few streets away from Times Square and most plays are within 10 mins. walk.  The Blue line is half a block away so can go anywhere on the subway including going to and from JFK airport.  It is across the street from Port Authority which was great for our friends coming in from Baltimore on the Greyhound bus. The Hop On buses are also just a few blocks away. The street it is on is not glamorous but safe.

I would rate our experience a full 10 in all ways.  For the price it is awesome!

title: VERGOGNOSI
text:
1. Ascensore in comune con il rooftoop. Questo significava aspettare anche 5 min.
2. Stanza tripla piccolissima.
3. I primi due giorni abbiamo avuto problemi con la cassaforte. Si apriva da sola e suonava. Abbiamo dovuto chiamare i tecnici per due volte.
4. Un giorno non ci hanno pulito la stanza senza darci spiegazioni.
5. Un altro giorno non ci hanno cambiato gli asciugamani.
6. Abbiamo chiesto un taxi per l'aeroporto e ci hanno chiamato un loro servizio con limousine che ci ha fatto pagare un sovrapprezzo perche abbiamo pagato con carta di credito quando il prezzo era stato già stabilito all'inizio della corsa. 

VERGOGNOSI!!

title: tutto sommato bene
text: l'albergo è pulitissimo e le stanze fanno bene il loro mestiere, comode, spaziose e silenziose. letto comodo e  bagno grande. i contro sono la via (40th street) che è davvero brutta al limite della fatiscenza ( anche se basta fare 200 mt e sei in pieno centro). e il locale sopra (skyroom) che durante il wend richiama tanti ragazzi che poi dormono in hotel facendo tardi. la colazione è abbondante e buona, un po' affollata e il locale squallidino ma tutto sommato funzionale. giudizio nel complesso positivo

title: Giusto rapporto qualità prezzo
text:
Sono stato qui quest'estate durante un viaggio con la famiglia  ed amici.
L'hotel è ben tenuto, le camere pulite e il personale sempre disponibile anche se non sempre del tutto competente.
Il quartiere è China Town, nella parte bassa praticamente attaccato al Manhattan bridge, non proprio bello (esteticamente parlando) ne pulitissimo (soprattutto sono fastidiosi gli odori) ma del tutto sicuro e centralissimo.
Un ottima soluzione per stare a Manhattan senza spendere un patrimonio.

title: Ótima localização
text: Excelente localização, próximo a Brodway e Times Square. É possivel ir a maior parte dos espetáculos da Brodway a pé. Equipe atenciosa, educada, excelente atendimento. Quarto confortável. Local do café da manhã pequeno.

title: Nice hotel
text:
This hotel is very convenient to Times Square and all amenities. The rooms are spotless and the staff very helpful. Breakfast is also available,(a rarity in hotels in New York) and breakfast while served with paper plates and plastic cutlery was really good. 
My only complaint...there are not enough elevators for the number of people using the hotel, you could have a 15 min wait.

title: Very good, will stay here again
text: I read in the hotel writing  "we'll do the best to make you satisfied" and can say that it's true. First of all staff is friendly. Room was clean ( thanks  to room maid Jocelin), bed comfortable. There were enough clean towels, bath amenities, complimentary water and fast wifi. Small coffee machine in room and complimentary breakfast with good choice  (fruit, bread, eggs, yogurt and good coffee) especially if you're not late and come by 8 am). Location is great, just 5 min walking to subway station and bus terminal. Overall I had strong impression that it's customer oriented hotel. I love it and will definitely come to stay here again.

title: Friendly staff
text:
This hotel was in a good location, close to Times Square. The room was clean but quite small, the biggest thing was the shower! The view was a multi story car park so not the best and the windows didn't open causing the room to be stuffy. 
The breakfast dining area was small causing long waiting times. The food was ok but the cutlery and plates were all disposable, not what you expect when you pay £350 a night.

title: Gutes Hotel mit Top Lage
text: Wir waren zu viert in einem Zimmer, die Betten waren leider zu klein für 2 große Personen so dass ich auf dem Boden schlafen musste. Das Zimmer war sehr sauber und gepflegt. Im gesamten Hotel hatte man kostenloses WLAN. Das Bad war geräumig und man hatte alles was man brauchte. Die Lage von diesem Hotel ist perfekt nur ein paar Geh Minuten entfernt ist der Times Square und auch der Central Park ist nur ca. 15 Minuten zu Fuß entfernt. Man hat gute Verbindungen ab diesem Hotel z.B. von der Metro oder dem Bus Terminal. Es gibt viele Einkaufsmöglichkeiten in dieser Gegend. Das Frühstück war natürlich American Breakfast.

title: מלון מצוין, מיקום מעולה
text:
המלון נהדר, ארוחת בוקר טובה ומגוונת. המיקום מצוין - קרוב לכל האטרקציות, במרחק הליכה מטיים סקוור.
החדרים נקיים, צוות המלון אדיב.
יש בר על הגג שאקטיבי מאוד בערב. 
תחנות אוטובוס וסאבווי ממש ליד המלון. מומלץ מאוד.

title: OK place for a visit to NYC
text:
Check-in at 10pm, friendly and efficient. 

King room on 29th floor, looked North over Port Authority building car park.  Small, but comfortable. Loads of plug positions for recharging etc. 50"+ TV with many US channels. Free Wi-Fi. Cleaner very good.  Bathroom extremely cramped, contortion required to enter bathroom! Shower always had hot water. Only 8 rooms per floor, South-facing rooms have lift shafts other side of wall.

Breakfast adequate, selection of cereals and fresh fruit.  Toast, bagels etc. Selection of chilled juices. Bacon(crispy!), scrambled egg etc. Very busy if you arrive after 7am.  Did not appreciate being asked to leave table whilst still drinking coffee, basically told to take it up to our room!

Strange lounge/bar arrangement.  On top floor is Sky Room which looks as though it belongs to hotel - "Start your day with our free breakfast buffet, and end it with a drink at the hotel's rooftop bar".  Hotel description says Sky Room is "open to the public Thu-Sat".  However, despite the Marriott Call Centre assuring me that hotel residents could use it all week, this was not the case! The hotel's Sports Bar, which doubles as the Breakfast room, soulless and expensive.  Bottled beer $8, and wine $12/glass. Rates at several bars nearby were $5 and $8.

Room rate varies each night, check your bill carefully! During the 5 days we were there it ranged from $167-$377(w/o tax)!

title: 40 ans Audrey
text: Très bel Hotel , nous sommes venus en famille de marrakech et france , nous avons aimes , la gentillesse du personnel, la propreté !! Un seul bémol qui n'engage que moi , ça fait plus de 50 ans que j'arpente les Hotels du monde entier et c'est la première fois que je dois faire la queue pour prendre mon Pt déjeuner !!! Remerciez votre architecte pour la taille de la salle !!!  Je reviendrais chez vous

title: Fairfield Inn &Suites New York/Times Square
text:
Muito boa localização,perto da Times Square e do metrô.Eramos 4 pessoas ,a vó com 4 netas adolescentes e nos ofereceram um quarto bastante apertado,não havendo lugar suficiente para as malas,imaginem para as compras.
O café da manhã incluindo é uma boa pedida.

title: Lost license arrives in the mail
text: I stayed at the hotel a couple weeks back. During my visit to NYC I lost my license. Needless to say this created a huge hassle getting back home. Just before the day I was headed to the DMV to reissue, it arrived in the mail. It was found by the Fairfield housekeepers, passed along to the front office supervisor who mailed it to my address across country. Thank you so much Fairfield. Greatly appreciated! I'll be back and recommend this hotel to all others!

title: Fairfield Inn NY Times Square
text: Emplacement selon moi ideal car proche d'une grande partie des lieux touristiques (Times Square, Mme Tussaud, Empire...) mais neanmoins plutot calme. Essayer d'avoir chambre au-dessus du 15eme etage. Chambre confortable et bien insonorisée (sans clim pour nous car trop bruyant). Les plus: Rooftop (non testé car avec enfant de moins de 21 ans...), le concierge au petit soin pour reservation visite, conseils, confirmation navette.

title: Good for a bed
text: The hotel is clean, good for a sleeping - the beds are comfortable and is much quieter than anticipated (we were on the 6th floor) Great location walking distance from penn station and very central for everything. The rooms are small but had everything we needed- free safe, coffee maker, iron, hairdryer. Breakfast is ok- bagels, juice, fruit, eggs and coffee are good, however the breakfast room is no way big enough for the amount of guests staying at the hotel and you will often have to wait for a table, and you always feel rushed by staff when eating breakfast, so don't expect to go down to eat and leisurely look up things to do for the day, it's not and enjoyable experience but it's included in the price and fills you up until lunch! There are not many lifts for the amount of floors so expect to be waiting a while for them at busy times like breakfast.  In conclusion I would recommend if it's your first visit to New York as you won't be spending much time in your hotel as there are so many things to see, however when I visit again I would probably look for a hotel a little further away from Times Square.

title: Location, location, location! Great location and caring staff!
text: Great location and great staff! We arrived early and were able to have our car parked and luggage stowed. The bellhop gave us awesome directions and dining reservations. It is a short walk to Time Square and Broadway. You do have to give yourself a little extra time for the elevator but it was not a deal breaker for us, we'll definitely stay here again. Also, breakfast is one of the best I've had and I love that they seat you to help with crowd control. The staff is caring and you can tell they have done their best to fix the concerns that guests have had.

title: 1st Visit to NYC
text: I did a lot of research prior to booking the hotel. Read a lot of reviews and decided on Fair Field Marriott in Time Square. From the moment we got there when they stored our luggage to the day we checked out there was such a consistency in the employees desire to make our stay a pleasant one. Michelle Granados, Front Desk Supervisor certainly went above and beyond to exceed our expectations. Thank you Michelle for contributing to our excellent experience to our NY vacation. Is people like you and the attention to detail that sets the hotels a part. We will definitely be back again.

title: It is Just a Fairfield Inn
text: The hotel is just okay. The free breakfast was spot on. Saved me some money on that meal. The hotel has a Club on the very top floor. It has beautiful views. But one thing I didn't like is that it is only for adults. You could not in anyway take your kids to the top to enjoy the views. TV size in room was great. I was able to find something to entertain me on it. Hotel is just a few blocks away from Time Square which is great. Room size is not the biggest, just enough to fit a king bed, chair and closet. Wish was bigger to fit a couch in case you had guest in you room. It is close to something to eat. It also has the subway across the street.

title: Friendly Staff, Average Hotel
text: Location was right across the street from the Port Authority, so wasn't the nicest area...though walking distance from a lot.  Hotel room, though nice and clean, was small, even by NYC standards, and our view was of the Port Authority parking garage.  Small, slow elevators.  Didn't partake of the free breakfast.  Hotel staff was very friendly (with the exception of the evening bartender who had an issue giving us wine glasses to take to our room).  Wouldn't stay there again.

title: Quartos espaçosos
text: Padrão Fairfield, achei os quartos com ótimo tamanho já que em NY isso não é comum . Tem café da manhã incluído e boa localização. Os funcionários são cordiais e atenciosos. Boa opção para ficar em NY.

title: Couples night
text: I booked a standard room for one night and when I got there, I asked if there were any upgrades. There were and I was upgraded to the 32nd floor(top floor) with an amazing view of the Empire state building!!!! Room was really nice and clean. Breakfast was a bit crowded and one of the workers changing coffee was a bit pushy but over all I would definitely stay there again.

title: Location, location, location for the price!
text: Great location, rooms a bit small, elevators slow, long waits. Roof top bar caused evenings to have slower elevator service as they dedicated them to their cover charged patrons. Breakfast free but insane and everyone is waiting like savages to eat breakfast.  We left as we were in line for over 30 minutes. Too many people in too little time means insanity with really a bad attempt in organization.  We valeted our car, only to be told afterwards that there is no in and out privileges so for $60-$62 a night, I should be able to have in an out service. While I understand it says that in their policy it should be reiterated when the guest checks in. The other thing that was a turn off for me, was people smoking right outside the front doors of the hotel.  I understand it is a city environment, but, that is just not ok, as there are plenty of sidewalks in NYC to smoke. Otherwise the hotel was clean, staff friendly, modern.

title: mi sono ricreduta
text: avevo scritto una recensione abbastanza buona su questo hotel, in quanto la vicinanza da due linee della metro e l'albergo in se, ne facevano un luogo abbastanza soddisfacente. La sorpresa l'abbiamo avuta quando è arrivato l'estratto conto della carta di credito, allora abbiamo scoperto che, ci hanno addebbitato 276 dollari per il parcheggio della macchina che noi non avevamo. L'errore è ancora più grave in quanto di solito gli extra, qualora ce ne sono, vengono evidenziati al momento del chek-out, quando si ha la possibilità di contestarli eventualmente e non quando il cliente è già a migliaia di km. Dopo avere fatto notare l'errore, a distanza di mesi, ancora non abbiamo ricevuto nessun rimborso, per cui fate attenzione.

title: Nice hotel with great location
text:
The location of the hotel is great with Port Authority Bus Terminal just 1 min away and Times square barely 3 min away. There is a building undergoing renovation two doors down, so the side walk is in serious need of repair. 

The room was clean and size was decent, same goes for the bathroom.

Only thing I was annoyed with was the lift - you have to insert your key card, wait for the light and then select your floor. There was one lift where the light would not come on. The first time me and 2 other guest all inserted the card and the light didn't come on. Then we just tried selecting the floor and it worked. I have never been a fan of key card in the lift.

Now the question is "is the price worth it?". In my opinion Yes. Coming from India the exchange rate really hits you but the price is worth the location. If you want the room rate cheaper, book your stay on the weekend.

title: Didn't like it
text: Being a platinum member of Marriott Rewards was not good enough to get a room on arrival at 10:00, nor when I next asked at 12:00. At 13:00 they finally gave me a room. The room was not much to speak of, being so cramped that one couldn't pull the chair straight back from the desk as the bed blocked it. I think being a platinum member of Marriott Rewards made not the slightest difference at this hotel, since breakfast is free for all guests (huge lines unless you get up at the crack of dawn), there is obviously no lounge and I could not recognize any single advantage tied to my Rewards membership. The main thing this place had going for it was location.

title: Amazing customer service
text:
Quick visit to NYC, and happy I selected this hotel.  It is very busy and the staff handled the rush with no problem.  Checked in quickly, room clean and in working order.  Fluffy towels, good water pressure, comfortable bed, mini fridge, and valet parking!

Easy walk to theater district, Hell's Kitchen, great places to eat and drink.

Loved the customer service!  

Didn't love the elevators.  Too small to handle the volume of guests during busy times.

title: Nice rooms, great location
text:
This hotel is situated close (5 min walk) to Times Square. The staff are friendly and attentive and the decor is modern.  It would be the ideal hotel except for one glaring issue. 

The only weakness of the hotel is the elevators which are very small holding only 5-6 people each and are extremely slow. The 3 elevators are always busy seemingly stopping at every floor as people try to go down for breakfast. We were on the 7th floor and after watching the elevator open on our floor packed full, it was quicker for us to use the stairs than wait for an open elevator. What's worse is that at some point in the evening they take one elevator out of commission for regular guests and devote it to those who pay to use the roof top bar. Nice for those folks but not so nice for the rest of us that just want to go to our rooms.

title: Apartamentos muito bons e ótima localização
text:
Ficamos oito dias hospedados neste hotel, a localização é excelente, possibilitando fazer muitas atividades a pé.
Os quartos, embora não sejam muito grandes, estão bem cuidados e atendem o necessário para uma estadia tranquila.
A internet funciona bem e o café da manhã está incluído na diária.
O café da manhã é estilo americano, sem muitas opções, mas com o suficiente para uma boa refeição. Dependendo do horário tem um pouco de fila, mas nada que ultrapasse cinco minutos.
Certamente ficaria hospedado novamente neste hotel.
Tive apenas um pequeno problema, pois o quarto estava diferente do que eu havia reservado, depois de um pouco de confusão (culpa também do meu inglês..rs) tudo foi resolvido com a ajuda da recepcionista Kam (desculpe se não estiver escrito corretamente). Ela foi nota 10 e resolveu tudo.

title: Perfect Hotel!
text:
I spent 4 days in the fairfield Inn Hotel the last september with my friends. All was simply perfect: location in Times Square, The center of Manhattan; bedroom great, very clean and complete of everything you need; very good and full breakfast; hotel staff very kind and available to ask to all your questions. I recommended the Hotel for job trips or holidays, alone or with Family. 

Ho trascorso 4 giorni nell'Hotel Fairfield Inn, lo scorso settembre con dei miei amici. Tutto è stato semplicemente perfetto: posizione in Times Square, il centro di Manhattan; camera grande, molto pulita e completa di tutto ciò di cui hai bisogno; colazione molto buona e ricca; personale molto gentile e disponibile a rispondere ad ogni tua richiesta. Raccomando l'Hotel per viaggi di lavoro o vacanze, da solo o in famiglia.

title: L'attesa....
text: Hotel in posizione strategica data la sua vicinanza a Times Square, alla Central Station e a molti altri luoghi di interesse. Pulito,camere sufficentemente spaziose e con grande tv ; aria condizionata sparata al massimo ! Discreta la colazione anche se servita in locali troppo angusti per poter accogliere tutti gli ospiti che l'hotel contiene. Un disastro salire e scendere con gli ascensori ( sono solo tre e, la sera addirittura solo due ) per raggiungere le stanze - l'hotel è oltre venti piani di altezza !

title: Muy recomendable
text:
El hotel es muy recomendable, de lo mejores en que me hospede en manhattan, es moderno, limpio, no tenes sorpresas en las habitaciones, ya que muchos otros hoteles estan siendo restaurados, y pueden tocarte pisos muy viejos y en mal estado (lo digo por experiencia propia) El desayuno es hasta temprano 9:30 dias de semanas y hasta las 10, los fines de semana. Muy completo!, huevos, bacon, panes, bagels, wafles, papas, yogur, cereales (varios), frutas, cafe, te, chocolatada, jugos. 

La unica contra, es que si decidis irte a otra ciudad por algunos dias, y dps volver al hotel, no te guardan las valijas, es decir, solo las guardan durante el dia, no pueden pasar la noche en el hotel, yo viaje a Washington por unos dias, y tuve que guardarlas en un lugar que esta a 3 cuadras del hotel (U$d 15 cada bulto por noche). Dps volvi al mismo hotel. Por politicas de seguridad, solo las guardan si haces un check in muy temprano, y te las almacenan para que puedas salir a recorrer tranquilo. Lo mismo cuando haces el check out temprano, y tu vuelo sale tarde/noche, te las guardan sin problemas.

title: MALA EXPERIENCIA.
text:
nos quedamos en este hotel en septiembre del 2016 ,al llegar del aeropuesto nos atendieron muy bien y en español durante la recepcion ,habia un problema con mi tarjeta de credito pero la noche quedo pagada y los 2 dias restantes se desconto el pago desde mi tarjeta . aqui comenzo el problema me descontaron un precio diferente todas las noches y no me respetaron el precio de mi reserva online ,la noche del 3 dia llegamos a la habitacion muy cansados y la tarjeta no funcionaba bajamos para ver que pasaba y nos dijeron que no podiamos sacar nuestras cosas hasta no cancelas todo , explicamos que nos habian descontado las 3 noches desde la tarjeta y que estba todo pagado, la recepcionista comenzo a grita y faltar el respeto  en ingles y dijo que no hablaria mas en español con nosotros, llamamos a un superio y nadie nos ayudo , decidimos irnos esa misma noche a un lugar mejor y donde se nos respetara .ademas el desayuno muy malo , los ascensores son muy pocos y el personal deja bastante que desear .
no se queden en este lugar .

title: Gute lage,mangelhaftes hotel
text:
Lage des hotels ist einfach top. Hotel selber ist sehr mangelhaft. Die zimmer sind sehr klein.aussicht des zimmer ist nicht schön. Beim frühstücks- buffet lautet es je früher desto besser. Ab 8 uhr muss man anstehen bis es platz hat. Machen Sie sich auf lange wartezeiten gefasst. Das buffet ansich ist sehr einfach ausgestattet. Eier,speck,wurst,cornflakes und brötchen. So ist es und zwar jedentag.
Personal ist mehrheitlich freundlich.
-Unbedingt kreditkarte als depot mitnehmen. Das hotel möchte eine kreditkarte als depot.nichts anderes.-

Skybar: die skybar hat nichts mit dem hotel zu tun. auch haben sie nur an gewissen tagen offen und manchmal dürfen nur eingeladene gäste in die bar. Meine schwester ist 20 jahre alt und sie durfte nicht mit nach oben um zu schauen wie die bar aussah,sogar mit begleitung meiner mutter.fand ich einbisschen übertriben.

title: Per pochi giorni può andare
text: Non rimarrà tra i posti del cuore ma resta comunque accettabile soprattutto se a viaggiare è un gruppo scatenato di persone che escono di mattina e rincasano tardi. La stanza per tre è decisamente piccola, l'armadio inesistente e purtroppo la moquette onnipresente. La vista non è granché dal 22 piano. La scelta dell'albergo è stata anche motivata dall'inclusione della colazione che a conti fatti consiglierei di fare fuori per la qualità mediocre dei prodotti offerti e il locale angusto e deprimente. Punti positivi: posizione comoda, materassi confortevoli, assistenza in camera rapida ed efficiente. Su tutto il resto chiudiamo un occhio.

title: Great staff; NIce room
text: This hotel is conveniently located near Time Square and the Metro station.  The rooms are great, comfortable and clean.  I appreciated the daily breakfast that was more than bagels and fruit.  The staff was excellent and well prepared to assist with all my needs at any time, even offering suggestions to make my stay even better. I would definitely stay here again and refer family and friends.

title: Hospitable staff and convenient location
text: Our stay at this property was excellent, largely due to the hospitable staff and convenient location.  Our room was clean and comfortable and appeared to be recently renovated.  Since we were on a high floor, the view from our room was quite nice.  The free breakfast was a nice change from our usual bagel and coffee when we visit New York City.  Options were basic but included scrambled eggs, bacon, turkey sausage, cereals, yogurt and an array of fruits.  The dining process was well orchestrated with each party given a particular table, like you would experience at a regular restaurant.  Most properties that include breakfasts are more free-for-all settings and this change was refreshing.  Depending upon the arrival time, there could be a short line but it moved well.  We attended a number of Broadway shows and most of them were less than a 12-minute walk away.  We walked to the Metropolitan Museum of Art in less than an hour.  It surely would have been faster by subway but the weather was too beautiful not to walk.  This property does not put you in the middle of Times Square but certainly close enough to enjoy the action.

title: Strategico
text: Hotel in posizione strategica, difronte al Madison Square garden e a pochi minuti dalla centralissima Times square; camere non grandissime ma comode e pulite, letto king spettacolare, doccia enorme. Colazione continentale molto fornita soprattutto per quanto riguarda le pietanze americane (bacon, uova strappazzate, etc). Consigliato

title: Memorable stay!!
text:
We were first time in NYC and this location is just bang on Times Square ( though you feel bored seeing all the glitters after few days)... but still it's manageable. 

Connection from JFK via Metro pretty easy, hop on hop off just round the corner opposite PABT

Breakfast is OK and you can take the things to your room provided there is waiting in the area

Rooms are of decent size and we did not face any problem opening two large suitcases, a cupboard is there too

SKY bar, the nightclub operates from THU to SAT and mind you lines are pretty big!!!

Loads of eating options nearby and the traffic!!! my god... just Keep Walking!! Cheers

Also, we mistakingly  left out camera in the hotel but were glad when the hotel people found it and gave us back the next day

Thanks to Marriott hospitality!!!👍🏻

title: Ok
text: Since the merger with SPG i got the Elite status and wanted to try one of the Marriots hotel, location is good since we had our meetings at 39th street, room ok and te reception is nice, pretty fast service and fast internet.

title: Never been here because...
text: I booked one night room in april for my stay in september. It's was a non refund room so normally they had to charge the stay. They did not, and 2 days before I had an email from booking that my credit card was invalid. I wrote an email for asking them to keep my room, the stay has to be in 2 days and I Will pay at the check in if it's possible. They reply that they keep my room and it's okay for the paiement. The day before my stay they cancelled my booking !! It was difficult for me because I was already in NY ! I wrote them 2 times after that, and I am still waiting for an answer ! I work in a hotel and I can tell that this is not a great way to do with your guest !! Hopefully I find another hotel for stay. Never again !

title: If you like your shopping gifts stolen then stay here
text:
My husband and I decided to go to new York for our 2nd wedding anniversary and to celebrate that fact were going to be parents beginning of 2017.
We decided on spending 6 nights in new York as we appreciate we won't be able to return anytime soon. 
We chose a marriott hotel, yes it's pricer than some hotels but we wanted to be near times square and a good brand we know and trust...so we thought.

We stayed on 26th floor so.had good views.  Bed was comfy and room was cleaned to a great standard daily. The breakfast was a buffet but it didn't have much choice and felt repetitive.

My husband and I went to new York to see the sites and do a bit of shopping.

Wednesday 7th September was our 2nd wedding anniversary and a few months previous to this I had emailed the hotel direct and asked if they could suprise my husband with a little something  (I didn't mind paying)... the response "we are be happy to do something for you both" which I was really happy with. We decided to go for a stroll around central park for our anniversary, grab a snack, have a nap in the afternoon  (being pregnant I am constantly tried) as we had booked Broadway to see a show that evening so wanted to go for a romantic meal before.

On our return to the room after our morning out the house keeping had been in but there was no suprise for my husband. When my husband was is the bathroom getting ready to go out I rang reception and asked about the "suprise" ... they had forgot and asked what time we were heading out..I said 5pm.
When  we got in that evening the hotel staff had left an anniversary card in our room and a bottle of wine (I didn't mind that I couldn't drink it as I was really pleased for my husband).

Roll on to Friday 9th September when it came to checking out. My husband and I were packing and we noticed a shopping bag (a large brown bloomingdales paper carrier bag) had gone missing. Inside of this bag were gifts we had bought : 2 bags and a basketball shirt. We already had a shopping bag in the wardrobe and valuables in the safe so this shopping bag was next to our suitcases.(as nowhere else to put it).

When I told the mangers about this (immediately after we had realised) all she said was she would put me through to house keeping to see if they have seen it... obviously no one had apparently seen it. Head of house keeping said it could have gone out in the trash... I highly doubt it as as soon as you appear in the bag you can see gifts. After speaking to the management again she said "all I can offer is to fill out a form for our insurance" at this point I was in tears! Gifts we had bought that you can only buy in new York had been taken from our room and there was nothing anyone would do to help. We were leaving to fly home to the UK so we couldn't rebuy them!

I asked for them to check CCTV from the hallway ... their reply "we don't have cctv"
So, I pay nearly $2000 to stay at (what I thought was) a reputable hotel and they don't have cctv!!!!!! They said they would check the card activity from when I last remember seeing the bag... this was 5pm Wednesday night as I remember getting some m&ms out of the bag before going to the theatre.
I asked if we needed 3d to call the police for an incident number which they replied we didn't. 

On my return home 12 days ago I've had no help dispite several emails and tweets.
The hotels insurance will not pay out as I can't prove there staff have stolen my things (as no cctv).

My belongings only come to a little less than $100 but I cannot replace the gifts I bought but why should I be out of pocket.

The last holiday we will have before we have our baby has gone from a dream holiday to a nightmare.

Please don't pay to stay in this hotel. I wish I had a warning before I booked.

title: Great location
text:
In a central position for site seeing, very close to all types of transportation. Clean rooms with all amenities, and quite big rooms considering it is in a city. The staff very friendly especially the ladies in the breakfast room., great selection of food too. Lots of building work near the hotel.  There is a roof bar with views of Manhattan which is nice for chilling out, only this is also open to the public as well as hotel guests.
The only down side we found, there were a few people sleeping rough further up the road from the hotel.

title: Discreta struttura
text: Per la fiera dell'abbigliamento Coterie, ho scelto questo 3 stelle poco distante dal javits center. La hall regala la sensazione di un hotel di categoria superiore, esattamente come le camere, dotate di un televisore a schermo piatto da 46", frigobar e cassaforte. Le camere poi sono di dimensioni considerevoli e sobriamente arredate. Il fatto che è un 3* emerge dal fatto che il frigobar è vuoto (ovviamente lo si può riempire) e dalla sala colazioni decisamente sottodimensionata per la quantità di ospiti, nonché dalla qualità della colazione stessa (discutibile). Il personale è cortese ma sbrigativo. Resta il fatto che sia un'ottima scelta

title: Excellent establishment
text: Friendly staff, excellent service, very clean rooms, fantastic bed, large bathroom and a reasonably sized breakfast in the morning. This establishment is approximately three miles from the centre of Manhatten and is close to Subway lines E, M and R. Definately well worth the stay in a Marriott quality without the Manhatten price tag.

title: Ritorno nello stesso hotel
text: Sono ritornato nello stesso hotel dopo 2 anni e devo dire che sono sempre moltooooooo soddisfatto,personale altamente qualificato,cortese,gentile e sempre pronto ad aiutarti.Le camere ottime,  il personale di pulizia ai piani molto cortese.Mi hanno prenotato una macchina per l'aeroporto basso costo e confortevole...un bel macchinone di lusso...La posizione e' ottimale vicino a Times square e alla stazione degli autobus,tutto a portata di mano.Complimenti alla reception,sono persone adorabili.

title: Goed gelegen stadshotel
text: Het hotel ziet er prima uit. De kamers zijn redelijk klein, maar zien er modern, netjes en erg schoon uit. Het personeel is erg behulpzaam en vriendelijk. Het ontbijt is inbegrepen en vonden wij naar Amerikaanse begrippen royaal. In vorige recensies wordt er gesproken over lange wachttijden voor de lift: erg overdreven, valt allemaal reuze mee. Verder metrostation vlakbij, maar ook op loopafstand al vele must-see-things bereikbaar. Voor een volgende trip zou ik dit hotel weer boeken!

title: Great staff| Good Location despite construction
text:
I am a long time Fairfield/Marriott client. This location was typically excellent in service, cleanliness, quality of breakfast and a helpful staff (especially the concierge). The sitting areas were magnificent. The TV monitors in the breakfast area were everywhere and a nice added touch. Starbucks in the room was awesome. Gave you ear plugs in case it was loud. Didn't need them. Saturday nights can be busy in the lobby due to the rooftop party. But besides congestion, no issues with it.

The opportunities:
Small bathroom made getting in and out of the shower tough. The sink and shower are in the same room. Hard to share space if its more than one person.

Warning about local construction (in NYC where transportation is already an issue, being at a location that is hard for taxis, shuttles and cars to get to made it more difficult)

*Gentle* reminders about check out time instead of a bang on the door from housekeeping at 11:58 and when you open the door, they are already banging on the next door yelling "check out". I felt like I was day camp.

A stool in the business center area would be helpful. I know the goal isn't to have people remain long, but a simple courtesy for those who may not be able to stand long would be great. One older lady almost fell while sitting on her luggage trying to print her boarding pass.

title: Pro e contro
text: Io e le mie amiche abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel con le mie amiche per 7 notti. Che dire,la posizione è senz'altro strategica permette di raggiungere Times Square a piedi. Ma purtroppo abbiamo avuto dei contrattempi un po fastidiosi. Per prima cosa è la prima volta che mi succede in un albergo di dover richiedere la carta igienica perché non c'era neanche un rotolo di scorta e nonostante in camera fossimo in 4 anche il numero di asciugamani lasciati non era mai quello giusto. Come già detto avevamo prenotato tramite booking il nostro soggiorno per 7 notti,ma il giorno dopo il nostro arrivo l'albergo ci informa che a lui risultavano solo 6 notti e che dovevamo pagare la differenza. Ci viene scritta la somma dovuta , ma quando siamo andate a pagare la ragazza della reception ci fa un conteggio diverso. Molto sgarbatamente e scocciata ci dice che l'errore era stato fatto dalla sua collega e che se volevamo potevamo parlare con lei . Così abbiamo fatto e il conto scritto era giusto con molte scuse ci è stato offerto un drink. In tutto questo però c'è stato addebitato un secondo deposito. L'ultimo giorno tramite l hotel abbiamo prenotato l 'albergo la macchina per andare in aeroporto : 4 persone 8 bagagli. Ci viene rilasciata la ricevuta della somma da pagare 67dollari. La sorpresa è stata che il driver si è rifiutato di portarci perché la somma dovuta non era quella giusta ,visto che avevamo troppi bagagli. A nulla è servita la ricevuta nelle nostre mani se non pagavamo di più dovevamo scaricare le valigie. Cosi abbiamo fatto e abbiamo preso un taxi. Ancora una volta quella scritta non era la somma giusta. Mi è sembrata veramente una mancanza di professionalità grandissima che non mi aspettavo proprio. Mi chiedo quello da pagare dipende da chi si incontra? E se avessi pagato all'albergo la cifra non giusta chi mi avrebbe restituito i soldi?

title: Basic, Small but Centralized
text: A basic, and very small cramped room for four people, at a cost of $1300.00 US for three nights. It did include breakfast, which was excellent, but you had to line up to get into the extremely small space. The only saving grace was that this hotel is 20 walking blocks from everything. The front reception area is non existent with one bench along the wall and the check in counter. Also there are three elevators, and if you wish to use them between 7 and 9 or 4 and 6... forget it.... you will wait at least 20 minutes to get on one.

title: Buena relación precio/calidad
text:
Estuve con mi familia durante  7 días.  Habitación cómoda, muy buena la cama y los almohadas.  Baño cómodo.  Si bien para el desayuno hay que hacer cola todos los productos son de muy buena calidad.  Kelloge cereales (vs cereales), fruta fresca, queso filadelfia, miel, mermeladas, huevos,  tocino, panes, café y te vs. Pero lo que más me llamo la atención es que uno puede llevarse en una bandeja, que también te la dan, para que te lleves  los alimentos que quieras.  Además siempre había botellitas de agua y Una máquina de hielo en el subsuelo.  El mirador del boliche del último piso está muy bueno.  Como crítica es la demora en los ascensores. Y la existencia de varios homless en la zona...pero indudablemente volvería.  
Su ubicación es perfecta.

title: Pretty Awesome
text:
Group of gals came to NY to see for the first time and experience big city life and the sites!
Fairfield was super clean and staff was very friendly-- one party flying in from Germany and it was no problem to leave her name so she could get her own room key - 
Beds were comfy, bath super clean and everything we needed - we could not want for anything! We even had chocolate on the pillows! Just need more hooks fit towels as we didn't require room clean every day and just a tiny disappointed about the lounge not advertised not being opened every night -- we expected to go unwind every night on the rooftop -- so that was a bit disappointing we could only do a few nights out if a week stay --- but I still give you a five star!!!

title: A visit to New York
text:
Good comfortable rooms and friendly helpful staff. Well located for visiting New York. Somewhat noisy arear. The breakfast is rather poor and monotonous. Close to Manhattan brich (China town). 
Subway station is at 10 minutes walk.

title: Mid range hotel at prime location
text: Stayed here for the first time. Rooms are mid size but very well maintained. House keeping is excellent. Toilets including bathtub are clean and towels are changed daily if the guests wishes so. The breakfast which comes with the room is the take away. The spread has variety and is healthy and tasty. There is also a roof top lounge which attracts quite a big crowd on weekends and can be enjoyed by the hotel residents free of cost. Overall a no frills hotel and value for money. One negative is the frontage, quite unimpressive. Wifi in the rooms and reception area is great.

title: Buena elección
text: Situación inmejorable, muy cerca de Times Square pero no en todo el meollo. El desayuno sencillo pero no hace falta más, tienes el resto del día para comer guarradas. La habitación muy bien, cama grande y muy cómoda, la habitación es espaciosa y siempre muy limpia, además es bastante nuevo todo. El único problema es la terraza de último piso que está habilitada para discoteca, ya que da bastante por saco tanto la clientela como los porteros, de hecho se colaban en ascensores que estaban habilitados exclusivamente para clientes del hotel e incluso llegarnos a preguntar los porteros que a donde íbamos.

title: Bellissimo soggiorno
text: È gia la seconda volta che abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel dopo 3 anni, vicino a time square, la camera al 23simo piano era silenziosa, pulita, ordinata, personale gentile, cortese e disponibile, l ascensore era un po trafficato al mattino  all'ora di colazione, ma niente di stressante, visto che eravamo in vacanza... ci siamo trovati benissimo in questo hotel, se dovessimo tornare a New York ancora, soggiorneremo nuovamente li!!!

title: Great Location
text: First time staying here and couldn't have asked for anything better. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and breakfast was ok. Even with how busy it was we didn't have to wait to long for the elevators. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Excelente localização!!
text: O hotel fica muito bem localizado, próximo à times square. Além disso o metrô com linhas A, C e E fica na mesma quadra. O café da manhã é bem servido ( com direito a café da starbuck). A recepção também é bem atenciosa! Uma boa pedida na ida para Nova York!!

title: Good for the money. Good location. Dirty frontage.
text: This location offers great location, great free full breakfast, and great wifi. I will stay here again just for this reason alone. The front of the hotel is so smelly and littered with garbage. They seem to leave their garbage at the front of the hotel and it smells so bad. The hotel shared lobby with a night club. I find it weird. It may not be kids friendly at night time. There are only three elevators for 30 plus floors building. The wait time for elevator is terrible. At night time when the club is open, one elevator is used for the night club only and leaving only two elevators available for hotel guests.

title: OK room....not great for the price but average
text:
The room was OK in my opinion.  My girlfriend was with me and she very politely asked the manager about what kind of laundry detergent they use as she has allergies and broke out in hives, and the manager accused her of lying which to me is unacceptable.  We weren't being accusatory we were just asking out of curiosity and the guy was flat out rude.  

One other thing that struck me as odd is that, I could tell that somebody (likely housekeeping) was in the room every single day but nothing was cleaned at all.  Beds were not made, we received no fresh towels, no soap replacements, yet still somebody came into the room every day.  One day I got back from work and my door was wide open....again, nothing was cleaned and there was nobody in the room.  The front desk clerk feigned ignorance.  If you aren't going to clean my room then please stay out; I felt as though my privacy was violated.

title: Ubicación perfecta!
text: Muy buena opción para visitar la ciudad, Times Square a 8 min a pie, metro y estación autobuses al lado.. Dimensión de la habitación justa para 3-4 personas y una estancia d 6 noches.. Poco espacio para guardar ropa i las maletas! Limpieza justa, cama cómoda, grande y agradable! Espacio del desayuno muy pequeño para tantas habitaciones (244).

title: Rien à redire
text:
Hotel très propre petit déjeûner compris très correct
Nous étions au 30 étage chambre très correcte ménage fait tous les jours et serviettes changées vue sur l empire state building.....
Personnel très agréable
Nous avons juste attendu un peu une fois à l ascenseur et quand je dis attendre c est moins de 5 mn 
Au petit déjeuner le plus que nous ayons attendu est 5 à 8 mn aussi nous y avons été 5 matins à des horaires variables et nous étions 3
C est vrai que la climatisation est bruyante mais elle l est partout non?
Bref très bonnes appréciations c etait notre deuxième séjour à New York et cet hôtel était mieux que le précédent 
Si nous devons revenir nous y retournerions

title: Buen hotel excepto ciertos detalles
text: En general, el servicio del hotel es acorde al precio, la atención de la gente de recepción, la ubicación es muy buena y las habitaciones también solo que un poco pequeñas si se hospedan más de dos personas. Las maquinas de café durante todo el día y que entreguen botellas de agua para llevar son un buen punto a favor. Para el que le guste, el bar ubicado en la terraza es muy bueno, sobretodo porque al estar alojados en el hotel no hay que hacer fila ya que es muy concurrido. El punto más bajo del hotel es el desayuno, muy limitada la variedad de alimentos, el espacio para desayunar es muy pequeño lo que hace que se formen filas esperando mesa, encima los mozos TE APURAN PARA QUE DESPEJES LA MESA y así hacer lugar a otros, lamentable. Habiéndome hospedado anteriormente en el Fairfield Midtown/Pennstation, recomendaría ese por sobre el Manhattan/Times Square

title: Viaggio di nozze perfetto
text: Esperienza fantastica a New York soprattutto per aver alloggiato in questo hotel meraviglioso con Sky room da favola. Personale gentilissimo, colazione ottima, camere pulite e nel cuore di Manhattan...cosa dire di più lo consglio!

title: Trip with friends in NYC
text: We went to NYC in late January, early February with 3 friends. The hotel is excellent well located. Near 42st Port Authority Bus Terminal, Times Square, etc. Everything is at our disposal. The personnel is helpful. The breakfast is good but always the same. So with our 2 weeks trip, we couldn't eat it anymore. Everything is fine except the card system. When they touch your phone, they don't work anymore.

title: Situación aceptable y poco mas
text: Habitaciones cuádruples muy pequeñas en las que no existe sitio ni para dejar las maletas. Unicamente dispone de 3 ascensores para 32 plantas lo que genera importantes pérdidas de tiempo hasta encontrar un hueco. El desayuno es poco variado, nada que ver con cualquier bufett europeo. Además el salón únicamente dispone de capacidad para 74 personas. Ello supone tanto colas para entrar como que luego te apuren para que te vayas y dejes sitio para otro. Los platos, vasos y cubiertos son de plástico. Inaudito. El servicio de limpieza deja bastante que desear. El polvo solo lo limpiaron 1 vez en 10 días. Además pese a ser 4 solo nos dejaban 3 toallas. Tuvimos que pedir la que faltaba en 2 ocasiones. Finalmente el último día alrededor de la medianoche desalojaron el hotel por una falsa alarma de humo sin mediar explicaciones ni disculpas. Además la alarma no sonaba de manera permanente por lo que no sabiamos si era realmente o se trataba de otra cosa. No repetiríamos. Decir también que nada más llegar nos pidieron la tarjeta y bloquearon 140 euros por hipoteticos consumos. Nunca me había sucedido.

title: Friendly and ideally located
text:
Nothing is too much trouble for the staff at this hotel, all done with a smile.

The location on West 40th Street is ideal for nipping in and out of during the day, the Port Authority is across the road and while some see this as a negative I found it a positive as there are about 7 subway lines that run through it. One tip for people, take note of the signs on the entrances and enter the one that is relevant to the line you wish to use otherwise you can end up walking half a mile in warm, humid tunnels (the trains themselves are air conditioned but they have to blow off the excess heat somewhere).

Is there a dubious liquor store and Chinese restaurant on the same road, yes, but we had no issues no matter the time of day (or night).

The room was large enough for our needs, 2 adults and an 8 year old, with two queen sized beds and a shower big enough for two. Paul Mitchell toiletries are complimentary from the hotel, and my wife appreciated those. We were on the 24th floor and no issues with noise, room faced the Port Authority but the view was still great looking towards Times Square and the New York Times.

Coffee machine, hair dryer and iron supplied in the room, coffee machine is a little redundant as free coffee is supplied in the lobby 24 hours a day. The room is air conditioned with full control in the room.

The lifts, which everyone mentions, are not the speediest but I only had an issue on one night where there was a private function in the Sky Room and they seemed to be using all three lifts. I must admit the attitude that night did make you feel like a second class citizen, hotel guests spending hundreds of dollars a night were getting in the way of people buying a beer. However that was one night, in fact one hour of one night.

The complimentary breakfast is a great way to start the day, bacon, sausage, eggs and potatoes on the hot side and bagels, cereals etc on the cold side. Eat as much as you want, with the room run efficiently, in fact a special thank you to the room supervisor who squeezed us in ten minutes late for breakfast. Tip, read the sign in the lift for queue times for breakfast.

Ice and vending machines in the basement.

Finally at check out the staff could not be more helpful, looking after the luggage and letting us create a bomb site while we tried to beat the 23kg limit per bag.

If not for the attitude on the Tuesday night where they had the private function it would have been 5 stars, the staff deserve it.

title: Très bon emplacement - Petit déjeuner inclus
text:
Avis un peu tardif, notre séjour en famille remontant à l'an dernier;
Notre avis rejoint nombre de commentaires déjà publiés.
Personnel très professionnel et agréable. Petit problème avec le détecteur d'incendie réglé vite et bien.
Petit déjeuner compris dans le prix, avec un choix satisfaisant. Bon, c'est à quelques encablures derrière le buffet d'un bon vieux Novotel, mais nous sommes aux US : oubliez vos 5 fruits et légumes pendant la durée du séjour ;-).
Chambre calme et propre (deux lits double) mais pas hyper spacieuse. Ordre et rangement sont nécessaires pour que deux adultes et deux ados cohabitent une semaine.
Demandez un étage élevé (au moins le 12e), sinon vous aurez vue sur l'énorme bâtiment de Port Authority, juste à côté.
Mais justement, on peut pénétrer dans ce bâtiment par la porte latérale pile en face de l'hôtel et attraper immédiatement le métro; C'est top.
Et l'hôtel est près de Times Square, mais pas trop près pour éviter le bruit et la cohue. Vous pouvez aussi commander une voiture (65 USD pour JFK) pour vous ramener à l'aéroport. C'est super pratique.
Donc en résumé, pour NY, une bonne adresse.

title: New york last stop
text:
Rooms are small, Old furniture, corridor are extremely narrow and hot, 30 floor with ONLY 3 lifts, and one of them is dedicated for Rooftop Club during weekends.
restaurant is extremely small considering No. of rooms.
Location is OK, very close to time square and surrounding area.

title: Muy lindo hotel!
text:
Nos hospedamos en diciembre, para pasar Navidad... La pasamos excelente! Muy buena atención, muy bien ubicado (a metros de la estación Porth Authority y del subte, y a pocas cuadras de Times Square). La limpieza del lugar estaba ok, había muchas familias, la decoración de Navidad muy linda!, el desayuno super variado! Había opciones para los que desayunan fuerte como los norteamericanos (huevo, cheddar, bacon) y opciones mas "light" (frutas, yogurth, cereales, tostado/medialuna) como solemos desayunar los argentinos. También tenía café de Starbucks las 24hs disponible gratis, y a la tarde ponían a funcionar la máquina de pochoclos! 
Venía gente de distintos lugares a conocer la terraza (que dicen que es lo MEJOR del hotel) pero no pudimos subir ya que los dos días que intentamos estaba cerrada por ser feriado de Navidad.
Las malas:
-Todas las tardes ponían un cartel de "happy hour" en tragos.. El barman no sabía preparar buenos tragos (por lo menos los conocidos) sino sólo medidas de bebida blanca. Al momento del cobro nunca existió tal "happy hour", por el contrario quiso cobrarnos de más y sólo después de quejarme bajó la cuenta más de 30usd! (Quería cobrarme tragos que no había consumido) por lo tanto si quieren tomar un trago que no sea en la barra del hotel... 
-La ubicación tiene sus pro y sus contra: si bien está cerca de todo, de noche esa cuadra es muy oscura y al haber una licorería en la esquina, suele estar lleno de borrachos y gente en situación de calle. También había una obra en construcción en esa cuadra lo que hacía obligatorio pasar por un pasillo oscuro y apartado (ya que en un tramo no había vereda) siendo poco agradable para hacerlo de noche.

Definitivamente lo recomiendo para ir en pareja o en familia! Es un hotel lindo, en el centro, no tan caro y muy cómodo! Excelente atención en el front desk! Volveremos!

title: Posizione strategica nel cuore di Manhattan
text: Hotel veramente molto strategico per visitare al meglio la città. È possibile raggiungere a piedi in pochi minuti Times Square e la fermata della metropolitana è praticamente di fianco all'hotel. Curato nei dettagli, pulito e confortevole. Unico aspetto forse da migliorare, la gestione della colazione. Nel momento di maggior afflusso c'è un po' di fila che comunque si smaltisce rapidamente. Veramente consigliassimo.

title: Loction
text: The hotel's location is perfect and the upkeep of standard is good. The receptionist who check us in, when checking in said that our original booking price had a mistake, and dismissively said that our stay would be a further 600$ extra even when we showed the email of our booking she was unhelpful. This left the initial impression that the service is poor quality, which was proven throughout our stay, as none of the staff smiled, or showed the slightest interest in being approachable. A high price was paid for a service that was not present, so in the end the only positive thing about the whole hotel in general was the location.

title: Muy comodo y bien situado
text: Hotel moderno y comodo con una situación maravillosa, todo te pilla al lado. SI coges una habitación familiar para cuatro personas te sale superbarato. EL desayuno americano es abundante y rico, te prepara para un buen dia de turismo

title: I recommend
text:
Staff friendly and helpful especially at the reception, good location, good breakfast although it may seem a bit industrial, not too noisy in the 30th floor.
A walk from the New York times halfway between the south and north of New York.
In the evening you can take advantage of the panoramic terrace to enjoy a drink with views of New York
I recommend it !

title: Wonderful Stay
text:
We had an unexpectedly wonderful stay at the Fairfield Inn & Suites in Times Square and expect to return upon our next visit to NY.

My wife and I are fans of the Marriott chain generally and we decided to stay at the Fairfield based on price, location and its Marriott affiliation.  We arrived on a Tuesday evening and departed the following Thursday morning.  Throughout our stay, we found the location great, the room clean and comfortable, and the other amenities quite good.  Several good restaurants are close by and it is right across the street from the Port Authority, which is often our point of entry to the city.

Our impression of the hotel was driven largely by meeting and speaking with staffers Bryan Farrinas and Michelle Granados.  Our interactions with them throughout our stay, together with Manager Katherine Palomba, let us know that we were in a great customer service environment.

Thanks very much!

title: poor quality service
text:
The location of the hotel is very good being close to Times Square.

We spent 6 nights. in this hotel. Location is not bad although the road is noisy, with many works on adjacent buildings. Housekeeping forgot to clean the room for two consecutive days. We had obviously to complain (the hotel granted a limited discount). Also, no toilet paper being added, so after some days you have to go and ask for it...

At breakfast choice is very limited. Polystyrene plates and cups instead of stone. 
When the rooftop is open there is a long line at the lifts. Air conditioning in the room was very noisy and strong; not possible to dose it in a more balanced way.

title: Comfortable beds
text: We came for a business trip and usually stay at another hotel but it was booked. This was the only place we could get into, so we checked it out! The first impression wasn't great....lobby was packed and really no order to what was going on. Once we finally got checked in, we had to hunt down our bell hop for our bags, which we found our bags left in the middle of the lobby, but he was outside:/....Finally get to our room after about 30 minutes of waiting for the elevator. The were only running 2 of the 3, due to the 3rd one running people up to the club. (which you will see it all coming and going from there....came down our first night to go find some dinner and had to watch a girl puking in the lobby at 10pm! She was already that trashed from the club upstairs)  The elevators are the smallest ive ever seen....our bell hop couldn't fit in with us, so he had to wait for it to come back down for him. Our room was small, but very clean and cozy. The beds were excellent, which was perfect since we were working all day and walking a lot so we needed a good rest every night. We never tried the breakfast as we were always rushing out to work in the morning, but i'm pretty sure they offered a free breakfast. (we also didn't have time because we had to wait 20-30mins in the morning for the elevator to come get us and get back down because it stops at every single floor and people cram on there as if they can fit!)The hotel was a pretty good location, we were able to step out and grab whatever we needed at anytime. It is directly across from the port authority which has a starbucks inside if you don't want hotel coffee:) When we went to check out, we were told to call about 45 minutes in advance to get our vehicle, so we called about an hour before we needed it. It took over 2 hours to get it back to the hotel and then the guy just handed us the keys and walked away....all of our bags were sitting on the sidewalk, he didn't offer to help or anything. It was beyond rude..ive never seen anyone act that way at a hotel, especially there. So....we will not be staying there again, nor do i recommend it to anyone but if your in a pinch...the beds are nice and the rooms are clean, just stay on a lower floor so you can take the stair because the elevators are a nightmare and the staff is not very accommodating at all. (oh and if you need ice....the only location is the bottom level....good luck with that!)

title: Hôtel très correct
text: Nous avons séjourné dans cet hôtel pendant une semaine et nous avons particulièrement apprécié son emplacement a deux pas de Times Square .L'hotel à un bon rapport qualité/prix pour NY.Les chambres sont confortables bien qu'un peu petite , rien à redire en ce qui concerne la literie et la salle de bains ainsi que pour la propreté. Le petit déjeuner est correct et suffisant , il est vrai il vaut mieux y aller de bonne heure afin d'éviter la foule , mais cela est valable dans beaucoup d'hôtel aux US .

title: Furchtbar
text: Das Zimmer mit zwei Betten ist für mehr als 2 Personen nicht gedacht. Das einzig gute an dem Zimmer ist evtl. noch die Dusche. Die Klimaanlage ist viel zu laut und den Verkehr auf der Straße hört man auch. Haare auf der Bettdecke und dem Laken. Absolut ekelhaft! Keine Ablagemöglichkeit für Kosmetikartikel und fast keine Haken für Handtücher. Keinen Platz für Koffer. Personal auch nicht besonders freundlich. Die Wartezeiten am Frühstücksbuffet gehen auch nicht. Ich frage mich, wie man einen Speisesaal mit einer Kapazität von 74 Personen einrichten kann, wenn das Hotel über 30 Stockwerke hat.
