Da kommen wir schon zum nächsten Problem. Drei mini Fahrstühle funktionieren hier einfach nicht. Zu lange Wartezeiten und zu Stoßzeiten hält man erst in gefühlten 100 Stockwerken, bevor man dann in seinem eigenen Stock ist. Absolut nicht zu empfehlen das Hotel. Das einzig gute: man ist gleich am Times Square und ist relativ Nahe am Geschehen. Das wars aber auch schon.

title: Très moyen...
text: Nou avons passé une semaine en couple dans cet hôtel. Certes il est très bien situé mais plusieurs éléments se sont montrés contrariants : climatisation de la chambre très bruyante, salle de petit déjeuner petite (queue) et bruyante, avec service qui vous pousse à l'expédier pour céder la place. En revanche, service d'étage très bien.

title: Soggiorno da 4****
text:
Situato sulla 40th (tra l'8 e la 9th)nel cuore dei Manhattan,questo hotel meriterebbe senza alcun dubbio la quarta stella.La posizione è centralissima,5 minuti a piedi da Times Square,e c.a.10 dall'Empire...
Comode e sempre pulite le camere,con utili e funzionanti accessori.La vista dal 26°piano è da togliere il fiato...l'Empire,e gli altri grattacieli propio davanti a te...
Colazione ricca ed abbondante...forse è vero (come leggo da altre recensioni)un po' di confusione...ma nulla di particolarmente fastidioso.Il personale è gentilissimo,sempre sorridente e pronto ad ogni tua richiesta.L'idea dello Starbucks all'interno è fantastica!
Super Consigliato..

title: Soggiorno perfetto
text:
Diffidate da coloro che scrivono male di questo hotel. Secondo me è una location a cui non manca nulla.  Vicina a tutto,  colazione perfetta (forse poco varia, ma c vi sono hotel in cui non ti fanno mangiare nulla). Stanze pulite dotate di tutto. Forse è rumoroso il condizionatore ma forniscono i tappi... 
Non potevamo scegliere di meglio. 
Unica cosa non telefonate dalla camera... 5 minuti chiamata locale mi sono venuti 17$.

title: Viaggio di Nozze perfetto
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel i primi 10 giorni del mese di agosto in occasione del nostro viaggio di nozze a NY City. Appena arrivati siamo stati trattati benissimo dalla reception ( segnalo la squisita gentilezza della signorina Jasmine ).
Camera perfetta al 27 piano con vista su Time Square! Una favola!!  Servizio di pulizia ottimo e colazione buona ( c'e' di tutto mancano solo gli affettati).
Il personale in generale e' molto gentile ed anche se noi ci spiegavamo male con il nostro inglese maccheronico erano molto pazienti e facevano il possibile per accontentarci.
La posizione dell'hotel è ottima sulla 8 avenue 40 Street, a 10 minuti da time square e 2 minuti dalla metro,se noleggiare auto c'è la possibilità di parcheggiare nel garage dell' hotel al costo di 52 euro a notte ( prezzo in linea con i depositi di Manhattan ).
Segnalo inoltre la splendida skyroom raggiungibile con l'ascensore dove i cliente dell'hotel possono accedere in maniera gratuita consumazione a parte.
Rapporto qualità prezzo ottimo quindi posso solo ringraziare tutto lo staff del bellissimo Fairfield Manhattan!! :-)

title: Solo commenti positivi
text:
Hotel in una posizione ottima .
Zona tranquilla e sicura .
Pulizia eccellente .
Colazione internazionale curata nei dettagli .
Staff cordiale e disponibile ad ogni richiesta . 
Vista sull'empire state building . 
Dotato di terrazza panoramica dove fare degli aperitivi in compagnia

title: Fairfield Times Square Excellent service, poor breakfast
text:
Location is good being close to Times Square and subway.Room is small but nicely furnished. Staff was excellent and helpful, except for the staff at the breakfast. They were extemely rude, i understand they are trying to move people through quickly because of the crowd, but they have no social skill and are basically hostile. The breakfast has a few good item, toast, muffins, yogurt, juice, coffee. The cooked items, eggs, bacon, sausage are absolutely horrible and basically not edible.Maybe its because they have so many people to feed they have to get it out fast, there are long lines. 
Liquor store a few doors down had very questionable characters hanging out it front and one tried to start a little trouble but backed down.
The roof top bar seems to cater only people not from the hotel, which i don't get.
Again the staff (outside of the breakfast area) was excellent and responded immediately to extra requests, and was able to immediately help us when our limo to the airport cancelled on us at the last minute, they were able to get us a ride immediately for a little less than the limo cost.  
Overall,  nice place to stay, just avoid the eggs & sausage, and cross the street immediately leaving the front door
All in all I would stay there again

title: Great location and service!
text:
My wife and I were warmly welcomed by Jasmine who checked us in promptly. Our room was clean, quiet, and on the north side of the building so no direct sunlight heating the room up. The bed was comfy and the TV was great for watching the Olympics. There is a mini fridge for your own drinks and snacks.

The breakfast was included but we skipped it 2 of the 3 days we stayed at the hotel. The line-ups were just a little too long at 9:30 when we made our way downstairs. The food was as you would expect from a buffet: hot & quick so you can get on with your day. Lots of choice.

We took advantage of the Sky Lounge while were there and appreciated the skyline at night. Be aware the view is premium as are the prices at the bar. No table service either so be aware of the self serve rule.

Hotel staff were excellent but keep in mind, our room was serviced by housekeeping despite having a "Do Not Disturb" on the handle when we were out for the day.

title: MUY BUENA UBICACION, BONITAS VISTAS EN PLANTAS ALTAS
text:
Ubicado en la manzana de al lado de Madison Square Garden, en la West 33rd Street que es una de las calles que rodean al Empire State, a 5 minutos andando de Times Square, es decir, ubicación casi inmejorable. 
La atención es amable y la habitación incluye desayuno (recomendamos madrugar un poco para desayunar o habrá que hacer un poco de malabares para acceder a todos los productos).
Si quieren disfrutar más de las vistas, yo pediría habitaciones en plantas altas (también porque cuánto más alto, menos ruido de la calle llega). 
Las habitaciones son amplias para lo que es NY. y al estar al lado de Penn Station, si vienes en tren desde JFK es comodísimo.
La terraza de arriba ofrece muy bonitas vistas de NY tanto de día como de noche (aunque no esté el bar abierto se puede acceder a ella en determinadas horas).
En nuestra próxima visita repetiremos con seguridad.

title: Stayed Here For a Concert & Would Recommend It To Anyone!
text: I booked this hotel at the last minute (Monday for Thursday) because, I won tickets to a concert in Central Park Friday Morning. To Begin, Because I am a member of Marriott Rewards (Which is Free) I checked in on the Marriott app on Wednesday for Thursday and told them I would be there at 9:00 PM, When I arrived they had my room ready, keys done and all I needed to provide was a ID & The Last 4 Digits of my Credit Card & I was on my way to the room. When I arrived they gave us 2 bottles of water, then when I got to the room they gave us 2 more bottles and mints on the bed for FREE which Is a first. The staff was nice, there was always someone at the desk to greet you and Coffee was always available even when I left for Central Park at 4 AM. And the biggest plus was THERE IS ONLY 8 ROOMS ON EACH FLOOR!! Which made for a great nights sleep! The grounds were always clean, the fitness center was great but. the only 3 things I didn't like was 1. they had 3 elevators but, from 5:00 PM - 4:00 PM 1 of them was for the bar only and eventually made a Line in the lobby and a 10 minute wait to go down to the lobby. 2. The coffee didn't taste good but, I found out like most Marriott's they serve Starbucks (Yuck!) I just wish they would serve different brands. 3. I wished the Breakfast was served later because, by the time we got back from Central Park at 10:30 AM Breakfast had been over for 1 Hour so I missed it but, breakfast in NYC is a huge plus. I would stay here again and recommend the hotel especially you want to stay near Times Square (less than 2 blocks) or are leaving on a early bus or train from Port Authority Bus Terminal (40th Street Entrance located directly across the street!) or New York Penn Station (10 Blocks South).

title: Buena ubicación
text: El hotel está bien ubicado en wall street, metro cercano, buena cama, sólo el aire acondicionado hace mucho ruido, lo cual no me dejo dormir muy bien. La atención del personal fue buena, el desayuno fue bastante bueno. El hotel está cercano a la costa.

title: Perfect position but something to improve
text:
The hotel is located few minutes from Time square and with metro station in the same street. Rooms are small but nice and comfortable. I did not like we stayed 7 nights and the only change the sheets in the bed last day, and just because we asked for it twice...
I work in hotel and we change the sheets every three days.
The room rate was quite expensive but that is the average rate for an hotel in Manhattan. Moreover breakfast was included, even though there was no variety. They were proposing us everyday the same stuff. They definitely should improve it. Staff was quite nice. In general it was no bad at all, but next time I would rather try another hotel.

title: Friendly and Helpful Staff
text: I didn't read any reviews before picking this hotel. I was in NYC for work and usually stay in Marriott properties. The hotel was recently remodeled and quite stylish. The room was very nice. I had no issues at all here and found the staff to be very very friendly. There was one time the elevator was super packed going down to the lobby (I got on on the 20th floor) and some people were crabbing but come on, it's NYC EVERYTHING is crowded. Not sure what Marriott can do about that, space, all space is a premium. Other than that one time, I didn't have any congestion with the elevator. I didn't go to breakfast so can't comment. They got me a car to go to La Guardia, great price great driver. Would stay again. Leaving the hotel if you turn to the left and walk to the end of the block there is a great NY pizza place. $3 for 2 slices of cheese and 1 can of soda. Can't beat it. YUM! I bring my own noisemaker to sleep in any hotel. If you find noise a problem, NYC isn't for you so bring a noisemaker or download an app on your phone. Lots of sirens... :)

title: Excelente ubicación
text:
Como todos los hoteles Inn, es un hotel sin muchos servicios, apenas lo básico: hospedaje y desayuno, pero está muy bien ubicado. Casi todo se puede visitar a pié desde allí. 

La habitación estuvo bien, aunque muy pequeña, casi que no tuvimos espacio para las maletas. 

El desayuno es como los que les gustan a los estadounidenses, harina, harina y más y más harina con grasa y bebidas artificiales; pero por lo menos tuvimos desayuno, por la zona prácticamente ningún hotel lo incluye.

title: Friendly hotel
text: This has to be the first hotel I've ever stayed in that provides breakfast using plastic/polystyrene  crockery and cutlery!! Not really what you expect when paying over £300 per night. Apart from that the rooms were clean and it has a fabulous location for Times Square.

title: Convenient location, nice staff, clean & comfy, busy breakfast
text:
Could not be more conveniently located. For those arriving by bus, it's just a block or so from the front door of the Port Authority. We really wanted to avoid hauling luggage by cab or subway. And it's just steps to the 42nd St/PABT subway station (which is connected underground to the Times Square station), where you can catch just about any subway you could want in Manhattan.

Yes, the block outside is a mess - construction, some less-than-savory businesses, but we never felt unsafe. And as soon as you step inside, it's clean and quiet. Daily water bottles for all four of us were appreciated.

Our 14th-floor room was quiet (no street noise), clean, and well appointed. Free Wi-Fi, comfy beds, nice bathroom. Compris breakfast was busy, yes, but you can grab cereal, granola, yogurt, bananas and head back to the room if you don't mind missing the hotel pan of scrambled eggs, microwave bacon, or toast. We had no issues with waiting for elevators.

title: Great 1st visit to New York
text:
So glad I didn't believe the horror stories about this hotel.  I had absolutely no problem using the elevators, if anything was an issue with the elevator, it was the other rude hotel guest that jumped the line to try and get on the elevator.  No issue either with the elevator dedicated to the club, even was allowed to use it one night.  
Yes, the room was small but still no issues and we had a family of 4 staying in it.  We also stayed on the 8th floor and was not bothered by any street noise what so ever.

Over all a great experience all around!

title: Excelente ubicacion y servicio
text:
Visite junto con mi esposo e hijos adolescentes este hotel la ultima semana del mes de julio y nuestra experiencia fue muy grata.
Llegamos a hacer chek inn a las 4am y a pesar de que fue algo lento, el personal siempre fue atento.
Nuestra habitacion estaba en el piso 16, aunque reducida para 4 personas, cuenta con excelentes camas y almohadas, maquina de cafe, cafe Starbucks, agua embotellada sin costo y frigobar solo por si quieres conservar algo frio... buena limpieza y productos Paul Mitchell para consentirte en la ducha...el servicio de la habitacion siempre fue diario y puntual.
El hotel ofrece un desayuno todos los dias, con diferentes horarios, a partir de las 6am y hasta las 9:30am, el cual consta de pan, baggles, huevo, yogurt, cereal, fruta, etc. El cual te ayuda a sobrellevar la mañana de manera aceptable...para mi el cafe Starbucks fue lo mejor! Y el servicio del personal de servicio excelente.
Su ubicacion es perfecta para los turistas que desean visitar las principales atracciones de Times Square y Broadway...frente al hotel se encuentra una de las entradas a la Terminal de Autobuses de la Autoridad Portuaria, lo cual es perfecto para traslados en metro o autobús a algunos puntos de la ciudad y esta muy bien resguardada y segura...tambien se encuentra muy cerca de la estacion Penn Station. 
Para nuestra salida, el hotel nos consiguio un transporte seguro al aeropuerto.
Sin duda lo recomiendo ampliamente.

title: Se han apropiado del dinero de posibles incidentes
text: Me alegra je en este hotel entre el 2/6 y el 9/6 y luego entre el 11/6 y el 13/11. Al llegar nos cobraron un extra por posibles incidentes, de U$ 290 en la rivera instancia y de U$ 87 en la segunda. Al retirarnos del mismo nos explicaron que como no había habido ningún incidente se nos reintegraría el dinero en 72 hs hábiles. Desgraciadamente hasta la fecha no lo han hecho y ni siquiera han respondido a nuestras gestiones. Tiendo en mi poder toda la documenta que lo acredita. Es una ur un hotel de la cadena Marriot internacionalmente reconocida se comporte de esta manera con los clientes.

title: Overall Experience
text:
This is our 6th hotel in our 19 days vacation. On this trip alone, we have stayed at Hyatt Regency (LA), one Holiday Inn Express (Vancouver), one Hampton Inn (SFO), one Wingate Inn (Calgary). At NY, being a silver elite member of Marriott, you would think they would give you some credit. But when we arrived at around 4:30 pm on July 28, they had no room available. We had to wait. But somehow, the family next to us got a room immediately. The concierge (Hispanic young guy) was rude and unhelpful for options on shuttle or taxi. The breakfast area was very small. Not many sitting spaces. Long lines, regardless if it is 7am or 8am or 9am. And on our third morning, they were out of pancakes. They missed cleaning my room one day. Trash overflow and did not see security roaming the halls to control noise. Noisy neighbors past midnight daily. Rooms are small. Holiday Inn Express is better. By the way, I am also a IHG silver member with Holiday Inn.
I would never use this hotel again.

title: La mejor relación precio/valor
text: Buen servicio de habitaciones, nunca falla. Los jabones de cara y cuerpo, shampoo, acondicio ador y locion humectante son Paul Mitchell. El desayuno está incluído y es bueno pero termina muy temprano (9:30am), debería durar hasta las 10 am de lun a viernes ya que cuando se está de vacaciones nadie quiere madrugar. Hay un bar llamado Skay Room desde donde puedes ver la ciudad. La habitacion es confortable, la cama king, tiene peinadora, mesas de noche y un refrigerador ejecutivo y un pequeño closet. Cuando vuelva a Manhattan me quedaré aquí de nuevo

title: A Great Option When in NYC
text: I stayed overnight during a recent workday in NYC when severe weather shut down the Long Island Railroad.  The Fairfield Inn & Suites had availability when I checked at 745pm, and offered a great price.  I walked the short distance from Penn and was pleasantly surprised at how modern and well-equipped this hotel is.  The staff was welcoming and professional, and the rate included wifi and breakfast the following morning.  I typically stay at other hotels when in NYC, but will certainly consider this property for future visits.

title: Overnight stay.
text:
We had tickets to The Late Show with Steven Colbert.  Both my husband and I work in Manhattan and needed a place to stay because we were going to miss the last train home.  

The hotel is on the same street as the NY Port Authority Bus Terminal - on the southern side street.  The outside was typical of what you'd expect there - crowded - dirty - there was construction of a new building on that block - it was a typical July hot/smelly evening in my favorite city.  Once in the Lobby all that changed.  Nothing fancy - just clean and air conditioned. 

The room wasn't large but clean and well-kept.  All we really did was sleep and get up for work the next morning and shower.  Breakfast was the general hotel buffet with bagels and pastries, various hot and cold cereal, eggs and breakfast meat.  We got there early before most of the crowds.  The coffee did the trick and we were on our way.  

I'd definitely stay again if it is convenient to where we are if we need to spend another night in the City.

title: Buono
text:
Rapporto prezzo e servizi più che buono
Considerata la prima colazione inclusa che non è da poco, personale disponibile e gentile , camere pulite, e colazione abbondante .
Location ottima e vicinissima al centro di Manhattan , raggiungibile a piedi .
Di fronte stazione di autobus che portano dappertutto .

title: Good hotel in a great location to explore the city
text: Overall, a very nice hotel.  At first we were taken aback by the size of the rooms, a little small compared to other places we stayed, but it was a good value.  The only down side was breakfast, it was on plastic plates and hurry up and move out. Very little variety and stressful way to start your day

title: Hotel ótimo com boa localização e café da manhã
text: Hotel muito bem localizado, fica bem próximo à Times Square e o Port Authority fica bem na frente. Adorei o atendimento, todos os funcionários foram super gentis e receptivos (A Kimberlly, o Raymond e uma brasileira que eu não lembro o nome foram muito atenciosos!!). O quarto possui frigobar, o que facilitou muito! Sempre comprávamos algumas coisas pra deixar no quarto pra quando desse fome. Sobre o quarto, não é muito grande, mas atendeu às nossas necessidades. Eu amei e com certeza me hospedaria mais vezes, ótimo custo x benefício.

title: Excelente localização
text:
O hotel vale pela localização , em 2015 o preço estava mais compatível pois a região não é das melhores , porém para que visita NY pela primeira vez e não quer investir muito pode valer a pena.
Os quartos não são muito grandes, mas atendem para duas pessoas. O café da manhã incluso no preço é abundante e variado , porém é bom evitar o horário de pico.
Tem no hotel um terraço onde se faz festa no final de semana , isso atrapalha um pouco a circulação dos hóspedes pois um dos dois elevadores e utilizado para subir os frequentadores ao terraço.
A cama e super confortável e o banheiro razoável.

title: Nice hotel
text: This hotel is close to Times Square. It is a short walk to many attractions. The parking valets were fast and courteous. The breakfast area is small but the breakfast selection is nice and the food was good.

title: Very central with sky bar
text: Next to the Port Authority and close to Times Square makes this hotel a great place to reach up and down town. The hotel has a great sky bar where you also can be outside on a terrace. Breakfast was a little bit busy and the food is a bit fast. Rooms are ok and quiet for NY

title: Fantastic Location and Customer Service
text: We talked with Daniel on the phone before our arrival.  He had maps & city information ready when we got there at 9:30 AM.  Since it was well before check in time, no room was ready yet.  He tool our luggage so we could go out Touring.  He called us on our cell phone to tell us our room was ready..

title: aller plutôt a celui de la 33e
text: séjour en famille a quelques mois d'intervalles, nous avons pu tester les 2. c'est sans comparaison. dans celui ci le personnel est toujours pressé et ne fait aucun efforts pour nous comprendre alors que notre anglais n'est pas si mauvais. le soir l'hôtel est pris d'assaut par des bimbos et nous on fait la queue pour avoir un ascenseur . niveau chambre propre et joli bien qu'un peu petit pour une chambre familial mais vu le prix du m2 on comprend. pour le petit dej, il vaut mieux y aller très tôt, voir très très tôt sinon comme la salle est minuscule on a pas fini de faire la queue et/ou d'être séparer.

title: Great location and great stay!
text:
For a family trip, this was a great choice. The location close to the main subway lines was an easy walk..about 5 min walk. We walked to the subway and took the subway everywhere we were visiting. It was also a short walk, maybe 10 min to Times Square. Did not feel unsafe at any time (Times Square at night, in the subway, or anywhere-lots of police presence!)

The room was clean, and while we were expecting the small hotel room and corridors in NYC, it was bigger than other hotels we have stayed at in NYC. The hotel had a modern, urban decor throughout. Comfortable bed and good shower. 

The hotel had posted a sign of when peak traffic occurred at the breakfast buffet and we went during a non-peak time, which worked great for our schedule. We had no problems and the buffet was the standard fare, but when we left, there were many people looking for a place to sit (although there was a greeter to seat you?). Sum up: Go early for breakfast.

We drove into NYC and parking was a breeze at this hotel. We bought the parking with the room in a package, so we found value in the overall price paid (given that we were in NYC). Bellhop and parking staff were great looking after our baggage and car. 

There were only 3 or 4 elevators, so sometimes there was a little wait, but not too bad. The concierge was helpful with our direction questions and gave us a map and marked the way to the places we were visiting. Check in staff was friendly and helpful. Overall, we had a great stay.

title: Great Hotel!
text: Although the room was small it was very clean and the staff was absolutely fantastic! They were very helpful in finding nearby points of interest, including restaurants, and it seemed as if they couldn't do enough for us! We'd recommend the hotel to anyone who wold like to be in walking distance of both Times Square and the Javits Center, where we went every day to a convention.

title: Do NOT stay here!
text: They do not tell you when you check in...that if you are on an upper floor that there is a DISCO NIGHT CLUB above you. It vibrates your room until 4:00 AM!! When we complained at the front desk, we got a smirk with "yeah, there's a band up there." Ruined our vacation as we were kept awake all night. One evening a staff member locked the elevator we were on until he loaded 8 "ladies" headed for the club. They also have mandatory CARDS for the elevators which DID NOT WORK half of the time. Same with your room door...half the time you can't get in until you insert the card FIVE TIMES! Probably necessary security for NYC, especially considering the "clientele" surrounding the entrance to the "Club" every evening...but did they have to accept the low bid to produce the cards for them? Room cleaning crew and breakfast staff are excellent but front desk is a truck load of attitude...always acted as though we were interrupting their texting.

title: Excellent newly refurbished
text:
Very polite staff. We had a newly refurbished room. Rooms are small (as in most Manhattan hotels) but enough for luggage . Beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was also clean and well appointed . Room cleaning was done regularly and to a high standard. Room has a free electronic safe . Hotels offers a free breakfast ... bagel cereals some fruit bread preserves eggs bacon . Coffee available downstairs at all times.
Located opposite the main bus station which was very convenient for the bus to  Jersey gardens  outlet mall . Times square was 5 minute walk. Lots of places to eat within less than 5 minutes away.

title: Yuck
text: There are so many hotels in New York near Times Square. There is no reason to stay at this one. It's on a smelly, crowded, ugly street. The room was so uncomfortably small. The decor was dated. The heating and a/c unit was noisy and never got the room to a comfortable temperature. The bathroom was very dated. The view was terrible. There was a line down the hall at 8:30 a.m. for the free breakfast, which wasn't good. The lobby was loud. The feel overall is too tight for comfort. We stayed at a different hotel the first night of our stay. We went from bliss there (I wrote a glowing review of the Renaissance New York Hotel 57 at https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g60763-d575732-Reviews-Renaissance_New_York_Hotel_57-New_York_City_New_York.html), to terribly uncomfortable here. We checked out after the first sleepless night, even though the second night was non-refundable. Enough said.

title: Wonderful stay, great price! Other reviews are a little too critical.
text:
Long review, but other people got me nervous for no reason, and I hope this helps to alleviate some concerned travelers staying here in the future. The price is really great for the area and it was an overall great stay! Many thanks to Kim, she really knows how to deliver customer service!

Kim checked us in and cheerfully accommodated us with the requested early check-in and high floor room. This was especially important to my fiancé and myself, because we were in town for a wedding, but she is in full study mode for an upcoming licensure exam and needed the extra few hours to study. I understand that these requests can't always be accommodated, but thankfully it was able to happen for us and the courtesy and kindness with which Kim did it made our day and really put this hotel at the top for us. 

I was somewhat nervous to stay here given some of the reviews that I had read. I want to ease the mind of those of you who may be in the same boat:
1.) ELEVATORS: Yes, there's only 3 elevators and yes it may take a while (2-5 min) to get up to a high floor room, but this is ONLY during peak hours and remember you're staying in a fairly tall building with a lot of people, it's to be expected. 
2.) ROOM SIZE: Yes, the hotel rooms are smaller than what most of us are used too, but again, you're staying in NYC, so unless you're paying a premium at a Ritz for a suite, I think we can all agree that a nice bed, desk, armoire (for a closet), sink, and walk-in shower are more than enough. 
3.) BREAKFAST LINES: Yes, the breakfast area gets really busy around 7:15-7:30a, but the potential business of the breakfast area was CLEARLY advertised in the elevator. So, we got up at 6:45a and beat the rush. Problem solved. 
4.) BREAKFAST: Yes, you serve your own breakfast on plastic plates with plastic utensils, but if this is a problem for you, I really don't know what to say to you. I thought the food was fine enough, the area was clean, the ladies manning the door and picking up plates were efficient and doing their jobs well. 
5.) NOISE: There's potential for noise from the street and from the SkyDeck bar, in our case more likely from the bar, and Kim warned us and let us know to call down if it became a problem, but we were fine through the night. Only noise was from some neighbors with small children, but it was no problem at all. 
6.) ROOM: The room was recently renovated (per a card left in our room) and it was nice and clean with no problems to speak of. 
7.) CITY VIEW: We paid a little extra for a "city view" room and did indeed have a room facing away from the Port Authority terminal and towards lower Manhattan, beautiful! 
8.) CONCERNS BEING CLOSE TO PORT AUTHORITY: Yes, the area is right next to the Port Authority terminal and there's potential for "unsavory characters", of which there were some, but again, you're staying in NYC, there's interesting people everywhere, get over it, look after your stuff, don't get in trouble, and just enjoy your stay. 
9.) TRANSPORTATION: The subway entrance for the Port Authority terminal for select trains, I think only the 2 and 3, were right next to the Walgreens only a 2 min walk away. So convenient.

title: Bella Estancia
text:
Este hotel esta en buena ubicación cerca de Times Square, la 5ta. avenida, Biblioteca Pública muchos lugares de interes, la habitación en piso 27 excelente vista me gusto las camas muy comodas y habitación amplia, todos los dias dejan agua y cafe todo limpio y bien cuidado, el wifi excelente llega muy bien, el desayuno si le falta variedad siempre lo mismo pero a nada no es malo las personas que atienden muy atentas, el personal de recepción tambien todos muy atentos.
Tiene Happy Hour en el piso 32 se llama Sky Room es un bar tranquilo con una vista maravillosa y unos tragos riquisimos vale la pena visitarlo.
Regresare a este hotel nuevamente.

title: Ótima localização
text:
A localização é excelente! Fica em frente a estação de metro e de ônibus, que leva inclusive para o Outlet. Muito próximo da Times Square e de várias atrações. Próximo também do NY Times. 
O quarto é pequeno e há algum barulho em decorrência da estação de ônibus. No entanto, é limpo e confortável.
O café da manhã é bastante razoável, com iogurte, sucos, pães, etc.

title: Amazing location, average rooms, and
text: I stayed here for business in the city. The room had all the basics of a Fairfield Inn and nothing more. Location is fantastic and the bus terminal across the street was very convenient.  I did have one issue, but the front desk staff offered some Marriott Points which made up for the problem.  I love a good view and I always request high floors. The view from my room was not good, just the parking for the bus terminal.

title: Location is great, but.....?
text: We stayed her because it was close to Jacob Javits conference center, where we were exhibiting. Check in was efficient, rooms were ok for New York, lobby very small, breakfast was very crowded, with people lining up if one were to come after 7.30 am. I had problems with the door as the keys would not work well, had to get keys recoded several times and to come down 26 floors each time was painful. The billing system needs some improvement, as the hotel billed me incorrectly. The price for is average hotel was high. Not the best of my stays at a Marriott property.

title: Atendimento chamou a atenção
text: Muito bom o hotel! Belo café da manhã! Café Starbucks. Atendimento chamou a atenção, sempre muito gentis. Deu problema no meu cartão de acesso ao quarto várias vezes e eles sempre prontos para ajudar. Tinha computador impressora a disposição para impressão do bilhete aéreo-check-in. Gostei da localização, ao lado de uma estação do metro e outras bem próximas, uma quadra acima e ao mesmo tempo não ficava na muvuca da Times Square

title: Great location and service
text:
Though 40th St isn't the most picturesque of the Times Square/Hell's Kitchen area, the location can't be beat. Just a couple blocks from the theaters and all the great haunts of 9th Avenue. 
The front desk was great about getting me a room that met my needs (wants really). Ray in the breakfast area was a consummate professional in a role that is usually filled by people who couldn't care less about customer service. Thank you, Ray!

title: Excelente relación calidad / precio
text: Me encantó este hotel. La habitación que me dieron era muy amplia con una cama king supremamente cómoda. El baño amplio y el equipo de camareras mantenía todo muy bien cuidado. El desayuno es muy variado y es auto-servicio. Mantienen cafe durante el día para quienes desean llevar antes de salir del hotel. Esta muy bien ubicado, cerca de Port Authority y del Times Square. En el ultimo piso tienen un bar con una vista increíble que definitivamente hay que disfrutar junto a unos drinks!

title: Ottima Location
text:
Siamo stati a NYC a giugno 2016: l'albergo é a quattro passi da Times Square, vicino fermata Subway è molto comodo per spostarsi a piedi. Ho trovato il personale molto cordiale: sia alla reception che nella sala colazione ed anche le signore dei servizi al piano erano molto carine (ho chiesto degli asciugamani in più e me li hanno portati subito).
Unico neo il condizionatore in camera rumoroso: noi l'abbiamo spento - ma il caldo era poco - , però a luglio/agosto potrebbe essere un problema.

title: Excellent location, and great staff!
text:
My wife and I stayed here for a week while visiting Manhattan and attending some shows.  Location, location, location.  You can access the 42nd St/Times Square subway stations during most hours without ever crossing a street (SW corner of 40th & 8th Ave by Chase Bank, note, a bit dingy and not obvious as it's a building entrance), and other hours by crossing one street.  The Port Authority Bus Terminal is literally across the street, which also has some food court type eating and a Starbucks.  We were able to easily walk to two shows, "Lion King" and "Beautiful," and went to Radio City Music Hall with just a couple of subway stops.

The very small breakfast area is a picture of efficiency.  While it's unusual to have a "Wait to be Seated" queue at a hotel breakfast area, the ladies who run the small dining area know how to churn people through - just expect that you will typically have some folks sitting next to you.

The SkyBar is quite the place, with a lot of folks really decked out for the evening, and actually has an outside velvet rope on the weekends.

We did encounter a couple of issues during our stay, but the staff was quick to apologize, try to change it, and throw in some Marriott Reward Points for the problem.  Now that's the way you take care of customers!

We would definitely stay here again.

title: Boa opção
text: O atendimento do hotel é excelente, a maioria dos atendentes falam espanhol também, no que facilita e muito a comunicação, e são extremamente atenciosos. O quarto achei pequeno para a solicitação feita para 3 pessoas, mas atendeu nossas necessidades durante os 10 dias. A localização é boa, em frente ao Port Authority e entradas de metrô, a apenas algumas quadras da Broadway, times square e demais atrações. O café da manhã é bem fraco, sem variedades. Uma boa é o chá, café e chocolate quente sempre a disposição, a água em garrafinhas de 500ml não são cobradas, e tem um computador com internet e impressora a disposição.

title: Pleasant stay for a quick Broadway visit.
text:
My wife and I came down on the train for an overnight stay to see a show.  It was a hot day and, because of some health issues, I have to travel with some "portable" oxygen tanks.  Because we were on the train, we had to keep them in two large duffel bags.  Due to the rush hour traffic and being on the wrong end of the one-way of 40th St, we walked the block over from 8th. We must have been a sight coming in from the heat.  

We were greeted by Jasmin and Brian at the front desk and handed a bottle of water. Just what the doctor ordered.  In a matter of minutes we were in our room. It could not have gone smoother.  After a rough day of travel, sometimes a smile and a bottle of water at the right time can really turn things around.

We didn't spend a lot of time in the room, due to our tight schedule, but  it was very comfortable and well appointed.  It was recently done over and was in great shape.  The design is modern but not achingly so. Contemporary, not futuristic.

We had a drink in the bar after the play ("Long Day's Journey Into Night"! How could you not have a drink! Jeez!).  Very humble but the bartender was very friendly and it fit the bill.

All in all, a very enjoyable, if brief, stay.

title: Always liked this property...now it is at the TOP of my list thanks to Michelle!
text: I have to give a huge shout-out to Michelle at the Fairfield Inn Times Square New York.  I had a problem purchasing additional points for my stay.  Michelle not only pro-actively called the points desk, and patiently tried several solutions, but when the problem couldn't be resolved, she talked to the manager and secured a rate that more than made up for my troubles.  She never doubted my claim and was above and beyond in being both professional and polite.  My faith in Marriott has once again been restored. This hotel is definitely a "10".  Michelle, sorry, you're not  a "10"....you're a "100'!!  Give her some praise, and a raise, Marriott!!

title: Awesome service by Sam the do0r man
text:
Just wanted to say the Sam( the door chap for the Fairmont Inn Hotel times square)  is amazing and went they extra mile for my family. He made us feel welcome and nothing was too much trouble
He has set a great example of customer service !
all the best Sam

title: Great location
text: The hotel is a typical small footprint NYC hotel - 6 rooms per floor.  But, its a really tall building with a well lit, well appointed interior and friendly staff.  Breakfast is free but the typical scrambled eggs, bacon and muffins offering.  The top floor is a nightclub.  Don't be fooled; the dress code states "business casual" but the people who go dress to the nines!  It's one of the places to be in the Big Apple.  But, most importantly, the room is accommodating and quiet comfortable.

title: Clean and modern hotel
text:
This is one of the best hotels my wife and I have stayed in. She searched for a hotel for our recent Father's Day weekend trip, looking specifically for hotels that earned high marks for cleanliness. This hotel is clean and modern. The staff is friendly and accommodating. They situated us in a room near the elevator, but we never heard it, or our neighbors. The hotel served a wide variety of food options for breakfast (included in the price) -- more than any other hotel I can recall staying in.

It was a hot day, and when we checked out, one of the staff ran over with cold bottled water for our trip. 

We enthusiastically recommend the Fairfield Inn.

title: Wow!
text: The surrounding area is in transition with lots of construction activity around the hotel.  It's still an ideal location in a short walking distance from the theatre district.  The staff are the best and went over and above to make our trip enjoyable, comfortable and memorable.  They even delivered birthday cupcakes  directly to our room for my daughter's 10 birthday.  How the front desk clerk remembered this is beyond me.  It really touched us.

title: Nice hotel
text:
Nice clean newly refreshed room. 
The tv was exchanged to a lager one during our stay. 
Comfortable beds.
Well functioning internet. 
Good location close to almost everything. Breakfast ok, but the location for the breakfast became crowded most mornings.

title: Staff and the location were great!
text: The friendliness and competence of the staff made our trip a great success! Concierge Karen got us exceptionally good tickets to two Broadway shows, suggested great restaurants (one we went to 3 times!) and helped us navigate the subway. She went above and beyond making sure we had a great time. The front desk staff were always cheerful as well as every other hotel employee we encountered. The room size was a bit tight and the bath could use some hooks and counter space, but hey, it's Times Square!

title: Fun trip
text:
Great hotel for the price in New York City, Near everything, walking distance to Broadway, Madison Square Garden. Great shopping. Room was comfortable. Very friendly and accommodating staff.
Will stay again.

title: 2-week Manhattan Visit
text: Considering the location and the price, this visit was very successful. The location was very convenient for everything we wanted to do including the Javits Center (NY2016 Stamp Show); the subway; independent, gluten-free restaurants; and walking, boat, and bus tours of Manhattan. The daily breakfast was a great value. The staff was excellent, couldn't have been better. The refrigerator was very convenient, quiet, and hidden in an end table.The newly refurnished room left a little to be desired: leaky shower door (not a good design plus not aligned properly), and not nearly enough hooks for hanging towels and clothes. If I ever make a similar trip, I will look for a room with a lounge chair.

title: Great location and very pleasant stay for 2 nights.
text: Price was right and great location.  Walking distance to Times Square, Central Park, Broadway and many great restaurants.  Staff was friendly….. Joy in particular at front desk gave us a great room since it was my first time to NYC.  Rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable.

title: One night stay
text: Though I never really left the hotel, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful including giving us a late checkout while I waited for someone to pick us up. Breakfast was fine; beds comfortable; used some Mariott miles

title: Great Anniversary Weekend Visit
text: We have visited this hotel several times before and chose it to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary last weekend.  The location is very convenient in the theatre district and we have always been well treated at the hotel,  This time was just as good as before.  The hotel has a boutique quality to it and the hospitality is very friendly.  Our room was recently updated and gave off a warm relaxing feeling.  We mentioned the occasion of our visit and the service staff went out of their way to make sure we were well cared for.  The facility isn't a full service property like larger hotels in the area and the breakfast experience can be crowded and bustling given the space, but the food got us off to a good start each morning.  The dining area becomes converted to a small bar for evenings and we had a very nice nightcap experience one evening.  All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and plan to return again in the future.

title: Great weekend in NYC
text: My husband and I planned an anniversary trip to NYC and found this Fairfield Inn centrally located in the area we were looking for. From the time we arrived to when we left, the staff was great and the location was better then we anticipated. Easy access to the subway, walked to Broadway shows, and plenty of restaurants to choose from. Loved the breakfast and the staff was very helpful during their rush times.

title: OK tourist hotel near to times square
text: Usually stay in a Hilton chain but got a good rate here when everything else was jacked up. I usually don't like to stay in times square. I couldn't face breakfast here it was a complete tourist trap with kids running around everywhere. Of course that's not a bad thing, I just wasn't in the mood. It also didn't look very good. Plastic plates, rubbery scramble egg etc. I didn't see any oatmeal. The room as OK, but noisy. Given it's location. Couple next door were having a lot of fun pretty late in the evening ... if you get my drift. Gym was closed so I had to use the one next door at the four points. That was a bit of a hassle because of course I couldn't hook into their wifi to listen to music.

title: Excellent facilities
text: This is a city centre hotel so is obviously standard in its appearance and decor. All facilities were excellent - great bed, good TV,  good shower and bath and all clean. We were very comfortable during our stay. Breakfast was fine, help yourself buffet and lots to choose from - eggs, cereal, pretty packed fruit salad and porridge. Located near to great bars and restaurants in Hello Kitchen.

title: "Ótima localização"
text: Hotel bem localizado, próximo a Times Square com café da manhã excelente. O atendimento da recepção não deixou a desejar. Assim que chegamos, a recepcionista informou que o "check-in" seria às 16h mas que poderia antecipar para às 13h. As entregas de encomendas sempre foram informadas pela secretária eletrônica do quarto ou no momento de nossa chegada ao hotel. Para adiantar o "check-in" com a companhia aérea e imprimir o "boarding pass" pudemos utilizar o próprio computador do hotel. O serviço de concierge também foi muito útil e prestativo.

title: Excellent location and friendly staff
text: We were in NY for only three days, this hotel was in a perfect location. One block from the hop on hop off bus, and three blocks from the theatre and Times Square. And across the street from the bus station, so we only had to cross the street to catch our bus to Washington. Rooms are not huge, but fine. Breakfast is really nice and most of all the staff is very friendly. The concierge pointed us to a lovely place for dinner.

title: Perfect lodging and location for a weekend trip
text: Definitely a great hotel and great location. I booked this hotel for a 80th birthday trip with my mom. The hotel room was small (as we expected for NYC), but clean and comfortable. I should note that we had a king bed room, and while there was a chair at the desk, there wasn't another chair in the room. Thus, for relaxing in the room and watching TV, we had to sit on the bed. This was fine with us as we really didn't spend much time in the room anyway. We had an upper floor (27th floor of 32 total) and didn't notice the traffic noise at all - I think that could be an issue with the lower rooms. There were 3 elevators, and wait time wasn't an issue during our stay. Breakfast is provided and is the typical continental style - assorted cereal, yogurt, breads, eggs, bacon, juice, etc. The seating area can get busy, but the staff works hard to seat people in an orderly fashion. We never had to wait, but also went earlier in the morning (as the staff had warned that wait time was the worst in the later part of the morning). The hotel is within easy walking distance to the theater district and times square - my 80 year old mother is quite fit, but definitely had no problem walking to our tours or theater. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Great Overall Experience
text:
This was my first time staying at this Fairfield, but the experience was one of the best I've had in hundreds of hotel stays. Jose M was great, he was friendly, helpful and I could tell he wanted my stay to be the best it could be. The check in was smooth and efficient and Jose was there in the morning remembering my name and asking how the night was.

Kimberly went above and beyond, I left my cellphone in the cab on my way out of town and she was able to track it down and get it back to me. It would have been easy to give up, but Kim didn't and it was very much appreciated. 

The rooms were clean and current and offered a great view. 

I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Wonderful Hotel!!!
text: Stayed here at the Fairfield Inn and Suites and absolutely love it. I lucked up on this beauty because when I made the reservation I was supposed to be staying at another location. Upon arriving at the hotel I realized that I was in the wrong place but it seem to be at the right time. The staff there was helpful, wonderful and just an overall joy to be around!!! When I checked in they made me feel special because they gave me, my wife,and her cousin a bottle of water and also gave me my own personalized candy bar. I know that may not sound like much to many but to me it made me happy. The room was a pretty nice size for it being located in the Time Square area!! The bed felt like I had just laid down on a cloud!! The breakfast was great and it made my stay worth while!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the midtown area because it close to all the tourist spots and I got my bang for my buck!!! Again thank you to the staff!!

title: Excelente
text: Lo recomiendo 100%, desde el ingreso con personal que habla español muy cordial y amable, personal de aseo y restaurant muy amables también, desayuno impecable, internet muy bien, por cortesía del hotel tienes las 24 horas disponibilidad de té, café o chocolate caliente sin costo adicional, ubicación espectacular, casi todo cerca y caminable. ¡Muchas gracias por todo!

title: Buena relación calidad/precio
text: Este hotel está bastante cerca de los sitios emblemáticos de Nueva York. Times Square, Biblioteca Pública y Empire a 10 min. andando aproximadamente. Habitación para tres amplia y limpia. Desayuno suficiente, café todo el día gratis, wifi buena y gratis. Aunque el entorno es bastante ruidoso al estar al lado de la estación de autobuses, dentro del hotel no se nota.

title: Great Location, Awful Check in
text: Okay this is my 2nd time staying here. The location is perfect right in Times Square and near everything. The lobby is small like with 2 elevators with the 3rd elevator exclusively for the club rooftop patio patrons. Check in time was 4pm. We came there 5pm and the line up was horrid right out the hotel door and against the wall. We waited 1.5-2hours in that god awful line. We went straight to front desk if they could hold our luggage and come back after they said you gotta wait in the check in line. Upon finally getting to the front desk to check in. The staff were rushing but did delivery good customer service and apologized for the wait. Our room was ready and everything upon leaving check in area the elevators themselves had a nice 1 hour line up. The elevators are very tiny can only fit 3-5 people with luggage. We did not reach our room till 8-830pm. The room was very nice the Refresh newly renoved rooms definetly delivered. The Room although small to fit 2 Queen Beds were comfy and the pillows were soft and very comfy like. The Bathroom with Shower as nice amazing water pressure. The Sink with no counter space not liked but ok. The Room was good we enjoyed the room stay but did not enjoy the elevator hotel. We opted for stairs instead going from the 24th floor down was not fun. Other guests took stairs with us and complained they waited 30 minutes and still no elevator going down. So i would imagine going back up would take forever. So our entire stay we did stairs. Upon mentioning to front desk they couldn't help us just said "OH, were overbooked" but upon checking website if i could book rooms for that same day it showed lots of availability. We wasted so much time at this hotel going up and down. I would now not choose this hotel for any more future stays. Check in was god awful and those stairs i still have nightmares about them leaves a bad taste in my mouth. Do not stay here you will definetly waste half your day running around!!!!

title: Great Weekend Getaway Spot!!!
text: The location is within walking distance to all the major attractions. Kimberly at the front desk could not have been any nicer. The elevators are small as well as the rooms, but this is NYC. The hotel has been newly renovated and is bright and clean. Free WiFi and Starbucks coffee. Breakfast in the morning was good. Get there early because it does get crowded. We will definitely stay here again!

title: great location, easy but busy breakfast, rooms are nice and perhaps even little bigger than can be expected in NYC
text: Great location as you would and should expect for a location close to Times Square. Breakfast is easy and expect the traditional items. Breakfast area gets very busy but trays are available for taking items to your room. Serves Starbucks coffee. Rooms are nice and perhaps even little bigger than can be expected in NYC. In fact we had a baby crib placed in the room with no issue at all.

title: Nice hotel on a street that doesn't make you feel it should be there
text:
West 40th Street between 8th and 9th avenues is not the most inviting street. Port Authority bus station is on the North side of the street and the Fairfield and Sheraton Four Points are on the South side directly across. I needed a hotel a bit farther uptown that 33rd street and this location seemed perfect. 

Head out the front door of the hotel, take a left down to 9th Avenue, take a right and walk about six blocks North and you'll hit restaurant row- pretty much any type of food or bar can be found on 9th in the mid-40's to 50's. It's a great area to find some place to eat that isn't slammed with Times Square tourists and traffic. 

The hotel is very nice- bed was awesome and the shower was hot fast and strong. Very clean and internet free wi-fi was easy to access and didn't slow down.

The lobby is designed oddly with a few pillars smack in the middle of the busiest foot traffic areas so it can become clogged with people because of them quite easily.

I'd stay there again as the location is perfect and the rooms are nice.

title: Easy option with the Family
text: We had booked a room with 2 beds for our family, two adults two kids. Because of remodeling we were put in two rooms.  I was initially concerned about being separated,  but we were right next door.  We all had a fantastic stay! Parents had tranquility and the kids felt independent. The location is down a side street, so the street noise was minimal.  The proximity to things was great, we ended up walking most places so we really saved on cab fare. They put a sign up about howhat breakfast crowds will be and it is right on the mark. I went down alone for coffee at 7 and it was practically empty on a Sunday morning,  when I returned with the family at 8:30 it was packed! Go early. The staff were very helpful and friendly.  We had requested extra pillows and even though our room was changed we did have 2 extra pillows waiting for us. Our girls room was a usual room but I think my room was one of the recently remodeled one. The bathroom was amazing,  it was like a spa shower. So much so that our youngest insisted on showering in our shower.

title: Rooftop vulgaire Vigile très grossiers
text: Famille de 5 Adultes , impossible de pouvoir accéder au Rooftop ... LES VIGILES préfères les femmes  vulgaires ...vigiles très grossiers , nous avons été éconduits .. alors que  nous avons séjourné au Fairfield Inn pendant 7 nuits...nous n'avons pas pu entrer ,  alors que nous sommes allés plusieurs fois dans des Rooftop beaucoup plus sélect .Très déçu de l'accueil..

title: Excelente hospedagem!
text: Hotel muito bom, limpo, confortável, com um ex-ce-len-te café da manhã - apesar de não muito variado - mas, por ser NY, é ótimo! A localização também é boa para quem vai ao evento do US Open, a estação em frente ao hotel te leva direto às quadras. Em frente ao local do café da manhã tem um mini lounge com dois computadores (pouco para o hotel). Atendentes prestativos mas não falam português.

title: fairfield in Times square
text:
La zona en la que está es un poco fea por afuera . Muchos homeless en la cuadra y por enfrente la parte posterior dela Port Authority (terminal de omnibus)
estás a un toque de todo . a pasos de Timessquare.
lo que nos sucedió es que 2 días sin INTERNET. Sin wifi e incomunicados con nuestros afectos.
El desayunador tenías que hacer cola , rápida, y cuando llegabas tarde algunos alimentos  ya no había y no se reponía.
el Sky Room lindo chiquito.
la habitación bien piso 22 .

title: Lo aconsejo
text:
Excelente ubicación en Time Square Con Desayuno incluido.
No perderse de caminar por el puente de Brooklyn.  Un rato antes de anochecer
Todo una gran aventura. 
Museos Central Park caminar caminar mucho
Recomiendo sacar el metropas, es por 7 días.

title: Best Option In The City
text: I did a lot of research on hotels in New York City.  This is the best central location with the best price.  The hotel has been recently remodeled.  Rooms were nice and very clean.  A big perk is they have a very nice free breakfast bar with excellent choices.  The staff of the hotel was very friendly and helpful.

title: Dirty location
text: Just spent 4 nights here and very disappointed we were on the 5th floor the noisy from the bus station and traffic woke us up around 4.00 am everyday. The room was clean but we should have realised there was a problem when we spotted the ear plugs next to the bed. West 40th street is dirty and lots of drunks hanging around. The deluxe breakfast is situated in a room which is more like a corridor and all on plastic plates with plastic knives and forks. Cheap 3star at 5star prices

title: Fairfield is fantastic !!!
text: Great place to stay.  Conveniently located near subway, this hotel is quiet and has a wonderful breakfast included in the rate.  I would highly recommend this property because it is close to everything and feels like a safe, homey place to stay.  It is not overrun with noisy tour groups and the staff goes the extra mile to make the hotel stay nice.

title: Good value, good location!
text: Very nice rooms - clean and quiet.  Good breakfast included in the morning as well!  Great location very close to Times Square and short walk to 5th Ave and the Empire State Bldg.  My room here was cheaper than another "chain" I stayed at in New Jersey! Good value for the location and the staff was very accommodating.  Very pleasant experience!  Would definitely stay there again!

title: Finishing renovation-But don't let this deter you!  Stay here!
text: Very pleasant receptionists.  Concierge held our baggage until late afternoon check in.  Small lobby but close to subway.  They were still renovating so 2-3 elevators were available.  There is coffee/tea available 24-7.  The breakfast is included and they seat people to use space efficiently.  I did see staff assist an elderly disabled woman.  The rooms were neat, clean, newly renovated wood with special lighting on the bed.  The room had a safe, free bottled water, in room hidden refrigerator.  Free Wi-fi, workout room.  Nice bathroom!  New beds/sheets, they even provide ear plugs to reduce noise, but not needed-double glass.  Only draw back is you have to call for ice to be delivered-no biggie.  I would highly recommend this place!

title: Well located and clean good value for the money
text: The Fairfield that I stayed at near times square was convenient to both entertainment and Midtown. The desk service was friendly and helpful. They did a good job managing the crowds at breakfast which is free and the beds were very comfortable. For what it is - not posh but clean - it is a good hotel and good value for the money. Mostly appear to be tourists from Europe. I  recommend it if you're a tourist looking for a hotel that provides a comfortable stay, does not have any bad surprises and is convenient

title: Nice visit
text: We were four in the same room and it was quite small but we managed two nights very well. Room (and the whole hotel) was clean and we get by asking separate blankets. Location was easy to us, the bus station were opposite of the hotel and Times Square very near. Although for a longer period I would prefer the other location. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We managed to lock the bathroom door from the outside and and the maintenance came immediately. Breakfast was good and there was the healthier products too. Wifi worked well in the room.

title: Linn
text: Rummet kändes rent och fräscht men lite mörkt. För mjuk säng. Vad man förväntar sig av en kedja i den klassen. Frukosten var ok. Typiskt amerikanskt med endast engångsartiklar. Hissen var otroligt långsam och ibland kunde man få vänta upp till 10min från att man tryckt på knappen till den var framme hos dig. Men de höll på att bygga om så hade överseende. Men överlag helt OK hotell men närhet till Times square och tunnelbanestation.

title: Pas de Wi-Fi!!!
text: Nous avons été 24 heures sans wi-fi alors que nous étions là pour le travail ! Pas très commode. De plus, nous avons attendu notre voiture pendant une heure au moment de quitter. Mais la chambre était confortable.

title: It's ok...
text:
I booked two rooms in this hotel for a 5 night stay starting on the 30th April. We arrived to the hotel around 14:15 and we were told that if we came back at 16:00 our two rooms would be ready on the same floor, perfect! They took our bags so that we could go and get something to eat until 16:00, again, perfect. 

We arrived back to the hotel at 16:00 to be told that it'll be "a few minutes" for our rooms to be ready. 20 minutes later and no sign of the rooms. We went back up to the reception and we were told that because of our "very specific request of two rooms on the same floor" it would take longer to get them. This was NOT a specific request, we were told by a girl on reception that this is what they were doing for us. We did not once request two rooms on the same floor.  Anyway, another 30 minutes passed, still no sign of a room. 20 minutes passed and I went back out to check and she said she'd call housekeeping to check and she would come to us in the bar and let us know. 10minutes went by and one of the receptionists came in to offer us ONE of the rooms, the other wasn't ready. Eventually at 18:00 we had both rooms. Two hours AFTER we were told to come back.

One room was for 2 people and the other for 4. The 2 person room was fine. However, the 4 person room was nothing short of a disgrace. How it is advertised as a 4 person room is beyond me. There was coffee facilities for 2 people, water for 2 people, ear plugs for 2 people and 2 chocolates on one of the beds. It was set up for 2 people, not 4. The only thing for 4 people was the 4 bath towels in the bathroom. In saying all of that, the room/bathroom were clean and cleaned every day.

Onto the breakfast room, what an absolutely laughable set-up. A narky, rude and shouting hostess  ordering the guests around the breakfast room. You have "wait to be seated" and you will be shouted at from across the room if you do not abide by these rules. Literally everyone working in the breakfast room was extremely rude. On our last morning, we literally had just put our last bite of breakfast into our mouths and the hostess lady was over to ask if we could "move" and "let the other guests have a seat"... Also, careful around the toasters, saw a few ants taking their mid-morning stroll around the edges!!!

Overall would not recommend this hotel to anyone.  Every single employee we encountered during our stay were extremely rude except two of the concierge boys and the guy in the bar in the evenings.

title: Staff pessimo e incompetente
text: Abbiamo soggiornato per sei notti in questo Hotel. L Hotel è in una posizione strategica e le camere sono nella norma di un Hotel tre stelle. Le camere sono abbastanza pulite e la colazione buona anche se abbastanza affollata la sala breakfast. Gli ascensori, solo tre per circa 30 piani, in orario di punta sono sovraffollati e per arrivare alle stanze nei piani alti o scendere ci vuole del tempo. Nota negativa e non da poco lo staff inadeguato e per niente professionale; al momento del check in lo staff presente nella reception richiedeva subito la carta di credito e senza avvertire il cliente autorizzava il pagamento anticipato del soggiorno. Il problema è che ci accorgevamo grazie all arrivo di una mail che i pagamenti erano errati. Infatti una camera veniva pagata due volte!!! Subito avvisavamo la reception che annullava una transazione. Il problema che alla banca non risultava il pagamento negato e questo denaro è stato prelevato dal mio conto. Ma io dico è possibile fare errori di questo tipo????? Fortunatamente il mio servizio di carta di credito mi ha permesso di notare tale anomalia prima di lasciare l albergo però con altre carte di credito non avresti la possibilità di accorgerti in tempo di certi errori!! Inoltre subito dopo la transazione non ci veniva rilasciata alcuna ricevuta ne' ci veniva detto quanto pagato come se non fosse un problema nostro. In tutto il mondo una volta effettuata una transazione viene rilasciata una ricevuta di pagamento soprattutto quando si parla di tanti dollari. Spero giunto in Italia di non trovare altre sorprese in quanto le carte di credito utilizzate sono state due. Oltre a questo, il personale varie volte interpellato non ha preso in considerazione la gravità della situazione e solamente il giorno del check out dopo l ennesima sollecitazione si è degnato di farci avere una dichiarazione scritta dell'errore di transazione. Sono cose che non devono assolutamente accadere soprattutto quando si parla di denaro di turisti che giungono da varie parti del mondo. Questa cosa è inaccettabile e fa capire la superficialità del personale dello staff. Consiglio all Hotel di valutare bene il proprio personale che è fondamentale per raggiungere delle ottime valutazioni.

title: Good nights stay
text: Great location, just minutes away from the heart of Times Square. Very helpful staff. Room was well prepared and of sufficient size for two people. Only minus point was the quality of breakfast but was just sufficient. Free tea and coffee near the lobby all the time.

title: AMAZING SERVICE...Prime Location
text:
I recently spent 1 night and 2 days at the Fairfield Inn.  I chose the hotel based on its location -- it was a 10 minute or so walk from Grand Central Station...2 blocks from 42nd street.  From the moment we checked in we felt so overly welcomed by Jasmine and Kim.  They work tirelessly at the front desk to make sure that everyone is comfortable.  Check-in was a breeze, the room was immaculate (we even had complementary water which, if you have stayed at a hotel in NYC or the surrounding area you know is not common). We heard many people talking about the roof top bar.  They said it is NY's best kept secret.  We did not go there because we had to get up early to do a walk in central park.  You are staying in the heart of NYC you are near everything.  I would recommend the hotel's breakfast buffet!  We ate at Dafni Greek Taverna...as a New Yorker I would recommend looking for some of the authentic restaurants...not just the ones you see on the Food Network...email me if you need recommendations.

We had theater tickets in the evening after the walk in Central Park.  They have "day rates" if you need to check out later on in the day/evening.  What a fantastic advantage.  I was able to get back from the walk and then get ready for dinner and the show and then check out.  

On a side note, Thank you to the entire staff.  My friend also stayed that weekend and her son has cancer and like us, was in the city for the walk.  The entire staff made him feel like a King/Celebrity.  They went out of their way for my friends family and when I picked up my luggage later on Saturday night they inquired about the walk, how he did and how he was feeling.   It was so heartwarming and I am so grateful for all that you did.

I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel!

title: Nice Central Hotel
text: Generally I had a good stay, Most of the staff of the hotel were nice (Especially the check in hostess Kim). The Room although it was very small, it was nice and quiet. The Location of the Hotel was also very nice. Sky room was nice too. The Breakfast could be improved. Basic and bland. However there was a big variety of items such as bagels, muffins, breakfast cereals, Fruits, Yoghurt, nice fruit salad e.t.c. thus anyone could find something to eat. The Starbucks coffee that is served all day was also a nice plus.

title: Absolutely Fabulous
text: I stood for Mother's Day 2016.  Loved everything.  Hotel is cute.  Breakfast was good.  Bar/kitchen area is quaint & comfy.  Front desk staff was so polite & pleasant.  Room small but still comfortable.  Top security.  I had a lovely stay and will stay there again.  Everything so close and available.   I loved my stay and recommend it to everyone to stay.  They have a rooftop/sky view hangout.  Great place!*****

title: Super hotel
text:
Partie avec 2 amies dans cet hotel pour 3 nuits , nous avons passer un très bon sejour .
Hotel propre personnel gentil et attentionné les chambres sont agréable et bien décorées et silencieuses , ménage fait chaque jour .
